description:
We went there before bouldering, we each got the single cup which is 2 scoops of the same flavor. My friend got the Thai tea flavor and I got the black sesame flavor. Honestly I have to say that the Thai tea flavor is crazily good, it is a shame that no one else ever made Thai tea flavored icecream cuz it is just SO FREAKIN DELICIOUS. The black sesame one is so rich, it is not watery and sweet at all, and u won't feel sick after 2 big scoops. 

Anywayz, definitely try out the Thai tea flavor; but they actually switch out flavors sometimes they do jasmine green tea and my friend it is also extremely good.
author: Shuang W.

description:
This is a pretty hipster ice cream shop.  You won't find an enormous list of flavors, but short list of perfected ice cream flavors available for your tasting.  I sampled the flan, coffee, and herby, fruity tea flavor (sorry....the name escapes me).  I was stuck between the flan and the herby, fruity, tea flavor, but decided to get the flan in a sugar cone.  They are really generous with their scoops too (a 1 scoop is really 1.5)!  It is a bit on the expensive side, but I would definitely come back to try more flavors.

Pro-tip: bring water! They do not have complimentary water to clean your palate, either in between tastings or while you loiter in their wonderful space.
author: Alex J.

description:
The ice cream is really good, although it is pricey ($5.50 for a single, $8 for a double, +$1 if you want a handmade sugar cone). You are allowed to sample 3 flavors. I tried the salted mango, black sesame, and sweet cream, and they were all very good. I think that whatever ice cream base they use is very creamy and it makes the ice cream extra rich and delicious. 

I ended up getting a single scoop of black sesame on a cone. They give a generous amount and it is pretty rich and filling.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place has been on my SF ice cream list for awhile and I finally made it out here! I tried the Basil Chocolate Chip flavor and Peanut Brittle - both of which were incredible and very creamy. I decided on the Basil Choco Chip and had a scoop on a housemade sugar cone. The ice cream was actually so delicious! I would say it is pretty sweet and creamy though, so if you like more of a balance with your ice cream (like bittersweet chocolate or something like that) this might be too sweet for you.

I would highly recommend coming here though if you're on a mission to eat all the ice cream in the city like I am!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Cute icecream shop in dogpatch! Very creamy and rich. 
If I am in the area, I would definitely come back to try other flavors!
author: Clare L.

description:
We got the candy ginger ice cream and the peanut butter malt balls. The ice cream was a little too sweet but creamy and pretty smooth. Could have used a little  more ginger flavor. It needed more  of a balance since the ice cream itself was pretty sweet already and then there's the  sweetness from the candied ginger chunks. 
The peanut butter malt balls were decent because they were nice & soft when you bite into it. Kinda wish the malt crispy in the middle was more prominent in terms of the flavor it provided. The peanut butter overpowered everything.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
I had the French Lavender flavored ice cream here and it was actually pretty good! It comes in a cup or sugar cone and they give you a pretty decent sized scoop for a single, albeit it cost $5.50.

The French Lavender was creamy and smooth, and you could really smell the strongly scented lavender. If you enjoy the smell of lavender, you'll probably enjoy this. The sugar cone on the bottom was also pretty good and well made.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Hot day Sunday- time to try new flavors. DIVINE EXPERIENCE. 
Ordered a triple scoop (~$9)

-  NOUGAT  
 (Icecream w/ almonds+ honey + pinches of dried orange + dried apricot--what a bonus to be tasting the rich creaminess while chewing fruits altogether! )

-  CANDIED POMELO  
(Grapefruit + nibs of real fruit--Very fruity & authentic. This is a slightly bitter-sweet flavor. It balances out the other flavors' sweetness perfectly. For a mellow-not-so-much-sweets- type of day, this is a great option )

- SALTED MANGO  (creamy & rich....so filling!)

All deliciousness in one cup. (see pics of the big scoops, & try them!)

- Incredible customer service. I came here @ 4:55, right before closing. There was still a line of 6 people before me. 

The 2 staff took each order patiently, and still managed to let me sample 4 flavors. It was way passed their closing time, but good service was their priority. (5 thumbs up for that!!!)
author: Jess W.

description:
I only like 2 ice cream shops in the City. Mitchell's ice cream and Mr. And Mrs. Miscellaneous!

You can't go wrong with this place. The only thing I wish they had was parking, it's hard to find parking in the Dog Patch area. 

Friendly customer service, one time Carl and I went here and we knew it was almost closing time, we couldnt find parking; we went around and around and wasted time. He decided to just double park and stay in the car. I walk up to open the door and it was locked, their closed. But the cashier seen me, and opened the door anyway, served me with a smile. Really appreciated that and we definitely enjoyed our ice cream :)

Their menu will blow your mind away. So simple with only a few flavors, but flavors you will never think of. Irish cream, burnt sugar, sweet cream are just a few. They seem to switch/change it every other week and i noticed because I have been here a few times and every time there are some that still on the menu, some are new. The one that I love so much is the FROZEN HOT CHOCOLATE - if you go here and this is on the menu, do not leave without getting it. It's crazy good.
author: Madel R.

description: Omg I had a scoop of their Sweet Tea flavor on a sugar cone. Heaven in my mouth. I will be back soon for sure.
author: Sia M.

description:
After hearing so many things about this shop, I finally had the opportunity to check it out in person. Unfortunately, it failed to live up to the hype. I really appreciated the cute art work on the walls. The person working at the counter was rather grumpy and limited me to 3 samples even though I had shared each sample with another person. 

Overall, the ice cream at the shop was light and refreshing, though less creamy than I prefer my ice cream to be. The candied grapefruit had real grapefruit bits, which I appreciated.

The matcha was not sweet at all, and even though I'm a match purist, this could have benefited from a little more milk and sugar in it.

Expensive ($8) for a small double scoop. Little Giant is still my favorite ice cream spot when it comes to friendly service and generous portion sizes!
author: Nicole H.

description:
A very hip little ice cream spot in hip little SF. I had the golden milk and amaretto flavors, with their peanut butter malt balls to top. The golden milk flavor was very rich in seasoning, quite a heavy hand on the turmeric side. It was really good when sampled, but perhaps a little too much for me as a full on single scoop. I am an almond fan, so the amaretto did me no wrongs. Very nice long-tail flavor, not too much of a sugar punch in front. I ended up liking it much more than the golden milk. 

The malt balls were okay - nothing too noteworthy for me, although the size and peanut butter were something that I have not seen very often. 

Overall a good place to check out and stop by if you're in the area, probably very very based on what flavors you get that day though.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
So I hooks a right on 22nd and ILLI---N---O----I----S
Some Yelpers talkin nice so I said "let's do this"
I jumped out the ride, and said"what's up?"
So many folks in line so I said "I'm stuck"

Since these haters peepin me I'ma glide and swerve
These tourists lookin so hard they straight hit the curb
Gonna think of better things than some non 9 to 5 trick
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous's ice cream flavors are so hard to pick!

(give my profile a "follow" if you like my reviews/list)
..................................................................................

Quite possibly and actually it is now my favorite Ice Cream shop in the city (and it forced me to create a list to quantify it).

Went with the:
Pink Squirrel (almond Liqueur + Cacao Liquer)
Butter Toffee
Chocolate Chip

All three were pretty amazing and not conventional flavors for me.  Gourmet ice cream at it's finest and yes it's a little pricey but it's the city and it's different.

So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Recchiuti Confections 
24 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
Been wanting to come here for a while despite my friend's lukewarm feelings toward it. Still had high hopes and decided to give them a shot but I absolutely do not understand this place's high ratings. It's not a bad shop but compared to everywhere else in SF the flavors are limited, the texture is average, the service is below average (our employee looked like he wanted nothing more than to get the hell out of there to a point where my friend and I thought he was upset with us), and they limit the number of items you can taste to 3 items (they also don't warn you about the limit until you've already tried 2).

Their flavors are a bit on the less sweet side which I prefer. I tried the frosted flakes, Friar Tuck (cinnamon & hazelnut liquor), pomelo, and my friend's chicory coffee & matcha. None of them were overly sweet and usually the tart/bitter flavors come out a bit more which is nice. I settled on the Friar Tuck which was the only flavor I haven't seen elsewhere. Texture-wise the ice cream is average. Firm but not too creamy but at least not overly crystallized either. Just fine.

Overall, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous does have solid flavors but between the poor experience, limited service, and average textures, I'll opt for one of the other ice cream shops in the city.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Unpopular opinion: average ice cream with a hefty price. 

Tried the Bourbon cream and strawberry milk on a Sunday. None of the flavors really stood out to me (maybe I went on an off day). So I asked the guy which one was the popular flavor of the day and he suggested strawberry milk. The cone is an extra $1+ on top of the price for a scoop. 

Taste: the strawberry milk was soooo plain in flavor. I felt so unsatisfied afterwards. It really tasted like an ice cream bar that I could've bought from a 7/11.
author: Fei S.

description:
Not bad ice cream, pricey, plenty of seating in a clean and large space but awkward table arrangement making it crowded near the cashier. Did not try their candies.

For $8 I got 2 scoops of chocolate and matcha to share IN A CUP (1 scoop is $5.50). I probably could have gotten 95% of this amount of ice cream at Garden Creamery for $5...and I don't know if I can taste a difference in the quality...Toppings are also $1...

If the ice cream had been phenomenal, I wouldn't have complained so much about pricing but for me, the flavors don't come through as strongly as I'm used to. Maybe the ice cream was meant to be light? It wasn't very rich or dense. I'd say the texture was standard albeit slightly grainy and I think I tasted some salt in both flavors which was subtle but nice. It might have been just me but the chocolate tasted extremely familiar almost like chocolate pudding (not sure if I like that). That isn't to say I didn't enjoyed the ice cream; I just probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back. There wasn't a lot of interesting or unique flavors to try either. Slightly disappointed.
author: Lydia Z.

description: Who doesn't love ice cream at 11AM? I stopped by here after picking up some meat at Olivier's and managed to beat the line on a Saturday. Coming here early is a must. I walked in and was immediately overwhelmed with what I should get, but after sampling a few, I decided on the banana ice cream with the housemade waffle cone. 200% worth it and would totally eat again. Having only been here once, it's hard to say whether this registers as highly as some of SF's other ice cream spots, but I would absolutely come back here again.
author: Lisa I.

description:
If you're in the Dogpatch area of San Francisco, definitely give this spot a try. Especially if you've got a sweet tooth. 

A fairly small place with a handful of tables, Mr. and Mrs. M is simplistically decorated. Sporting a chalkboard menu with 9 unique flavors and 7 topping options, one scoop of ice cream without toppings will set you back $5.50. Add $1 per topping and another $1 for a waffle cone and you're looking at about $7.50 for a trip to the ice cream shop. 

Pretty pricey for a scoop of ice cream, but I will say that it was definitely worth trying. I was torn between the French Lavender and Frozen Hot Chocolate, but since it's only one flavor per scoop I had to pick one. Went with one scoop of the French Lavender + hot fudge and their regular cone. The ice cream was pretty strongly Lavender flavored and would have tasted better without the hot fudge. Needless to say, it was delicious and all of my friends wanted to try it. Ate every last bite. And scooped the bowl clean. 

They have sundaes and floats too, as well as pint sized/smaller boxes to take home. 

Current flavors: 
French Lavender
Sweet Cream
Frozen Hot Chocolate
Black Sesame
Yogurt+Granola
Peanut Butter Malt
Amaretto
Jasmine Green Tea
Pina Colada

Toppings: 
Hot Fudge
Caramel
Pineapple
Whipped Cream
Valrhona Crispy Chocolate 
Toasted Almonds
Sprinkles
author: Saachi G.

description:
The flavors here are everything! It was honestly so difficult to just choose one flavor because all the flavors were yummy. I went for the Sage and Honey Kid Scoop ($4.50) in a Waffle Cone ($1.00) while the boyfriend got the Burnt Sugar Single Scoop ($5.50). I can't get over how well they created the flavors in the form of ice cream. I seriously loved the uniqueness of the flavors, especially the Burnt Sugar, but didn't think I'd be able to eat too much of it either.

Perfect spot to end after a nice meal in the Dogpatch area! We even waited a good 15 minutes until they opened after having brunch down the street. It's worth it!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
I'm not a sweets-person but have a long list of sugary spots bookmarked for my friends & family who all have enough sweet teeth for the next 100 people. Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous has been toward the top of that list for quite some time.

Color me stunned - their ice cream was AMAZING.

Yes. Me. Non-sweet tooth McGee is calling it amazing, all in caps.

I tried a few flavours -- Kahlua+Cream, Pumpkin, and Frozen Hot Chocolate -- before settling on the Kahlua. It was not too sweet and had a strong coffee flavour. Yes, please!

All of three of my samples were great, I just didn't think I could eat more than that small taster spoon of them. (Hint: SUGAR)

The place is expensive, but it's worth it for some top-notch ice cream. This is the best of the best...er, ice crème de la ice crème.
author: Nic Z.

description:
Located in the historic Dogpatch neighborhood, this unassuming store serves up some unique and delicious ice cream.

With the critically acclaimed Bi-Rite Creamery attracting massive crowds and lines out the door, Mr. & Mrs. offers a less hectic and more laid back environment to enjoy your ice cream. The flavors are rotating and fairly unique, but the hours are a bit random. Due to the ever changing menu and minimal social media and web presence, you really don't know what's going to be offered until you get there.

During my visit, the flavors were pannettone, eggnog, irish cream, banana, bourbon & caramel, just chocolate, mascarpone, sweet cream, and pumpkin. Scoops start at $5.50 for a single, $8 for a double and $9 for a triple. A cone is an additional $1, and you can only get 1 flavor per scoop. The scoops aren't that large, and if you're already in the shop, you might as well get your money's worth by getting the triple since it's triple the amount at double the price (I'm sure you can find 3 flavors you like).

I tried the pumpkin, bourbon & caramel, panettone and just chocolate, all in a cup. The ice cream has a very creamy texture and a medium firmness to it. The flavors are complex and bold, but not as experimental as some other places. The pumpkin tasted like homemade pumpkin pie, the panettone almost reminded me of eating the classic Italian sweet bread. The chocolate had a rich chocolatey flavor and was slightly bitter. The bourbon & caramel was just sweet and needed some saltiness to balance it out.

The interior is cleanly decorated with a long communal table and a few smaller tables. The staff is friendly and patient as you explore and sample the menu. You can also get the ice cream by the pint to stock in your freezer to save you the trouble of coming back, but it's worth the trek to see what new flavors on the menu.
author: Khoi T.

description:
Ice cream is pretty good! They have a lot of interesting flavors like Irish cream, fruity pebbles, frozen hot chocolate... 

While the ice cream is good, my one complaint is that it is very expensive! A kid size is $5 and a single scoop is $5.50. It is almost not worth the price.
author: Julianna K.

description: So delicious! Flavors are very unique - definitely ask to taste them before deciding on which one. Line is pretty long, but worth the wait.
author: Hillary D.

description: So worth the calories.  Love this little unassuming ice cream shop in dog patch.  I love places that don't mess with something good.  They make good flavors, not too many, not too few.  They're interesting but not weird.  Interior is easy going, great little spot.
author: Christina L.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place and adding it to my collection of places I've been for ice cream, and though the staff and area was nice, the ice cream was definitely not the best I have had. We came during the afternoon on a Friday and the store was fairly empty. The store itself looks super artisanal and classy, and it felt like I was having ice cream from someones home. 

For flavor options that day, nothing really stood out to me too much. There were a lot of holiday flavors, such as pumpkin, peppermint stick, and eggnog, but nothing really tasted amazing to me. I ended up choosing the peppermint stick flavor, and though it was good, the peppermint was honestly too strong for me. I with they could have added chocolate or something else to it, to tone down the mint flavor. My friend decided on the burnt sugar, and thinking it would taste like caramel, she ended up really not enjoying her ice cream, since she literally said it tasted bitter, as anything burnt would taste. Furthermore, the ice cream here is pretty pricy at $5.50 per single scoop, and the scoops aren't too big either.

I am glad I tried this place, but it wouldn't be a go-to if I'm craving ice cream. The texture of their ice cream was great, but in terms of their pricing and flavors, I would be hesitant to come too often.
author: Sandra S.

description:
I'm not a huge ice cream fan, but this place is pretty fantastic. Aside from Mitchell's, this is one of my favorite spots in the city. 

Inventive ice cream flavors that are pricey, but worth it. The lines do get long so go later in the day. Parking is limited, so be prepared to look for a spot for a while--especially if the Giants are in town. 

Too my favorite flavors to list, but you can't really go wrong with picking any random one and tasting it.
author: Ajay G.

description:
A friend of mine mentioned that this was her favorite ice cream spot in SF so as someone who loves ice cream, I took the chance to check this place out when I was over in the dogpatch. The shop is located right of the corner and there is street parking surrounding the area. On a Saturday early afternoon, there was no line and only two small groups were eating inside. The shop is very tiny - seems like they're producing on-site. There's a small counter with a limited number of ice creams. 

Since I never tried many of these flavors, I wanted to sample a few to get an idea of what I wanted to get. The server gave me the tiniest samples of the flavors and in a friendly way shunned me by saying "this is the last sample I can give you: (I ended up trying four). There apparently is a limit to how many samples you can get - two, which wasn't made clear in the beginning. A big turn off for me because every other ice cream shop in SF has never limited the number of samples..

I got a kid size scoop of the peanut butter flavor, which ended up being a  tiny $4.50 scoop in a cup. They had a $5 credit card min so I purchased a peanut butter/brown sugar cookie (the sweetest, overwhelming sugary cookie that I've had). The ice cream was nice and creamy but my wallet felt a burn because of the price. I typically rate ice cream shops based on the whole experience - staff friendliness, complexity of flavors, and "was it worth the cost?" Compared to Salt and Straw, I think this place underperformed for me.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Fun little ice cream spot with good ice cream. I tried the Cinnamon Pecan and it was delicious! You can also try the flavors before you order. The art on the wall added a cute touch to the place. Parking was easy to find and the lines weren't long. I can't wait to try the other flavors.
author: Christian F.

description:
Legit my new favorite ice cream shop! Been meaning to visit for a while, but I finally got to join the hype. :D

Love their ice creams- nice texture and creaminess. I tried the peanut brittle, dark peppermint, and matcha green tea. The peanut brittle was delicious- tasted very peanuty, but I liked the peppermint one more. It was very refreshing and the mint flavor was very crisp. The matcha one was decent, but not the best, in my opinion.  

I ended up getting the peppermint! The interior is very basic, furnished with wooden chairs and tables, but it's definitely a nice place to chill, read a book, study, or hang out. ^^
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Clean and modern feel with delicious ice cream, unique flavors, and friendly service. 

Located // In the middle of Dogpatch area with street parking available. 

Ambiance // Modern feel with lots of kids and families. I came here my bf on Friday after work since this place closes at 6pm, we rushed and barely made it on time. Lot of toddlers with their parents in this ice cream shop... super cute. 

Ice cream // I tried the French Lavender and was immediately sold on it! SO GOOD! My bf got the Frozen Hot Chocolate, which was surprising because he strongly dislikes chocolate ice cream. 

Pricing // Single scoop was 5.50 plus 1.00 more if you want their homemade sugar cone 
Tip: The homemade sugar cone is AMAZING and definitely worth getting 

Overall // 
Love the name of this place and I love the ice cream. My only wish is that it was open a tad bit later so that I wasn't rushing after work to try to make it here before closing.
author: Emily T.

description:
After 7 long years of wanting to come here, I finally did after a walk exploring the neighborhood on a sunny, yet chilly Sunday afternoon. I saw a giant painting of ice cream on waffle cone on a corner of a building and I thought wow! Cool! I left my walking group and ran inside because I was excited  for ice cream ! In case you couldn't figure it out, my weakness is ice cream and I just love  it! Yah! 
Nice small shop with a few tables to actually sit down and chill and have nice conversations. The flavors are posted on a chalkboard and hard thing was to decide which flavor and do I want sauce toppings too? From banana rum to Tea flavors to pick, I sampled and decided on the most flavorful lemoncello  and pumpkin flavor had the strongest flavors that tastes like the real thing.  The whiskey ice cream was very light in taste and was just ok. 

Yup, the good reviews do match up with this place, excellent quality ice cream with unique flavors and it is worth the trip when I am coming from the other side of town in the opposite direction. Yes I would love to come back and even head to the Neighbor Bakehouse and take out a pastry to go too! Both excellent places.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
San Francisco definitely does not have a shortage of ice cream bars. My husband and I normally go to Bi-Rite for our ice cream cravings but decided to try something different this time. My sister recommended Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous since she always passes by it but never has had the chance to try it. 

So my friends and I kidnapped my sister to have some ice cream. 

It looks like their flavors change from time to time. On the day we went, they had pumpkin, olive oil, chocolate, sweet cream, malted milk, french lavender, etc. 

My husband got their chocolate ice cream with caramel syrup and toasted almonds. I got a kid sized scoop of their malted milk. My sister got a scoop of their sweet cream with their housemade cone. 

My husband loved his ice cream -- the mixture of the ice cream with the caramel sauce was a great combination. My malted milk ice cream reminded me a lot of the whopper candies. However, half way through, I got really bored of the flavor. I think it may be better to get some sauces or toppings with it? The winner to my sister's ice cream was their cone. Their housemade cone actually had a savory element to it -- it was salty. It's kind of like salted cornflakes and it went really well with the ice cream. 

My friend had their french lavender and cardamom rose sundae andddd it had a huge punch of floral flavor. I can't say I liked it. I also got to try their earl grey ice cream and it was really odd because it was salty. 

Overall, their ice cream flavors are on the stronger side of things. As for the texture, it was pretty smooth but I've had smoother. Honestly, I think I still prefer Bi-Rite.
author: Doriee D.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was on my ice cream list for months, but it took a while to make it there due to the location and limited hours. The wait was worth it! The price is fair. The flavor selection is more limited than other shops in town, but I promise there will be multiple flavors you want to try. We chose 3 scoops to try multiple flavors, but I will be back to try more!
author: Emitom H.

description:
Heard so many great things about this place but was disappointed by the small variety of flavors. Unfortunately we came on a day when the flavors weren't so extraordinary. There was peanut brittle, thai tea, cookies and cream, etc. 

We opted for the thai tea ($5.50 single scoop) with a housemade waffle cone (additional $1). The thai tea flavor was pretty good and the cone was tasty however it melts incredibly fast even when it's not that hot out. The bottom of the cone isnt really sealed shut so the ice cream leaks through.

Overall, I keep hearing so many great things so I want to come back and maybe try some other cool flavors.
author: Annie N.

description:
San Francisco's ice cream game is so strong, you can't be wasting your time (and calories) on mediocre ice cream. 

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is definitely at the top of the pack, although not my favorite (yet?). I'll need to try more flavors to be sure, but with their closing hour at 6pm, I doubt I'll be able to rack up 20+ visits like this one place I usually go to in the Mission.. by the Dolores.. that starts with a B..

Anyway.. their flavor selection seems a bit lighter than other shops. During my last visit only earl gray caught my attention, but it was very good, creamy texture, with nice/not too overpowering tea flavor. 

$4.50 for a kid's scoop which is the perfect size to top off your stomach after a nice meal, cause I only venture out here to eat, heh.
author: Laverne N.

description:
[Out-of-Towner Review]

I pride myself on trying all the ice cream spots in SF.

This is fairly close to AT&T park seems like a no-brainer. That is until you get distracted by Hard Knox your first go around. Then you go out of your way to make it there again, even if you're in the Castro area.

Maps to get here makes you go the craziest way, but it always works out well. It's on the corner and is somewhat hidden, besides the image of an ice cream cone with about six scoops of ice cream on a cone.

When you walk in you realize they don't have air conditioning. It was a particularly warm SF day, think the 80s, so it was warm in here. Stale warm. Tons of people, mostly families, spilled about at all the tables. The one small two top nook was also taken up by a couple, which also lined where a mural image was painted on the wall.

The ice cream selections for the day didn't really entice me. I tried a few to see how I liked the texture and flavor they offered. I decided to change it up and I went with a sundae with their sweet cream ice cream and added their homemade caramel and toasted almonds. It was actually really good. It was nice to deviate from just a scoop in a cup.

The homemade caramel is what made it good. It was a bit smokey if that makes sense. I can't quite put my finger on the flavor, but it was really good. The almonds could have been natural for all I cared about, the caramel flavor was good enough. The crunch the almonds provided was perfect.

Lil ordered the special of the day, which was essentially their take on Mint Chip. They did also just put out a Matcha Green Tea ice cream while we were there, but I didn't try it. 

Overall it wasn't bad and was on par with SF ice cream pricing (which is dumb expensive), but I don't think I'll be heading back here anytime soon. It's near ATT park, but not convenient to get there post Giants game.

Too many options make this one kinda obsolete...
author: Steph G.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 1:30 pm and there was no line! Someone in our group said he tried to come on a Friday and there was a line out the door, so definitely recommend coming late afternoon on the weekend to beat the crowds. I was split between the Paradise Tea and the Banana with Dark Rum flavor, so I deferred to the server's recommendation. She said the Banana was a more popular option, so I went with that and upped the WHABOOM with their in-house made caramel. I was so full before that ice cream, but I devoured it and could have ordered another. It was well-balanced and not sweet at all! The caramel complemented the flavor very well (had a caramal apple flavor to it, less sweet, more of that brown sugar, nutty flavor). I would definitely come back to this place and get the same thing over and over again!

Also, it is right next to Smokestack at Magnolia Brewing! So after you can swing by and get really delicious BBQ, beer, cocktails, and whiskey flights after!
author: Frances P.

description:
You guys are sleeping on Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous if you haven't tried it yet! It's hands down the best ice cream in the bay! I'm an ice cream addict and I'm telling you, their ice cream is way better than any other shops that I've been to ANYWHERE. I alway get a double scoop. One with sweet cream, which seems to be a permanent flavor, and one seasonal.

My only complaint is that they only allow 1 flavor per scoop and I always want to 2 flavors, but a double scoop is always too much for me so it always ends up going to waste ):
author: Annie N.

description: I think this is one of the many places in SF to get delicious different flavors of ice cream. My sister told me that I had to try this place for ice cream. We drove the car down and while we couldn't find parking. Some of stayed in the car while my sister and I hopped out and ordered for others. YUM. I think is my favorite, so far.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: This place for the win! This was some of the most delicious ice cream I've tried in the soma/dogpatch area. I loved the Pina colada flavor--sweet and savory art in a cup!  Hats off to the fiord flavor as well. Can't go wrong here! Enjoy!
author: Camille B.

description:
Can't go wrong at my fave ice cream place in SF. The texture is creamier, the portions are decently sized, and the flavors are great, though not very experimental. Nice place to take a breather - when it's sunny out, it floods the place with light. Also, the wall outside with the tall scoops is 'grammable.

The bf and I have made many trips to Dogpatch just for Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. We usually get a triple - once they changed flavors while we were there, so we got another single scoop as well hehe. No such thing as too much ice cream, amirite!?

Wanted to see if they sell ice cream cake for the bf's birthday, but they never responded to my email or answered the phone :(
author: Eva W.

description:
Dex wanted to get dessert before dinner at Skool, so we went to check out an ice cream shop we've both been waiting to try. You know an ice cream shop is amazing when there's a line (almost) out the door even when it's freezing in the city. 

The shop is pretty cute, with high ceilings and huge windows that let in natural light. Everyone was bundled up and sitting at the communal wooden tables and chairs they provided. As we walked up to the counter, I noticed the prices of the ice cream. $4.50 for a kids scoop, $5.50 for a regular human scoop, and $6.50 if you want to get ice cream in a cone. My wallet insta-cried. 

But what can you do? These were the prices you pay for in San Francisco. And the taste was definitely worth it! Mmm, earl grey and chocolate chip cookies... delish!
author: Christine S.

description:
Love this place! They make most of their toppings (whipped cream, chocolate fudge, caramel) from scratch, and their flavors are pretty eclectic. Whipped cream was not overly sweet, fudge was dark and thicc. 

The burnt sugar tasted like actual burnt sugar.... mind blowing :O

I love that they have alcoholic flavors like fernet blanc, which surprisingly went well in a sundae. 

Would definitely come back here to try their rotating seasonal flavors! Splurge on your calories and get the sundae, I dare you.
author: Alexis Y.

description:
I am not really an ice cream person, but I love Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous. They always have interesting flavors, but even if you're not adventurous there's generally something more standard you'd probably like. Their tea flavors are especially refreshing in the summer, imo. I don't know how you make a rich ice cream taste light but they do it. It's small and can get pretty crowded when it's busy, but you could easily walk to Esprit or Mariposa Park and sit there to eat. The staff have always been friendly, too!
It is a bit pricey, though, so not a treat to be had too often (probably good anyway since it's ice cream!)
author: Lilith W.

description:
We were having brunch across the street and decided to have dessert at Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous. My group of three walked in on Saturday, March 4th around 3:30pm.

*Butter Toffee
*Copper Fox: single malt whiskey w/cherry wood + applewood smoked barley
*Crema Catalna: lime w/burnt sugar swirl

We all got a Kids ($4.50) sized scoop. I can't eat much dessert in general, but my Copper Fox was pretty good. Creamy and flavorful. I tried the other two flavors as well. I liked the Crema Catalna, but I think the added caramel made it a little too sweet. I liked the lime flavor though. The Burnt Toffee was good too. Bits of toffee which I adore.

Overall, I do adore creamy, rich, and smooth ice creams. Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous delivers on those fronts.
author: Elena N.

description: Place looks nice and the service at the counter good, however the ice cream itself weren't all that good to justify the price. The flavors (mint chocolate chip, Kahlua & cream, limoncello) weren't impressive, but the biggest problem is that they used too much salt-a very fixable issue.
author: Bor C.

description: Love love love this place. I work close by, so me and my friends are often here for an "ice cream run." I mean when is ice cream not a great pick me up? When we walk by during lunch, we slow down to see what flavors they have for the day. Some of my top favs so far: birthday cake is number one and frozen hot chocolate.
author: Allyson M.

description:
My favorite ice cream in SF. Bi-rite is a pretty close 2nd but Mr Mrs' flavors are so consistently delicious. The base ice cream recipe is perfect and the result is an ice cream that has a nice firmness and isn't too sweet. 

Midday on weekdays is usually busy, better to go a little later after lunch or earlier...if you're a dessert first kind of person. 

The interior is a little small so best get your ice cream to go and stroll Third St. Very simple interior decoration and design with a cute colorful mural, the place is clean and they have bins for compost/recycle which is awesome. 

Also don't get turned off if you are vegan, they usually have a non dairy flavor of the day so ask what they have. I've tried a chocolate and coconut vegan sorbet and they were both delicious.
author: Alexa N.

description:
I happened upon Mr. and Mrs. while walking around the Dogpatch. I'd heard about it before so I convinced the bf to go in since we were there anyway. Minimal wait on a late weekend afternoon. Clean, modern, and surprisingly large space for an ice cream place with about 15 seats. 

Service was adequate. Note to self: ask and you shall receive! We weren't offered any tastings but some people after us asked and got them.

The ice cream was delicious! We tried the cookies and cream instead of risking a flavor that we might not like. However, Mr. and Mrs.' version of cookies and cream was very different from any other ones I've had, but in a good way! We both agreed it was very smooth and creamy. The game changer for me was an unexpected savoriness. I almost thought we were given some kind of salted caramel by accident. The savory notes were different but I love salty-sweet things and really enjoyed it even though it was not very traditional.

The only things that keep me from going back regularly are the price and location. Mr. and Mrs. is pricier than the other already pricey ice cream places in town. It is also in a neighborhood that I rarely venture out to. But if I'm in the area, I would definitely wander in again to try more flavors.
author: Venna L.

description:
Solid!

I love the more adventurous flavors at Mr. and Mrs. though not all of them are hits.  The couple times I've visited, almost every flavor had changed from the menu previous.  This makes each trip to the store a surprise, but can also be disappointing if you fell in love with a more unique flavor from before.  They don't have an extensive list of flavors, so some days end up being better than others depending on your personal taste.  I really enjoyed the kinako and black sesame and the scoops are very generous!

I just wish the store was closer to my office or that they were open later, who can make it to eat ice cream on a weekday before 6?!

Tips and Tricks 
-Pay attention to those hours
-Can get pretty crowded on weekends
author: Jessica L.

description:
This ice cream shop is a dream come true. All the flavors they offered at the time I went sounded great and tasted great. I tried the earl grey, cheesecake, and the pink guava. Literally wanted them all! It was a tough choice but I ended up choosing pink guava. Every guava flavor I've tried before this place has only offered it as a sorbet, but this place had it as ice cream. It was soooo creamy and rich with a subtle taste of guava. Not overwhelmingly sweet either. Omg it was so good. Seriously perfect.

Came back another time and got the cheesecake flavor. Same creamy texture as the first time and tasted a bit gingery too. Also fantastic!

Love how they offer interesting flavors that make me want to sample them all. Definitely coming back here a million times. Only downside is that their business hours aren't great, for they close quite early. How's a girl supposed to get her Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous ice cream fix after work when they close so early everyday?
author: Annie H.

description:
Came here for a quick ice cream snack. Seemed like a hipster kind of place considering all the other places nearby and there was some event going on where some were dressed like steampunk haha. Maybe it was just coincidental halloween is coming up soon. 

Earl Grey - nice tea flavor except it was awkwardly savory o.O My friend and I had tried this as a sample and looked at each other with the same thought in mind. totally didnt get this ice cream after getting that savory taste LOL 

Simply Chocolate - flavor wise reminded me of this fudge bar i ate the other night at a friends house. Smooth fudgy chocolately ice cream goodness. Simply chocolate. XD 

French Lavender
Cardamom Rose

These both was ordered as a sundae with chocolate drizzles, chopped almonds. Cardamom completely covered the rose flavor but it was pretty interesting to eat something sweet with cardamom flavor. French lavender was nice and light. Not overpowering as some teas/fragrances can be. 

Sweet Cream - sweet... cream... Lol what more can i say? 

The flavors are unique and nice. Very smooth ice cream but you get sick of it fairly quick. I wasn't even planning on eating any ice cream. All the above flavors were gotten by everyone else i was with. They ended up eating maybe half and pushed it off to me, with exception to the simply chocolate. He himself devoured that one. Lol 

A lot of places, you'd have trouble with only a scoop or two. Here, even a kid's size may be enough for 1-2 people... Lol...
author: Andrew C.

description:
My favorite ice cream spot in town! The scoops are smooth and creamy and pack quite a bit of flavor without being overpowering. So far I've especially enjoyed all of their tea flavors--earl grey is my favorite. The lineup seems to change with supply/demand so be ready to try something new! If you've got a sweet tooth, I really recommend pairing your ice cream with one of their delicious cookies.

The space itself is simple but cozy and I have yet to wait in a line. Be wary of the slightly odd hours (and remember that good ice cream is worth going a little bit out of your way for).
author: Dennis C.

description:
This ice cream establishment has been around since 2009! 
The house made cone is to die for. It's a buttery waffle cookie that's bomb. I wish they made it bigger though, it's wrapped so skinny! Paired with their yummy ice cream, it's soooo good. Order right though, meaning what hits the spot for you the most, because their flavors change daily, and given the prices you're only going to want to order 1 flavor/1 scoop. My friend and I shared a total of 5 samples (I tipped a $1 for the tastings but could tell the guy was over helping us lol).

We tried:
Lotus cream
Frosted flakes
Irish coffee
Milk and cookies
Chocolate chip 

The standout for me was the milk and cookies as it had some peanut butter cookie notes, great texture (not crumbly), and a nice sweetness that brought out the vanilla flavor. It paired so, so well with the house made waffle cone.

Expect to pay $5-8 per person.

Hurrah for no line on a Saturday!!!! Hurrah for a uber clean bathroom on site, and cute-to-boot art on the walls, and amazing bench seating. Great spot for catching up with friends!
author: Sarah W.

description: Finally was able to venture out to the Dogpatch for brunch and of course, I had to leave room for ice cream after! Luckily, it wasn't crowded so we got to sample a lot of their flavors before deciding what we wanted. We went with two single scoops ($5 each) of burnt sugar and peanut butter malt balls with their house-made sugar cones. Both the flavors reminded us of flavors we had tasted elsewhere (at other artisanal ice cream shops) but somehow elevated in their own unique and very creamy way. And by the way, their house-made sugar cones are definitely the way to go. They also serve freshly baked cookies which looked absolutely delicious but we were too full to get them. Definitely stop by when you're in the area or just make plans to check out this hipster ice cream spot!
author: Andrea P.

description:
Like many ice cream parlors in SF, Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous consists of very unique flavors. They do pride themselves in their organic ingredients and you can definitely taste it in the texture of their ice cream! 

Be sure to check their hours before coming here, because they do have very random hours - they open late and close early. On a Sunday, the close at 5pm.. which is rather early for a weekend. 

As mentioned earlier, all their flavors are very unique. Their menus changes constantly! As my party and I were enjoying our ice cream, they switched out a flavor from chocolate chip to celebration cake. The only downfall about this is that if you like one flavor, there is no guarantee that the next time you visit it'll be there. 

Upon arriving, there was no wait! Yay. so we decided to sample literally everything on the menu (sorry servers). Be sure to ask for a sample to get a taste of their different flavors. My favorite of the day was their jasmine green tea which was very subtle. Their other unique flavors included sweet cream, eggnog, and peppermint stick.  

The prices are very fair and they do give you a large portion. I am an ice cream person, but I do like my ice cream in smaller portion. I got a single scoop for $5, but had so much trouble finishing it. I'd recommend getting a kids scoop or share the single scoop with someone else. 
I'm excited to come back here for my next visit so I can try more of their different flavors!
author: Shelly S.

description:
I always wanted to try this place.  It was so delicious!  I had a butter toffee sundae, which I thought was very pricey ($8.50) and for what it was.  The ice cream was good and I loved the space.  I've been to many ice cream joints and you can get so much more for your money elsewhere.

Don't get me wrong.  This place is good, but these trendy spots give you so little for so much money when there are other places that give you softball sized scoops for less than their 2 scoop sundaes.
author: Rachel L.

description: My teacher and a friend recommended me to this place. I think their ice cream has really nice texture ,but, to me, it way tooooo sweet. I tried choco truffle :( too much sweet , peanut brittle (still way too sweet but better than choco truffle) anddd the best for today is limoncello, omg finally i found something not too sweet here lol
author: Tiratiwan L.

description:
I had high hopes for this place, but the price and flavors available the day I went were slightly discouraging.

We got the candied ginger and paradise black tea flavors. Candied ginger was okay, and tasted like a ginger snap. I LOVED the paradise black tea, though. We got the last scoop! It was light and fragrant and tasted very florally which was super cool.

The ice cream is expensive for what you get though. $7 for two scoops in a cup!

Parking is kind of hard because of the area. We found street parking about a block away but I think there are lots somewhere too.

In short, the ice cream is good, but I would definitely only come when they have interesting flavors. Otherwise, it's a bit overpriced and may be out of the way for some people.
author: Meghan L.

description: With all the ice cream places around SF, you can't go wrong with most of them. It also makes it really hard to decide which one to go to. Lucky for us, my boyfriend and I are into trying something new and we haven't tried this place. I got the grapefruit and Campari (a type of liquor) and my boyfriend got the sweet potato. I loved mine though! It was light and the grapefruit was not overpowering. His cousin came along and we had the chocolate chip cookie, which did not skimp on chocolate chips. It was really good! One tip I might add before coming here is to bring cash. They don't accept credit cards under $5. A kids size (which is plenty) is $4.50 and a single is $5.50. Also only one flavor per cup. No mixing! Other than that, I definitely would come back!
author: Brittany D.

description: Yummy is all I can say.  Stepped in here last weekend after having some soul food across the street, we thought our stomachs
author: Cecil E.

description:
Every so often, I'm reminded that there are still some really kind-hearted and good people left in the city. My friend and I stopped by for some Sunday ice cream and sweet treats. In front of us in line was a woman and her 3 children. She didn't have enough cash to pay for everything, so asked if she could cancel one of the ice cream orders. The owner told her she could just have it even though she was a few dollars short. Heart melted.

On top of the exceptional customer service, they serve my favorite ice cream in SF. I finally got to try Pink Squirrel, which reminds me of marzipan. The homemade sugar cones are phenomenal! My friend got the butterfinger ice cream with Vahlrona crunchy chocolate pearls.

I also can never leave without a bag of peanut butter maltballs. These are a must try.I can't buy the big bags anymore because I find myself eating the entire thing in one sitting...
author: kim p.

description: A most delicious ice cream shop in SF proper ... probably my favorite ice cream shop? With rotating daily ice cream flavors that are made fresh daily in house, delicious handmade cones, and toppings galore, it really doesn't get any better than this. I have enjoyed eating ice cream here every time I've visited and that's indeed no small task considering that I've gotten different flavors each & every time I've been here. The cashier also allows you to sample flavors before buying & I would highly recommend that you do so. It's also nice that this place takes card though it is kinda hard to find parking nearby (Dogpatch) so do keep that in mind. Overall, a great ice cream shop to come to. There's also a sizable amount of seating as well though such is probably not enough were the place to be busy (which I can imagine it being during off-hours or especially weekends). Worth a stop in for sure.
author: Jack M.

description: Amazing ice cream! Great flavors. Creamy and rich. Refreshing. Unique variety. Made right there in plain view.
author: D. S.

description:
It doesn't have to be your birthday cake to ever get birthday cake ice cream! We had brunch in the area and I really wanted dessert so we eagerly waited at the front door (and took pics with the giant ice cream mural) until this place opened. We were the only ones for a little while so we were table to take our time and try a few flavors. Most were pretty good, but I knew I wanted the birthday cake when I laid my eyes on the sign. I loved that there were actual (chocolate) cake chunks in the ice cream. The ice cream was really good, but I wished it was birthday cake flavored instead of vanilla with sprinkles (though I do love a good vanilla).

Overall, we added a waffle cone and it satisfied my sweet craving. Be prepared to pay SF prices for this ice cream cone!
author: Sophia Y.

description:
There is no lack of great ice cream places in SF. You can literally spend all day eating ice cream and still not try them all (believe me, I've tried). But out of all the places, I would say Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous holds a solid position as one of my top 3 (or possibly I'm just throwing a number out there so as not to offend anyone)!

For being in the city, parking doesn't seem too hard to find (speaking from my two experiences coming on weekends). Besides the street parking scattered in the area, there is a parking lot area if you go down 22nd Street past the store. 

What I really like about this place is the unique flavor offerings. There were no overlapping flavors the two times I came here. This may be because the second time it was the weekend of St. Patty's, so they were offering inspired flavors (e.g.: Shamrock Shake, Irish Coffee, Bailey's, Guinness). The downside to this is that you never know exactly what flavors will be available, and they may not have "classic" go-to flavors in case you're super picky. But I don't think it should be a problem, because I haven't had a flavor I've hated yet! My personal favorite was the French Lavender (but some people complain it tastes like candles/soap).

One thing to note is that the ice cream is on the sweeter side, and the store doesn't really have water readily available. They can serve it to you in the little ice cream cups, but with the long lines and the little amount that the cups it can hold, it can be a little inconvenient.

Now ice cream in SF is quite expensive, so I recommend going with a group of friends and getting the triple scoop to share. That way you get to try more flavors for less money!
author: Helen W.

description:
The ice cream speaks for itself. I'd go as far as to say its poetic how they capture the essence of every flavor of their ice cream. I got the Hot Cocoa and felt like I was actually drinking hot cocoa! It reminded me of Charlie and Chocolate Factory when the kids tried the 3 course meal gum and they felt like they were actually eating the foods the flavors captured. 

All in all, this is my new favorite pure ice creamery of all time.
author: Sang Yoon K.

description:
It is located on a corner. There's a good amount of street parking behind the building. Cute decor inside. They sell other treats like cookies and candy. 

I ordered the Butter Rum ice cream in their homemade waffle cone. Delicious! Stronger rum flavor than I was expecting but still tasty. It is a little pricey but that's what you get for unique flavors and homemade ice cream. I will definitely come back to try some of their other flavors.
author: Nicole S.

description:
First off: GET THE pb malt chocolate balls. They are perfect as a quick satisfaction to your sugar craving AND! If you're a baker, get the bag ( I think they come in a dozen or 2 ) to use them to decorate your cake. 
The ice cream flavors are pretty amazing. Nothing out-of-this-world just simple flavors that will definitely excite your senses.
author: Kia M.

description:
Funky name, somewhat weird hours, and incredible ice cream. Despite living relatively close to this place, I've only just got around to trying this place due to the fact that they're only open normal office hours on weekdays. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and was blown away.

The smell of their house-made cones fills the air as you walk in and instantly makes you want to try one. They don't have a ton of flavors, but each one is incredibly unique. I sampled the berry brandy, orange blossom, and salted mango. Every one was delicious, but I settled with the orange blossom on a house-made cone. The cone has a freshly made, crunchy texture that puts cake and sugar cones to shame.

From a price perspective, this is definitely on the higher end as far as ice cream goes. But given the quality, it's more than worth it.
author: Tim X.

description: So worth the hype!! The ice cream here is so rich and creamy without being so heavy as to leave you with a stomach ache. I love their unique flavors and that they don't always have the same options. Their waffle cone is legit-super fresh and crunchy! I haven't had their cookies before but they looked really good so I am excited to try that and the root beer float the next time that I go.
author: Taline M.

description: Terrible customer service. I work across the way. Thought I would go in for a quick scoop of ice cream but the service was so long it took me three times as long as I imagined. The young woman behind the counter took for ever to talk to her friend in front of me. The line finally started moving once a group of white women walked in behind me. And the ice cream was not good. Not the place for me.
author: Johnny B.

description:
You only get to try three samples. I wish they told me that before I started asking for samples, so I would have chosen more wisely.

This place has been on my list forever, and I finally get to cross it off. 

Here's the scoop (see what I did there?): 

Texture is on point
Flavor is quite bland
Ratio mix ins are proportional (from the sample I tried)
Flavors aren't adventurous or fun (maybe it was just the time I went?)
Waffle cone is super fresh, crispy, and delicious! 
Vegan options!

S'aigght

It's quite the cozy.
author: Shereen A.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco and a significant radius beyond.  You will not find a creamier ice cream that packs so much deep flavor in each bite.  Everything else will seem icy and generic after you've tried it here.  Love their flavor experiments as well.  Today was banana with dark rum.  Goddamn
author: Marshall Y.

description: Love this ice cream shop! First of all they got super cool flavors depends on the season. Second, their waffle cone is fresh made and super delicious. Last but not least, you could sample as much as you want. I tried their sweet cream, berry & sour cream, rose and black sesame. I was at first deciding between black sesame and berry sour cream. Eventually I got their berry sour cream since this seems more unique and I was craving for something refreshing. I love how the sour cream did not take over the flavor of the ice cream while keeping fruity ice cream taste buttery. The sour cream def created another flavor texture for the ice cream. I also love their black sesame, you could def taste the seedy flavor. Their waffle cone was amazing. First thing I noticed is that waffle cone was thick enough so it did not break easily. Also you could tell it is a delicious waffle cone by "smell" it. The size was just perfect because you did not finish it in a bite while it did not stuff your belly with only cone. The only down side for this place was that it did not have AC so it was steaming hot inside. I guess it made sense so people could finish their ice cream and get otta there since the line was long. Anyway I will def be back!
author: Yushan W.

description: I really enjoyed the chocolate ice cream here. My friends were so-so on their selections but I had it with the homemade caramel sauce and some salted almonds and I was basically eating heaven, at least for me. It's a little pricey but no more than other artisan ice cream places.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The place is cute~! There's this art on the far left wall that's cool. I went here with my photography class as a quick stop. The staff was friendly and served us quickly. 

Not cheap ice cream but great quality! My friend got guava and (I think) I got some tea flavor (maybe jasmine?) It's creamy and has amazing flavor.
author: Ashley P.

description: For sure the best ice cream in San Francisco, and they give you 3 tastes each, so share them with someone special. Try their delicious home made cone, and then throw in some absolutely wonderful buttery salty peanut cookies, and your day will be infinitely yummier. Rich creamy ice cream with subtle flavors and great people watching.
author: Laura D.

description: I would argue that Mr & Mrs is the best ice creamery in the city (yeah, you heard me Bi-rite fans!).  However, being tucked away in the Dogpatch, there are still a lot of people who have yet to stumble upon this gem.  I'm unashamedly an ice cream snob and have probably tried all of the ice cream shops in SF.  Mr & Mrs is always on point. The flavors here are original and delicious, the texture smooth and creamy, and I'm a sucker for housemade cones.  Service is always great, parking is never too crazy, and it's on the same street as a couple of good brunch options, a fromagerie (because who doesn't love cheese), and Neighbor Bakehouse! A must-stop for people searching for good ice cream in SF (and wanting to skip the ridiculous lines at other shops).
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Coconut Cream = creamy goodness

The staff is friendly, will answer any questions about the ice creams. 

Easy to get to if you're taking the K/T. 

Not much to say accept it's legit good?
author: Cynthia L.

description:
ahhhh...Mr. n Mrs. Miscellaneous. u were FINALLY open we were in the city last weekend! the last few times we went, it was so disappointing that they were closed each time. : / 

Mr. n Mrs. Miscellaneous is located on 22nd Street in the Dogpatch District in San Francisco. there's plenty of parking all around the area in front of residences. 

the space is large enough to accommodate groups of customers, though there's usually a line out the door on the weekends. I love the tall glass windows n their colorful drawing of an ice cream cone on the exterior. it's so cute! 

so this ice cream place is my favorite one in all of San Francisco. their flavors r always tasty, even though it's not a long list like at other shops. I like to think that it means they put more time to craft those delicious few. their ice creams r consistently smooth n creamy every single time I'm there. they only use natural n organic ingredients also. we usually order the a single scoop with their handmade waffle cone. they always taste fresh n crunchy!) I believe their waffle cone machine has changed? they don't look the same.)
author: Julie W.

description:
Really high quality ice cream! Tried the fresh cream flavor and it tasted like...well...fresh cream.  At $5.50 for a single ($6.50 if you want a cone) it is not cheap, but the quality means it is a must try.  I would have definitely tried more flavors if I hadn't just eaten an overwhelmingly filling meal at Serpentine.

The flavors are really unique and the quality is maybe the highest I've had in the city.  Perfect amount of sweetness and extremely smooth creamy texture.  

That said, it is just missing that "warmth" that makes an ice cream place such a nostalgically amazing experience that brightens up your inner child.  My actual child seemed to enjoy it though. :)
author: Tarek S.

description:
After sampling ice cream all over San Francisco, the next shop on the list was this quaint spot, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. We entered the shop on a a weekday afternoon and as expected, there was no wait. The lady at the counter was friendly and helpful as we were able to sample over half a dozen flavors before we settled on our favorites. We tried the malted milk, sweet cream, Thai tea, grapefruit, chocolate, and a sweet cream cake flavor. I chose a small grapefruit candy in a homemade cone and my friend ordered the Thai tea, also in a cone. The flavors are robust and quirky, but they are rich and delightful. The only trouble is that the location is far out and hard to get to. If it were closer, it would be easy for me to become a regular. Try this place out, if you haven't already!

Note, if you order a medium or large in a a cone, it would be pretty filling as a small cone was enough to make me full.
author: Jessica E.

description:
When I'm in the Dogpatch area and no matter how full I am, I am getting a scoop of Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous ice cream! It's not my favorite in the city but its on my top 5. I recommend their earl grey. Best flavor I tried so far. 

Also recommend their home made licorice and marshmallow. I love the ice cream sign outside as well. Picture of it every visit.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Really good ice cream, worth the hype.  My honey graham ice cream was super creamy and tasted just like honey with some yummy crunchy bits of graham crackers in it. Bring your own water though because they don't offer any due to the water drought! 

Extra bonus: Kind of random but available parking down the street.
author: Linda H.

description:
We came here after climbing on a Sunday, I've been in this area multiple times but unfortunately never had the chance to try it because they are closed on Monday and Tuesday. 

They had a decently long line, and very little seating so basically you can eat standing up or find somewhere outside. 

We had the calamansi ice cream, and the sweet cream flavor. The calamansi grapefruit flavor was delicious, it was creamy, light and had a great light scent.  The sweet cream flavor was also super creamy and had a tart sour cream ishflavor. 

The ice cream is a bit pricey $5 for a scoop or $7 for two scoops, its not something I would get everyday but its great to enjoy novelty ice cream once in awhile.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is one of my have-to-go-to places whenever I'm in the area. They have some of the most unique and tasty flavors of any ice cream place in SF (yes, including Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite). 

What I really love about this ice cream place is their distinct selection of tea-inspired and Asian-inspired flavors - some of my favorites include Thai Tea, Black Sesame, White Rabbit (like the candy!), and Jasmine Tea. Their other, more classic flavors are delicious too - get the Malted Milk if you can! These flavors aren't available all the time, since the store rotates between flavors very frequently, but that just means you have to keep coming back! 

I also really appreciate how generous the scoops are - the 3-scoop option is the perfect size to share between two people. The store itself also has a couple long tables for people to sit down and enjoy their special treat.

Note that this place tends to close a bit earlier than other stores, so make sure you take a look at the hours before you visit - I've come more than a few times only to find out that the store was closed.
author: Yuan J.

description: I usually order 2 scoops just for IG worthy pics but I've never finished two scoops before.... Until TODAY. White rabbit - with condensed milk and white chocolate is to die for.
author: Sarina A.

description:
Cute & hipster ice cream shop! Sweet flavors (like. really sweet) but $$$$!!!! 

Prices have been updated from Yelp!!! ($$$): 
- SCOPES: $5 (single), $7 (double), $8 (triple)
- PINT: $10 
- ANY TOPPING OR CONE: $1 

So...yeah. Pretty expensive ice cream. Probably the most expensive ice cream I had in my life. :P

The flavors were good, although everything was really sweet, which kind of masked the essence of the different taste themselves: 
- WHITE SESAME W/ ALMOND BRITTLE (3/5): the almond brittle stood out a lot but was super sweet. Didn't taste too much of the white sesame. 
- CHICORY COFFEE (3/5): standard coffee flavor 

We also added hot fudge (extra $1) and thought it would be HOT fudge, but it was just a sad few drizzles of COLD chocolate syrup, from what it looked and tasted like.
author: Wendy F.

description:
i try every new ice cream place when it comes out. and you know--after time has passed--this one store has really stood the test of time.  it's the ice cream store you marry.  i mean--this IS san francisco--i could probably marry a Mr AND Mrs Miscellaneous.  The hardest part of such a marriage would be simply spelling it on the license at City Hall. And maybe on a lease.  But beyond that hand cramping chore, I mean, cmon, it's totally worth it!

Anyway--it's the one parlor where the flavors are just done perfectly.  Have you tried the Earl Grey?  The simply chocolate?  Matcha Green Tea?  They are the best embodiments of those flavors I've tried anywhere in SF or beyond.  The texture is also outstanding--not icy or grainy--very creamy.

Of course no store is perfect. In this case, they are closed on most of the days I really crave ice cream.  Sometimes I find myself cheating--visiting Mr Slocombe or Ms Bi Rite... but Mr/Mrs is all cool about it--they know I'll come back to them because they're secure in being the best and too busy to worry about me--they're focusing on achieving the best of their craft.  PS, even though I'm married to Mr/Mrs Misc, I still like to keep a little Garden Creamery on the side.
author: Philip L.

description:
What a great find!  Beautiful flavors with clean and smooth textures.  
I adore the simplicity of the layout and their menu flavors are a handful amount.  

Service is great and the location is a bit further out from me since I reside near palo alto but when life gives you lemons I come here and scoop up a limincello instead.   See what I did there?  Lol

Love love love this place.
author: Victoria B.

description:
Their ice cream is definitely one the the best I have ever found in the city. So happy to come try out this place. Would love to bring my friends over again when we hang out next time. 

Give you a solid thumbs up!
author: Susanne S.

description:
After seeing the great reviews, I definitely wanted to check this place out. I stopped by after lunch, and as it was a hot day, the place was pretty crowded.

There wasn't much of a line though when I went up, but unfortunately, the service was rather inattentive. I stood in front of the register / ice cream for around five minutes as people just walked around the back ignoring me. Then, proceeded to start talking to another customer who had shown up after me and before I had even been acknowledged started helping them out. Once I was helped, the guy was kinda spacey and I had to get his attention a couple times. 

Overall, the ice cream itself. I got the strawberry flavor since the other ones I tasted were too sweet. I honestly thought it was just ok. It didn't blow my mind and wasn't amazing or anything. In my opinion, marginally better than normal ice cream, and at a much more than marginally higher price. The place itself is very modern and chic, but I won't be making the trip here again unless another hot day hits and I happen to be passing by.
author: Michelle L.

description: I'm pretty sure this is my favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco. Yes I love Humphry Slocombe, Bi-Rite Creamery, Garden Creamery, Mitchell's, etc. but Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous takes first prize for me because they're able to achieve such pure flavors, an amazing texture, and they don't rely on gimmicky flavors to attract people. In fact, my favorite flavor of theirs is called "Just Chocolate." How much simpler could that be? Other past flavors worth mentioning are earl grey, sweet cream, and burnt sugar.
author: Victoria J.

description: This is the best ice cream spot in SF.... and people don't even know it. I suggest this to all of my friends who love ice cream. Definitely go visit them if you're in town. You won't regret it!
author: Jerry W.

description: Extremely limited selection and zero non-dairy ice cream options. FYI sorbet is just sugar water and doesn't count. Save yourself some time and $$$ and just go to any grocery store in the city instead.
author: Eytan H.

description:
I came here after a hard workout at Dogpatch Boulders to reward myself. I ordered the orange blossom, black ipa (21st Amendment), and the pink squirrel (strawberry, cacao, and rum?). The ice cream flavors are similar to Icis, but has a thicker, creamier texture. The black ipa did taste quite bitter considering ice cream usually tastes pretty sweet. My favorite was the orange blossom since the orange flavor was quite strong. I split the three scoops with my friend cause there was no way I could eat it all myself. 

Tip: You can ask for a waffle cone on top and then scoop one of the scoops onto the cone if you're trying to save a bit of money and splitting it with a friend.
author: Edward W.

description:
The flavors did not interest me the day I came here. After trying a few different flavors, my friend and I decided on butter pecan and chicory coffee. 

Butter pecan did not taste like anything special. I only chose this flavor because nothing on the menu caught my eye. Chicory coffee was gooooood! If you love coffee, you will really enjoy this! It tasted like Vietnamese coffee in ice cream form! The house made cones were really good also, but I feel like it is really overpriced: $1 for housemade cones, $4 for kids scoop, and $5 for single scoop. 

The flavors are a hit or a miss, maybe I will come here when they have more exotic flavors.
author: Shirley S.

description:
Their Ube ice cream was the most magical ice cream that I've ever had. I've had a lot of ice cream in my life, but nothing has ever close to this level of ice cream perfection. The perfect texture between iceiness and creaminess, the subtle sweetness and malty flavor of the fresh Ube, the balance between the saltiness and sweetness... ugh. Mr. And Mrs. definitely set the bar for the best ice cream ever with their Ube flavor. Words cannot describe how sad I am that it's not on the regular rotation. I would describe it kind of like Rick and how he feels about the Mulan Szechuan Teriyaki dipping sauce.

Please bring it back. :'(
author: Alex C.

description:
Wow no line and great dessert place after breakfast at dogwatch area. 

Basil leaf is so amazing I cant stop raving about how much I enjoyed it ! So light and refreshing and dead on with the scent of basil!

Also had Earl grey tea which changes at each place but tea enthusiasts will be pleasantly excited about this!


Phenomenal customer service and would highly recommend to those who want to scream for the cream !
author: Olivia L.

description:
Ice cream in San Francisco is as loved & revered as pizza, burgers, & coffee.  

So bring baseball into the mix?  Genius.

I came in specifically for their "ballpark" ice cream.

There wasn't any.

Was I disappointed?  Yes.
Was I sad?  Yes.
Did I pout?  Almost...

Except I didn't need to.  Because, although they didn't have ballpark, they did have...

Ovaltine!

Ovaltine?!  I LOVED Ovaltine!  It was a staple of my childhood!  Yours too, right?

I went from "no ballpark?!?!" all crestfallen, to "ovaltine?!?!" all excitement in about 10 seconds.  Nice save, Mr. & Mrs. M.  
Nice save.

Of course, I asked to sample first.  I'd never even seen Ovaltine ice cream before, much less had it.

And guess what?  It tasted EXACTLY like Ovaltine.

I found this comforting & almost disturbing.

HOW do they DO that?!?

I also asked to try the strawberry shortcake, since it was the last day of summer & all...

It was fabulous.

They were both so good, in fact, that I left w a half pint of each.

Props for even doing half pints.  And major props for the peanut butter malt balls.  I only had one (25 cents at the counter), but it was truly fantastic.

The ice cream flavors are 5 stars.  Easy.  Same goes for the quality.  Small batch & organic is SO San Francisco, isn't it?

I have only one negative.  Ballpark should be on the menu everyday during baseball season.  What if Pence or Bumgarner walked in for chrisakes?  Do you really wanna be the shmuck that has to tell him that ballpark's not available today?

I should think not.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Om nom nom nom, I love a good ice cream spot, and this definitely made my top ice cream spots list!!  We were in SF going furniture shopping, and obviously wanted a fun treat since we were already that far north.  I found this spot and it didn't disappoint.  

They have a pretty limited menu, so I could imagine that if they just don't have something that resonates with you that you wouldn't like it as much.  I had the Ovaltine flavor which was SO good.  Reminded me of childhood.  It was perfect.  The flavor was great, the ice cream wasn't too light or too thick, it was just perfect. :)

I'd definitely come back next time I'm in the area!
author: Alyx F.

description:
In my opinion this is the best Ice Cream parlor in the city. Freshly made ice cream flavors daily.  The Ice Cream is incredibly smooth and delicious, you can taste the craftsmanship.  The best part is it remains something of a secret as all these other new shops try and market themselves.

Don't be fooled by hype, you won't ever be disappointed by a scoop here.
author: Alicia F.

description:
The dogpatch is dead, but not because of this place. There's always a line out the door whenever I drive by, and was lucky today when we walked in and got our ice cream within 10 mins.

Such a hip spot. Hip, but unpretentious--my favorite combo. There were about 10 ice creams to choose from (truffle chocolate and butter toffee were so tasty but also so sweet), and lots of tiny snacks to buy and take home or give as gifts. The chocolate chip was delicious and I definitely recommend it. 

Feels way more like a local ice cream shop compared to bi-rite or humphrey slocombe. Tons of seating, and tons of parking (the dogpatch is dead, remember?).
author: Steph D.

description: This is a great spot on a beautiful day. The owner and work staff are awesome down to earth people that chat it up with you if there's no line. The favors are always changing and you will never guess what flavors they will have until you walk in. If your in the dog patch and have a sweet tooth stop by and say hi.
author: Miguel P.

description:
Ice cream was delicious and fresh. Pricing was reasonable. Service was good. 

I got the bourbon caramel. Sooooooo delicious
author: Catherine W.

description: I came here to try some unique flavors but the day I went, most of the flavors were basic. I wanted to try the Earl grey or black sesame. But I ended up ordered a scoop of basil and birthday cake on a waffle cone. The basil was refreshing and light and the birthday cake was vanilla with chunks of chocolate cake and sprinkles. I liked the texture of the ice cream, and the waffle cone was pretty good. But I really wanna come back for more unique flavors.
author: Vy T.

description:
This is an ice cream shop that epitomizes the mom & pop business in the 21st century. It's probably the reason why half the people around made the journey to this neighborhood.
It's appropriately named too. There are typically about 10 flavors available at a time on the chalkboard menu. There's never any rhyme or reason or central theme around the randomly chosen flavors of the day. There's usually always at least one alcohol flavored one, be it whisky, rum, bourbon, beer, etc. I once saw a Mary Jane flavor. I don't know what's in it, but it sounds interesting. Of course they offer classic flavors and some interesting combinations as well. 
There are also other cookies & sweet treats. Among the selection, it looks like their peanut butter malt balls are most popular.
We came on a sunny Sunday afternoon and there was a line out the door, but it moved pretty quickly. There's a good amount of seats, but they were all taken, so we took our ice cream to the little children's park a couple blocks away.

It is a little pricey. One scoop is $5 and a cone is $1. A kids' size is $4. (I'm still a kid, aren't I?) 
Mr. Joy & I shared two scoops for $7, of bourbon & vanilla. Texture was nice and creamy. You can definitely taste the bourbon, but it was more like a bourbon aftertaste.
