I don't usually like liquor-flavored desserts, but it was mostly sweet. I don't typically go for vanilla either, but it balanced out the bourbon. 
It's nice that they serve their ice cream in small paper cups with biodegradable spoons, too.

Give it a try if you're in the area. The overgrown city has created an interesting dynamic in this neighborhood and it warrants a visit.
author: Joy W.

description:
When the SF Eater blog named this place one of the 14 Essential Ice Cream Shops in SF, I knew I had to try it out.  My wife & I came here on an unusually warm Sunday afternoon, and there was a steady line in this cozy establishment.  We had time to think about our options and ultimately chose a single scoop of strawberry (for her) and a single scoop of PB&J, both on homemade sugar cones (which look just like waffle cones).

The strawberry was good, but the PB&J was excellent.  There were huge ribbons of very thick (possibly house-made) peanut butter interspersed with sweet raspberry jam streaks.  Plus, I recommend splurging the extra dollar for the homemade cones, which are bigger than the regular sugar cones and can hold your scoop(s) for a bit longer.  

My wife also purchased some licorice, which she enjoyed at the Giants game later that day.  The next time I come back, I will probably get some cookies or peanut brittle to go, too,
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Such a hidden gem in Dogpatch! Perfect for a warm afternoon after work. 

I like the fact that this little shop is intimate and very unique in the flavors they offer. They have seasonal flavors that constantly rotate. My boyfriend and I got two scoops on their fresh waffle cone (definitely get the cone!)

My favorite flavor was the lavender green tea. I'm a huge fan of green tea so this was delicious. Their icecream was so fresh and the lavender notes blended surprisingly well. 

The honey peanut butter flavor was average, but I think the toffee flavor from Tin Pot is much better in comparison. 

All in all, I would definitely come back if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to get a scoop.
author: Kristi L.

description:
On a hot indian summer day in SF, this was the perfect place to be. Apparently, they have different flavors daily! I was intrigued by the sampaguita (jasmine flower) flavor in a freshly made waffle cone! I was not disappointed. It was so refreshing and delicious. I am glad I finally made it out here. 

$5 min charge for credit card so expect to get a larger scoop :)
author: Yin H.

description: Whoa! I literally opened my eyes wide open after one taste of the chicory coffee ice cream. Intense burst of coffee and what is ostensibly chicory (but tastes like dark chocolate) await in every spoonful. Very special experience.
author: John E.

description:
This is how you always want ice cream to taste. Period. 

Plus friendly service with a smile :)
author: Cassedi C.

description:
I must say this is my favorite ice cream spot in the whole Bay Area. I've been to this place 4 times so far, and everytime I feel very fulfilled after having their icecream here. 

I tried to visit this place everytime I visit SF. Personally I really much love the "dogpatch" area. It's not hard to find parking, it's filled with specialty stores such as a winery, art galleries, brewery, and eateries.

Icecream-wise, they use stuarts, which is quality milk. Second, their flavors change all the time. I was able to try different flavors everytime. Their icecream leans toward a bit sweet, which doesn't work for all flavor. However, their icecream flavor explode once it enters your mouth!

I had the chance to try Anchor steam(beer) flavor, candied ginger, gunpowder greentea, black seasme, seasalt caramel, vanilla

1 star knocked out because sometimes it's really too sweet, and rooms for improvement!
author: Gary C.

description: Literally the best ice cream I've ever had. The texture is out of this world - incredibly creamy, yet solid and not quick melting. We tried 4 flavors and they were all heavenly- bold, but not over powering. The calamansi lime is my favorite. There was a little bit of wait, but it was well worth it. Trendy decor reminiscent of a modern commercial warehouse complete with a chalkboard menu. Highly recommend!
author: Mel D.

description:
Tasty ice cream option in the Dogpatch. Stopped by here after having brunch in the area, otherwise I can't really imagine myself coming all the way out here for ice cream.

Anyways, it's a small ice cream place - tables are actually a bit crammed, but clearly pretty popular. They have a couple of rotating flavors that I thought were pretty unique, e.g. the guava which is what I got. Some basic flavors, some creative ones, so that was neat. I got a kids scoop which was a fairly generous single scoop at ($4). They do have a minimum $5 credit card charge if you only have a cc.

Ice cream texture was nice and creamy, rich in flavor despite it just being guava, and just really well made. I don't know if it's the best ice cream I've ever had, but I certainly enjoyed it and will likely stop by if I'm ever in the area again.

tldr; yummy ice cream with unique flavors!
author: Jasmine X.

description: The most amazing ice cream I have ever had.  I consider myself an ice cream addict and I've eaten all sorts of ice cream from all parts of the world and all varieties and exotic blends you could think of.  I can kill a pint no problem.  These guys do it right and do it well, on any flavor I've tried.  Earl Grey,  Sweet Cream and Thai Tea are some of my personal favorites.  Even the spoons are great on the pallet and recycled.
author: Adolf M.

description:
I'm no ice cream connoisseur, which is probably why my reaction to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous' ice cream isn't "OMG, this is delicious," but rather, "WTF, $5.00 for ONE scoop?" I know SF is expensive but this is outrageous. There aren't very many flavors offered at any given time. Today was vanilla, coffee, chocolate, strawberry, and lemon. Those are not creative at all.

In an effort to be Asian and save my date $3.00, I suggested that we get a double scoop in one cup for $7.00 instead of two single scoops for $10.00. Plus, I always love trying different flavors so it gave me a good excuse to try out his choice as well. We ordered coffee and strawberry and I'll admit that both were fresh, tasty, and organic. But that doesn't justify the wait or the price tag.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. WHY U SO GOOD IN MY BELLY?!
It's quite a trek for me to get to the Dogpatch but whenever I'm in the area, I always come here and never regret it. Recent ice cream flavor favorites: Mango and English Breakfast Black Tea. Oh my gosh- I'm salivating just thinking about it. I actually bought a pint to go and you can choose two flavors to go in the pint! Win, win if you can't choose one! I love this place and it's so delicious. YOU MUST COME HERE IF YOU HAVEN'T TRIED IT. !!!
author: Grace L.

description:
When I'm bored of the regular vanilla or chocolate ice cream flavors, I come here. I have yet to be disappointed. Their flavors are always different so you get to try different ones every time you come here. 

Staff is always so friendly as well! I've read some reviews about complaints that the staff looked annoyed when people want to try flavors. Okay. I've seen people try 5 flavors (-.-) I get you want to try everything- I do. But especially when it's busy, please don't be a pain in their ass and ruin their shift. It's ice cream. I mean it's delicious ice cream but let's not make their lives hard please. It shouldn't be difficult to be nice. 

Anyways. Come here if you're bored of "regular" ice cream flavors. Portions are pretty big too!
author: Alex D.

description:
This is my go-to place when my girlfriend and I are looking for ice cream in the city. Personally, I prefer this over Smitten, Humphrey Slocombe, Bi-Rite etc.

PROS:

1. Excellent flavors - they occasionally have various asian-inspired flavors, and those are usually some of my favorite. My go-to flavor that they usually have is Malted Milk. Sometimes they have other flavors too like White Sesame / Black Sesame that are some of my favorite.

2. Perfect texture - I like the texture of the ice cream here a lot. It's not really a gooey or melty texture al all - it keeps its shape very well.

3. Consistency of experience - I haven't had a bad experience here!

4. Indoor seating - There's usually enough seating indoors.

CONS:

1. Price - A single scoop is a bit pricy (although it makes sense in San Francisco), which is why my girlfriend and I usually get a triple to share.

2. Hours - The hours here are inconvenient and they're occasionally not open when we're in the area and are thinking about Ice Cream. However, this place is definitely worth a special trip when you're in the area!

TIPS:

1. Check the hours and make sure that they're open before you make the venture.

2. They're located a few blocks away from the 22nd street caltrain station.

3. Street parking is usually findable and is free, although might take ~5-10 minutes.

4. Try the Malted Milk! It's the best!

5. Ask for samples - they rotate out flavors extremely frequently, even during the day.
author: William C.

description:
Wow. I live just up the street and I've been wanting to try this place since I moved in - well folks, Sunday at noon is a great chance to get in/out before the crowds settle in, and let me tell you, it'll be absolutely worth it. 

When I asked which flavors they're know for, they told me the flavors change constantly and they'll let you try any flavor you want replete with a metal tasting spoon! 

I ended up rocking out Malted Milk (a classic flavor) and finished the single-scoop cup in about 10 min flat. Hundreds of other Yelp reviewers have already reinforced how good this stuff is, so just go there already.

Really though, consider coming to the dogpatch for a visit and experience what we have to offer; I think this is the best neighborhood in SF.
author: Jason L.

description:
I have had a lot of ice cream in my life time, and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is average in my experience.  The flavors sound unique and interesting, but not intense enough during each spoonful.  When I eat a new flavor of ice cream, I ask myself if I can tell what that flavor is if no one told me.  At this place, the flavors are not prominent enough to stand out.

1 star off: mediocre flavors for miscellaneous flavors
1 star off: $5 for each scoop is pretty ridiculous
author: Ally W.

description: EXCELLENT PEANUT BRITTLE! If you catch them on a day with Ginger ice cream, get that! The Dark 'n Stormy ice cream is pretty good too! Another time that we went they had Mint Cookie, which tasted like a mint leaf with oreo cookies in it. It was refreshing for a warm day in the city. The Green Tea Calamansi was tasty, but it tasted more like a Jasmine green tea with a little lime zest in it. The Burnt Sugar tasted just like a caramel ice cream. Yummy! You pretty much can't go wrong with any flavor from Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Aimee I.

description:
Another delicious place near work to challenge my waistline... :-\

The very first time I went in there, I nearly screamed with delight when I saw the ice cream flavor of White Rabbit. My mind was in circles..."as in the Chinese milk candy that I so loved as a child...and let's face it as an adult still"...I get it anytime it's on the menu. 

I remove one star because recently they raised their price substantially. $5 for one scoop is really high. I'm not sure if they use completely organic products but I still think it's high regardless.
author: Viyada S.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is one in a long line of SF bougie ice cream shops. Their limited hours and menu only make you crave it more. (Really? No hours on Monday?)

So I was finally able to stop by for a scoop. Looks like we were able to beat the crowd, because after we sat down with our flavors, a line of people came in, presumably in hopes of getting ice cream before closing. There are a lot of unique flavors available. We went for lychee black tea and orange chipotle. The flavors are true to their names. The lychee black tea is fruity and not overly sweet, mostly tea-flavored. The orange chipotle was great because it was like eating a high end orange-sicle with actual chipotle chunks in it. Good for spice lovers. I want to try the rose cardamom and the french lavender.

Feel free to ask to try flavors before you buy. At $4 for a kids scoop and $5 for a normal scoop, while this ice cream won't break the bank, if you're like me, you don't get the chance to eat this every day. (If you do get the chance to eat fancy ice cream every day... lucky. Where do you work?)

There is a lot of room to sit around, chill, and eat. Also, while ice cream is the main draw, you can bring back a present for the poor souls who weren't able to come to MaMM in the form of things like cookies, pretzels, or peanut brittle (haven't tried any of them yet).
author: Jade V.

description:
5 stars for the housemade peanut butter malt balls alone, but hell yes to these friendly folks, their offers of samples (Brittany B. and her experience with no samples at Smitten should be pleased) and their unique flavors. I was so delighted with my fruity pebbles ice cream i can't even tell you. Brown Butter, Sweet Cream, Birthday Cake... Yum. I feel like this place has the uniqueness in flavor like Humphrey Slocomb and the texture of creamy Bi-Rite. All and all, quite awesome.

Someday we'll have to try the Fernet or one of the Boozy Flavors like IPA, Chocolate Vodka, Guinness Stout.
author: Nikki M.

description: Was happy to find a top notch ice cream place in SF. Not a fan of all the crazy toppings and obscene amount of salt that is becoming popular recently, won't mention any names here. You will find simple clean flavors here with one of the creamiest textbook textures you've ever had. My favorite so far has been banana, my wife loves their sweet cream.
author: Kartik S.

description:
Stopped by toward the end of our day in SF. I only tried the Frosted Flakes flavor, which tasted like delicious Frosted Flakes cereal milk. Their cookies look tasty too; will have to grab one next time.

It's located out of the way of where I usually hang out in the city, but if you're driving in there is plenty of parking in area!
author: Lindsey C.

description: I absolutely love their ice cream because it's smooth and their flavors are simply perfection.  The mango sorbet and Earl grey tea, as well as the black sesame are a few of my faves.  Luckily, the ice cream isn't made in bulk which means it is relatively fresh.  Unfortunately, the ice cream isn't made in bulk so tubs last until there's no mo'.
author: Janet T.

description:
After consuming 2 sandwiches, we decided to get our sweet tooth fix on.

We sampled a few flavors and settled for the Chocolate Chip.  But of course, one scoop isn't enough for Him let alone for 2 people so we got the Sweet Cream as well.  The flavors are really subtle and nothing too memorable.  

4 stars goes to the Peanut Brittle-Brown Sugar Cookie.  Nice crunch on the outer rim, soft on the inside.  Not too peanut buttery, not too sticky.  He definitely missed out on this one.

Good service.
author: Linda N.

description: Another neighborhood gem! The ice cream here is worth the line and the weird hours. Seriously, so good. (The vegan chocolate sorbet is ...what!? so, delicious.)
author: Urban S.

description: The ice creams here were yummy and creative! Love it. I guess that's why it gets such good ratings on yelp. I would love to come hang out with my friends here next time!
author: Lawrence C.

description:
Have been meaning to check out Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for ice cream forever. It's in the Dogpatch, so it's a little out of the way for me in terms of where I usually hang out in SF. The name is super cute and so fun to say! 

There were 9 flavors available on my visit: French lavender, black sesame, sweet cream, orange blossom, basil chip, ovaltine, ube, cookies n cream, and salted mango. The girl at the counter said that they make their ice cream in small batches and that when they run out of a flavor, that's when they replace it with a different flavor. I sampled the salted mango and the French lavender. (They used real spoons for the samples.) The lavender was really good - you could definitely taste the lavender flavor. The salted mango wasn't really salty - I couldn't really taste any hint of salt, but I really like the fruity mango flavor. I ended up getting a scoop of the salted mango and a scoop of the black sesame. The texture and consistency of the ice cream was really good. Perfectly creamy - not too icy or soft. The black sesame was good, but not the best black sesame I've ever had.  

I was hoping that they would have earl grey the day I visited. The girl said that they usually have a tea flavor, but not that day. I liked the place and the ice cream. If I'm ever back in the Dogpatch (there's a Caltrain stop here) I want to try their earl grey, which is one of my fave artisanal ice cram flavors.
author: Sylvia K.

description:
Me and my boyfriend think Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous has some of the best ice cream in the city. When we crave ice cream, it's the first place we think of. One of the only negatives to this place is that it closes fairly early compared to other places. I crave Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous at all times of the day, and I wish I could get it all the time. The very first time we came here, we came right when it opened. I had the cookies and cream on their house made cone, while my boyfriend got the mint chip on the house cone as well. Their ice cream is just well-made. The quality is consistent, and that's why we always find ourselves coming back for more. 

We've been coming here later and later in the day, and we're always disappointed to see that "sold out" sign over the house made cones on the menu. i guess with their popularity, their cones just sell out earlier and earlier. Guess we have to come here right when they open. I don't mind at all. 

On our most recent trip here, I got the Chicory coffee drowned with their house made hot fudge. Good lord was that decadent. The fudge isn't too too sweet, and I wondered if I could get the fudge in like a vat so I can bathe in it....so good. I imagine this would go great on any of their flavors. Seriously, I don't think you can go wrong ordering any of their flavors. So don't mind the lines because there is something great waiting for you at the end of it. 

++++ for free street parking because it's a rare treat in San Francisco, and it should be cherished.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Delicious ice cream. I still think Humphrey's is my #1 but I finally had the opportunity to try Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous out in Dogpatch and loved the unique flavors here as well.

I showed up at 11:27AM and they didn't unlock the doors until 11:35AM, but once inside, the staff was friendly and let me try 3 flavors ( I was upfront and told them I was really indecisive and needed to try 3, ha ha). I had the Sesame, Earl Grey, and Cardamon & Rose.  

The Earl Grey and Sesame were my favorites so I bought both and a pint to take home. Scoops here are generally pricey but the pints are worth it. $4/kids scoop, $5/1 scoop, and $7/2 scoops. $8/3 scoops. When did ice cream become so expensive? Pints are $9- more reasonable.

Overall - I like the fresh ice cream made daily and I like the comfy ambiance. They have lots of communal seating so you can eat your treat here!
author: Veronica S.

description: I've been holding back on writing a review so I could keep this little gem to myself but I guess there's no hiding it, the secret's out. This was especially apparent over the weekend when I found myself standing in the long line out the door... but thanks to the staff, it moved quickly. Their flavors are always original and on point so there's no wrong choice... you pick what sounds delicious and it will surpass all expectations beyond your wildest dreams. This time, I had the Fruity Pebbles flavor and it tasted better than the actual cereal. Case in point.
author: Spring L.

description:
Yes, I now get it.
Prior to our current cold spell, I had the fortune of stopping here as a pre-meal snack on a recent late Saturday afternoon.
Friends have long touted this ice cream shop to me; in fact, it was a ten year old kid whose palate is of a thirty years old foodie that introduced me to this corner ice cream shop.  
Arriving on a recent late Saturday afternoon, I finally tried it.  The counter person/cashier recommended salted mango (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=8G6UJGqRynAIbtOifu_t9g&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q), so a single scoop for me, please; my other choice was the lime cheesecake.  The counter person did not steer me wrong as my eyes rolled upon the first spoonful.  The fragrance of the mango shined with the salt offering a stark yet delicious contrast to the creamy mango sweetness; in Asia and Hawaii, some locals sprinkle cayenne pepper on mango for a similar flavor contrast.  
This works!
The seating area was only about half full and everyone seemed to be enjoying their cold sweet treats.  I ate mine in my car as I waited for our takeout dinner order from Hard Knox across the street.  Let's just say that this was the highlight of my evening meals.
Yes, will be back and definitely sooner than later.
author: Mike C.

description:
There are so many well known homemade ice cream shops all around San Francisco. Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous has definitely earned a good reputation for good quality ice cream. I love ice creams made in small batches where they experiment with different flavors.

Lychee Black Tea - Delicious! If you love boba drinks and addicted to ice cream like I am, get this one! It's all in one! Tastes like a boba milk tea in ice cream form. The black tea was strong and over powered the lychee flavor, which I didn't mind.

Lemongrass - Reminds me of Vietnamese noodle soup! It's weird, but weirdly good! I enjoyed this very much because its so different, something I have never tried before.

Burnt Sugar - Pretty much just plain caramel flavored.

I can't wait to come back to try other flavors! They sell by the pint too if you want to bring some home.
author: Janny S.

description:
I've been here twice so far and have been impressed both time. I can't wait until the next time.

Their flavors are pretty unique and I always see something different.

I usually go for one of the tea flavors. The Earl Grey was really delicious and has a strong tea flavor but in my most recent visit I had the Lychee Black Tea. This is now my favorite to this date. I love lychee and put it with tea, it's a match!

Peanut Butter Malt Balls - They have these in a small ($5) and large ($9) bags as well as individuals (25c). I couldn't resist but go for a bag. I'm glad I did because these were amaze balls! Peanut butter fans, you will love these!

It is located right off the 280 and very close to the caltrain station in the Dogpatch. I like how easy it is to get here and there is plenty of parking. The area is not congested at all with traffic.
author: Michael C.

description:
I love the setting of this place - there was definitely a hipster vibe from the furniture and decorations inside which I really liked. The people working there were also super nice! It was a very nice environment. It's a nice place to sit and enjoy ice cream with your friends.

They have a lot of unique flavors that I found a  little intimidating. I got the frozen hot chocolate (it just tasted like normal chocolate ice cream). 

Good ice cream and good ambiance.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Sleek, modern neighborhood shop that serves high-quality ice cream in unique flavors. While the prices are a bit on the high side, the quality of the ice cream is evident, and you also aren't overwhelmed with large portions if you're counting calories.

The seating area is relatively small and gets crowded easily if there are lots of people swinging by. I'd also love to see this shop open at nighttime hours instead of mainly afternoon hours.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I absolutely love this ice cream parlor! Their menu changes regularly and they have the most unique and delicious flavors, but you better eat up or bring a pint to go since they may not always have the same flavor when you return.

The staff are super friendly and helpful, and you can sample every flavor if you're like me and can't decide what you want to order cause everything sounds so delicious!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: $4.50 for tiny,i mean very small  kids scoop and $5.50, for very small regular scoop,$1 extra if you add home made cone,or you can get  free boxed cone,boxed cone was pretty good,and icecream was pretty good,its a big place,they should do more with it,like selling cofee,no proper signs outside which they should fix,they should clean the front window,and give you bigger servings of icecream,they are gentrifying the area,but i would not walk around the area at night,the have none milk icecream but you have to ask,as its not on menue,server could be more friendly,
author: cc c.

description:
I'm a weirdo, but I'm actually not a big ice cream fan.  So to find a place that I actually love is surprising, and deserves five stars.  Not quite sure what makes it so damn good, it's a little creamier and butterier than your average ice cream (is this called custard?  I don't know shit about ice cream).  But I love it and crave it.  I also love the little chocolate vahlrona pearls.

It's also still a bit of a hidden gym...doesn't have half the line that Bi-Rite usually does.
author: Casey P.

description:
Passed this place walking through the Dog Patch and had to stop. The peanut brittle ice cream was fantastic. Plenty of seating and lots of people waiting for their fill.

Definitely get a scoop or three.
author: Shaun J.

description:
Ice creaaammmm!!! Too good. 

They switch out the flavors here all the time, so I don't always get the same flavor. I really like their salted mango and almond brittle/sesame flavors!! The salted mango is very refreshing, and tastes good with anything creamy. The almond brittle flavor tastes a bit "asian," probably bc of the sesame flavor. I'm never disappointed when I come here. The kid-size is always enough for me. If I come with a friend, we typically just share a double. I can't wait until the dogpatch develops further; this place will definitely have a line out the door - especially with all the renovations of pier 70. Also, the employees are super friendly, and don't mind if you try the flavors. I like this place more than Bi-Rite!
author: Connie L.

description:
Shark week + rainy day = every right to indulge in ice cream at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.

When you see a building with a painting of an ice cream cone topped with several layers of ice cream scoops, you know you're at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous! It's a cute little ice cream shop but seating was limited... even on a cold, rainy day!

I recommend the Pink Squirrel and Pink Guava ice cream! After finishing the two scoops, I went back in line to get another 3rd scoop and got the Birthday Cake ice cream. I think all their ice cream is pretty solid. It's not as creamy as other ice cream places and I think the flavors are a little milder. Personally, I prefer creamier ice cream.

kids scoop: $4
1 scoop: $5
2 scoops: $7
3 scoops: $8

Make sure you get 3 scoops and be aware that one scoop only limits you to one flavor.  

I'll be back if I'm in the area, but if I were to choose where to get ice cream, I'd go somewhere else like Bi-rite or Mitchell's...
author: Janet H.

description: Loved the ice cream! It was some of the very few ice cream that want overwhelmingly sweet and tasted fresh.  I got the salted mango and are it so fast because partially to was melting so quickly and because it was so good.  The other flavors I sampled seemed good too and definitely tasted a lot better the more you ate.
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Ice cream counts as carb-loading for the Nike Half Marathon right?! I was skeptical when a friend suggested that we visit Mr. and Mrs. Misc instead of Bi-Rite. But, he was driving so we made the trek out (rather far if I may add) but I'd be down to make the trek again.

While artisan ice cream places are all the rage in LA and SF (too apparently), Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was worth it! They definitely had some very unique flavors. But I was floored by their "Citrus Crisp" (lemon, lime and orange (Sun Drop Hollaaa!) + chocolate pearls). Citrus + Dairy was a weird concept to me until I sampled it. The lemon creamy and not too tart and the texture of the chocolate pearls were awesome. Got it on top of a homemade sugar cone - perfection! 

As for other flavors I sampled: 
*Black Sesame lacked a depth that Asian Black Sesame Ice cream typically has.
*Bourbon + Brittle (Peanut Brittle) was a little too sweet for me. 

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous (while your name is tongue twister), you're better than Bi-Rite!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
This spot loses a star because of the silly hours of operation (I'll get back to that), but they do have really great ice cream...and with so much cool stuff happening in this area nowadays, it's definitely worth stopping by.

Service is friendly and the ice cream options are both delicious and very creative.  You're only allowed three samples, sadly, but I guess it's better than nothing?  Between my boyfriend and me, we tasted pink squirrel (like the cocktail, with almond extract!), NOLA-style chicory coffee, burnt sugar, and maybe one other but I'm totally blanking.  We both ended up getting the pink squirrel.  It was awesome on its own, but I ended up adding the house-made citrus rainbow sprinkles for fun - they ended up making things a little too sweet, but I'm not regretful.  I think this ice cream is better than Humphrey Slocombe, but I haven't tried Bi-Rite to compare it to that...

The shop itself is pretty cute and they had a fun selection of vintage candies - all Halloween themed for the month of October!

The downside here though are the hours.  They close between 5 and 6 pm every day, which is absurdly early.  And they aren't open on Monday or Tuesday.  Who can go and get ice cream before 6pm on a workday?  It boggles my mind that they don't stay open later at least on Friday and Saturday when I see so many people in this neighborhood for dinner, drinks, etc. In addition, I made a special trip here to surprise a friend one Thursday, leaving work at 5pm to make it before closing time, only to find a note on the door that they randomly weren't open that day.  They are always doing mad business - I can't imagine that they couldn't support longer hours at least a couple of days a week.  Why not open later and close later?  Like, who is getting ice cream at 10am on a Wednesday??

Anyway, I like this place but I wish it was more "user friendly."
author: Tay H.

description:
This is the best ice cream in San Francisco. As an avid ice cream afficianado, this gets the Jess Pie Award of Best Ice Creams in the Bay. The perfect texture. Calibrated and creative flavors. Just the right amount of cream.

Winner, winner. Ice cream dinner.
author: Jess C.

description: Having been to lots of different ice cream shops since moving to SF, I have to say that this is possibly my new favorite. I've had my fair share of good ice cream, so I was actually surprised by how good the ice cream here was. They have a good selection of flavors that are interesting but not overly creative or tacky. The ice cream itself tastes just right in terms of richness, flavor, and sweetness. Everything tastes balanced and not too much or too less. I honestly couldn't decide which flavor to get because they all tasted so good, which is a good problem to have. I will definitely come back for more!
author: J L.

description:
Finally got to try Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous after so long!  We walked here after our lunch at Piccino on the kinda warm but breezy Saturday afternoon.  Upon first glance I didn't see too many attractive sounding flavors, but sampled the Pink Squirrel and loved it.  He also sampled the cookies n cream.  I asked the employee what the Pink Squirrel was and she said it originated from the cocktail of the same name with an almond liquor flavor.  And it did taste like it!  Loved it and the creaminess of their ice cream.  We shared a double ($6.50) which was a generous portion.  The ice cream didn't even start to melt until the last little spoonfuls.  

He asked me if I prefer this over my beloved Bi-Rite, and I said it's a hard choice, but I like the flavor selection more at Bi-Rite, but prefer the creamy texture of Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous more.  He preferred M&MM more.  I believe Bi-Rite is a little cheaper too.  The flavors here change everyday so it may be a gamble trekking all the way down here if you are only dead set on a flavor or two.  I would definitely like to come back and try more flavors.
author: Cat C.

description:
Wow worth the drive. I usually stay away from fruity ice cream flavors but I got the Candied Lavender ice cream with Limoncello and it was amazing. As always, get it in a sugar cone!

This easily makes it to one of the best ice cream places in the bay. Can't wait to make another trip when I'm back in sf.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I came here as we were driving back from seeing a couple open houses in the Dogpatch. This has always been on my list of ice cream spots to try, but I'm almost never in the area (Bi-Rite has it beat for convenience).

The entire time we were there and including whenever we drove by, this place had a line that reached the door or even extended out the door! Luckily, the line moved fairly quickly and we had time to decide which of the unique flavors to try. 

Earl Grey - tastes exactly like biting into a tea bag, but not too overpowering. Nice, refreshing, and flavorful.

Orange Blossom - reminded me of an orange creamsicle. Orange flavor with a creamy texture.

Thai Basil - strong, but surprisingly not overpowering basil flavor. Probably one of their more unique flavors.

The two ladies behind the counter were nice and efficient, without getting flustered by the giant line of ice cream hungry customers. Their unconventional ice cream flavors remind me of Bi-Rite, but I think they are more creative -- turning savory into sweet!

Now, if the could just move to Berry Street next to Philz, my life would be made. I would also probably be broke and 20 lbs heavier, but I'm willing to take my chances.
author: Leana L.

description: Out of the way, nondescript looking ice cream shop in trendy dogpatch. The flavors are delicious with honey grahams and milk being my favorite :) Tried the cookies once, and they were so-so, but the ice cream is worth driving out of the way for.
author: Ana G.

description: My mentee and I went to this place after picking him up from school, absolutely delicious! The lemon ice cream and sweet cream is definitely a must have on a sunny day.
author: Kareem R.

description: The best ice cream I have had in the city. God blessed the cows that made this cream.
author: C. S.

description:
There's so many ice cream places to be had in San Francisco, but come here for some really unconventional flavors. Their flavors range from Stone IPA ice cream to Basil and Chocolate to something called Pink Squirrel. Chances are, you are not going to find these flavors anywhere else, so give them a try before returning to salted caramel or balsamic strawberry or whatever.

The texture of the ice cream is moderately smooth and creamy, but it's nothing mindblowing. The flavors themselves aren't going to melt your tastebuds either but they certainly leave an impression because of their originality. I had the basil and chocolate which quite literally tasted like basil and chocolate. Fortunately, this combination worked although I can't see myself eating this flavor consistently. 

Like any other hipster/trendy ice cream shop, it's about $4-6 a scoop with an extra $1 for the in-house made cone.
author: Derek T.

description:
Still really great three years later!

Salted mango and jasmine tea ... yum. :)

--satisfied repeat customer
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. has been my go-to ice cream for quite awhile, and I finally get the pleasure to review it. In my book, Mr. and Mrs. beats Bi-Rite and its other competitors by the smallest of margins. Drawbacks in the debate for superiority point to the area (Dogpatch) where Mr. and Mrs. is located, the lack of days and hours it is open, and the rotating and unpredictable flavor schedule. Pluses include better parking and more inside seating for those #table4two dates. But the ice cream itself cannot be beat.

The consistency is perfect, a symphony of creamy, light, and smooth. The texture is to die for. Their flavors come out sharp, but never too overwhelming as in other ice cream spots. And it also doesn't break down icy or melt as fast. When it has added chunks or chips in their flavors, Mr. and Mrs. takes the time to keep those pieces standardly small and uniform. Overall, Mr. and Mrs. takes extra time in their craft to deliver an ice cream that hardly ever disappoints. 

Some of the flavors that I have tried and endorse:

Burnt Sugar (Yes, close to caramel, but has the darker tones of actual burnt sugar)
White Rabbit (My Asian folks rejoice. Eat it paper and all)
Sweet Corn (Yummy little bits of corn. Bring floss)
Calamansi Honey (Sweet and sour gloriousness)
Jasmine Green Tea (Does not have that overpowering green tea flavor)
and many more...

And don't sleep on the little extras. The cookies are pretty darn good, as is the licorice. And if you're feeling adventurous, top your ice cream off with some of that house made hot fudge or caramel. That'll do the trick.
author: Carlo D.

description:
I love shoving my face with the ice cream here. It's one of my favorite past times. In my opinion, the waffle cone can sometimes take away from the ice cream itself. But if we're being honest with each other, the waffle cone makes for a bad*ss photo op. Choose your own adventure.

Why do people love this place? The staff is so patient with indecisive San Franciscans it almost feels like charity work. The flavors are always rotating. There's always something weird to try. It's a real small business with owners that genuinely care about their products.

-1 star just because I feel like the checkout process is a little broken and because I want you guys to stay open later into the night.
author: Brianna L.

description:
After some BBQ and Brews on a Sunday afternoon, the family and I peeped over to the ridiculous sounding ice cream store next door. The line was out the door, but the ice cream justified for it. I got the Strawberry Rose and my cousin got the Tea infused flavor. Both were absolutely divine, not too crisp and not too creamy. The consistency was perfect and the flavors weren't too bold. 

4 stars for the $5 credit card minimum...
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
This ice cream place is awesome! That's why you'll always find a line outside.
I like that they have creative unique flavors. You should sample them first. I've noticed the ones with alcohol flavors tend to be a bit strong and overwhelming for me. I like to stick to the classic flavors such as banana, chicory coffee, and salted caramel. They also have jasmine green tea (you can actually taste real tea flavor), earl grey, and lavender. Some unique flavors include lychee black tea, flan, the white rabbit (i heard this is a must get, unfortunately they didn't have it every time I've been there so far). Some flavors can be real sweet too. The consistency of their ice cream is a nice creamy texture.

Their waffle cones are also freshly made. They're nice and crisp and not too sweet.

The staff is very friendly so don't be afraid to sample your heart out.

They also make cookies and snacks. I want to try their cookies one day. The pictures look amazing and I love peanut brittle.
**update: had their peanut brittle and brown sugar cookie. So good. It was crunchy and chewy with a nice mix of sweet and salty. It wasn't too sweet for me. Would go perfect with a glass of milk. I really liked the texture. 

The place has a modern feel to it. Big glass windows to look in and out of. They provide a decent amount of seating for the size, but it gets crowded.

Parking is street parking, but the neighborhood isn't super busy so I've never had a hard time finding parking.

I'm a die hard ice cream lover. How can I say no to Mr and Mrs Misc?
author: Stephanie L.

description:
This is possibly the best ice cream in the world ... definitely the best in SF that I've had so far.

... I really love the butterscotch chocolate chip cookies.  The ice cream flavors are sublime and elegant.  They are also very consistent -- every time I'm gone, it's been amazing.

I wish this place were closer to home or more convenient to get to ...
author: Andrew S.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has landed a top spot on my list of  favorite ice creams in the Bay Area. The ice creams are well curated and artfully concocted.  Although the portions are small ($4 for a single scoop), the flavors are dynamic and you'll want to appreciate its complexity.  The ice cream is smooth, creamy, and dense. 

two current favorites:
-Jasmine Green Tea: tea tastes high quality, smooth, one of the best tea ice creams!
-Orange Blossom: orange with floral notes, tiny orange bits

Definitely ask to sample the flavors! Our server was very patient and let us sample almost all of the flavors.  The black sesame was unlike other black sesame ice creams I've had.  The mango licorice was also quite delicious...if only they weren't 50 cents each, I'd buy a whole bunch!
author: Melissa T.

description:
I still love Mr & Mrs for their awesome ever-changing flavors. 

It had been a good year and a half since my last visit here, and I was a little disappointed by the texture of their ice cream. My bar is set very high from the perfectly creamy and rich-but-not-too-heavy texture I remember from before. But this time I found that their ice cream may have been kept a little on the cold side, as the texture had tiny ice bits in them. Of course, I still truly enjoyed their ice cream, but I'm just being picky because their stuff is usually so perfect!

Of the flavors that were available this time, I thought Sesame was the most exotic and delicious. Like a lightly sweetened version of toasted sesame. The Maple Black Pepper disappointed me in that I couldn't really taste the pepper. If you like mint, the Grasshopper was a great option. And I personally found the Sweet Cream a little plain and too sweet for me.

We went for the Cookies 'n' Cream - always a tasty, safe bet!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mr-and-mrs-miscellaneous-san-francisco?select=8a6gHVeAlB787y1A0QBrdQ#8a6gHVeAlB787y1A0QBrdQ
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I'll start this review by saying that there are only three things in this world that I'm extremely picky about: coffee, ice cream, and men.

Today, I got to try San Francisco's beloved Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. My expectations were very, very high. Considering the 4.5-star rating on Yelp, I was hoping for imaginative flavors, incredible ice cream consistency, and high quality ingredients. I honestly thought that I would be leaving a 5-star review...

However, my expectations weren't met. None of the flavors offered today blew my mind... I was disappointed. The strangest flavors definitely were the flan (way too sweet), maple black pepper, and Jack Daniels (no thank you). I ended up getting a double scoop of the honey graham and maple black pepper on a house made sugar cone. The honey graham was good, the maple black pepper was better. Both flavors were creamy and not too sweet, which I enjoyed.

But did my taste buds explode? Nope. Did my eyes roll back when I took the first lick? Eh. Did my stomach beg for more? Not really.

It was good, but not anywhere near the godly likes of shops such as Ici in Berkeley or Salt & Straw in Portland. (Sorry, I don't mean to sound like an ice cream snob.)

Does Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous have the potential to win me (and my stomach) over? Maybe. I'll just have to come back and try more flavors.

Still a top contender for the best ice cream in SF, though!
author: Jennifer K.

description: The frozen hot chocolate tasted exactly like hot chocolate with melting mini marshmallows in it in ice cream format.  Super delicious.  Very cute space.  I just wish it stayed open later!
author: youssarian w.

description:
If you are looking for unusual and exotic flavored ice cream, this is the place for you. My friend took me here raving about it. Of course, this type of ice cream stores changes flavor daily which makes it so special and unique. When we went, I ordered the White Corn and Citrus Crunch. 

The White Corn was really sweet and you could see the yellow dots of corn. The Citrus Crunch was super light and refreshing. I also tried my friends Strawberry Guava which was amazing.

They also sell cookies and malt balls. I got their Peanut Butter Cookie and tried they Peanut Butter Malt Ball as well. Both items were fantastic. I wish they would expand this to SoCal!!

Tiny ice cream shop but the line goes out the door! Also, this place has the best name ever!!
author: Juan F.

description:
Still one of the very best!

Decor is blissfully minimal. Flavors are always of highest quality and taste. Crowd is always friendly and unpretentious.

I tend to always go for the Chocolate Chip mixed with another flavor. Yesterday, an Horchata flavor made the cut, and my-my, so damn good.

Lines can get rather long on a hot day, so come prepared with a book to read.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Cute place, very simple and straight to the point. Very hipster and just what you expect in the area. I wouldn't say this place is great nor would I say it's bad. It's just another shop in the books. I do like that it's family owned and the owners actually work in the shop. Definitely want to support local business owners. 
The owners weren't exactly friendly, but not mean either. I'm sure they are tired but I would have expected it to be more welcoming. 

There weren't many interesting flavors, sort of the usual. The ice cream itself was good. Solid. Price wise, pretty expensive for what you get. 

If I'm in the area, I would consider coming back. Other than that, nothing to make the trek out for. A little miscellaneous for me.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
REVIEW #1000--Not for myself, but for Mr. & Mrs. Misc--1000 people averaging 4.5 stars can't go wrong!

Adventurous ice cream flavors + cutesy name + catchy storefront painting of towering ice cream in the hip Dogpatch neighborhood--all the ingredients for a place that would make San Franciscans melt.  

[THE BAKERY]

When I first walked in, I was surprised that to predominantly find wafts of bakery smells rather than the rich milky smell of a creamery at Bi-Rite and Ici's.  To give the benefit of the doubt, maybe it's all diffused in the heights of the tall warehouse ceiling, or perhaps it is masked by the baking smell.  I was disappointed when I realized that what I thought were samples were really just small pastries for sale.  All the baked goods do look delicious if you somehow have space in your stomach for ice cream AND brittles/cookies.  

[THE CREAMERY]

Yelp tells me of wondrous ice cream flavors, but on any day they only serve 8 choices.  (I guess there are only 8 Wonders of the world.)  I guess that decreases the utility for Yelp review such as this one, but before you stop reading, you may want to look at my suggested procedure:

1. Decide what looks good on the menu while in line 
2. Sample 2 of the richer flavors you want to try (so you can try it without getting too full from entire scoops.  As a general rule of thumb, I usually sample anything with caramel because it tastes best in small sample sizes)
3. Get a double scoop of the lighter flavors you want to try (no need to waste samples; if it sounds good, chances are it is good)
4. Eat the top scoop quickly so you don't look like a fatty that got a double scoop

[THE FLAVORS]

The flavors are indeed quite Miscellaneous and playful.  

(+) The JASMINE GREEN TEA is understandably popular, and I would imagine it to be particularly so in tea fanatics who are secretly craving boba and find themselves at a pricey ice cream parlor instead.  I know saying this goes against my people, but I find the jasmine green tea ice cream to be the epiphany in the latest trend towards creamas/milk foams/sea salt things--a perfected remake of the jasmine milk tea.  The tea flavor is so good that it tastes more like tea than the actual milk tea of those dismal powder-powered chain boba shops (i.e. Lollicup, TapEx, Quickly's).  

(+) The PISTACHIO MASCARPONE (the two go surprisingly well together) and FLAN (description included something with caramel) are tasty, though these belong in the sampling category because they are so rich I'd probably feel sick after whole scoops.  

(+/-) The VANILLA BEAN is as boring as it sounds; instead I suggest the CHOCOLATE CHIP which is vanilla ice cream with chocolate chips.  

(-) The alcoholic ones are not alcoholic enough.  I've tried the LEMON CAMPARI (which has delightfully strong lemon of kid-made lemonade) as well as the KAHLUA CREAM (which had a strong coffee flavor that could have been mistaken for Vietnamese iced coffee in a blind taste test), but neither were very alcoholic.  (Or maybe the City just makes strong drinks so now alcoholic ice cream is weak in comparison)

(-) My friend got the GRASSHOPPER, which is a hipster name for mint chocolate chip.  Anecdotally in our case study with n=1, we report that the grasshopper seemed to melt faster because we both ate our ice cream at the same spot at similar rates, only the grasshopper melted way faster and it got all over her hand and got blown into her clothes.  

[THE CONES]

I was excited to try the HOUSEMADE SUGAR CONE because I was unimpressed with Bi-Rite's generic cones and I horribly miss the artisan-swirl-chocolate-filled cones from Ici's in Berkeley.  I had high hopes in my extra $1, but the ROI was not great because there wasn't much unique about the cone except that it got uniquely soggy.  I'm sure it would be quite good on its own, but like the low-melting-point grasshopper, they need to do a bit of materials engineering work.

Surprisingly, the REGULAR CONE was better than the specialty housemade sugar cone because it did not get soggy, plus it does not cost extra. More $ saved means more scoops P:

[MISCELLANEOUS TIPS]

- Prices are exact change!!!  No fumbling with an awkward handful of coins while simultaneously juggling a melting ice cream cone and having no hands to take a picture.
- $3.50 half scoop, $4 single scoop, $6 double scoop, $8 triple scoop... expensive, but worth it once in awhile, especially if you still have a lot of flavors to be tried.
- Creaminess is average, meaning you can probably finish a double scoop if you had lunch awhile ago and you go with my strategy of sampling rich flavors and getting lighter ones.
- Parking in the immediate area is annoying, but if you go further into the residential area it is not impossible.
- There is a decent amount of seating with 2 large communal tables and a small side table.  It gets busy on weekends, but people usually leave after they finish their ice cream (quite fast because it's so tasty)
author: Edna C.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday and was perfect for a hot afternoon in the city. Great ice cream but somewhat questionable service. And perhaps a tad expensive for what you get, but that's San Francisco.

-----

Single scoop ($5): Had the creme di cassis (a.k.a. black currant) and it was everything the name implied. Creamy, smooth, currant-y (is that even a thing?). It was sweet but not overwhelmingly so. They only let you have one flavor per scoop, which is fair, but $5 for just one scoop seems a bit steep, even for San Francisco.

Also tried bites of my friend's caramel with sea salt, thai tea, and maple black pepper. The caramel had an incredible rich caramel taste. Thai tea was good but seemed less creamy than the other flavors. Maple black pepper was not bad but I didn't get any hint of black pepper (maybe for the best?) but it was a bit too sweet. 

-----

Although granted that there was a long line, the servers were not friendly and did not seem happy to let my friends and I have any samples. Perhaps we caught them at a bad time, but they seemed generally unfriendly... or perhaps just cooly nonchalant and un-engaging, which seems to be becoming the norm for these type of hipster-esque places in the city.
author: Megan L.

description:
I opted for the Fernet branca (alcoholic beverage that tastes like licorice) Not a strong licorice taste. I like!

Rose lemonade (Rose, lemon zest, and ginger.) - also one of my favs. 

You can only try 3 flavors max. and kid's size is $3.50, which is enough to satisfy my taste buds.

Can't wait to try more of their unique flavors.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty crowded. The line moves fast though, thank goodness. I was about to go for the cookies n crème flavor (my default if there's no pistachio or hazelnut) but I decided to ask the person helping me which flavor she would recommend. So because of that, I ended up getting the Crema Catalana. SUCH an interesting flavor. So glad I didn't go with cookies n crème. The Crema Catalana was definitely more memorable. The main flavors are lime and burnt sugar. The citrus-y tang goes really well with the sweetness of the ice cream, and helps to balance it out. The ice cream was refreshing and creamy at the same time--perfect on a nice summer day. The stuff here is on the pricey side, but totally worth it. Try the unique flavors here--you won't regret it! Will definitely be coming back from the Crema Catalana.
author: Ashley Y.

description: One of my favorite icecream places in SF! Their flavors are always so unique and the texture of their icecream is always so creamy - definitely has that homemade feel to it. Also ample room so it doesn't feel cramped when you're inside, and there are benches and chair to sit on inside while you enjoy your icecream (: Definitely worth a trip, and much better than Bi-rite in my opinion!
author: Megan K.

description:
Best ice cream ive had in my LIFE!  Favorite flavors:

Black sesame
Black tea
Jasmine green tea
Frosted flakes

DAMN!!
author: Jeff B.

description:
Basil leaf ice cream just landed in my top 3 ice cream flavors of all time, across time and across the world.

One of the best ice creameries in my hometown of SF. Only two others are in contention.

Thx misc
author: Stephen H.

description: The vanilla custard ice cream is the best. And they have rainbow sprinkles. What else could you want?
author: Christina S.

description:
I'm amazed by the foot traffic this ice cream shop gets as it's located near an industrial area in the middle of nowhere.  

After hearing all the rave, I finally made it out here.  A few of the flavors I intended to try weren't available since their menu changes frequently.  I ordered the macapuno (young coconut).  I tasted the coconut flavor and even had shreds of young coconut when taking a bite.  Unfortunately, it was a bit too sweet for me, but the ice cream was very creamy.

Verdict:  it's good...but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here as there are better ice cream shops in the City.
author: Candice H.

description:
What more can I say except, "Please, just GO!"

Mr. and Mrs. Misc. serves the best form of artisanal ice cream I have ever come across. Consistency is thick and creamy, just the way ice cream should be! Ice cream flavors are creative and packed with flavor.  

Also, the owners are cool. One time, we managed to make it to the shop before they closed and towards the end of their shift, the owner followed us out the door to give us a free peanut brittle cookie! How nice and unexpected!
author: Camille E.

description:
My favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco! They change their flavors pretty often. Some of my favorites are: Earl Grey Tea and Mango Chili Lime.

I'm also a huge fan of their baked goods. It's definitely a must stop for me whenever I'm in Dogpatch.
author: Lily L.

description:
Is this my favorite ice cream in San Francisco? No, not necessarily. Will it do the job on a hot day in Dogpatch? Sure thing!

I've had Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous on my radar for a few years. We don't venture out to Dogpatch very often, but finding ourselves here on a sunny Sunday I was 100% ready to give it a go. 

They have a ton of unique flavors here and I gladly sampled around 4 of them. They rotate flavors fairly often, so it is likely that they won't have the same flavors the next time you go in. I settled with a kid's scoop of Orange Blossom in a sugar cone and my bf had a scoop of sweet cream. I really loved the hint of floral orange blossom throughout the ice cream. It was perfectly nuanced and not too fragrant. It was, however, cloyingly sweet. I don't have a huge sweet tooth to begin with, so maybe it's just me, but the sugar level was overpowering to the point that I didn't want to finish the ice cream, save for the fact that it was keeping me cool on a 70+ degree day. Notably, all of the ice creams I sampled and the taste I had of my bf's scoop confirmed that all the ice creams lean heavily on the sweet side. 

So, overall? Fantastic selection of quirky and traditional flavors. Would I go again? Maybe, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. If you're in the hood and need a sweet treat, stop on by.
author: Liz G.

description: Hands down my favorite ice cream spot. I only make it here when I'm working in the area so whenever I go there's always a new flavor to try. I had the Fruity Pebbles ice cream a week or so ago and it was delicious, tasted just like Fruity Pebbles.
author: kim p.

description:
This place gets too much hype for what it is. Average ice cream, average toppings. There is very little that is unique about this place or their flavors that another ice cream shop in the city does not do better.

I tried the sweet cream, the chocolate, the lavender, butterfinger and root beer. The root beer was good, the rest were not very memorable.

One thing it does have going for it is that it is right next to Dogpatch boulders, so after a rough climb you can stop by here for a treat on the way home.

Perhaps the mango flavor (which was not there today) is where the success is to be found, but otherwise I can't say that I would ever recommend or choose this place over the likes of Smitten's/Birite/Humphrey's.
author: Mark O.

description: Best limoncello and butter toffee ice ever!!!! Waffle cone extremely perfect! Had to try the pomegranate licorice (note to self: get more than 4 pieces). Peanut butter malt balls = next level. This place may just trump Mitchell's Ice Cream and Humphrey Slocombe's. My new ice cream SF diamond GEM
author: Je M.

description: I'll start off by saying their ice cream is superb! Rich quality you can taste, though their flavor options are very limited. I also feel like the portion sizes aren't worth the price I'm paying for a single scoop. Although the ice cream is some of the best I've had in the Bay Area, the price and portion sizes kind of deter me from visiting more frequently. Their store hours are shorter than other creameries too, so I recommend coming earlier in the day if possible!
author: Charisse S.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon...long line, but moves fast! 

The staff was nice and prompt with giving samples, which is important for me to choosing which flavours I want! I ended up getting a double scoop: english black tea / grasshopper (creme de menthe with chocolate pearls). 

The English black tea ice cream was SO GOOD. It was creamy and the tea flavour was strong but not overwhelming; it didn't taste overly artificial either! The grasshopper was a very solid mint chocolate chip ice cream. 

I like this place better than Bi-rite mainly because their ice cream doesn't melt as fast!
author: Theresa L.

description:
200th review!!

Came here from a recommendation and hearing that it was similar to scoops in la. I feel like it's more of 3.5 stars but decided to round down because I'm really picky with my ice cream. 

PARKING: there is street parking and it wasn't that difficult to find. We parked right next to the place. 

ATMOSPHERE: your typical trendy ice cream store with long wooden tables that are kind of squished so it's hard to squeeze in sometimes. There's actually a good amount of seating compared to most small ice cream stores. They have the blackboard menus and other goodies like cookies and flavored licorice. 

FOOD: I was sad they didn't have the brown butter or mint flavor so I got cookies and cream but I also tried my moms earl grey and it was good. I like the tea flavor which reminded me of green tea. Very refreshing. I have to admit though, their cream is more creamy than I prefer and slightly sweeter too so it wasn't as icy and refreshing and scoops. Their flavors are pretty unique but overall I wasn't super impressed. My sister who is allergic to dairy was excited that they had sorbets but apparently you have to buy it by the half pints instead, you can't get it by the cone or cup. 

Also, the kiddie cup was the perfect size for me.  It's basically one round ice cream scoop.

Overall not bad but it didn't fit the bill in terms of ice cream I prefer.
author: Brittany T.

description:
Ughhh, I forget the name, but it was a tea-based ice cream with fruity overtones. I see that they change their flavors regularly; really want to try the jasmine tea at some point. We stopped by right after brunch a block away at Just for You. It was a great finish to a big brunch.

The fruity overtones were a bit too strong, but once I got over that, it was good overall.
author: James N.

description: This ice cream was delicious. Parking was easy and the line was quick! Small serving for the price, but the flavors were amazing!
author: Cassie H.

description: They have some unique flavors. You can only try three, so I tried black sesame (not my cup of tea, reminded me of mashed potatoes), basil with salted peanuts, and sweet cream. I went with basil which was delicious. I would come back often to try different flavors and because of its location at the Dogpatch. The owners are very friendly and it wasn't too busy. It's pretty spacious inside for an afternoon ice cream break. Highly recommend it- perhaps the best ice cream spot in the area.
author: Jaime F.

description:
So I was told by two of my friends that this was the spot in dogpatach to get ice cream. Well I'm a huge ice cream fan! So I just had to try it for myself.

I went on a Wednesday afternoon. It's a small little spot if your not paying attention you will walk right past it. When you walk in you see a seating area and then you see a chalkboard with different flavors on it. I tried the Rum Raisin which was actually really good. It had real rum and raisin in it! But I ended up falling for the pink squirrel! I totally forgot what it had in it BUT you should definitely try it! My friend kept it classic and got the vanilla with chocolate little balls on the top. I had to taste since I'm writing the review. Nothing to special it was still good though. The best thing about this book lave was the waffle cone! Thus has definitely been the best waffle cone I have ever had! Seriously. It was crisp, soft and sweet. I have to say I enjoyed the waffle cone more then the ice cream. 

The only thing I could say could've been better would be if they had more ice cream flavors, been to other ice cream shops with more flavors.
author: Monee C.

description: Yum yum yum! Love ice cream and the minimalistic decor of the spot. The line goes out the door and they close fairly early - so when I got a chance I had to swing by and try. I was impressed with their homemade goodies on the table before you buy ice cream. They allow you to only sample 3 flavors since it holds up the line - but I was super satisfied with the jasmine green tea and sweet cream! Got two scoops for $7 and the homemade cone, which I highly suggest! Such rich milk flavor in the sweet cream and the jasmine tea was spot on with the tea flavor - not too sweet or bland. Definitely want to return to try other flavors or whatever specials they have that day :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
If Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe merged and opened a location with easier parking and shorter lines then you'd get Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous. 

The ice cream is made onsite and it's rich, creamy, creative, and clean (less butterfat content). The flavors aren't too crazy you won't find something you won't like. 

We ordered the OVALTINE, BASIL CHOCOLATE CHIP, and CREMA CATALINA (lime and burnt sugar). SOOOO GOOOOOD!!!  Loved the generous scoops. Ovaltine tasted exact and the lime and burnt sugar gave my tongue tingles. 

While I may like BiRite's salted caramel better, I'll take the convenience factor over here. I'll definitely be back. 

If you're a tourist with a car, I'd say it's a must stop. Biking distance from ATT park. 

1 Scoop - $3.75
2 Scoop - $5
3 Scoop - $6 
Add a cone for $1

My favorite ice cream joints right now. 
1. Mrs and Mrs Misc. 
2. BiRite 
3. Humprhey Slocombe
4. Mitchells
5. Smitten
author: Earl G.

description: This review is for the hot chocolate ice cream.  It's amazing. It doesn't taste like chocolate, it tastes like hot chocolate. The moment when your tastebuds realizes that you are actually eating frozen hot chocolate is magic. Yes, it is expensive, but a little goes a long way. A child size will satisfy your cravings perfectly.
author: Shoole S.

description:
Came to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous on a saturday afternoon. I came here with a friend after brunch because there is always room for dessert, or as she says, there's a second stomach for dessert. We came here at the perfect time because after we sat down, there was a line, and both the flavors we got were sold out.

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has a hipster chill atmosphere. I love all the different tables they have inside, and I could totally imagine doing work here. A lot of light is let into the room because of the tall windows, and it just makes you feel so happy on top of eating ice-cream. 

Service:
The service here is excellent. The workers are super nice and they will let you sample the ice-creams. 

Taste: 
I ordered  a single scoop of lychee black tea and my friend got the citrus crunch? The lychee black tea was very strong, but I liked that. It had a very nice taste to it and if you like boba drinks, this one might be for you if it happens to be on the menu. The ice-cream was nice and creamy and very flavorful. My friend's was also very flavorful and it had these little balls of chocolate or something in it.

A single scoop was $5 if I remember correctly. Overall the ice-cream was really good. I love trying and discovering new ice-cream places in the city. Definitely give Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous a try for some not your ordinary ice-cream flavors.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
Ice cream, and cookies, and licorice! Oh my!

The ice cream here is top notch. My triple scoop of Malted Milk, Vanilla Bean, and Pumpkin was an adventure in pleasantly subdued flavors. I particularly enjoyed the Malted Milk flavor. While the Peanut Brittle and Brown Sugar Cookie didn't provide the flavor I was hoping, my cookie-eating partner says Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous makes some of the best Chocolate Chip Cookies he has EVER had. She also really enjoyed the Sour Cherry licorice stick.

In short - this place is a TRIPLE THREAT ice cream joint! Come prepared to enjoy ice cream and many of the other goodies they offer.
author: Mark C.

description: Love the interesting options here. Cardamom rose was my choice and literally every bite was amazing. Would definitely go back every time I visit SF.
author: Irene C.

description: Came in on a Saturday afternoon, there was no line & the staff was extremely welcoming. The chicory coffee was my favorite & probably one of the best coffee ice creams I have ever tasted! Will definitely be back!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous ice cream has rotating and new flavors daily. Definitely taste a few before you settle as you will probably end up needing more than one flavor in your life.

This past weekend I decided on a scoop of Pink Squirrel (almond and chocolate liqueur) with a scoop of chicory coffee... it was a delicious combo all held together in a homemade sugar cone!

The store is cute with a few tables inside. Not only a worthy the stop if you are in the area - but also worth the trek to the Dogpatch!
author: Shannon H.

description: Awesome ice cream! We tried the Lotus cream, cookies and cream, matcha tea, and butter pecan. Top two were Butter Pecan and Matcha Tea. The consistency is great and.i would definitely go back if I'm in the area!
author: Akshaya V.

description:
Great alternative if you don't want to endure the long lines at Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe or having to search for parking in Mission or the Embarcadero.  They have a rotating menu of flavors, but they're all pretty delicious and unique that I'd doubt you'd have trouble finding a flavor you'd enjoy.  

I was able to sample 6 different flavors with my girlfriend, but ended up opting for the lychee black tea, burnt sugar and bergamont, but would've been just as happy going for the other 3 ice creams we got to try.  

Definitely under the radar because of its location but worth making a visit out here for.
author: David C.

description: I've been heard about how delicious their ice creams are tasted from my friend and this place had always been on my list. I finally had a chance to try their yummy ice cream, yess!! And I did meet my expectations and they had lot of interesting flavors. At other ice cream shops, I have no problem for me to try, but this place only allowed you to try 3 samples. I wasn't being informed that before I used them up, my friend had to beg the girl staff for 4th sample just because she really wanted to taste that flavor before she made up her mind what were 2 scoops she wanted to get. Their waffle cones were made fresh and very delicious! If I ever go to the city again, I'd totally go back to visit for some sweet treat :) The only reason why I know the ice cream is made with a good quality, is that my ice cream melts faster than other ice cream I buy somewhere else, because you know the ice cream you're eating is made with fresh Ingredients, no artificial or additives.   Happy foodie loves to eat ice cream, and you know this place is a must try when you're in San Francisco.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Whoops, forgot to write a review for this place! I've lost count of how many times I've been here. I've been coming here back when they didn't have any lines ahem ahem but good for them for doing so well! Unfortunately they've raised their prices. A triple scoop is now $8! So crazy. May as well get the pint for $9.99. I remember when a triple scoop was like $5 =( 

Stopped in today and got a pint of Basil Chocolate Chip and my forever favorite Black Sesame. I love everyone who works here! Alex and Zaya are the best! I have no idea what was up with Humphrey Slobcome and their new employees but they're total dicks. Ruined my happy ice cream experience and my pint from them was half air so I asked Zaya to really pack in our pint today after Slocbome screwed me and she really did. Yay! Happy days! I watched her little Asian arms pack it in like her life depended on it. She must be super strong because I would've given up halfway through. I am a weakling though. A 7 year old girl once beat me at arm wrestling so a future in ice cream scooping is not for me.

I've been to all the ice cream places in the city and this is still my favorite place by far! Make sure to stop by Longbridge Pizza too next door. Can't go wrong with pizza and ice cream!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Best ice cream in San Francisco! I've eaten at 10 of the top ice cream shops in the city and this blows always all of the others by far as the ice cream is concerned.

First, this is the only creamery who actually had the scooper who knew when asked, how much butterfat is in their ice cream. Thanks for educating your staff, the rest of the numnuts in the city need to get their ppl up to speed especially since consumers know way more about ice cream these days.

Second, low overrun makes for delicious goodness and  they have it! Creamy, dense ad delicious.

Third, Flavor options were limited though :-/ and seemed to be a little plain. With a product like theirs they could push the envelope a bit more and be more bold. I also didn't see a vegan option, too bad, missed opportunity.

Fourth, They have organic cones if you want too. 

I like the home made goodies although the licorice was a bit hard. Malted milk balls were yummy.

Pricing was fair, higher than others in the city but appropriate.

Hours were limited but assuming that's because the neighborhood is sketch after dark. Oh and the sun was blaring in the Windows, maybe a roll up shade?
author: Tamara K.

description:
A reunion with my buddies got us to this nice, clean, and spacious ice cream shop. I have not seen a store that has 100 out of 100 for health score. One can judge for itself upon entering this place. 

My favorite was the Early Grey for its decadent subtle sweetness. I also tried salted mango and coconut which was fairly good. 

Parking can be a pain in the butt at this location, but that goes as well as anywhere in SF.  If I'm ever around this area, I'll definitely swing by for some ice cream goodness.
author: Owie N.

description:
Line goes out the door - always a great indication of something good to come. Tried the black tea ice cream. Was amazing and sweet, but not too sweet! Definitely a surprise to since the name made it sound a bit bitter.

The only downside to this place is that they change their flavors everyday. How do they even do that?!?!?! So if I really liked the black tea this time, I might not see it next time I go. Though I'm sure there will always be other great flavors to try ... so maybe it's not too bad of an issue.

This place was kind of like an American version to the Chinatown Ice Cream factory in NYC. Really interesting flavors! I'd come back again.
author: Connie H.

description:
I find even the kids scoop size too big to finish in any ice cream parlor in the US and this place is no exception. My husband and I shared one kids scoop of the sweet scream flavor and without a doubt agree that this is the best ice cream we have ever had in our life! 

The shop is in the middle of a very run down looking industrial area, but the inside of the shop is quite spacious and modern looking. Even though there was a steady stream of customers, everybody had space to sit down and enjoy their ice cream.
author: Sharanya A.

description:
Cute ice cream joint in the Dogpatch.

I tried the sage & honey and it was way too granola for me so I went with the chocolate in a cone and it hit the spot. They also sell some packed goodies to go, we picked up some peanut butter maltballs which are amazing to snack on.

Kudos for using reusable spoons for samples!
author: Alison L.

description:
I never knew there was an ice cream right across from Serpentine (oblivious me). I almost missed this place if it wasn't for the large picture of an ice cream tower on the front. 

Hot days are kind of rare, especially if you live in San Francisco! The best way to go about these rare occasions? Ice cream!!! Thankfully when I walked into the store, there wasn't a line out the door.

I really appreciate ice cream places with a mix of normal and unique flavors. Two that stuck out to me were lemonade and cookies & cream. Lemonade sounds normal, but I have never seen this flavor by itself on an ice cream menu. Unforunately, the lemonade flavor wasn't as tart as I wanted. I think I would have preferred it in sorbet form. However, the cookies and cream was amazing! I really wanted to savor the taste and the smooth refreshing texture. 

I'd love to come back here. Try it out!!
author: Jonathan C.

description: Candied lemon peel was solid. It had the right amount of sour and just enough sweet to be perfectly refreshing on a sunny day. It wasn't too crowded around 11:30am right at opening. There's plenty of seating and sort of an open old school atmosphere.
author: Tammy T.

description: Perfect place to eat ice cream while touring dogpatch in SF. Had the cookies and cream and hubby had the mocha chocolate. They give you as many samples as you want too! There was a line but moves quickly. Love the name of the shop too!
author: Madeline S.

description:
Got some white russian ice cream made up of coffee,kahlua and vodka.Pint got me 3 scoops.

I also tried the rose marshmallow.It's simply AHmazing.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
I actually thought I would never get to try this place because the first time I attempted to go, it was closed for a reason I can't remember. Well this time, it was open! Horray! 

I came with my cousin and we both got the double scoop in a cup. I had the citrus crisp and earl grey tea while my cousin had the sourcream with nila wafers and lavender. I think my favorite was the citrus crisp because it was interesting. I would most definitely come back to try the other flavors!
author: Tommy L.

description: New to the neighborhood so I decided to try this place out. It's been on my list of ice cream places to try in SF for a few years. There is usually a line to order - on nice days there's a line out the door. I sampled the guava - it didn't taste much like guava. I got a small of the cookies and cream. It was divine. Probably the best cookies and cream ice cream I've ever had. It is very rich so I think the small is just the perfect amount for one person - or for two to share if you really like that person!
author: Brie P.

description:
Best ice cream shop in the city IMO.

I'm honestly amazed at how consistently good they are.  They have new flavors all the time but there has never been a visit here which doesn't involve me having an internal debate over which flavor should I NOT get because I have to draw the line somewhere.  (And somewhere for me is usually 3-4 flavors at a time.)

Based on the ambiance and location you might think this to be another pretentious froufrou ice cream shop but I've come to believe these folks are quite humble.  They're always kind and helpful.  They are also very generous.  Whenever I get a pint to go it's packed so full that it's leaking over the edges by the time I get home.  

I love their coffee and tea flavors and they have many variations (earl grey, jasmine, etc).  White rabbit (based off the chinese white rabbit candies) is another one of my favorites.  The list goes on, almost any given visit there is literally a new amazing flavor.
author: Erica Y.

description:
San Francisco certainly has a lot of great ice cream, but to me,  Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is the best. Located in the hip dogpatch neighborhood, its the perfect spot to get some fantastic ice cream and take an afternoon stroll.
