The flavors change daily, so there is always something new to try. But, there are some classics that appear on the menu frequently (like chicory coffee) so you can try their signature flavors that way. I recently visited over the holidays, and they had a lot of seasonal flavors like eggnog and peppermint.

Simple scoops are always great, since the ice cream is so high quality. But if you want to go all out, get a sundae or add a topping. I like adding the valrohna crispy chocolate pearls to a scoop, and my husband thinks they have the best hot fudge around.

Staff are friendly and happy to let you sample a few flavors. 

This place really can't be beat. What a shame that Mr. Miscellaneous is already taken, because I'd love to be Mrs. Miscellaneous and eat this ice cream every day.
author: Maria M.

description:
Finally had the chance to make out here for their ice cream. Really strange location.

I was so put off by the service here. They have about 10 flavor or less here, mix of seasonal and what is probably some of their staple house flavors. I asked for 3 samples - none of them were that appealing to me, so I asked to try the ginger snap (saw another person with it). The guy behind the counter seemed like he was about to get it then decided not to - said you are limited to 3 samples. Wait...what?..I looked around to see if I missed the sample nazi sign but there were none in sight. Um well that was really weird. Never heard of a limit on samples at an ice cream parlor.

Was contemplating just leaving because of that, but figured I came out here for ice cream and went with a single scoop of black sesame. It was an interesting sweet and savory flavor but after a few bites leaves you thirsty and sick of it. Again, none of the flavors I tried really stood out to me so I don't understand why this place is so highly rated. And for $5? I rather buy a pint at the grocery store or go to some other hipster ice cream place.

What kind of ice cream shop limits your samples lol. I was thinking of buying a cookie but after the whole debacle decided I didn't want to support such an outrageous business. You can guarantee I won't be coming back here again and will warn friends who consider coming here.
author: Stine H.

description:
The Mr. and Mrs. definitely boast some of the most unique flavors I've seen, many of them Asian-inspired -- white rabbit, pink squirrel, misugaru? This might be the main reason why I'd return, as their flavor-board is constantly changing, and I didn't catch them on a day when they had a few that I'd anticipated getting to try (earl grey, bananas foster, misugaru)

This place sports an unassuming storefront with the exception of a giant ice cream cone sign out front to assure that you'll know you're close, even from blocks away. We went on a pretty chilly day so were pleased to also find that there was absolutely no line, kind of a shocker for a place like this. The staff was friendly and open to letting us try as many flavors as we'd like. The indoor seating was also a plus. 

Other than that, I can't say making the trip down to Dogpatch is fully worth it. If it was located somewhere more central, this would definitely be a place to frequent more often for a quick scoop. However, there are definitely other ice cream shops I'd prefer over this place(Birite, Ici's).
author: Junes S.

description:
BEST.ICECREAM.EVER. 

This is my go to for yummies! Not only is every flavor of ice cream the bomb  but all the cookies, peanut brittle, malt balls, licorice and everything else under their roof is SOOOoooo good!!! 

Great service even with the crowds. Be patient! 

I know some people complain about the hours, but this is a mom and pop shop. Open from 11-6 Wednesday - Saturday and Sunday from 11-5. The owners are awesome and very accommodating!  

It's a must try!
author: Rdstargrl C.

description:
If you are craving a delicious, good quality ice cream, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is the place to be!

You can taste the difference from other conventional ice creams. The unique homemade flavors are fantastic and are fun to try!

The staff is super chill and friendly, and they also offer house made confections. The chocolate malt balls are to die for - a perfect round of chocolate with a slight crunch and a serendipitous peanut butter filling.

So good. I'll be back!
author: Charlie H.

description:
The sundae is very good. Love the pineapple pieces 
Early grey tea flavor was good
Unique enough tastes to come back for more
author: Jones T.

description: Very good ice cream store! Limited flavors, but the flavors they have are super flavorful! The strawberry sorbet tasted really fresh.
author: Jen G.

description:
Finally, an ice cream shop with indoor seating! Perfect for devouring ice cream on a cold day and drawing the envy of passerby as they stare through the floor-to-ceiling windows. 

It sounds like the flavors rotate seasonally, or whenever the owners decide to experiment with new ingredients, but there are safe choices like Sweet Cream for the less adventurous sweet-toothed. I tried the Maple Black Pepper and Misugaru (originally a Korean drink powder with roasted rice, barley, soy, and red bean) before settling on the Misugaru since I love the subtle toastiness of rice and barley. Other flavors currently in stock are Sesame Rose, Eggnog, Pumpkin, and Almond Butter. I resisted the urge to sample all the flavors... If you're feeling like your dessert was especially hard-earned today, go for a sundae or root beer float. Cookies and other sweets available at the counter also. 

Toppings like whipped cream and sprinkles are available for $1 each (eh...), and you can get your ice cream in a waffle cone for no extra charge. But if you ask for the homemade cones (which always seem to run out), it's an extra $1 as well. A single scoop is $4, making Mr. and Mrs. kinda pricey, and forcing you to buddy up with someone if you want to meet their $5 min for card requirement. 

The line moved efficiently thanks to three employees handling the counter. Seating was a little tight: two rows of black tables set up cafeteria style with short stools on either side. A few smaller tables scattered along the sides can be yours if you get the timing right. 

I totally fell in love with this area of SF when we came here and will be back for sure if I'm in Dogpatch.
author: Helen S.

description:
Best ice cream in SF. They have classic and funky flavors. Some favorites include: Jasmine tea, Earl Grey tea, cookies & cream, white rabbit (a riff off the White Rabbit asian candy which has a cream/condensed milk flavor).

Everybody is super nice, and patient as you sample the different flavors. 

If you really want to full on fatty, get an ice cream float to go. It's huge, full of sugar, and amazing. Just eat/drink it quick as the paper straw will get soggy if you savor your float for too long.
author: Evelyn M.

description:
It almost knocked off Bi-rite from my favorite ice cream place but Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is definitely up there was one of my favorite ice cream spots. Sometimes they have a bit too many funky flavors and I might not actually enjoy any of them and that's why it's a 4 stars. The cons is the funky flavors but the pros are also the funky flavors. They usually provide you with 8-9 different kinds of ice creams of the day like Chichory coffee ice cream which was totally enjoyable. 

I definitely count Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous as one of my favorite ice cream joints so I definitely recommend coming here when you're in the area. 1.Bi-rite  2.Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous 3. Ici!  It's kinda in an isolated place and it's not really around any other restaurants but if I get the chance, I definitely love to come here. I could really use an ice cream right now! SIGH :(
author: Ernest Y.

description:
Ice cream is my weakness it's true
and Mr, and Mrs. you are my go to

In SF we're spoiled
Ingredients you can't pronounce, you've been foiled

They have about 10 hipster flavors for your choosing 
English black tea and pink squirrel are some of my musings

Vegan options are limited to one kind
peanut brittle and cookies are also a find

You can not show up impromptu
being a mom and pop shop 
their hours can be infrequent leaving you blue
author: Kristi G.

description:
When it comes to ice cream, it doesn't take much to win me over. If you have creative, gourmet flavors which are generously sampled, I will easily love you. Dense texture, with an obvious high-fat content helps too.

Mr & Mrs more-than lives up to the hype, with their pretty modern space hidden in the Dogpatch. Virtually any visit here becomes a pilgrimage to this far-flung corner of SF. A spacious & pleasant spot to stay and savor a scoop.

We visited on a sunny October day, and they had some shockingly tempting flavors on rotation: White Russian, Basil Choc Chip, Banana Ginger, a crazy toasted rice flavor, and others. Scoopers were friendly, and prices were predictably high ($6 for a double-scoop). When it comes to artisan desserts, there's almost no price I won't pay. I could think of worse addictions!

Kind of surprising that they close at 6pm on weekdays (doesn't anyone else crave a scoop at say, 9pm?) Plan your visit accordingly.
author: Nique F.

description:
I'd been meaning to try Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for ages and I finally had an excuse to make it all the way out after arranging brunch plans right next door with a few friends.  Sadly, the ice cream overall failed to impress.

The best was easily the Earl Grey tea - bold tea flavor very true to its name.  I also liked the black sesame and toasted notes in the Misugaru Latte.  Those aside, the pink guava and fernet branca weren't too bad while the bourbon + brittle was bland and devoid of any bourbon flavor.

Lastly, I thought it was kinda silly that they limit you to a couple samples whereas places like Humphry Slocombe encourage you to try as many as you like...not to mention make better ice cream.
author: Eric F.

description:
NOM-NATION. Are you ready for the best house-made hot fudge of your life? On top of the most interesting flavors of ice cream you've ever had? With decent-sized servings and a comforting, homey, creamy texture? I'm sorry, I just made myself drool thinking about it...

I've been to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous a couple of times now, and each time there have been different, impressively awesome flavors. You can never predict what you're going to get, but I consider it an ice cream lottery. I've even had the flavor board change (more than once) while I've waited in line. I love the sense of adventure trying something new, and I haven't been disappointed yet. Notable favorites include almond butter, imperial stout, and bitter lemon... but even the vanilla tastes like miracles here. Seriously, try anything they'll serve you. 

I'm a purist, but my husband swears by their sundaes. I will admit that the house-made hot fudge is the best I've ever had, the toasted/crushed nut topping is superior to your standard (it has almonds!), and the whipped cream is fresh and light as a cloud. 

Minus one star only for the stark and cramped interior (it's pretty difficult to walk through the tables, or to find a trash can). I don't think they have a bathroom, either. Definitely not a place they want you to linger, but that's ok I can take my ice cream and walk with it. :)
author: Catie F.

description:
The ice cream flavors here are very thoughtful and well executed. I tried several and loved them all:

- White rabbit: condensed milk and white chocolate. it tasted just like the white rabbit candy.

- Salted mango: mango is one of my favorite ice cream flavors and after trying this rendition, the addition of salt is simply brilliant. the ice cream itself isn't crazy salty but you get that hint that really helps develop more of the mango flavor.

- Chicory coffee: i've had my share of chicory coffee in the south and the bitterness that chicory typically has wasn't prominent in this ice cream. the coffee flavor was strong but balanced by the milky creaminess of the ice cream. chicory coffee pairs well with the creamier flavors such as white rabbit. 

Love the space and seating at Mr. & Mrs. I have to try some of the sweets including those pb malt balls! Service was cool and courteous. I'll be back!  

$5 minimum to use card. I trust you'll be ordering much more than $5 worth so no worries there.
author: Maya S.

description:
The final frontier.  The Dogpatch.  Tucked away in the Eastern seaboard (bayboard?) of San Francisco is one of the last remaining gourmet ice-cream shops I had yet to patronize, even though I work less than a mile away.

At last, after all those years of trying to line up my schedule with their exclusive / restrictive workday hours, and really I mean who spends their weekend in Potrero Hill unless they live here, my partner and I ended up viewing an apartment in Potrero on a Saturday afternoon and the minute we were done, I bounded ecstatically towards Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  The line was out the door as it was a hot day, but moved quickly and the queue ebbed and flowed and there were periods when the cashiers had no one to serve.

The scoops here are huge.  The root beer and coke floats are a great bonus, but there isn't as large of a selection here as at Mitchell's or even Humphrey Slocombe.  Still, I don't mind quality over quantity.  Now, for the


----- ICE CREAM -----

Almond Jelly: 5 stars
Wow, just wow.  So creamy and delightful, but it helps if you enjoy the almond jelly dessert.  My less Asian partner didn't appreciate this one so much.

Orange Blossom: 5 stars

Blackberry: 5 stars

Paradise Tea: 4.5 stars

Ginger Cookie: 4 stars
Satisfying, with spicy crumble bits in it.

Malted Milk: 2.5 stars
I don't know, this one didn't float my boat.  Was oddly salty, and not in a harmonious Sea-Salt-Caramel way, but my partner liked it.


I ended up getting a double-scoop Almond Jelly + Ginger Cookie in a sugar cone, while my partner got a Virgil's root beer float with THREE scoops of Vanilla Bean in it!  We found ourselves absolutely ice-creamed out and still with an entire scoop left (but of course, I dutifully scarfed it down).


---- VERDICT ----

The texture of their ice-cream lives up to the hype, it's miles better than Ice Cream Bar, and maybe even better than Humphrey Slocombe's (which tends to be on the melty side) and Smitten.  I wasn't blown away by their flavour selection though, and probably wouldn't come out of my way to have ice-cream here all the time.  But if I happen to be in the neighbourhood again, I'm definitely stopping in.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Fighting through Saturday afternoon traffic through The City to come here - expectations are high. Even in this non-touristy industrial area, the street parking is hard to come by. Weird. And the line's not even that long but it moves very slowly. I phoned in an order to San Tung while waiting. 

The ice cream was fine - just not worth the inconvenience. I was disappointed by the San Miguel beer flavor. Just wasn't good. For artisanal ice cream, I'm a huge fan of Rori's in Santa Barbara. Never a PITA line there either.

And don't leave their licorice in the car. It will melt and soak past the brown bag and into the car seats. And the car owner will then bitch all weekend about your carelessness on social media even after you put $100 of sushi in her stomach.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I love this place! Mr&Mrs is a mom and pop little ice cream store with ice cream that's made fresh everyday. Most of the time, you'll see the owners, "Mister" or "missus" in the back making ice cream. 

Everyday they usually have around 8-10 daily flavors that they change often. They also usually have a couple of sorbet flavors as well.  

I can always find a flavor on their menu that I love.
author: Kay A.

description:
The Dogpatch is a hot commodity right now. This place usually has a wrap around line, but it was wide open and happened to be a sunny day - perfect opportunity to try the ice cream! Sampled frozen hot chocolate and French lavender but ended up getting a cone of honey caramel in one of their homemade hot off the press waffle cones. Holy moly. They also had treats at the register that caught my eye and I ended up buying an unnecessary chocolate peanut butter malt ball. Didn't need it or have room for it and I hate whoppers but this was quite the delicious malt ball.

Good ice cream - creative flavors. Homemade cones. Treat yo self!!!!!
author: Katie P.

description:
Just take it. Take my money.

I thought I would never say this, but....you win San Francisco. Your ice cream is the best and even out of the top ranking ones around SF, this is by far the winner. You'll never know what flavor they'll have, but every flavor is on point. Don't even matter what you get.

The reason why this post is so short is because there are no words that can describe the awesomness of this place.
author: Nathan L.

description: I'd been wanting to try this place for awhile but it's not near me at all. I finally made a trek to the dogpatch and got to try this! I had the bourbon and caramel ice cream. Wow! So good. And soooo light it's like it just disappears. I love the flavor and texture of this ice cream. I tried the coffee as well and was so good. Will be back again!
author: Emily F.

description:
With a fraction of the wait at Bi-Rite and delicious rotating list of flavors from simple to exotic (Chinese almond jelly!), this is THE spot.  The homemade toppings are also divine- first place I'll actually crave whipped cream...it's that good.

And can we also talk about those Peanut Brittle and Brown Sugar cookies?  $2.50 of pure decadence...chewy, dense, perfect balance of sweet and salty. Some of the best I've ever had.  Gems like this keep me coming back to Dogpatch.
author: Jen E.

description:
stopped in for an after-lunch treat--what a nice shop!!
They have different flavors everyday.  Sadly, today there was no chocolate flavors on the menu...  but I sampled several interesting and tasty ones.  I picked Amarena Cherry - very tasty and subtle.
author: A H.

description: I'm glad I was able to make the stop! A bit surprised how I bookmarked this place & BAM! I end up here without even knowing! This place is located right on the corner. There's a mini stop & parking all along Illinois is your planning on stopping by! Once you walk in, it's a very simple place that serves organic in-house made ice cream! Very cool! Lots of tables for sitting! My sister & I were instantly greeted by one of the workers & he was very accommodating & patient. I tried the sweet cream & fell in love & decided to stick with it! I added the crispy chocolate pearls to it too. I ordered a single scoop, which was $5 & the topping was an extra dollar. Portions are a bit small for the price, but understandable since it's in house made. I definitely want to try the other flavors!
author: Gwyne P.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is a cute hip ice cream shop in the Dogpatch area near many delicious restaurants and wine and beer bars. The shop is located in a calmer and quieter part of San Francisco, so not as many people are there and the environment is much more chill compared to the likes of Union Square or other popular areas. 

Walking in, I only saw around four or five ice cream flavors that rotate every so often. Since I went when it was closer to closing time, less flavors were available, so I decided to try the earl grey tea and malted milk. Both were delicious but did not stand out; I have heard amazing reviews about the sesame flavor, and as a huge black sesame fan, I definitely need to come back and try that. The ice cream texture was not particularly creamy or unique, and the flavors stood out more than the texture; however, other ice cream shops also have flavors that are just as interesting, such as Smitten and Humphrey Slocombe, so I would not come back to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous unless I was in the area for something else.
author: Annie C.

description:
I really liked it. the choices in the upper echelon of creameries are quite few and Mr and Mrs miscellaneous has etched their name there along with bi-rite. I had the Meyer lemon flavor and it's tasted amazing. They were unfortunately out of their home made cones which I will definitely try next time. 

While mine was good, my wife got the cookies and cream and they wasn't really that heavy and didn't really have that many cookie morsales in it. Felt more like cream and that's it. Might have been the bottom of the barrel.

I also had a taste of the burnt sugar which is the flavor I am gonna get next time. Oh yes there will be a next time.
author: Anuj C.

description:
Who knew that ice cream could be so amazing? 

I came here by myself around 3pm during a weekday and let me tell you that there was a line out the door. So beware there might be a line but it loves pretty fast, I waited about 10 minutes. 

I had the chocolate chip and birthday cake with hot fudge. I was shocked that the ice cream was not too sweet, they were perfectly sweet and creamy. I'm very picky with my chocolate chip and this definitely meets my expectations. I love the tiny pieces of shaved chocolate over the large chucks. 

Another thing I loved was that the hot fudge didn't melt all of my ice cream like every other place you go to. The fudge actually harden on the ice cream. Who doesn't love ice cream with hot fudge that doesn't melt all of your ice cream? 

I wish this place was open later in the day but this is one of my favorite ice cream places ever!!
author: Kim L.

description: Really good ice cream, and it's my gf's favorite place. The best part is, we didn't hit a line! The flavors are so unique and different each time. I had ovaltine, which tasted exactly like the drink I used to have as a kid. They let you sample a few as well. I believe I had frosted flakes and kahlua, both of which were immaculate as well.
author: Samir K.

description:
I just waited 20 minutes in line for an ice cream cone. Judging by long queue out the door, you'd think we were waiting to get in to a night club.

If I wasn't with a group of buddies (with a giant sweet tooth), I probably would have bypassed this place. But I'm glad I stuck it out. The creamy ice cream at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is certainly worth the wait. It's not the best ice cream I've ever tasted (I'm still partial to Three Twins), but it's pretty damn good. I had the mint chip (which was spot on), and my friends ordered the Flan ice cream. I think I'll order that flavor next time around. 

A single scoop on a sugar cone was in the $5 price range (which seems a bit high, in my opinion). But in the big picture, 5 bucks is a small price to pay for 10 minutes of happiness. And if you need a caffeine fix afterward, be sure to check out Piccino across the street. It's a fabulous one-two punch on a hot summer day.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I'm rarely ever around the dogpatch area and I've heard many good things regarding this ice cream place. So, my friend took me here. We came around noon on Saturday and there was no line.The worker let me try 3 flavors. To be honest, I wanted to try everything.. haha. But, I could not decide between flavors and ended up picking three! I chose the sesame rose, sage honey, and jasmine green tea. The scoops were Huge, I did not expect them to be so big!! The sesame rose was different, but I could barely taste the sesame and did not taste the rose at all. The sage honey would probably be my favorite because it reminds me of the honey lavender from bi-rite, which is my absolute favorite there. The jasmine green tea was very strong on the tea side, which is what I prefer in a dessert. My friend also bought some of the goodies that were on the side. Tried the peanutbutter malt balls, and i LOVE peanutbutter. It was pretty good! The peanubutter brittle cookie was to die for! And, we also had the homemade oreo marshmallow. It wasn't too soft, not too hard. It was chewy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. I have never tasted such a delicate delicious thing, AND it was not too sweet. So, yummy!

Overall, I was very satisfied with my choices and I would definitely come back because the menu does change here and there.
author: Audrey K.

description:
Similar to Humphrey Slocombe, Bi-Rite, and ShakeDown though located in the isolated Dogpatch neighborhood, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous (shortened to Mr. and Mrs.) serves up simplistic flavors as well as some non-traditional, inventive, and tweakings on classics. Think

It's the place with the meshed up horizontal, vertical font directly adjacent to a colorful, artsy illustration of an ice cream that is endlessly scooped to oblivion. Not too hard to miss considering there's a decently modern exterior and minimalistic interior though notable for a moderate but not outrageous line out the door.

Prices have really skyrocketed in the past couple years:

Kids (1/2 scoop) - $4
Single (1 scoop) - $5
Double (2 scoops) - $7
Triple (3 scoops) - $8
Pints - $10 / Quarts - $20
Toppings - $1

*Typically stocked with a maximum of 10 flavors focusing on high quality and thoughtful care in perfecting their unique flavors

PEANUT BUTTER MALT (Single - $5): Kinda bummed at their "1 scoop = 1 flavor" rule"; Mr. and Mrs. uses their signature, homemade peanut butter malt balls that are available for purchase in bags or by-the-piece; Reminiscent of Smitten's "Cookie Dough with Pretzels and Chocolate Chips" flavor; Pretty sweet but that's to be expected from a flavor like this; Smooth, creamy, not-overly-rich consistency = PERFECTION in my book

PINK GUAVA (Single - $5): "Don't judge a book by its cover" - I regret not sampling or I would've committed; Unassuming (in a good way), Dad raved, refreshing - What's more to ask for in the summertime?!

PEANUT BRITTLE ($9): Mr. and Mrs. signature item; Salty and sweet; Similar to Smitten's rendition; Comes in the stylish and trendy Mason Jar

Plenty of seating with a couple communal tables; Decor is minimalistic while heavily relying on natural lighting

Too bad Mr. and Mrs. is located in Dogpatch, a slight detour from SF, or else I'd definitely visit more often. The couple flavors I sampled say it all and really reflect the mastery of what Mr. and Mrs. can do; reinvent classics and create unique combinations that are popular and instant favorites among the crowds. Mr. and Mrs. is a rarity in SF; a hidden gem (literally!) worth the hype.
author: Jacquie H.

description: Banana and toffee ice cream was solid. I got to try black sesame, but the flavor wasn't strong enough for me. Get your ice cream in one of their homemade sugar cones and you're in for a real treat! The guy behind the counter was helpful in providing whatever samples you need.
author: Elissa S.

description:
WOW! Sauntered in here on a fantastically warm autumn afternoon and enjoyed a delicious scoop of jasmine green tea that was perfectly subtle (as in there was enough flavor to excite the palate without overwhelming it with saccharine overload), perfect creamy texture. The house-made sugar cone was definitely worth the extra $1. 
Tip: The kids scoop is nearly the same size and a regular scoop so get the kids scoop and spend your extra dollar on the house-made sugar cone!
author: Lindsay H.

description: I. Love. This. Place. Yes, it is out of the way, but when you are in the area it is definitely worth a visit! First off, the employees are so accommodating and patiently allow you to try all the samples. I have not been disappointed by their flavors however out of the ordinary they may be. Some faves include horchata and the one with the chocolate chip cookies in it (I forget the name). I think the cookies are made in house as well. All in all, quality ice cream, creative and yummy flavors, and awesome employees.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Way overhyped. The flavors are basic and the taste is nothing spectacular. It's decent ice cream - meets basic ice cream expectations but doesn't exceed them one bit. Flavors on the chart today - vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, coffee, and lemon sherbet. Really? Even the corner store carries those flavors and not too bad either. I had the strawberry and my Mrs. had the coffee. Both were flat. 

It's not like this is bad ice cream, it's just nothing great and definitely not worth the trek or the hype.
author: V T.

description:
The ice cream here is just about as good as all of the other best and popular ice cream shops in the city (Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, Mitchell's, etc.).

I think I might add a star if they had more flavors to choose from, like Mitchell's, or if they were in a better location, like Bi-Rite. It's kind of in the middle of nowhere with not much else around to see.

We tried two flavors - they were both on the menu as their "premium" flavors (an additional 50 cents for some reason):

- Blueberry Cobbler:
This was awesome. You could see and taste whole chunks of pie in the ice cream. Really creamy and delicious.

- Almond Joy:
This one was pretty great too. It kind of tasted like an ice cream version of the candy bar.

They also have some other awesome stuff to order:
- Peanut Brittle & Brown Sugar cookie: This was an awesome cookie. It was extremely salty, but in a really good way that got the salty-sweet combination down perfectly. It was a little more thin than I usually like cookies, and not quite chewy enough, but it was still one of the best cookies I've had.

- Peanut Butter Malt Balls:
You can buy a prepackaged bag of these for $4.50, or you can buy them by the pound. My wife and I each just wanted to try one, so they sold us individual ones for 25 cents each, and it was well worth it. These are delicious and taste way better than your average chocolate malt ball. You can really taste the peanut butter, which is lined generously on the inside of the malt ball.

I would definitely highly recommend this place. The staff is also very friendly and happily willing to offer multiple samples, which is important given that they have a number of great flavors and it is very tough to decide. I would love to go back to get that cookie again and try some of their unique flavors.
author: Mike C.

description:
A hip ice cream parlor with delicious and decadent ice cream.  

+Texture of the ice cream is awesome. Very rich and creamy, almost like gelato.  Beware those who are lactose intolerant!  They didn't seem to have any non-lactose options.

+Flavors.  They have a lot of flavors that are unique like Ovaltine. 

+Fresh waffle cones.  They were making it while we were ordering, so good.

Tip:
-Get the kids scoop.  That was more than enough ice cream.
-$10 minimum for credit card charges.
author: Mui K.

description:
Went here a while ago because of an argument with a friend - which is the champion? Bi-Rite or Mr. and Mrs.

Having tried Bi-Rite first (tourist-style, you know how we small-town people do), I was biased in favor of them when I first walked in. However, after sampling a few of their unique and possibly questionable flavors, that bias was erased. The flavors were fun, different, but surprisingly really good!

Service was friendly, helpful, and patient - which was appreciated because I tried the heck out of all the flavors they had available before finally settling on the Crema Catalana (sweet and tangy, my favorite of the three), Peach, and Salted Caramel. (I do have a major sweet tooth - don't judge me!)

Flavor-wise, I cannot say which ice creamery is better, as they both have their merits. However, when I visited, there was no crowd, so extra points not waiting and having exorbitant parking in the vicinity. Mr. and Mrs. is definitely worth a visit.
author: Josephine T.

description:
Odd choice of location, but I guess it flows with the whole hipster thing--you know, fringe movement fetishes regurgitated into inauthentic meaninglessness. In this case, the library meets the power plant at the corner of farmer's market and grandma's house. Anyway, the change in your ash tray won't cut it, so bring your pocketbook for some of the priciest scoops around. $1 for some rainbow sprinkles?! Did a unicorn sneeze them out? 

Ok- so the salted mango and the fresh lavender were unique and well done. Rotating, varied, assorted flavors--Miscellaneous lives up to it's name.
author: MissM R.

description:
Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place Best Ice Cream consistency in SF if you like it cold and not melty. 

I've had it about 50 times and there was only 1 flavor I didn't like - Rose Cardamon

Favorites are - Corn Flakes, Cookies n Cream, and Birthday Cake.
author: Vince L.

description: I really like this place a lot. Very clean and ample seats available. Most importantly the ice cream was very good. I tasted the coffee, tea, grasshopper, honey with toasted nuts and rose. they were all very unique and tasty but I decided to go for tea and coffee as they were the best.
author: Qianqi L.

description:
My favorite ice cream shop in the Bay! 
Flavors that I love: Green Tea, Chicory Coffee, Earl Grey Tea

- Must spend at least $5 to use card
author: Joan K.

description:
I was drawn to this place since it had a line out the door when I was walking by and since I have been searching for a good ice cream place.

Not sure if I can add much to the 1200 previous reviews except to say the flavors of the ice cream and the waffle cone are amazing!
author: George A.

description:
Very excited that this ice cream shop exceeded my expectations. The variety and uniqueness of flavors made this a draw for our group, seeking a post-work-out treat. Staff was very kind to let us each try many of the flavors before making our selections.

Crema Catalina (lime with burnt sugar) - Delicious, fresh
Butter Toffee - Very rich and flavorful
Thai Tea - Fun orange color, had strong tea flavoring
Cardamon Rose - Good balance of flavors

[WARNING] CAR BREAK-IN: If you do go, DO NOT PARK in the lot at the intersection of Illinois St. and 22nd St. We went on a weekend evening between 4-6pm and at least five cars were broken into, including ours. Be aware and cautious of parking and your safety in this area.
author: Danielle C.

description:
An absolutely nice spot for an ice cream parlor in this area.

The cones are very delicious and it pairs well with the ice cream. Ice cream cones freshly made at the store? Absolutely brilliant, it is crispy and the amount of sugar is very appropriate. Props for the cones being freshly made. I was craving ice cream so I came in and ordered the Vanilla Bean Flavored Ice Cream. It was very delicious and I will be coming back to try other flavors.

The spacing between chairs are a little tight so that's my only downer. Otherwise, this is certainly the best spot to visit for those ice cream cravings anytime.

Overall:
- Friendly staff members
- Clean facility
- Good service
- Positive first experience
- There are some tables and chairs available

I am definitely going to make my way back for ice cream cravings.
author: Bennett W.

description:
Love the exterior of this ice cream joint hidden in Dogpatch and ALL the parking! Even though this area is slowly developing, I kinda wish it stayed as is. Plentiful parking spots and San Francisco will never be.

The interior was very clean and had ample seating that wasn't crowded at all. I believe they change the flavors often, since I was hoping to try some of the flavors my coworker mentioned, but I didn't see it on the menu.

My bf and I ended up getting the earl grey tea and french lavender, which were both great in flavor. I also tasted the passion fruit sorbet - which was perfect as a lighter alternative, but sadly, they did not sell those by the scoop (only in pints).

With heavy ice cream competition in the city, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is a top contender on my list!

PS - They provide a self-serve water station.
author: Tina C.

description: I'm on my quest to try some of the best spots for frozen treats here in the Bay Area. I've tried ici, meadowlark and now for Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous. While meadowlark is my favorite in terms of price and taste, this spot easily beat ici despite being a whopping 8 dollars for a two scoop cone. I got creme fraiche and chocolate truffle and I think creme fraiche was definitely my favorite. A bit sad that pink guava was out but the soothing flavor of the creme fraiche made up for it. Definitely worth a shot but not confident that I'll go out of my way to go back anytime soon.
author: Nadine C.

description:
Amazing organic ice cream that has the consistency of premium soft serve. I'm not quite sure if it's intentional, but it sure is appreciated! 

Their jasmine green tea is so rich, yet understated. The bourbon brittle is a delight as well.

The line is long though and flavors run out closer to 6 which is when they close. If you're in the area, Mr. and Mrs. is a must-go!
author: Diana B.

description:
I wanted the Pink Squirrel flavor, but they didn't have it when I went Sun 8/19/12.  I tried 3 flavors & picked Buttermilk Lemon which I found ok.  

Single scoop $3.50 - Huge cup full of ice cream.

I like the Croquantino Cookie $2.50 - caramelized hazelnut, orange zest, milk chocolate.  Yum.

Peanut Butter Malt Balls a bag for $4.50 - chocolate outside, peanut butter, & malt rolled up in a ball.  Yummy.

Prices have gone up:
Junior scoop $2.75
Single $3.5
Double $4.75
Triple $5.75
Peanut Brittle $7/jar

Charge it!
author: Ann L.

description: Just as AMAZING as everyone says. Too bad their hours are sort of wonky and it's a little out of the way (at least, I don't find myself in the DogPatch that often). I had the Friar Tuck-really light. I sampled some other flavors too like the bourbon brittle and everything was delicious. Excellent customer service! I really want to go back and try the cookies, homemade brittle or licorice.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
{ +'s }
+ 2-3 blocks from me
+ yummy flavors 
    * check out the jasmine green T, it tastes like boba milk tea!'
    * bourbon peanut brittle is in the freezer waiting to be tried
+ peanut butter malt balls, need i say more?
+ super friendly staff members
+ little crunchy chocolate things... not sure they're called but they're yummy! look for it in the 'toppings' section

{ -'s }
- lines can be long (but the best things come to those who wait)
- it can get warm in there, which is weird for an ice cream place!
- short business hours only open until 6 PM wed-sat and until 5 on sun. so if you want your ice cream fix at night, either prepare ahead or go elsewhere
- the line flow (enter + exit) is tight with the tables.  kind of hard to get out after you've completed your order especially when people bring in strollers and/or wearing bulky backpacks... yes, a backpack makes a difference when you're getting in/out.  that's how tight it is in there or was over the wknd

{ tips n tricks }
* ok no tricks this time
* no prepackaged pints, so you must wait in line even if you're not getting scoops
* parking is street only. for the most part it's easy... but then again i walk from home!
author: Tina F.

description:
I came in; he kept feeding me long-handled spoons top-heavy with some indescribably heavenly creamy concoctions....i soon lost my will to fight and went weak-kneed as my palate became slowly saturated with sweetness of the indescribable kind. Minutes after a catatonic haze of ineffable glory, I blurted out "cajeta, please!"

But i really wanted to mosh the ice cream repository--truth

Indicia of patronizing here: blissed-out metaphysical travels--- satisfaction at first lick, but can't lick just one
author: Jana C.

description: Hands down the best ice cream in SF.  I only wish they were open more often!  Flavors are made fresh daily and there's always something new to try.  Try the hot fudge-- it's amazing!
author: Rachel M.

description: Love their Salted Mango and Matcha Green Tea, their Frozen Hot Chocolate is a little too sweet for my liking. Will definitely be back to try their other flavors!
author: Cheryl C.

description:
I'm never disappointed when I stop by for my ice cream fix. 

I frequent many places for ice-cream but none come close to the unique flavors and creamy texture that come from the Mr and Mrs. The ice-cream is so creamy, that you can actually lick the ice cream versus store bought ones where you have to almost bite into it. The ice-cream melts pretty quick -- a proof that they don't use artificial ingredients.

Each visit is like a game that I look forward to. I try to get ahead if I can, scouring the most recent reviews and photos on yelp and their Facebook page to hopefully get a glimpse of the most recently served flavors (protip). Even when they don't have what I want, I can still come away with something that I'm happy with.

Sometimes I go with a safe choice, their classic "sweet cream" or any plain chocolate concoctions. If I want to get adventurous, I'm usually not disappointed with a new flavor -- and I never get samples, this is how much I trust them. 

PS - Don't forget to order a handmade waffle cone if it's available.
author: Jo V.

description:
My goal in my food life is to try every possible ice cream there is, the best ones that is. Truly a fat kid's problem. :)

With that, I think it' safe to say that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is hands down, the best ice cream in San Francisco.  It's still no Salt & Straw - a must if you're in Portland and they offer at Joan's on Third in LA but not quite the same.  However, Mr. & Mrs. exceeded my expectations.  Let me just say that I like my ice cream creamy, buttery thick, smooth, and made from scratch!  None of that icy frozen stuff please.  

Below is my rough rankings for all the ice cream spots I've tried thus far in the bay area.  

5 Stars 
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous

4-4.5 stars 
Bi-Rite
Ici Ice Cream
Humphry Slocombe 

3.5 -4 stars
Mitchell's Ice Cream
Polly Ann
Swensen's Ice Cream
Joe's Ice cream

3 stars
Three Twins Ice Cream 
Smitten

I came here twice for good measure to ensure it is indeed good, quality ice cream.  It's not quite in the middle of the city which may not be really convenient but parking is definitely easier than dealing with the inner city.  

So far I've sampled
- Rosemary Maple: if you love inhaling the smell of rosemary like me, imagine eating it. This is for all you rosemary lovers, it was perfectly sweet and salty along with the amazing scent.

- Grasshopper mint w chocolate pearls - This was definitely a hit, imagine mint chocolate but with crunchy chocolate pearls. It was a great combination together.

- Guanana - Banana & Guava, unexpectedly my favorite flavor there, I really wished they had it there the second time around. For some reason, this weird combination worked really well and I couldn't get enough of it!

- Sweet Cream - A simple flavor that was creamy and sweet.

- Banana w peanut butter - Another great use with banana but I am not a huge fan of peanut butter in my sweets.

The ice cream is fresh, creamy, and rich in unique flavors that doesn't overpower like Humphry's ice cream. The set up is simple just like their ice cream.  Their use of unique flavors stand out but it is still combined with the simple ice cream flavors.  My only complaint is that I wish they keep a few consistent flavors so the next time I go I know they'll be serving those flavors (guanana hint hint). 

Things to know: 
- They let you sample and never give you dirty looks.
- Get the housemade sugar cone cone! ($1)
- You get one flavor per scoop, might as well just get double or triple!
- Pricing: Single - $3.75, Double - $5, Triple $6
- Parking - There is some metered parking out front or behind the store.
author: Cam C.

description:
My favorite ice cream place anywhere. They have unique flavors that are not overly gimmicky but do them incredibly well. I usually just get ice cream in a cup but their cones are literally made in front of your eyes and are always a great treat. Highly recommended.

1) Mr and Mrs
2) Bi-Rite
3) Mitchell's
author: Brian C.

description:
YUM. who woulda thought that something like rosemary and honey would be a good icecream flavor???  I mean, that sounds like something you'd put on a chicken breast or something, but it worked.

The icecream here is creamy and creative!  The staff is friendly and the line moves pretty quickly although it's a little long.  Be sure to show up early since their flavors run out through the day.
author: Anthony C.

description:
Finally!
This was on my to do list when I moved away from the Bay Area 4 years ago. Unfortunately I did not have a smartphone and got very lost trying to find this place. Thank you modern technology.

I came on a Sunday evening and found a parking spot immediately on Illinois.

The flavors I tried:

*lemon poppy - muffin flavor in ice cream form. very unique! lemon peel flavor more than lemon tart.
*cardamom and rose - the rose wasn't too strong and made a lovely pair with the cardomon. my favorite.
*chicory coffee (sampled) - I've never had chicory coffee but this was a delicious twist on regular coffee flavors. nice and strong but no bitterness.
*citrus crunch (sampled) - the citrus was very subtle so all I could taste was the chocolate crunch balls. least favorite.

I shared a 2 scoop instead of ordering 2 separate single scoops and saved a few dollars! The shop was sunny and felt open even though it was packed with people. They had two long communal tables and a small table. Shared the small one with 2 random friendly people.

This place will now go into my top 3 ice cream shops in the bay and I can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: Janet L.

description:
Treat yo self. Seriously.

My absolute favorite ice cream place in the city (and dare I say ever). Love that the ice cream flavors are always changing so its always exciting to try something new. I've been here a few times and sadly forgotten what I've ordered each time but definitely know that I never walked out disappointed. Each ice cream flavor is unique and flavorful but not overpowering. The staff is extremely friendly and don't get upset when you ask to sample. The only negative is that they close early so can't just stop by whenever I'm feeling the deliciousness that is Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Krishna S.

description:
Ok so I am updating my review of this ice cream shop. I went yesterday and had the double scoop of sweet cream and cookies and cream and have to say this place is back to being one of the best if not the best ice cream establishment in the Bay Area! 

The texture of the ice cream, fresh taste, and just the quality of the ingredients oozing through definitely upped my happy factor!

Great job to the owners for creating amazing small batches of ice cream that will make you say Yummers! 5 stars by a freaking mile!!
author: Michael C.

description:
I wish they warned me as I tried the flavors that there was a 3 limit tasting. I didn't really like any of the flavors I tried. I tried the blackberry, the lemon with almonds, and pink squirrel. They were all OK flavors, but I was not too fond of them. I think I'm more of a bi-rite type of gal. I ended up going with the lemon and almond but there were too many almonds. I couldn't really enjoy the lemon ice cream with too much to chew. The ratio of almonds was too high in this ice cream for me. On a plus side, their cones are made in the store but I haven't tried those either.

The location is in a gentrified section of 3rd street so tread carefully. The area is in Dogpatch and right across from the Hard Knox cafe which I ate at beforehand. Inside Mr. and Mrs Miscellaneous, it's very cute. You can sit comfortably and use your laptop torelax for a while. They have a few long tables with stools as well as some private 2 seater tables. They also have some little snacks to eat, which I have yet to try. 

I wasn't too wow-ed with their selection but the menu isn't very big. I don't know what all the fuss is about.
author: Lyra C.

description:
I'm a complete ice-cream aholic and couldn't wait to come here. Loved the texture and flavors were great but a couple of things which took down my score:

1. The Palm Sugar & Turmeric flavor - not the best aftertaste in the world. It was recommended but I should have tasted it before I bought (my own fault)
2. No Amex accepted. Only a small gripe but then they took a while to sort out their standalone machine to accept Visa.

Otherwise - love the location and would recommend it.
author: Cameron O.

description: I came here on Saturday after having lunch in the area. They don't have typical flavors, so it took me a while to decide on a flavor. I went with the Basil with Salted Peanuts in a cone. This place is definitely pricey ($4 for a kid's scoop), but the ice cream was tasty. I was thrown off at first because I never had basil ice cream before, but I enjoyed it.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
They are normally closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Hence, I was sad -- devastated even, when I maneuvered forty-five minutes through traffic to discover they were not open on a random Wednesday. 

Anywho, I came back a couple of weeks later and am so glad I did! I tried the sweet basil and grasshopper (mint). Both were superb! Unfortunately, they ran out of their house made waffle at like 4 pm! Evidently, they were also out of a couple of ice cream flavors around that time.

Note to self: come early if you want to really try more of their unique flavors!
author: Jen N.

description: I came here for ice cream and had an excellent experience! The ice cream is excellent and the workers were so helpful and patient (I'm very indecisive). I absolutely recommend this spot for some goodies
author: Dominique F.

description:
This was a very interesting place. It's location is pretty much, in such a place that isn't visited by many unless you live around there and know that it exists. My friend took me here, since we were nearby and had my try all the flavors that day. Flavors of ice cream change daily and are very unique. The quality is great. You can taste how real and fresh the ice cream is. It's not what you buy at the typical store like Safeway. There's a special kick to this ice cream that you really have to get used to. It was very healthy for me haha :) I got a flavor called bread chocolate, which was their version of chocolate ice cream and that was pretty much the closest flavor to what I was used to. I really did enjoy it, but it's not something I would want to eat everyday. 

Also because the ice cream is so healthy the prices are a bit on the higher side. I got a kids scoop and it was $3.50. Wouldn't want to spend that much each time I wanted a little ice cream.

However overall this place is great, very trendy, modern look, and great customer service.
author: Julia K.

description: Earl Grey, Black Sesame, and Pink Guava. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is not ashamed of its love affair with unusual flavors. The story behind the name, "miscellaneous" (thank God for spell check), is that they specialize in the other, non mainstream flavors. Of course they do offer some normal flavors such as cookies and cream. This is great because when you and your buddies finish a day of climbing and want something sweet, you don't want to be arguing about where to go for ice cream. Even if your friend only likes "boring" flavors, they can find something they like at Mr. and Mrs. M.
author: Wendy H.

description: I love love love this place, and am pretty sad that it's no longer as accessible since I've moved.  The flavors often times change, but a few favorites do seem to pop back.  The Roasted Peanut is a must as you get that nutty flavor that gives off a bit of a salt taste...and I think it's because of the type of honey they use.  Black sesame was awesome too.  My favorite was the Blackberry, which wasn't too sweet, but you could also taste the milk flavor coming through as well.  Wish I could bring this down to LA with me!
author: Ashley C.

description:
3.5 stars.

I'm eating some of the peanut brittle right now. While I can appreciate the homemade taste and quality, I would prefer it with slightly smaller peanut chunks and more brittle.

Of course, I tried a bunch of ice cream flavors (while annoying the guy behind the counter) and to my chagrin, all of them tasted similar! The Jack Daniels and peanut brittle and pumpkin flavors were probably the most distinctive, but even so, neither was particularly unique.

Out of all the ice cream shops I've tried so far in San Francisco, Humphry Slocombe still reigns supreme!
author: Suany W.

description:
Getting here was easier than I thought - it's right by the KT stop on 20th street. 

The service is sweet and helpful. I tasted pink squirrel, jasmine green tea, and blackberry and ended up getting a double with pink squirrel and jasmine green tea. 

The pink squirrel is unlike anything I've tasted before but it's familiar. Make sense? 

The jasmine green tea captures the best parts of a beautiful, milky tea.

I really enjoyed the dense, firm texture of the ice cream. It was slow to melt on a hot day. :) I got my scoops in a cup and I was still treated to a crispy fresh cone topper. It was perfection.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Can't believe this place wasn't on my list of bookmarks! I randomly stumbled across this when I was having brunch across the street. So glad I looked it up to see what it was. Saved some room for dessert after brunch and hopped over here to check out the ice cream. 

They have a rotating list of flavors which could change as your standing in line! I like how you can go in and always try a different flavor. Kind of a bummer though if you have a flavor you really like because it may not always be on the menu when you visit. I sampled a few flavors and they're all so good so you really can't go wrong with whichever flavor you choose. 

The flavors are pretty unique and they are very generous with the scoop portions! It may seem a little pricey, but it is definitely worth your money once you try to tackle even a single scoop.
author: Maryann S.

description:
So so so expensive here but I really like the Jasmine Green Tea and Milk & Cookies flavor here. The service here is top-notch and the people are always very friendly. I get the kid scoop (1 flavor, $4.00).

Thanks to the guy serving there that offered to hold my half-pint of ice-cream ($6.00 for half pint, $9.99 for a pint) in the freezer while I ate my ice cream and went across the street!
author: Erica S.

description:
Before Halloween my coworker and I came here for a midday snack.

Cute, well lite location.

We had the kids scoop of the vanilla and coffee, and thanks for not judging us.

Good, solid ice cream.

Funny, school like benches. I felt like I was in someone's ice cream cafeteria.

Would I come back? Sure.

Kind of hard to find parking though.
author: Jack R.

description: This place has the most delicious ice cream and treats. From the almond brittle to the green tea ice cream I haven't had anything that wasn't great.  I think if you're in dogpatch it's a must to stop by and try it.
author: Steven G.

description:
I came here with my auntie for dessert after having lunch for her bday because she had seen it while driving by before and so we were in the area and decided to give it a try.

We walked in on a warm Saturday afternoon and the line actually wasn't out the door like I'm pretty sure it usually is. But, anyway, there was maybe 5 people ahead of us and the line moved quickly.

I decided on a chocolate chip and choco-malted crunch sundae and my auntie had a cup of ube (purple yam) and polvoron (Spanish shortbread)...all my Filipinos already know. Total was $10. 

My auntie really loved the combination of the ube and polvoron. She said the ice cream was really flavorful and each ingredient was distinctive.

I shared my sundae with the bf and he loved it. I was a big fan of all the chocolatey goodness and just the overall light and creamy texture of the ice cream. Perfection. 

I really love that you can tell the ice cream and all the toppings are pretty much made in-house and most of the ingredients are organic. You definitely get what you pay for and I would come back over and over again.

P.S. their ice cream menu of 10 flavors changes daily.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is THE San Francisco Ice Cream spot. Forget the Bi-Rites, Mitchell's, Three Twins (although I haven't tried) and froyo joints - overrated. THIS IS THE SPOT. You are seriously missing out if you haven't tried their unique flavors,  homemade cones, almond brittle and cookies.

Located in the Dogpatch just down the street from my humble abode, this corner ice cream shop never disappoints. The floor-to-ceiling windows allow the sun to stream in full blast on a beautiful ice cream day (everyday). The friendly owners (also neighborhood locals) keep their shop in prime condition - clean, stylish,  and always with fresh flowers! 

My favorite flavors include - Candied Violet, Orange Blossom, and now recently Brown Butter Sage. I can't wait to try the Ballpark if I ever get there before it sells out!

Will be there every weekend.
author: Erin C.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream place in SF. I'm not a huge ice cream lover and I rarely ever crave or eat ice cream but for some reason i keep coming back here!

Their flavors vary by the day and there's no way to find out their flavors through social media, but this places has not disappointed me with any of their flavors yet!

Their tea flavored ice creams are very good (earl gray, jasmine green tea). The other seasonal flavors like pumpkin, blueberry, are all very good too. Chicory coffee is a classic and Sweet cream is also good too.
author: Carmen C.

description: Wow. These flavors are crazy and they are done well. Super creamy and fresh with flavors like Pink Guava, cereal assortments, cheesecake, earl grey. Only thing is once they're out of a flavor that day , they are OUT of the flavor for the day
author: Paul J.

description:
I LOVE MR. & MRS.!!!

A few months ago, I got to try the Blueberry Sherbet! It was amazing! Yesterday I got the Guanana (Guava + Banana) with the homemade waffle cone! It reminded me a little of those Kern's juices. We also got a pint of the Tres Leches and Orange Blossom! Both were good, but the Orange Blossom was surprisingly delicious! We also got their Peanut Brittle cookie! YUM!! We'll definitely be back to try more ice cream flavors and we definitely wanna try their licorices, too! :D

Mrs. & Mrs. is almost up there with Bi-Rite... almost! I wish they had a website or their fb page was updated with the new flavors! I wished they had longer hours and the line inside was directed a little better. Maybe rearrange the tables? Or get smaller tables? It always feels a bit too cramped inside. But I do have to say that parking is by far a lot easier than at Bi-Rite!

Flavors I've tried so far...
- Sweet Cream
- Blueberry Sherbet
- Guanana
- Tres Leches
- Orange Blossom
- Peppermint Stix
- Jasmine Green Tea
- Crema Catalana
author: CeCe C.

description:
I'm addicted to this ice cream, IMHO it's the best in the city. Makes Bi-Rite look like Baskin Robbins. Don't miss out on the eclectic flavors like Bourbon caramel, Almond Jelly, and Ovaltine to name a few. 
They have a revolving list of flavors but I always find one I love, no matter what's on the list! 
Parking can be a drag but I've never encountered horrible lines or rude service. Sometimes you'll catch the owners behind the counter slinging the cream. 
Heaven on a cone!
author: Eden F.

description: I had the coffee with those delicious chocolate crunchy balls thingies on top. It's a simple store front with ice cream and other treats. Straight forward. I like the flavors of the ice creams, unique and some include some adult liquor flavors. Definitely worth the try and I like that it's a simple no bells and whistles place. I can appreciate some good ice cream!
author: Minnow N.

description:
Nice place not to much verity of flavor.
The vanilla one is good .
Next time we will try different place ,
author: Tom G.

description:
Considering I had a photo log dating back to June of 2010, I'm surprised I hadn't yelped Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.  I'm going to take care of that now.

I often use my lactose intolerance as an excuse to limit my intake on dairy, but on specific Tuesdays and Wednesdays each month that whole "I can't have too much dairy"-thing goes right out of the window.  I generally stop off at Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous prior to volunteering at the San Francisco Food Bank located just four blocks away.  Often the reasoning is two-fold.  Why arrive too early inside a massive warehouse waiting for other volunteers to arrive when I could kill time inside a fabulous ice cream shop and have some fabulous ice cream to boot?  If I crunch enough enzyme tablets prior to my visits my lactose excuse simply disintegrates.

I not only love the ice cream here, but everything I've tried has been magnificent whether that be the peanut or almond brittle, the malted milk balls or the crazy Peanut Brittle and Toffee Cookies (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=9uxO9bcwXSjZ5qgjsrQTOg).  I normally like crunchy cookies over soft cookies, but these stand nicely in between with crispy edges and a soft, chewy center of buttery cookie with fabulous peanut brittle and soft toffee melted in.

I've easily tried over twenty of their often-changing ice cream flavors, and over the months I have found a few favorites.  Their Nougat ice cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=InskBR3E7c-vh42WbKEaeA) was the first flavor I had ever tried.  If ever I experienced love at first bite this was it.  It's basically sweet cream from Marin's favorite Straus Family Dairy with organic pistachios and bits of dried fruit like cherries and apricots. The description is pretty simple, but the flavor was so intense.

I believe their signature Ballpark ice cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=-4KQDWx35oYwrneUwjSPpQ) was also one of the earlier flavors I tried.  I thought the entire composition was genius, and yes, its components did remind me of things I've had at a ball game.  It's crunched up pieces of chocolate-covered pretzels, chopped peanuts and Anchor Steam beer all mixed within a creamy, rich Straus cream.  Totally awesome!

Yesterday, I went all out and had a double scoop consisting of Bourbon & Caramel and Fudge Ripple (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=zcfLTHIT86XD2qmOkW9QSg) since San Francisco enjoyed a rare day of abundant sunshine.  As a whole I thought the two flavors combined very well together.  On their own however I thought the Fudge Ripple easily outflavored the Bourbon & Caramel.  Both flavors use the same delicious sweet cream.  The Fudge Ripple flavor had my tongue dancing though.  Mixed in with the sweet cream was big chunks of rich, gooey chocolate fudge mixed with chopped toasted almonds.  Meanwhile the Bourbon & Caramel was mostly sweet, sticky caramel.  For me anyway the bourbon flavor was a bit too subtle.

All in all though this is an amazing place for delicious ice cream, and a perfect place to fuel up prior to a Food Bank project.  I'll be back the first week in September.  Can't wait to see what flavors will captivate my taste buds next!!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I flood my basement. I finally understand what Ginger means. I FLOOD my basement. I flood other things but when I flood my basement it means that this blew my mind. I am living for the Earl Grey Ice Cream. The texture is smooth and creamy. The flavor is bold and it's not just Earl Grey. It's King Grey. The waffle cone is better than Mitchell's. Mitchell's still has a special place in my heart because the ice cream is top shelf, but this place! Visit it! It's an absolute must! It was so good that my head was cocked back the entire time I was enjoying it. That's not really a barometer for how good it was but I don't usually do that when I eat so it must mean this ice cream is special!
author: Grace H.

description:
The husband and wife team that run this business are really lovely people and make it a pleasure go here. With that said as nice as they are if their product doesn't stand up then the business doesn't work. Well that's not the case here. They serve up  some awesome, unique well thought out flavors. All around great Ice Cream!!! It really is a pleasure to support their shop.

If I were to make one suggestion, I wish they would install some kind of adjustable window shading as in the afternoon on a sunny day having the bright sun beat down on you while you sit is not so enjoyable.
author: Steven B.

description:
Wow!  If you're looking for a unique, delicious ice cream shop, then stop by this place.  They're located in the Dogpatch and offer a wonderful blend of creativity and flavors into their ice cream.  Their shop, run by two people who I presume to be Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, makes a unique batch of ice cream flavors fresh everyday.  They said that they never have the same flavors on consecutive days because they like to change it up.

I came here with a couple friends on a hot SF day.  I had a scoop of "Milk and Cookies" ice cream and I was in heaven.  It tasted exactly like a cross between your childhood dessert and sweet victory, in other words, it was amazing!  The portions were generous and for only $3.50!  Definitely recommend this place and hope that you can come here again!

Only downside is that they tend to have funny hours that cater more towards the working crowd.
author: Robert T.

description:
Ice cream is delicious in general and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous offers a good amount of flavors for you to try. 

Parking is all on the streets in San Francisco so good luck with that! 

The inside of the shop is a good size. There's a few chairs for people to sit and enjoy their ice cream and they even have a bathroom in here if you need to use it. The menu is big so you won't have a hard time seeing what flavors they have and you're even allowed to try out the flavors before you order so yay. 

Service was friendly, although they don't really give you another ice cream if you have a problem. Like for instance, when my cousins and I were here, we saw a girl fall down and drop her ice cream on the floor. Instead of replacing it, the workers did nothing and the girl ended up eating the ice cream that she had dropped. Yuck. 

I got a scoop of their white rabbit ice cream which is condensed milk and white chocolate and it was delicious. My cousins got different flavors of ice cream, and I forgot what they were called, but they enjoyed them so yay on that, too. And older cousin told me that when they run out of one flavor, they'll immediately refill it with another which is smart. 

Overall, it's a good place to get ice cream flavors that you can't really get anywhere else.
author: Venus L.

description:
HO LEE FUK!

I am not talking about the fake name of the Asiana airline pilot that KTVU aired on TV fairly recently (thanks to an intern, probably named SUM DUM FUK, who made a prank by passing false info to the station who dropped the ball and aired it without fact checking)

But rather, my reaction to the explosive delicious rich flavor of jasmine green tea ice cream by Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.

The line was long, so I didn't really bother to taste a lot of samples before deciding...I just went with gut instinct, and ordered one scoop jasmine green tea, and one scoop chocolate malted crunch. I guess I got lucky in that I went on a day that had chocolate flavor. Right when I paid, I sampled apricot ginger, and French lavender. The other flavors available were Ghost Chili and Shochu, Buttermilk and Blackberries, Cookies & Cream, Vanilla, French Lavender, Apricot Ginger and a few others that you might see in the uploaded pic.

Sampled the apricot ginger and that  was very good. Perfect for those into delicate natural fruit flavors.

Also tried a little French lavender....freakin SEXAY. I'm a dude and while I don't love lavender as much as many dudettes out there, I have to say lavender ice cream is quite ass kicking in SF. I can't say whether Bi Rite's Honey Lavender was better or this...but they're very close.

Chocolate malted crunch....this looked and sounded good. It was decent but as someone who grew up on Dreyer's Rocky Road and Haagen Daaz Chocolate Chocolate Chip, this did not floor me like the jasmine green tea ice cream.

So with that in mind, I got lucky in that I found a flavor I absolutely adored, and it happened to be available when I was there. Who knows, maybe it won't be again when I visit next time.

The Jasmine green tea ice cream....oddly enough after eating a few spoons, I could close my eyes and imagine myself at Yum Cha, partaking in dim sum. Maybe not Koi Palace, but some uber high end Michelin star place.

What if they could make a cha siu bao ice cream, a ha gow shrimp dumpling ice cream, and a beef cheung fun with soy sauce ice cream, as well as a turnip/daikon cake with Chinese sausage, Chinese ham, dried scallops ice cream. Add a few scoops of jasmine tea ice cream!

Then I will have a Dim Sundae!

HO LEE FUK indeed.
author: Ken K.

description: I can't say enough about how delicious this place is. I love their ice cream. Chicory or white rabbit or dark n stormy or cookies and cream
author: Bethtina W.

description:
Came here after trying bouldering for the first time for my friend's bday. 
It's a cute little corner ice cream shop! I tried their anchor porter beer ice cream and it was just ok. Kind of like a more beery tasting cream soda? I ended up getting a scoop of their coconut and pink peppercorn ice cream. I liked the coconut taste and the peppercorn but sometimes I would bite into a whole peppercorn making it too peppery and weird...since in trying to eat ice cream that's suppose to be sweet and refreshing. 

My bf and my friends got a coke float and a root beet float with a scoop of ice cream of their choosing. All really good but they did have paper straws which didn't seem to work too well when trying to eat and drink their floats properly. 

All in all it's a cute little place with some decent interesting flavors. I'm hardly in this area and when I crave ice cream it still is usually for Mitchell's
author: Christine W.

description: We drove to SF to try this ice cream place and we were not disappointed.  We had to wait in line for about 20 minutes (it was Sunday afternoon) but it was well worth it.  My kids ordered the mint chocolate, chocolate, and my husband and I ordered the tropical (banana, mango and coconut).  The ice cream tasted super fresh but the flavors were not too strong and it was on the "too sweet" side for me...although my kids disagree! I sampled the Earl grey tea and the sweet cream. While we were in line they crossed off two of the ice cream flavors on the list which made us really anxious.. I guess that's one of the disadvantages of a small batch ice cream place.  We found parking at the end of 22nd street.
author: monica o.

description: Love this place! They make their own homemade ice cream flavors with homemade cones. So delicious! Also the owners are super nice and local. One of the best ice cream places in the city!
author: Courtney C.

description:
Damn it only if I come into the city more often....

This place, IMO, is better than birite. The selection is great, the staff is friendly, and the flavor is awesome. They sold out so fast though. That's my only possible complaint.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Great ice cream shop with freshly made ice cream, fun flavors and not a huge line!  I had heard about Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous through a variety of channels and have been excited to try their ice cream and cookies for a while.  On a Saturday afternoon visit, there weren't many cookie varieties left, so I opted just for ice cream.  They had several fun flavors (i.e. Earl Grey, Old Fashioned, Basil Chip...), and I opted for Pink Squirrel, which consists of almond flavoring (and something else, that I don't remember).  Nevertheless, it was good. 

I was initially excited about the Old Fashioned, but the ice cream itself was plain and the only good part of it was the bourbon soaked cherries.

I'm definitely planning a trip back!
author: Audrey C.

description:
The Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous were in the house!
Scooping up the ice cream to the hungry line of customers. I've never been to their shop before so I made a special trip on the Metro (T-line) to 3rd & 23rd and walked one block back - in this neighborhood there are not alot of pedestrians and I passed a few of the local brothers hanging out. 

Ambiance: Very spare, just white walls inside with a big wall of glass windows facing 3rd street letting the stream of light come in. Two rows of country wood tables with seats so people can enjoy their ice cream indoors communal-style. This invites chatting with your neighbors and comparing flavor preferences.

The Line: I was lucky I hit the shop around 3:30pm when there were less than a dozen people but there was someone who was picking up multiple pints to take away and each pint is handpacked. A few minutes after me there was a swarm of people so the line went out the door.

Flavors: You have your traditional Vanilla, Chocolate, White Rabbit in addition to more exotic experimental flavors like Lime Chile. From other reviews sounds like they change their flavors everyday. I sampled two flavors which I ultimately ended up getting: Chicory Coffee and Black Lychee Tea. First off: the ice cream finishes very clean. There is no heavy, artificial residue taste in your mouth after you savor a bite. The Chicory Coffee was very nice with the chicory giving the ice cream an elusive sweetness complimenting the coffee taste. The tea flavor tasted like you were having a concentrated mouthful of pure tea.

The Mrs. served me at the counter and she was so sweet! Considering that there is a constant stream of customers, it's nice to have someone who exudes such genuine delight in serving their product. I had tasted Mr. & Mrs. Misc ice cream at an event and I mentioned this to the Mrs. She smiled and chatted with me for a minute or two and was patient enough to let me try my two samples before deciding. I could have asked to sample more but that's greedy huh?

Be warned! When you make it to the counter to order, you are faced with a row full of goodies. There are canning jars large ($14) and small ($7) with their homemade peanut brittle. There's a cake dome with homemade toffee peanut brittle cookies ($2.50) and there are small canning jars with a variety of sprinkles or other toppings for ice cream. All so tempting. I picked up one of the small paper sacks of their homemade malted peanut butter balls ($4.50) which looked really tasty and I couldn't pass up.

Good karma for me as I collected my double scoop of ice cream ($5) 'cos a tiny school-style table in the corner opened up. I snabbed it and was entertained watching the parade of couples, groups and families ordering and consuming their ice cream. When a couple sat down opposite me, I chatted with them since I spied the lady holding a jar of the peanut brittle. "Is it buttery?," I ask. "Yes, it's delicious and I can eat the whole jar in one sitting!" says the lady. I pulled my bag of malted balls a little closer to me as she eyed my treats and says she can inhale these candies just as quick.

For sure when you are without a car, Mr. & Mrs Misc. is a bit of an effort to get to in the Dogpatch. But it is accessible by public transit (either the T-Metro or the last stop of the 22-Fillmore which is 2 blocks away). The ice cream is fresh, creative and obviously a labor of love for these two. I highly recommend trying it.
author: Joanna T.

description:
Finally got to try this place! I love my ice cream and this was one of the last shnazzy gourmet ice cream places in the Bay that I hadn't been to yet. Just be sure to check their hours, as they aren't open as much as one would expect and they seem to run out of things quite quickly. 

Went on a Saturday afternoon and there was a line out the door and they had run out of their hand-made cones as well as the sorbet of the day. Boo. But, their sugar cones are pretty good too. 

The flavors are clean and crisp and the texture is one of the best I've had. Loved their lavender and jasmine green tea. For the mint lovers out there, this isn't your usual mint ice cream...it's the flavor of real mint leaves that comes through. 

Hoping to be back sometime soon!
author: Annie S.

description:
It's sunny and beautiful out right now, 7pm on Thursday, and I asked my wife, "wanna go across the street to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous?  Are They open?"  

She responded, "Nope, they're closed, because you want ice cream right now.  If you want ice cream, they are closed.  If you don't want ice cream, they are open."

The ice cream is solid enough.  The hours make it impossible.
author: Richard P.

description:
Came for the hype and stayed for the extra coolness inside (but there was no AC...on a summer day. Are you ok.) Really for the rating and the price I expected something phenomenal, maybe even Bi-rite level phenomenal. I sampled sweet cream and milk chocolate and both flavors were overwhelmingly sweet. No creamy after-taste that gets me wanting more. No memorable texture. All of my friends (me included) ended up getting the coffee flavor one and it was good, but REALLY how can you possibly fck up with coffee flavor anything? I know they change flavor often and maybe I came on a bad day, but if it's summer, an ice cream shop better deliver every single day because hello, demand is high.

I was so psyched to get here and get my glorious SF summer ice cream fix but EHHHH I'm good without it for a long time.
author: Minh L.

description:
Bottom line at the top: this is the best ice cream in SF.
--
Amazing. Salty mango, frozen hot chocolate, housemade chocolate and caramel, housemade cookies n cream marshmallows, house made peanut butter malt balls, peanut brittle toffee cookies, everything is perfection.
author: Dahlia S.

description:
I really like Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous's Ice Cream! What sucks is that they are always closed by 6PM, making it hard for me to go visit them unless it's during the weekends. Whenever I come here, there is always a line out the door. That's how you know they are that good especially when there's a line even on a cold day! I have tried the following flavors: 

Croquantino - Includes hazelnut, orange, and liquor. I had first tried this flavor for my first time at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. Had a really interesting taste. But now that I think about it, it is not as amazing as the three flavors below.

Pink Squirrel - Very interesting and unique type of flavor. It had included almond and chocolate liquor. 

Earl Grey Tea - I could really taste the earl grey flavor! So yummy!! Loved the taste.

Salted Mango - Had a really strong mango taste. Super tasty with a burst of flavors.
author: Philana C.

description:
this place has great ice cream. I love birthday cake and they made it into an ice cream. I'm in love. The problem is too much cream and salt in it. The texture is not thick enough to handle all that rich flavor. I would say it's about as on point as Humphrey slocomb but with a heavier emphasis on creamy and rich flavors and less innovation for fruit, spice, and other flavors.
