Still thoroughly enjoyed this ice cream and would def come again, they have great crunchy but not too sugary cones. Paper straws for the milkshakes. decor kinda like dandelion chocolates. 

Bonus, one of the cashiers looks like a modern samurai.
author: Megan L.

description:
The frosted flakes flavor is so good that I would eat it...

A) even if I had to slurp multiple shots out of Rob Kardashians belly button 

B) off the ground as it was being swarmed by red fire ants 

C) as it was dripping down a dirty mailbox topped with pigeon poop in the Tenderloin

D) even if it had to be rectally infused and the taste imagined 

E) ALL OF THE ABOVE GOD DAMNIT
author: Michael C.

description:
Ehhhhhhhhh is how I felt about Mr. And Mrs. Miscellaneous.. I came from Salumeria, around the Mission, on a blistering hot day and was expecting some amazing ice cream as the perfect cool down desert, but I was underwhelmed in all honesty. When I first arrived, there was luckily no line so I felt free to try some flavors. I tried the olive oil, cake & cream, old fashion, salted mango, and almond butter & honey. Of those 5, I could only taste 2 distinctively (salted mango & almond butter). Thinking that the Old Fashion had the coolest components, I decided to get a single of it. I was wrong.. The entire cup of ice cream completely lacked flavor besides when I ate an actual cherry! I tried REALLY hard to taste the orange and bourbon and such, but nothing came to.. I will admit, the texture was suuuper creamy and fulfilling, but it was just all cream with no flavor /: My friend ordered a salted mango, and it was far better, though. I was actually able to taste it and the texture was again, very delightful. I would say the "salted" part isn't as blatant as the mango, it's more of a slight after-taste (not in a bad way). It was honestly very reminiscent of Polly Anns mango ice cream with just a hint of saltiness. 

Overall, I would just rather go to Bi-Rites.. The amount you get for you pay isn't the most worth it, and the flavors aren't very apparent, or there at all.. Also, the drive here was a little confusing for me since I'm not as acquainted with this area, so if it's going to be a long commute, I recommend finding another ice cream place. The only thing I can commend is the space and nice workers. Other than that, I can't really applaud anything. Maybe I just got the wrong flavor, but regardless, I don't think I'll come back for a second try /:
author: Holly P.

description:
my brother has been talking abt this place.  Im a HUGE fan of ice cream! I know the bay has the BEST ice cream! So we came here on a sunday afternoon.  
The workers were friendly, one of them had a LOS ANGELES Raider hat on! AWESOME! I got the vanilla bean.  So creamy and yummy!
author: Remie M.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous easily is my favorite ice cream place in the city. I came here on a Saturday afternoon with the bf, his sister and her bf. All the ice cream I sampled were deliciously creamy and tasty. 

Personally, I am a sucker for Earl Grey anything, so I got a double scoop on a cone. I particularly love the floral taste of the tea so I instantly fell in love with it. 

The price of a double can be a little steep, but it is definitely worth it. The next time I see Earl Grey on the menu, I am buying a pint, maybe even more =P.

TIP: You should call before heading there. They have very odd  hours and sometimes they are not even open. Also ask for their flavors that day since they are always changing.
author: Marcus L.

description:
In a city full of ice cream shops that have been around for decades (Mitchell's, Swensen's, Polly Ann), popular new options like Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, and Smitten, and even new takes on the old-school like The Ice Cream Bar, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has become my favorite of them all. I love how out of the way their Dogpatch location is because it allows me to visit a part of the city that I rarely get to enjoy. I usually come on a Friday afternoon right before dinner (high five for dessert ruining your appetite for dinner!) , and parking has been a breeze. There's never a wait like Bi-Rite, but that has nothing to do with the quality of the ice cream here, I assure you. Perhaps I have great luck, or I have great timing...maybe both?

The flavors in rotation are creative, and there are plenty of them. I've been here only a handful of times but I see different flavors on the handwritten menu each time. They use Straus milk, which I love, and the butterfat content is lower than other shops, allowing two scoops to settle down faster in your tummy than if you were to consume that amount at, say, Mitchell's. I like convincing myself that there's less guilt if I'm going to be a baby piggy on my cheat day. Everything I have tried so far has been very memorable (that in itself is pretty amazing, don't you think?) but I REALLY loved the Black Lychee Tea, Banana Toffee, Honey Lavender, and Eggless Buttermilk Lime. I have yet to try the elusive Pink Squirrel, but I'm sure my timing will be right one of these days. It might bother some, but I also really like the communal tables; there are two of these long tables, and it wouldn't hurt to check out what your neighbor has in his/her cone so you can try that flavor next time.

Oh, and by the way, beware of the nice brunette who works there on Friday afternoons. I don't mean that she's rude. She's actually the opposite and makes sure you get huge scoops. I have yet to figure out whether that is a good or bad thing though...
author: Olivia V.

description:
The flavors here are so unique, and tasty too. Everytime I come here, there is always something new. It just sucks because they don't repeat flavors often, which can be a bummer if you fell in love with this one flavor, but they don't have it the next time.

I recently had the Strawberry Guava flavor, which was sooooo good. Creamy like how strawberry ice cream always is, but not too icy like a guava sorbet would be. They also have Pink Squirrel occasionally, which is considered their popular one. I think it's alright, just tastes like almost extract flavoring. Some other flavors are Sweet Cream, Cookies & Cream, Jasmine Green Tea, list goes on forever.

My only complaint is that they're barely open. I'd say that my boyfriend and I always have to plan a time to come here, and put it in our schedule, in order for us to successfully execute a trip here. I kind of prefer Humphry Slocombe more than Mr. and Mrs., just because Humphry is open more often, and the flavors are just as good. Also, Mr. and Mrs. seems to attract a lot more families, which can be a little frustrating if you want to have a mellow Sunday afternoon with no screaming kids.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I can give you a handful of reasons to visit the Dogpatch. You've got Neighbor Bakehouse cranking out croissants and other pastries that'll lift your spirits even on the gloomiest of days. (Not that there's a lack of sunny days in the 'patch). There's Third Rail that'll provide more spirits (and some mean beef jerky and cocktails). La Fromagerie makes the best cheese sandwiches in town (bonus: served by a lovable French staff).

But really, Mr. and Mrs. is reason enough to plan a trip. It's my favorite ice cream in the city and possibly the entire Bay Area. As a loyal Berkeleyan, I'm sorry Ici. Your cones are still genius and unbeatable. 

The flavors at Mr. and Mrs. are handwritten and seem to be slightly different each time I pay a visit. I've had their pumpkin, brown butter, black sesame, chocolate chiffon, and sampled others. They even have a fernet flavor on occasion to the ecstasy of local San Franciscans.

The ice cream texture is unbeatable, the flavor delightful, and the wait completely reasonable (major points on Birite here). 

Ultimately the final test is the ice cream happiness factor. My state of mind before, during (especially), and after (did not feel grossly full or saturated in sugar and fat) all of my Mr. and Mrs. experiences was that of pure elation.

Definitely get over here guys.
author: Sydney M.

description:
Alright, but wasn't worth driving the whole town for a cup of ice cream. I saw the amazing reviews on yelp that I had to come see what it was all about.

The dining room is beautiful and homey. Minimal and simplistic decor, me likey. I went with the cookies and cream and teammate went ahead and got chocolate chip. Service was nice and friendly, but ice cream was alright. Maybe I should have gotten a different flavor?
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Being an ice cream whore, I've been wanting to try this place since I heard they opened.  Finally gave it a go.  Been there.  Done that. No need to return.  Underwhelmed.    

Unless you live or work in this area, it's tough to be there during business hours.  I think it's great they started the business to have more family time but tough to get there while they're open.

Trekked over there on a sunny Sunday afternoon.  The queue was ridiculous but we endured because made the trek specifically to try them.  Of course I expected a queue, however:
Disappointment 1:  there were absolutely no cookies & I intended to buy cookies.
Disappointment 2:  they were out of a few flavors.  Most of the flavors mentioned by previous reviewers were no where to be found.
Disappointment 3:  tastes are limited to 3, when it's your 1st time & the favors are "unique" why limit it?
Disappointment 4:  the small size ($3.75) is a single scoop & limited to 1 flavor

Decided to share a sundae w/basil & birthday cake - both flavors were meh but the best of what I tasted.  I skipped the hot fudge or caramel for Guittard chocolate crunch pearls which were yummy - so were the almonds.  In the end, I paid $6.50 for a sprinkling of chocolate pearls & almonds.

Despite others trying to steal my heart away, Bi-Rite Creamery remains my #1.
author: Kim S.

description:
4.5 Stars

Organic ice cream.  Unique, delicious flavors.  Mostly everything made in-house.  Spacious & clean space.  Super friendly & great customer service.  What more can you ask for?

You  have got to try the Tres Leche, Crema Catalana, and Halva.

The only thing I didn't like was that the hot fudge in my sundae seized.  But I can live with that.
author: Rose A.

description:
Oh. My. God. YES! Having moved to Dogpatch several months ago, I've already visited the Mr and Mrs more times than I'd like to count (that, and Hard Knox, but there's another time and another review for that one), easily making them my favorite ice cream joint in SF thus far [ http://instagram.com/p/YYg7vOQfsX/ ].

While I'm not crazy about all their flavors, I've come across more tasty ones than not, including their jasmine green tea, earl gray, black sesame, salted mango, chicory coffee, palm sugar, and bay rhum. Their lighter flavors (the first three, for example) easily top my list, with their sweeter ones coming in at a close second, though possibly too sweet for some. Texture-wise, their ice cream is spot on: neither too hard nor too soft, melting in your mouth juuuust right.

Pro tip: come with a non-germaphobe friend and order a double or triple scoop to share and save! And if you want to use a card ($5 minimum), be sure to get a double with some extra, or just go all in for that triple scoop ;)

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - It does get a bit cramped inside, so be warned. Waiting in line for the counter is not usually an issue, nor is getting your samples, but be prepared to say a few pardons as you squeeze your way back past the line, to the door. As for the seating, with the tables arranged so closely together, your seating options are fairly limited to the outlier seats (of which there are about 10 spots?)

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
This does not compete with Bi Rite. AT. ALL. 

Maybe I came on an off day? The flavors that fellow Yelpers mentioned were not on the menu. It was fairly disheartening. I was very excited to try this place. 

I do like the simple decor and plenty of seating. If it's a nice day, I would prefer walking outside.

I ended up with Almond Butter and Cookies n Cream. The Almond Butter was good, but as I was eating, some parts of the scoop was very salty. It was as if it wasn't mixed thoroughly... Not a good experience. And well the Cookies n Cream was just that. Nothing special... I did try the other flavors, but none of them were appealing. 

I will maybe be back... if it is convenient.
author: Audrey N.

description:
Ice Cream in San Francisco is awesome. If you think about it, for a place to survive the cold weather we get, you really need some bomb ice cream. Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous does not disappoint. 

I came on one of the weird days when they had no interesting flavors. Interesting meaning some good mixes of deliciousness. However, what was there was pretty awesome. 

I tried the Malted Milk and Brown Butter, and thought the flavors were good...but not quite what I wanted. I found gold with the Earl Grey Tea. Its legitimately like I seeped some Earl Grey for a few minutes, and turned it into ice cream. Yum.

I also snagged a peanut brittle cookie - and that IS SO GOOD. I mean, I know this is primarily an ice cream place, but if you can...grab that baked good. So. Good.

Being the fatass I am, I also got the sour candy straws. Wasn't as great as the other stuff here. Overall though, its a pretty great spot for ice cream and baked goods!
author: Lily W.

description:
I bought a large size ice cream cup (3 scoops) so that I could share with my young children.

"Can I get an extra cup for my son?"

Reply from register dude: "What?  You want to share?  No I can't give you a cup and  you can't share a large ice cream."   (making sure to say it in a loud manner in an attempt to make a scene)

Thanks alot for the attitude,  the ice cream was good but not worth enduring the poor customer service.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
If you can find a time where this place is actually open, this is a fine scoop of ice cream.  One of the other customers told me that this is the best in SF.  High praise and I dont quite agree but should be considered as one of the top.  They have a range of interesting flavors.  For me the most memorable was the black tea.  You really do get the tea flavor and they didnt make it too sweet.  The chicory coffee was great at first bite but by the time you get to the end, the sweetness becomes a bit overwhelming.  

It is considerably better than Bi-Rite and can hold its own with Humphry Slocombe, but is not as good as Smitten (this is tough, comparison because smitten doesnt have the flavor range but the mouth feel is so much better and the house made cones have way more flavor at Smitten.
author: Scott C.

description:
48 degrees in SF and Mr. & Mrs Miscellaneous still manages to get a line out the door for people SCREAMIN FOR ICE CREAM... 

I must say, pretty good indication that this place is indeed superb. They offer delightful ice cream concoctions, but be warned, flavors tasted and liked today may not necessarily be readily available the next time you go since they are constantly changing their ice cream menu

This past visit, I had the pleasure of trying the Gingersnap and Italian Panettone (holiday bread) and was equally delighted by both. The gingersnap had a more subtle ginger/ cinnamon flavor whereas the Panettone tasted like ....well for a lack of better word- tasted like Christmas. (insert gigantic goofy smile), there was also actual chunks of bread in the ice cream which complemented the flavor and offered it a different texture. 

With the recent upsurge of creameries in SF, Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous is a must try on the growing list.
author: Ada C.

description:
An old familiar spot, just wish they used social media a bit more to post their daily menus. To their credit, they do post updates on hours when they change, though.

With the menu changing daily, it probably does more harm than good to read the reviews on this place. You'll be like me, getting your hopes up over magical sounding flavors like earl grey, jasmine, and bourbon caramel....sigh

Don't be too discouraged, though - their daily flavors, while maybe not what you walked in hoping for, are still quite amazing!

Favorites include cardamom, malted chocolate, and lychee.

The line gets long, but it's worth the wait for such delicious concoctions!
author: Claire S.

description: Everytime ive been in the neighborhood, this place is closed. The one rare time i showed up during the day, it happened to be very nice and sunny. Time for ice cream! Got the strawnana in a cup. Good rich strawberry and banana. They sell a lot of other confections but i didnt dig into those. Perhaps next time. Assuming theyre open when i show up!
author: Kim N.

description:
I'm sure its not always like this, but every time I come here, close to 10 times now, I find parking right near by, and there is a really short wait. I have even been here when it was sunny out, and "hot" (meaning over 70F).

This place is huge, but the place only seats about 25-30 people, and that would be intimately.

My friend LOVES this place. I think its good, but its not earth shattering. 

I like the Earl grey tea and Amarena Cherry.
author: Benny N.

description: One of my favorite ice-cream shops in San Francisco, and possibly anywhere. The ice cream is dense, creamy, not overly sweet, and the flavors are adventurous but not pretentious. Try the matcha green tea, birthday cake, sweet cream, ovaltine, basil leaf; anything, really. The owners are sweet and dedicated to their craft. Love it.
author: Susan E.

description:
This is world-class ice cream, with incredible customer service.

Sweet Cream, Burnt Sugar, Limoncello............ Always something new!

It's so creamy and consistent. 

Top marks.
author: David K.

description: I love love love love this place. By far my favorite ice cream shop in sf. While their hours are limited, it's worth the trek to the dogpatch during lunch or before dinner on the weekends. Be sure to get there before the end of the day as they run out of flavors. I love their ever changing menu! It makes every trip exciting and adventurous. Some of my favorites have been earl grey, ovaltine, White Russian and chicory coffee!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
This may or may not be my new favorite ice cream shop.

What got me hooked was their Ghost Chili Pepper and Shochu ice cream flavor. It tastes sweet in the beginning, but there's a kick at the back of the throat after you swallow. I totally regret not buying a pint of it. A pint ($9) sounds more reasonable than $3.50 for a scoop but when it's hot out and you need a little pick me up, this is where its at.
author: Annie S.

description: I want to like this place. Super-duper high quality, but somehow it often misses the mark. I walk past it 2x per day and am OBSESSED with ice cream, but this place just doesn't tempt me. The options are not packed with flavor. I prefer a gelato-esque flavor, and M&M M is on the extreme creamy end of the spectrum. So, if you dig creamy . . .
author: Antonia T.

description:
Ice cream melts really fast and most flavors are vanilla based. Pretty good but flavors didn't blow me away. Line looked long but goes really fast. Not understaffed so you get quick service. 

Got Fernet Branca and Peanut Brittle.
author: Tatty B.

description: I really enjoy this ice cream spot. I don't mind the higher price for this turkey artisan ice cream and other goodies offered. My one and only gripe with this location is that they do not keep their menu posted on any social media so you never know what flavor a they are offering that day. I have wasted a few trips to the shop and didn't get anything. And was frustrated after trying to fin parking and trying to call to get the flavored. I hope they can task someone with posting the flavor a daily.
author: Lani P.

description: Great quirky ice cream with amazing staff.  If you're in the area, definitely drop by for some of their more inventive flavors like Gingersnap or Brown Butter.  Yum.
author: Vince H.

description: Parking in this neighborhood is relatively easy to find. We came on a late weekend afternoon, the line snaked around and outside the building, however, the wait didn't seem too long. Just when they were out of one flavor, they popped out another (right after we left the register)! More adults than children as far as patrons go, so I'd say their flavors caters to that as well.
author: Judy M.

description:
If you like Horlick, you will like the sesame flavor here.  They taste almost identical and I know this because I used to drink Horlick all the time as well as eat it straight out of the jar.  The great thing here is that the sesame flavor comes with milk chocolate flakes which reminds me of Thrifty/Rite Aid's chocolate malt krunch ice cream.

I also tried the Root Beer which has a really different consistency from the other flavors that day.  It was much more dense and the root beer flavor doesn't hit you until the end and only very lightly.  My friend who used to work at a gourmet ice cream shop said this was a difficult flavor to turn into ice cream and I can see why.  The flavor just doesn't stay as potent from the bottle to ice cream.

They also have other goodies here like homemade brittle, brittle cookies, chocolate chip cookies, and licorice (sour mango was delish!).  Ice cream may be the product choice when coming here (obviously) but the peanut brittle and toffee cookie one of the best cookies I've had.  They make them really flat and chewy--my favorite style!  I was really sad because I left half on the table at home and my dad ate it.  

I like the big communal tables but the line doesn't make too much sense.  You go all the way to the ice cream to sample and put in your order.  Then you have to walk backwards a little to pay but you run into other people who are going forward in the line.  That needs to get fixed for crowded days.  Another thing to fix are the spoons which kept snapping in half when my friends tried to scoop a little out of their cup.

In the SF ice cream realm, there's definitely some stiff competition but I like the direction of adventure they take here with other flavors like salted mango but also being able to make the traditional favorites (peppermint, cookies 'n cream) really well.  The decor almost reminded me of some ice cream shops in NY; it was industrial but comfortable.
author: Shannon L.

description: I am very impressed by the rotating flavors here. They are so unique and so delicious. I absolutely love the bitter lemon and lychee oolong tea. This place is not shy on using tea flavors because there are other ones too like Earl Grey and Genmaicha. Other knockout flavors include peppermint stick, Irish coffee, cookies and cream. The texture and consistency is excellent. The ice cream is nice and silky and creamy, not icy. They have other treats and goodies too like cookies and chocolate malt balls. Great corner location, plenty of indoor seating, and T line access.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
- Locale Destination - 
It's on 22nd St and 3rd St in Dogpatch, SF. 

Nice open space with an industrial look in white. Very San Francisco. The staff were nice. Credit card usage is minimum $5. Street Parking, which might be tough sometimes... 

Unlike any other popular SF ice cream places, this place was sort of hard to ask for the samples. The spoon was so big and made us think it would be too much trouble to taste ice creams... ;( They don't have many varieties (around 10). 



- Gluttony Expedition -
Junior scoop cup: $2.75. Single scoop is big. 

Peanut butter malt: Nice crunchiness by the peanut butter malt. But a bit too sweet for me, as a whole. The sweetness is not overly strong, but it's sweeter than other flavors.

Vanilla bean: Very good! Very strong vanilla flavor.

Lemongrass & coconut : Graceful flavor of lemongrass. Good!



- Conqueror's Deduction - 
The quality of ice cream is as good as "Bi-Rite", but the flavor choices aren't adventurous nor creative as "Bi-Rite", "Humphrey Slocombe", and "Michelle's" when I visited. The gourmet ice cream competitions in SF are fierce - who just wants "Vanilla", "Chocolate" ??? I know they change the flavor choices daily, but I guess I wasn't lucky to see exciting flavors like "Jasmin Green Tea" etc.. ;(

Overall, "Bi-Rite" is still the best SF ice cream for me. I'm not a fan of typical "American" ice cream flavors - chocolate, banana etc... I came all the way from Orange County - SoCal. I wanted something different and cool ;( Unlucky me.  

***** Akiko's SF gourmet ice cream ranking *****
1. Bi-Rite Creamery
2. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
3. Mitchell's
4. Humphrey Slocombe
author: Akiko I.

description: I dropped by M&MM when we were having that heatwave (at least for SF) in January. Quaint place with atypical flavors of home made ice cream, that are really, really yummy!  I forgot exactly what I got, but they were of two different types - one had green tea, and the other had orange and lime of some sort. The ice cream itself was refined with no ice crystals or unpleasant chewy bits from unfiltered fruit. The prices were reasonable given the quality. I will definitely be returning here when another heat wave rolls through the city.
author: Josh S.

description: The BEST ice cream I've had in the Bay Area!! The flavors change daily and they are all creative and just delicious. The texture is perfectly creamy and you can taste right away that only the best ingredients have been used.  I also love how well their cookies pair with the ice cream, my fave being the peanut butter cookies. I feel so lucky to work nearby, all my coworkers and I love going there during work breaks.
author: Alondra T.

description:
Coming here is truly a treat every time. 

The flavors change, but I love every scoop. The most recent time I was here I had the Thai tea, and it tastes exactly as you'd expect...but better. Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous offers the best ice-cream in the Mission Bay/Dogpatch area. Similar to places like Ici in Berkeley and Bi-rite in the Mission, they're ice-cream is made fresh and come in unique flavors weekly. 

If friends are visiting from out of town, I'd definitely bring them here.
author: Alice H.

description:
i was a little disappointed coming here because i did not know that they did not have a set menu. i was coming here hoping to try to the burbon and caramel, but when i got there, they didn't have that flavor!! the flavors they did have did not really stand out - coffee, sweet cream, earl grey (i guess this was the only unique flavor).

i ended up getting the sweet cream w/ a waffle cone. The ice cream itself was good, but really nothing special. the cone however was one of the best cones i've had. I also got the earl grey which was probably my favorite out of all the different flavors.

note to patrons: keep your expectations low when it comes to the menu because it might be a let down.
author: Andy H.

description:
Managed to make it back again to check out another set of flavors.

This time the flavors suited me much better!  I ended up getting  'Honey Graham' and another that had bourbon, orange and cherries.  Both were really good.  The 'Honey Graham' was on a whole other level though.  I absolutely loved it!

I wish there was a way to know what flavors they have every day without having to check it out personally.
author: Jason S.

description: Rude, their ice cream 's not worth it. Was excited to go here based off all the great reviews but now I regret it
author: Katie F.

description:
We have little ones in our house so we use them as an excuse for dessert. As if we need an excuse for dessert!

Most Sunday's we end up at Oliver's, the butcher around the corner from Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous which means we ultimately end up getting some ice cream. 

First off all, the parking in this area is so much easier than at other ice cream places in the city - you know who you are!

There is almost always a line, so be prepared. The seating is communal and the decor is sparse. 

The Malted Milk is awesome, the chocolate tends to run very chocolaty so if you aren't a big fan of chocolate, I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Tara H.

description:
Loved the building itself! Modern look/feel, great decor, open/communal seating. Known for their ice cream, but they do have some cookies + treats as well. 

I looked up at the menu and could not decide what I wanted to get! So many out-of-the-ordinary flavors. I ended up with the White Russian and my friend got Peaches n' Cream. I really loved the taste of both flavors! Creamy, not overly sweet or fake tasting. I'm glad I went with the White Russian...as soon as I sat down with my ice cream, they ran out and erased if off the board. A single scoop was the perfect size for me...a junior might've been good as well. 

I sat there for a while, chatting with my friend. The employees changed out a couple of flavors during the duration of our stay. It's nice that they rotate flavors out...you never know what they'll have when you go! 

Can't wait to come back and try out more flavors!
author: Carole Y.

description:
Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous is a great addition to the Dogpatch area.

great ice cream! Fun flavors and toppings. They also have LARGE cookies, brownies, and other desserts as well. You can eat there or take it to go.

This lines are usually long but it goes fast. The people that work there are SUPER nice and helpful and let you try as many things are you want.
I had the Early Grey ice cream which was delicious. 
Can't wait to go back
author: Whitney S.

description:
Confessions of a Chocolate Freak

I heard a report on NPR Forum July 30, 2012 ranking 15 local ice cream makers, http://www.kqed.org/a/forum/R201207301000 and after some judges performed thorough taste testing of local independent ice cream shops, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous prevailed for its chocolate ice cream. They described the chocolate as "molten." And it beat Bi-Rite, Fenton's, Mitchell's, and the others.

I really wanted to taste it, and it landed on my bucket list of food places to try. I never happen to be in that part of SF, but I recently had a little time before I needed to pick up my dog at the vet. 

And what the hell?! They had no chocolate ice cream on their menu that day. I sampled the other flavors, but a chocophile like me doesn't get real excited by Vanilla, Violet, Caramel, Banana Graham, Malted Milk, Chicory Coffee, and the other non-chocolate flavors they had. Sheesh.

So the guy behind the counter suggested the hot fudge, which was an okay idea, but really not what I'd had in mind. I also sampled a Chocolate Peanut Butter Malt Ball, which was different, but was too sweet for me. *sigh*

The hot fudge was thick and pretty good, but wasn't really doing it for me. It tasted chewy like it had caramel in it, which was interesting. I think fudge is a pretty subjective thing, and I really was there for the ice cream. The missing chocolate ice cream. *sigh*

The guy spooning out the samples was extremely pleasant, and had just come inside from a cigarette break. Unfortunately the samples were affected by the smoky scent that lingered on him. He recommended that I call ahead first, if I want to be sure to arrive on a day that they offer chocolate. If I return, I'll be sure to call first. 

I remembered reading that their cookies were quite good, and they looked delicious. This is a Yelp friend's photo of a cookie that convinced me to try one, not a cookie from the day I was there. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=zcfLTHIT86XD2qmOkW9QSg#2527PMpJhisHCCqqaCYAwA I bought the Dark Chocolate & Peanut Butter Cookie. Normally, I wouldn't touch a peanut butter cookie, but this one was moist and delicious. I only intended to sample it out of Yelpcuriosity for this review, but I ate the whole damn thing. It was fantastic.

The ice cream was definitely fresh, creamy, and high quality, but without a flavor I truly love, I can't say it's the place for me. So far, Bi-Rite is still my favorite. Someday I hope to try Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous' molten chocolate ice cream, so I can decide if I agree with the ice cream judges.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great ice cream but very unpredictable and non-customer friendly hours.  They close early and always seem closed when we try to go.
author: Brad L.

description:
Another awesome ice cream shop in San Francisco.

I saw this joint on a random website that lists the best ice cream shops in SF so I had to go. Furthermore, since I haven't ever been around this area (dogpatch), I was more compelled to make my way out here to do some exploring. Upon arrival, there was actually a random festival going on (a security guard said it was called the Dogpatch Street Fest). Sadly, it seemed unorganized/bland and there was like no customers--probably because it was super windy/cold.

Anyway, I wanted to get some the famous pink squirrel ice cream. Perfect, they didn't have it that day. I went with the Macapuno flavor and the Milk & Cookies flavor. Both were amazing and more importantly, unique. Every time I go to a specialty ice cream shop that makes tasty ice cream I consider opening up my own shop. There lots of specialty/organic flavors for everyone's taste.

I think this place is Filipino owned (or influenced at least) since they have Filipino flavors and did a fundraiser for the typhoon victims about a week ago. I can't not give 4 stars to a joint for doing something like that.

Since it's right next to a popular restaurant called Serpentine, a plan for lunch/dinner there with ice cream before or afterwards at M&MM sounds like a pragmatic plan of action.

This spot should be on an ice cream fanatic's list of favorites.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Amazing!!! Had the Pink Squirrel, which is more of an almond flavor.  If you don't like almonds or the color pink, then don't get it, but there are a lot of other interesting flavors.  I have to go back and try the other flavors.  However, I was simply impressed with the flavors I had.  

There are very few ice cream shops where I would buy by the pint.  I think it's worth the price to get some packaged ice cream pints to go.
author: Anh T.

description:
this is hands down my fav ice cream join in SF.
Now that I live walking distance I fear for my lbs..... But I guess since I'm walking there it justifies it?  I'll just tell myself that. :)

So many unique flavors... they give you samples in real spoons :)
I usually try two or three before I make my final selection.

Pink Squirrel is one of my favs. here and usually my go to if I'm not sure what to pick.  It's chocolate and almond liqueur flavor.

Once I had the candied violet and I loved it soooo much!!!  I haven't seen it again but i hope it comes back soon.  I do remember having to pay a little bit extra for it.

1. Mr. and Mrs  
2. Humphries 
3. Bi-Rite  

IMO!!!

$5 minimum for credit card transactions :)
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
Forget Bi-Rite - this is the ice cream San Francisco deserves!

We showed up around brunch time on a Saturday and discovered that it wasn't too busy, which was awesome. As with many other "gourmet" ice cream shops, they had a variety of unique flavors, all cutely displayed on a chalk board. It's similar to Ici in Berkeley, Bi-Rite in the Mission, and Humphrey Slocombe in the Ferry Building in style and concept, but Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous has to top all of them. I would come here more if it weren't so out of the way!
author: Sophie H.

description:
this have been bookmarked for so long but i'm rarely in the dogpatch. we had brunch next door at serpentine and thought it would be a good idea to knock out 2 places i wanted to try at once

flavors tried
-rose choc chip: didnt really taste the rose
-ipa: barely taste the ipa and my friend couldnt find the alcohol in this at all
-ginger cookie: ended up with this but i got tired of it halfway through my cup

they didnt have any of the flavors other yelpers rave about =/ maybe next time will be better
author: Raquel T.

description:
Unfortunately you just lost a customer. Walked from my house with my daughter and arrived at 5pm. Employee outside said we could not come in and the few people still outside in line were the last ones. Just walked 20 min. Sorry we did not arrive at 4:59pm. We were the only ones who showed up at 5, not like there was a flow of other people and they had to make a cut off decision. I asked the employee if he could talk to a manager and see if he could work with us. He stated "I really don't want to walk back in there and ask for you. I don't want to let anyone else in, you will have to come back another day."

Horrible way to treat your local customer who frequents your ice cream shop. Don't worry about me or my family or anyone else I can tell about your bad customer relations supporting your business. 

Humphry Slocombe will get my business even though I will need to drive there instead of having a nice walk to get ice cream with my family.
author: INTHECITY S.

description:
This place has a line damn near out the door. Great ice cream parlor. They have their own unique flavors and make a lot of their toppings in house. 

Their staff are very friendly and very San Franciscan. I ordered two scoops - one guanana and the other crema Catalana (lime and burnt orange) with the crispy chocolate balls on top. 

Best ice cream I have had in my life. The flavors are bursting with flavor and the coops are very generous. LOVE!
author: Jenna T.

description:
Fab, fab ice cream!

Organic Strauss dairy.
No line.
Creative flavors.
No line.
Friendly staff.
No line.
Handmade cones.
and...no line.

Winner, winner!

I ordered a junior scoop of the Torrone flavor (almond, honey, and hazelnut) in one of their cones made on the premises (aka FRESH). Flavor explosion - creamy and delicious! There's just something about about Strauss dairy that definitely makes a huge difference!

I also sampled the Cardamom and Honey Graham flavors, both of which were excellent, too. It seems like you can't go wrong here. Plenty of seating, no line, and directly across the street from several popular brunch spots. I'll be back here in a minute!

P.S. There's a $5 minimum on credit cards, so either pay for your friend or bring some ca$h.
author: Mansi A.

description: A refreshing change of ice cream flavors. This place is a gem of the Dogpatch area. The place is very clean and the staff is so nice and courteous. Super yummy ice cream and the flavors are kind of bizzarre but good and very creamy!!
author: Maricar F.

description:
I think this place tops Bi-Rite. The ice cream is very creamy, smooth, and very unique flavors:

Lime-green tea - light, slight citrus with the serene taste of green tea

Burnt sugar - toasty and taste kind of like caramel. 

I thought I could finish two scoops but it was so rich (in a good way)! $4.75 for 2 scoops. I'm glad I don't live near this place, otherwise I'd be coming here for dessert too much!
author: Tes Y.

description: excellent ice cream!  creamy. not too frozen that i need to bite at it but at the same time without being runny.  service was excellent.
author: Jason C.

description: Some really tasty and unusual ice cream flavors as many have noted.  I had a scoop of the Ovaltine and my wife got the tea flavored one.  The sweet cream was also quite good.
author: Bob F.

description: Tasty salted mango ice cream to share with your best girlfriends while catching up on life.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Great ice cream by great people.  Mr. and Mrs. might just beat out the tough SF ice cream market.  The corn and caramel flavor was unbelievable, with absolutely perfect texture and consistency.  The taste was subtle, with a hint of sweetness that seems to come from the ingredients rather than just sugar.  I also tried the malted caramel crunch as well as the candied violet, both were delightfully - but not overwhelmingly - rich.  

They change their rotation often, about 10 daily flavors, hence the name Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  

The best way to describe this place is that the ice cream really does taste home made, as opposed to mass produced.
author: Angel S.

description:
Yup, this place lives up to the hype. I got the Rose with chocolate and it was so good! Very fragrant rose taste which was so refreshing. Their house waffle also had a nice brown sugar taste which was so yum. On the pricier side, but I wouldn't mind coming back for more. 

Other unique flavors that caught my eye included Black Sesame and Jameson Whiskey (say wahhh?!). They also have a sorbet selection which I unfortunately did not know of until I saw someone order after me.
author: Cindy L.

description:
18-August, Saturday:
After 1 scoop each of: 
-White Rabbit
-Chicory Coffee

I still hold a strong allegiance to my Salted Caramel from Bi-Rite Creamery.. I think that even the Three Twins from the freezer at the supermarket tastes much better than the quality, and texture I experienced here.

However, I do agree that this place is very reasonably priced, which is why I find that people hype about it so incessantly. But you really do get what you pay for, I almost felt bad for throwing away 3/5ths of this over-churned lactose cream-based ice. 

Pity.
author: Ty T.

description:
I can't believe how much the Dogpatch has evolved in even the last year.  It's a really trendy but laid back place to hang out on the weekends.  Mr. and Mrs. defines everything that the Dogpatch should, could and will be.

Reminiscent of an ice cream parlor from the early 1900's, this popular, yet humble, spot offers a diverse array of creative ice cream flavors.  All handmade with love and ingenuity.

Each day offers a new set of flavors that is sure to titillate your taste buds.  My favorites for today were the orange blossom with caramel syrup (my own creation) and the vanilla bean with butterscotch and cookie bits (another creation of mine.)  

In addition to their sweet and savory ice cream flavors, they offer other confections like jarred peanut brittle, cookies and licorice.  All handmade with the creative spark of Mr. and Mrs, whom I had the pleasure of meeting.

Mr. and Mrs. were working the counter with smiles on their faces.  These two people could not be more humble.  I just love how clean and nostalgic they have made their brick and mortar.

Their prices are very fair and consistent with the decent portions they serve.

I can't wait to come back and try more of the flavors and will definitely be back to try their grasshopper pie.  Thanks for making us feel welcomed in your home, Mr. and Mrs!
author: Victoria C.

description: Whatever flavor they make that day, it always seems to be good.  And for a $5 scoop, it's pretty darn big.  Just wish they would bring back strawberry shortcake!
author: Herb K.

description:
I love ice cream. Even better if the flavors are creative and different from the usual fare.

I believe there were about 8-10 flavors to choose from, and they all sounded delicious. I tried the "brown butter" and decided to get it immediately. The taste was spot on, and arguably a little strange, since there were tiny blobs of butter mixed in the ice cream. Regardless, it was delicious.

Will be back to try new flavors.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
One thing that I enjoy about my job is that I get to work anywhere in the city. Some of the areas with businesses for eats can be a hit or unfortunately, a miss.  

With a few places of great dining (mainly hole-in-the-wall places), I do enjoy working in the industrial Dogpatch and Bayview/Hunter's Point Area (Third St.). 

In my car and using my cadaver dog nose, I can smell the freshly baked ice cream cone mixture being cooked at this ice cream parlor on the corner of Third and 22nd Street. 

Normally, I would eat my ice cream in a little cup or straight from a pint or gallon container. But the smell of the freshly baked cone has lured me to eat it from a cone...even in my gangster-like business suit.

The ice cream shop has ten different daily flavors. I had a scoop of Croquatino and a scoop of Buttermilk Blueberry for $3.75 in a freshly-cooked cone for an additional $.50. The Croquatino is very similar to the popular Butter Pecan with a caramelized hazelnut and caramel sauce. The Buttermilk Blueberry has a nice creamy taste of Buttermilk with fresh blueberries. The freshly-made cone made a "huge" difference. Most ingredients are organic and the dairy is made from Straus Creamery. And the place is Eco-friendly too with biodegradable items...a huge plus! My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=NujqGHzWZi7eGNPiRGsXjw

I also spent $6.00 for a jar of chopped Peanut Brittle for a later treat. That later treat did not last long; less than 2 hours to be exact. The Peanut Brittle, loaded with nuts (not like me), is seal-packed in an air-tight mason-jar and made fresh at the actual location. Peanut brittle: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=hdtVcp27o6KVDq_OLPHwCg

The husband and wife, proprietors, are friendly with a smile. Maybe it's my suit and/or my "Joe Cool" image. 

My Visa was accepted for my over $5.00 purchase. I can't wait to try other ice cream flavors and freshly made items from this corner place.
author: Matt G.

description:
One day while in the neighborhood with my nephew, I found time on my hands and decided to stop intpo Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous to get a little dessert distraction. 

I ordered up one scoop of the Ball Park for me (Anchor Steam Beer, Peanuts and Chocolate Pretzels) and a Chocolate Chip scoop for the kid. We sat nearby eating our ice cream like a bunch of kids enjoying each bite. 

Good things don't always have to be pricey, but they have to be memorable. That's what Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was, so good I still remember every bite and sitting there enjoying it with a kid with ice cream all over his face.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream place in the Bay area. Their ice cream is rich, creamy and dense in texture. Their rotating menu has a solid selection of flavors. The store is urban, trendy.

- Better than BiRite
- Better than Humphry Slocombe

You know what? Rating ice cream is difficult. All-in-all Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is just more fun to eat than the other the Bay area places but the other places have their charms (ie. cones, ice cream sandwiches, unique flavors), too. So, in their own ways they end up with the same 4-star rating.
author: Yad L.

description: Really, really creamy ice cream. You can't argue with the price and portions because ice cream is sort of a commodity now, but man, the green tea tastes like what really good milk green tea tastes like. The cookies and cream is like creamy oreos in your mouth. It's a shame their handmade cones are $1 each and run out super quickly everyday. The only thing holding this place back is its location. Otherwise, they do great flavors, and they have lots of accompaniments (also very pricey). But, a caveat is that because it's in such a hard-to-reach place, you don't have to park too far away at all.
author: Danny C.

description:
I'd come here over Bi-rite anytime. 

- Giant wooden tables that fit at least thirty ice-cream zombies
- One bite of SWEET CREAM will take you to heaven 
- Friendly staff, DOGPATCH brunch time, open space with wicked ice cream flavors

We can't be too greedy.
author: Jiwon M.

description: Located in an industrial era of San Francisco, corner location with tall glass windows. They ran out of their waffle cones that day so we didn't get to try them, but I loved their ice cream! It was very smooth and creamy, the texture was great. They have interesting flavors which alternate on a daily basis. I ordered a 2 scoop of the strawberry and honey bear. The strawberry wasn't over powering like most strawberry flavors and the honey bear was perfectly sweet but not super sweet! Definitely recommend coming here when you get the chance, it is on the pricier side but I'm always up for good food if it's worth it and this is definitely worth it!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Winner! I loooove this place! My cousin raved about this place. I had to check it out for myself! 

Whenever I travel, the sites I visit are often dependent on what's "new" or "different" to eat around there...I wanted to try something different, so I went for the Nougat flavored ice cream. I looooved it. Almost got seconds, except I didn't want people to think I was being a fatty. It was also "too close to dinner time." Pfft. But I'd rather have nougat ice cream as my dinner! Definitely making a trip back to this place the next time I visit SF!
author: Karen L.

description:
Now here is an ice cream shop that resonates with me on an emotional level. I'm not kidding. I love Bi-Rite's artisanal creaminess and admire Mr. Slocombe's audacious flavor palette. But Mr. and Mrs. M. feels more life-size in their approach to their homemade, organic ice cream. They've been open for only two months, and I can somehow relate to the owner couple - a smiling Asian woman and a mustachioed tattooed guy in a knit cap - scooping up the samples. It appears that ten flavors are offered daily here (see photo), and unlike Humphry's head-scratching sensory combinations, they all sound pretty darn scrumptious. 

Jamie W. and I both went for double scoops since that was the only way to try two flavors successively. Both of us were drawn to their obvious signature flavor, Ballpark, which blends Anchor Steam-infused ice cream with peanuts and chocolate pretzel sticks into a sweet-savory frenzy of flavor. For our second scoops, he went for the Pralines & Cream, a can't-miss combination for any caramel lover, while I dove into the Candied Ginger, which really defied my expectations of a spumoni-like confection with its pops of gingery flavor (see photos). 

Other sweets abound here from hot fudge and butterscotch sauce to put on your ice cream to the brittle sold by the jar on the counter (see photos) to fudgesicles and floats. All of these goodies are served in a cavernous space, clean and white, with plenty of seating should you want to park it while you lick (see photo). This space strikes me as a lot more kid-friendly than the other fashionable ice cream shops probably because Dogpatch is a relatively more affordable neighborhood. Take advantage and take the trip down here. It's well worth the journey. 

ICE CREAM - 4 stars...delicious flavor combinations that stay life size 
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...nice, cavernous place to hang for a bit 
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...very friendly and low-key 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely a contender in SF's ice cream wars
author: Ed U.

description:
I love ice cream and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has definitely made it on to my list of favorite ice cream spots in San Francisco. They feature around 7-9 flavors of ice cream daily ranging from more basic flavors such as cookies and cream and sweet cream to more unique flavors such as salted mango and basil chip. The texture and consistency is PERFECT and I really enjoyed the sweet cream and salted mango - will definitely be back to try other flavors on their menu!

They have plenty of seating indoors but just a heads up, it is really hard to find parking in this area.
author: Nikitha R.

description:
Ice cream here, while delicious, is rather expensive. They also limit you to 3 samples, which is rather discouraging. I bought a peanut brittle cookie for $3 - quite delicious, but not anything I would bother getting again. 

However, parking is relatively easy and there wasn't a long line when I went - always a plus in San Francisco! Their flavors are very unique (almond butter, genmai - green tea and toasted brown rice!). I was disappointed to see that the jasmine green tea and earl grey flavors that others raved about were not available during my visit.
author: Mina K.

description:
Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous' ice cream is so addicting that I try to visit at least once a week! I truly believe that this place deserves more than 5 stars.. and let me tell you why.

-Plenty of parking
There aren't too many restaurants nearby so parking is relatively easy!

-Clean, spacious, and plenty of seating
The shop has a nice, airy feel to it with plenty of natural light to radiate throughout the building. There's plenty of room to move around and there's tons of seats to sit and actually enjoy your ice cream!

-Friendly employees 
Yup, there's a Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous and they're SUPER friendly. The guy with the camo hat and the girl with the glasses are also very nice! No matter how busy they are, they always make an effort to converse with their customers which is something I don't normally see at popular eateries.

-Quality service
Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous will go above and beyond to make sure that the customer is satisfied with their product. When asking for samples, they won't rush you, which is always nice because they want you to pick a flavor that you're satisfied with. For instance, I got a scoop of Bourbon & Caramel and the owner noticed there wasn't enough caramel in my ice cream scoop, so he added some of their delicious home made caramel for free. It was totally unnecessary, but much appreciated!

-Delicious products
Everything is made in house! From their unique ice cream to their delicious cookies and marshmallows. Everything and I mean EVERYTHING on their menu is good! When I go to ice cream shops, I normally go for a boring flavor like vanilla or strawberry, but since Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous switches up their menu every day, you will always find something that you like! Since they use Strauss milk to make their ice cream, you'll definitely taste the creamy component that I believe every ice cream shop should have.

-Prices
It's $3.50 for a single scoop and $4.75 for a double scoop, and sometimes I finish my ice cream and wish I had gotten the third scoop for $5.75. They also sell pints and quarts!

Some of my favorite products:

Ice cream.. and in no particular order! :)
-Candied Violet
-Sweet Cream
-Salted Mango
-21st Amendment Beer
-Banana Toffee
-White Rabbit
-Butterscotch
-Pralines & Cream
-Tres Leches
-Lychee Tea
-Caramel Turtle
-Almond with Toffee Bits
-Almond Jelly
-Honey Graham
-Buttermilk Lemon
-Hazelnut Praline
-Bitter American
-Buckwheat Honey
-Brown Butter
-Bourbon & Caramel
-Yogurt & Honey
-Orange Blosson
-Banana Jack
-Makapuno.. and I don't even like coconut ;)


The extra kick of sugar you'll need..
-Chocolate Chip cookies
-Croquantino Cookie
-Vanilla Caramels with Sea Salt
-Marshmallow covered in caramel covered with sea salt
-Any of the licorice (Pomegranate, Mango, Apple etc)
-Home made cones
-Any of the home made toppings
-Pecan caramels

To me, I believe that Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous is better than BiRite, Mitchell's, Polly Ann's, Swensen's, Humphry Slocombe, Joe's, Marco Polo's etc! They have quality products, unique flavors, exceptional service, and well, they're just so damn good!
author: Joyce E.

description: Yum. White rabbit and white chocolate. Hot daym. That waffle cone too was super fresh and tasty.
author: Iralyn J.

description:
Darn good ice cream.  The banana foster and the buttermilk and blackberry flavors are excellent. If choosing between the both, I would choose the blackberry.  

Real pieces of blackberry mixed in the buttermilk ice cream. Wonderful!
I enjoyed the banana foster flavor too, though I am not supposed to eat bananas. It was a small indulgence that I shared with one of my besties.
author: Marck N.

description:
If there was one thing in the world that makes me most consistently happy, it's ice cream. A third of the places I'm a Yelp regular are ice cream spots in SF and LA, and that number would be even higher if my own kitchen, and my experiments in homemade ice cream, were rateable on Yelp.*

There are two routes to delicious ice cream: complexity and simplicity. As a Vermont boy I love a good chunky ice cream - Ben & Jerry's, Salt & Straw in LA, etc. But I'm even more impressed when a smooth, single-flavor ice cream blows me away. And Mr & Mrs consistently does that.

Their pitch-perfect Fernet ice cream**, their brown butter, their pumpkin - all are ideal examples of a single-flavor masterpiece. They must have some alchemy going on in that back space to get the textures they get - how do they do that? Will I ever know?

Must keep going back to eat more ice cream. 

*Not a bad idea.
**Genius San Francisco flavor that I've been meaning to make myself. Mr & Mrs M's loses the bitter heart of Fernet but makes it palatable to the curious masses.
author: Sam C.

description:
BFF & I received a very warm, welcoming introduction to M&MM; no line (which means no waiting & no pressure to make a hurried decision) & when I asked, 'what kind of cookies are these?' the charismatic  African-American guy responded with 'the best cookies in the world!' And for the record, that peanut brittle & brown sugar cookie was damn close to being the best cookie in the world. Trust your M&MM ice cream dude--he ain't never lie!

After a few samples (earl grey was too mild in flavor), I settled on:
-- Crema catalana: lime custard & citrus caramel. Lighter & less creamy than our favorite ice cream joint's product (I was told it's rude to mention the competition... Which I always do..,my bad, oopps.) The flavor was exactly what I expected--buttery from the caramel with a citrus finish. 
-- Ginger blueberry: two flavors I love! Complimented each other nicely. Whole blueberries, burst of refreshing, almost spicy ginger. 

BFF & I were comparing M&MM to our favorite spot (FYI: if you must know, I've got 14 check-ins there to date...which explains my too-small jeans.) Our verdict: M&MM is a 'couples place'... It's safe, comfortable, they only combine 2 main flavors in their ice cream, even the environment is upscale for an ice creamery. Our fave is like a 'singles spot' where people go to find a manage a tois! It's kinda filthy, small, eclectic, the flavors thrown together just do not make sense...not a place you'd want to stay for long except to grab your goods & go. 

Just a glimpse into our minds. I apologize...and you're welcome *wink*
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I am a new fan of Mr. and Mrs. Misc.
Given the long line around the corner in the wind in the sun, it is worth waiting.  The crowd was friendly and great.  The service was good and the ice cream is excellent.
Silky and not too sweet with signature and special flavors.

Earl Grey is a must.
Salted Mango reminded my childhood memory.

There is no after taste and no fat feeling after enjoying this sweets.
author: Flora C.

description: More than worth the hype! Tried their lychee black tea, hot chocolate, and cookies and cream last night. So creamy and the flavors are distinct. The two women who helped us were incredible - they really care about their customers and about their ice cream. Terrific place! Find the time to go there . . . right now!
author: Gayle A.

description:
Review #1400 goes to this place... 

I saw it in Sunset magazine and said "Yes please!!" 

This place is up there with Sweet Republic (Arizona) and Marianne's (Santa Cruz).  

I love ice cream.. it does not matter if it is 300 degrees or -200 I will eat some kind of ice cream.... I love making it.. I love the different textures, smells, and of course.. TASTES!! 

After a long friggin hike up some stairs to Coit Tower (from the bottom of the residential area) and then traveling on Muni back to the Dogpatch.. around 4 something we ended up here. This place is sleek, clean and the prices are right! 


The bathroom is spotless and amazing (this was the first thing I went to after a 20 minute ride on the Muni).. probably the only time I have ever seen a bathroom at an ice cream joint look spotless.  But I don't go to an ice cream shoppe for the ice cream... 

There flavors change which is half the fun!! 
I got the Mexican Coffee which was to die for..creamy, rich and the perfect balance of flavors. I also got a huge frigging scoop of the Orange Blossom Honey. The guy behind the counter was not stingy on the scoops at all. 

I also got to try the Old Fashioned (like the alkie drank) which was also delicious. The Earl Grey was refreshing.

Other things I liked
1. The prices 
2. The homemade brittle is a super cute jar 
3. The other little noms for purchase  
4. Not at all crowded
5. Awesome service (and scoops) 
6. Reusable taste testing spoons/ environmentally friendly products in use 
7. Lots of natural lighting :-)
author: Vicky T.

description:
For some reason I feel like I've reviewed them before, but then again, my experience at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was extremely forgetful.

I've had this place bookmarked for years, heard glorious experiences from friends, but the location is a bit hard to get to, especially without a car. It's a pretty large space for an ice creamery, with quite a bit of seating, and a very sterile feel to it.

Unfortunately, our negative experience started upon walking in. My girlfriend and I came in, happily anticipating some good ice cream... but it didn't seem like the three ladies there cared that we were customers. We literally stood at the counter, a few feet away from all three ladies, and NO ONE noticed us. They kept talking for a good while, never even looking at their shop or noticing two customers are there. Well, one lady finally made her few steps to the register to ask how we were and to take our order. Problem was, for the beginning of that time, she was still talking to the other two, so my girlfriend and I kind of just stared and waited... and waited...

Their flavor menu at the time was pretty lackluster. I don't think it was worth ordering the two scoops, nor worth it to make the trek out to their destination. With the way they treated us, I'd pass...
author: Kevin J.

description:
Loved the location of this place. Why are all the places in SF so good! I sampled couple of the flavored and went with sesame. It was different but quite delicious. I also tried Cheerios and ginger and really liked the Cheerios flavor. 

I think it's better to have cash before you come here. There is a $5 minimum for cards.
author: Dayae K.

description:
Everyone has recommendations for ice cream. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was definitely was a trek to get to for me, but definitely worth it. I had to try some of the items. 

I tried the pink squirrel that everyone suggested, but it was a weird flavor to me. Also, I just like the little bit of a taste, and knew I couldnt finish an entire scoop of the flavor. I ended up getting my favorite flavor in the world - cookies and cream. It was as good as any of the other cookies and cream that I've gotten at other places, but it wasn't super amazing. I don't think I've ever had super bad ice cream, so delicious!

The line is super long, location is kind of far to get to, but I'll have to try some other flavors sometime.
author: Nina Y.

description:
This place was RIDICULOUSLY GOOD. I thought I had tried all the good ice cream places in SF (Bi-Rite, Swensen's, Mitchell's, Humphrey Slocombe, Ice Cream Bar, Smitten, etc.), but I was wrong! This has now become my 2nd favorite ice cream place in SF behind Bi-Rite.

Located on an unassuming street corner in the Dogpatch (across the street from Serpentine & Hard Knox), Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous is worth a drive or bus ride out to the area. My friends and I got here around 2-3pm on a Saturday afternoon, and there were only a couple people in line. Everything on the menu looked delicious, so I naturally had to sample multiple flavors. Here are the ones we ended up getting and sampling:

*Salted Mango (5 stars - junior cup for $2.75): SO GOOD. This was the flavor I got, and every bite was DELICIOUS. The ice cream was not salty, but the salted nature did a great job of complementing the sweet mango flavor so that every bite had the perfect amount of sweetness.

*Birthday Cake (bf gave this 5 stars): Sweet cream ice cream with chocolate cake and sprinkles? Who can resist! I tried some of this and thought it was super tasty. And the bf was in love with this.

*Bananas Foster (friend had this): My friend really enjoyed this. If you're a banana fan, you'll love this because it's a great banana ice cream with additional butter/brown sugar/cinnamon in it to give it a nice, sweet kick.

*Dark & Stormy (sampled this): Say what?? YES, this is actually ice cream that tastes like the alcoholic dark & stormy. Not sure if I'd order a whole cup of this on my own, but it was quite tasty and it sure tasted like the drink!

*Chocolate Chip Cookie (3 stars): This was an actual cookie, not an ice cream. This was the only thing that I wasn't crazy about. I liked that the chocolate chunks were evenly spread throughout the cookie, but overall the cookie was too buttery for me.

I will definitely be back very soon because I loved the ice cream I ate, and there's so much more to try! The flavors supposedly change daily, and they even change the menu slightly throughout the same day (dark & stormy was not on the menu when I first arrived, but it appeared 15 mins later). To add to that, the staff is nice, they have lots of tables to sit/chat, and I love that they give generous scoops!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Salted mango and black sesame. Yum. Great texture. Tempting to go back for another cone. 

Also got some licorice to go.

If I lived closer I would have already returned.
author: Marco M.

description:
This might be my all time favorite ice cream place. My boyfriend and I have been going on an adventure trying out new ice cream parlors and this place beats everyone out of the water. Yes, even Bite Rite (my second favorite ice cream place). Love the communal tables and open windows.

Ordered:
- Strawberry Milk: tastes like asian strawberry (there's a difference I swear!) but it was creamy and sweet. Definitely my favorite flavor
- Burnt Sugar: there's something about burnt sugar I will always love. Reminds me of my childhood when I would burn sugar on a metal spoon. So good.

Service:
I found it oddly funny that both the servers had pony tails or long hair in a bun. But they were nice and let us sample couple of flavors without looking too irritated.

I'm glad my boyfriend and I shared because the portions are HUGE! I'm definitely coming back and trying more flavors!!
author: Lia L.

description:
Date & Time:  Monday May 24, 2010 @ 4:30pm
Companion:  Birthday Girl Alice C
Scene:  Hipsters
Vibe:  Fun
Decor:  Charming.  Flavors on ChalkBoards.  Wooden Tables & Benches
Service:  Darling Couple Annabelle & Ian w/ A Special Visit from Their Adorable 15-Month Old Daughter Mia
Devour:  Candied Violet Ice Cream Cone & Coffee Ice Cream
Total:  $6
author: Genevieve Y.

description: This place is great.  Similar to Humphrey's, but has an inside and homed treats besides ice cream.  The inside comes in handy when it's freezing!  All of their delicious homemade treat are convenient when you are visiting with non ice cream fans.  What I love about this place, and Humphrey's, is there creativity when coming up with flavors.
author: Jessica H.

description: This place is cool because it's located in a warehouse like spot.  They got unique flavors. I had the roasted pineapple. It's not that sweet and the ice cream is smooth.
author: Alice T.

description:
DELICIOUS. This place became my new favorite ice cream place in the bay. I went ahead and ordered four flavors because thats what i do being the ice cream lover i am and how i test a ice cream shop out...

First of course: Caramel with Sea Salt  5/5 ...sea salt caramel...caramel with sea salt  doesnt matter as long as these two are together and this place did not disappoint 

vanilla bean: probably one of the best vanilla beans I've ever had that I can remember. enough said.

strawberry short cake: very similar to my favorite ice cream place, carmela.

I had a fourth scoop but to be honest...i cant remember what it was...but im sure it was delicious as well



Definitely my favorite ice cream spot in SF. must place to try.
author: Russell I.

description: Great ice cream! I really liked the citrus crunch.
author: Mark C.

description: Oh man.  They close early but it's worth the stop.  Coconut cream and frozen hot chocolate are my favorites.
author: Stanley W.

description:
BIRTHDAY CAKE ICE CREAM!!

OK, they have other flavors too...   But me, I'm sticking w the BIRTHDAY CAKE.  Better call first to see if they have the flavor you're looking for, they rotate.
author: Kim A.

description:
Best ice cream in San Francisco! Is there a rivalry between Bi-Rite and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous? No one ever talks or recommends this place, and I'm convinced that it's because the Bi-Rite location is just so good, right next to Dolores Park.

If i had to name the 3 most famous ice cream places in SF it would be Humphrey Slocombe, whose claim to fame is weird flavors (not my favorite), Bi-Rite (a little overhyped), and Mr. and Mrs. (my personal favorite).

Miscellaneous is in a great area of Dogpatch right off the 3rd Street T line. Slightly out of the way but their ice cream is just sooooo creamy! I think the texture is just perfect, not terribly sweet but feels so indulgent with its smooth texture. They also have cool, but not weird, flavors like brown butter, which is one of my favorite, funfetti, and other rotating greats. 

Take a chance, ignore Bi-Rite and just try Mr and Mrs. you won't regret it!
author: Kate M.

description:
Delicious ice cream and not your typical Grocery store flavors.

I tried the French Lavender. It tasted like a mix of French vanilla with the fragrant taste of lavender. 

Several tables to sit and enjoy your ice cream.

Also there is parking nearby.
author: Emily C.

description:
I think it is worth updating my review to note that:

1) the fernet branca flavor is in no way overpowering, but still incredibly good, and

2) cookies and cream marshmallows?!  WTF why have I never thought of/seen this anywhere else before?  IT'S SO DAMN GOOD.
author: Jenn C.

description: I love ice cream! This place is sooo awesome! They have really unique flavors which changes frequently. Came here recently and had the Thai ice tea and tangerine. It was super delicious. The only down size is the cost! Two scoops was $7! No lines and easy to find parking.
author: Vivian N.

description: Awesome dessert place in the Dog Patch! I came on a Sunday afternoon and it was not to packed thankfully. They have really unique flavors which I believe sets them apart from other dessert places. I had the strawberry milk flavor which was rich and flavorful. Also their sorbets looked really good. Definitely coming back soon to try out more flavors and their homemade cones.
author: Josue V.

description: Oh what! Had the best ice cream ever here on a nice Saturday afternoon after some fam ran the Spartan race. Not me, ha! Anyway, had the frozen hot chocolate... Not too sweet and had the perfect flavor of chocolate. I wanted to buy some more after I finished my single scoop. I should've took up my sister's offer to buy me a whole pint of it. Now I can only dream of it until the next time I'm in the city. It was pretty busy but the lines moved along pretty quickly. The employees were very nice and gave my Godsons samples of ice cream every time they went up lol. Yup... Ain't no shame. Can't wait to go back!
author: Sheryl D.

description:
After 6 months of trying to find a time when this place would actually be open and I would want ice cream, we finally got: 

1) Cookies and Cream
2) Thai Tea
3) Burnt Sugar

It's good ice cream. It's creamy and rich, the flavors are interesting and spot on. And we've gone to every serious ice cream parlor in SF. 

But the hours make it too tough to make it a regular spot.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Pink Squirrel, bourbon and caramel, and cookies n cream.  They don't mix well together, but on their own they are all quite good.  Like the cocktail, the pink squirrel ice cream is made with almond and chocolate liquer.

Since I ordered two scoops of alcohol-based ice cream I brought a designated driver with me.

Grab a cup of water from their little water station, you'll want it later.  The ice cream here is very creamy and sweet.
author: Erich D.

description:
This place puts BiRite to shame. The flavors change every couple days, everything is made in house and the owners love serving ice cream! My recommendation is a sundae - they are $7.50 but come with massive scoops of ice cream, a cherry, nuts, whipped cream and.. wait for it.. home cooked hot fudge. BOOM.

Avoid on Saturday's after 2pm - way too busy. During the week is the best time to visit.
author: Tom D.

description: MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM PLACE! It's amazing how delicious this place is compared to all the other HOT ice cream shops in SF. The owners are super friendly and very knowledgable on what they are doing. I always get the fresh lavender and jasmine tea.
author: Meredith L.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for quite some time due largely to my brother Anthony N. trying it without me and then telling me it was delicious.  Also, a few years back, Daniel L. took us on a ice cream tour all over the city where we stopped short of trying this place due to a very real possibility of regurgitation.

So after having a very filling brunch over at Nopa, a few girlfriends, the boyfriend, and I head over at my suggestion for dessert even though Bi-Rite and Smitten are both closer.

This place has really unique flavors, the texture is good, cute decor, friendly staff, but the ice cream itself is too sweet for my liking.  I much prefer Tara's Organic Ice Cream of the East Bay, which has all of these positives, but really highlights the natural sweetness and flavor of the ingredients without overdoing it.

3.5/5
author: Linda N.

description:
I pretty much fell in love with this place the first time I heard its name. I mean, how much more adorable can you get? 

They have a solid number of flavors, both traditional and innovative. I got the basil with dark chocolate and the white rabbit and loved both. Smooth but not overly rich.

Lastly, great service. We stopped by with a dozen of us all wanting to try different flavors and get different orders and they handled it perfectly. (Sorry I flung a sample at you by accident!)
author: Rowena L.

description:
Good Lord, Jesus Christ! Heaven on earth comes in the form of ice cream! The ice cream here is phenomenal! Came all the way here from San Jose to try their ice cream after hearing such great things about it, and I'm glad we went for the drive! My favorite was the malted milk! So creamy and rich in flavor. I also had it with their homemade cones and caramel which are to die for! The caramel is perfectly made - not to sweet and just the slightest bit salty to highlight the flavor of the ice cream. The waffle was the perfect accompaniment to both. I'm just sad I didn't try the chocolate fudge! 

They also have cookies, natural licorice, and homemade peanut brittle available for sale. I was too full to try, but I'm sure I will in the future!

The staff is so friendly too! They don't mind letting you sample the flavors, and are great at recommending flavors. I was able to try the French lavender, which was deliciously flowery and fresh tasting. 

My only wish is that the ice creamery stayed open longer and had outdoor seating. There definitely isn't enough room for all the happy customers in the shop. Can't wait to drive all the way out here again!
author: Joelle Kristina G.

description:
The top ice cream contenders fall into two camps: traditional and contemporary. I would say Bi-Rite, Smitten, and Humphrey fall into the contemporary camp because they have more unique and interesting flavors, while Mitchell's and Swenson's is more traditional even though they have some delicious tropical flavors like Mango.

In the contemporary category, Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous wins first place because their flavor combinations are overall most delicious. I don't think I can argue which quality of ice cream is better since most places I've been to churn extremely creamy ice cream (although bi-rite and smitten are on the richer, creamier side... almost TOO creamy). 

I loved the Banana Toffee, tasted sooo delicious with chunks of crunchy toffee bits, and the Salted Mango just tasted like mango but it was delicious nonetheless. I would buy their peanut brittle but I couldn't handle paying $7 for a small jar of peanut brittle!
author: Jess C.

description:
LOVE ME SOME ICECREAM!!!
(3.75 stars)

Love independent ice cream shops that are creative  and infuse different ice creams and make a signature out of it. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

Pink Squirrel - This was so delicious. The color of baby pink with a creamy soft taste. I liked it, it was simple. 

Creamy Catalana - This was also delicious. Very creamy with a richer taste. I think I may need to get this next time. 

Will I be back? Yup.

Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
Excellent salted mango ice cream. Cookies n' cream ordinary.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Danger!  Danger!  Diet-ruiner!  :P

I love the peanut butter malted milk balls even more than the ice cream...because you don't need to rush before they melt.  Some seriously good stuff!
author: Kristen S.

description:
I love taking a picture beside the 30 scoops of ice cream (I didn't count, haha)  on a cone outside of the building and comparing how I looked the last time I came. :)

The homemade ice cream here is great! Plenty of flavors to choose from. I like the more "normal" flavors here. I'm kind of scared to try their more "interesting" flavors hehe, but someday! Every time I come here I try to try something different. I really enjoyed the Cookies & Cream, Vanilla Bean, Pralines & Cream, & the Choco-Malted Crunch. I've also tried the Browned butter, Pear, & Mascarpone. Try the Valhrona Crispy Chocolate Pearls. :) They are a fun type of topping to add to your ice cream.

Scoop Prices are:

1 Scoop - $3.50
2 Scoops - $4.75
3 Scoops - $5.75

& Extra Toppings is $1 each.

I've also tried the cookies from here and I have to say that I was disappointed. It's probably for someone with a different flavor palate. The chocolate chip cookie was too bitter and the peanut brittle and toffee cookie was the saltiest cookie I've ever eaten in my life! :( For that reason only I docked off a star.

But coming here is a nice little treat on a warm sunny day. :)
author: April D.

description:
I definitely feel like Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is a dark horse candidate for best ice cream in SF.

As a lifelong LA Dodgers fan, I don't often venture out into SF Giants territory but this ice cream is so good that I'm willing to put fandom aside to satisfy my belly. 

Some of the highlight flavors available this late December 2013 weekend were: Rosemary Maple, Banana w/ peanut butter malt balls, and grasshopper mint with chocolate pearls. 

I really enjoyed the grasshopper mint w/ chocolate pearls. It has a minty flavor not like mint leaves per se but more like the Andes mint chocolate candy. The chocolate pearls are satisfyingly airy and crunchy like a Nestle crunch bar but in ball form. The texture is very good. 

The Rosemary Maple tastes like you would imagine. Rosemary leafs drizzled in maple syrup is how I would describe it. Flower and plant based flavors aren't my thing but I actually really enjoyed this flavor.

Banana w/ peanut butter malt balls was also fantastic.
