Two things to look out for before you visit. 

One, when a lot of people are there, you'll have to constantly adjust your chair because there are only about five tables total and seemingly less seats. 

Two, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous isn't active at all on their social media which means we never knew what their hours might be for the holidays or what interesting concoctions they were coming up with next.

I am an ice cream snob, not proud of it, but that means I will go anywhere to find great ice cream. This is it, some of the creamiest and intriguing flavors I've had. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous might even be better than SF's acclaimed Bi-Rite Creamery!
author: Matthew T.

description: Great ice cream, HORRIBLE hours. I have gone more times than I can think of and they have not been open. Even when you try to follow their hours, then they have an "owners day off" or some bs. Who closes at 6pm??????
author: David P.

description:
I came back yesterday hoping to grab some ice cream, but left disappointed.
Mr. and. Mrs. Miscellaneous, you guys should really consider signing up for a twitter account.

Second time it's happened to me, and I believe I'm not the only one that this has happened to but sometimes they close for special events/unknown reasons.

First time I came here they were closed, although yelp said they were open. I realized maybe I should call next time.

I went back and they were open, and I called them beforehand to check so I wouldn't have to drive there for nothing, no one picked up.

I came again yesterday, there was also a couple crossing the street trying to get ice cream, they had a sign at the window saying they were closed for a private event. The couple left swearing... apparently really, really upset. Yelp also said they were open.

Just a suggestion to open a twitter account and twitter on the days when you will be closed for those people who make the effort to make the trip all the way out there hoping to leave with some dessert but leaving disappointed.
author: Jenny Y.

description: A wonderful place to stop for ice cream.  It's a very spacious location with lots of equipment and personnel for having so few things on the menu, but what they do have is extremely good.  OMG, this is the best caramel sauce I've ever had.
author: Kevin E.

description:
Bi-rite's line was too long.
There was no parking near Humphry Slocombe.
Yelped an ice cream place with good reviews. 
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous it is.

I'm glad my friend and I ended up trying Mr. and Mrs. Misc. 
The line was short.
Parking was plentiful.
Ice cream flavors + consistency were so good.
WIN WIN WIN.

Try their homemade licorice. Their sour cherry flavor was the best!
author: Caroline S.

description:
Came here on my first venture out to the Dogpatch. Sidenote: the Dogpatch is so WEIRD!!!!! It's nothing like the rest of SF! I felt like I was in a weird industrial playground. So odd.

Anyway...

I can't remember what flavor I tried, but I remember liking it a lot. The thing about this place is it's very different than Bi-Rite & Humphrey Slocombe. Bi-Rite is in your face with its flavors! It's not subtle at at all. Humphrey Slocombe is a little more subtle and it's got interesting flavors. Mr. & Mrs. is not overpowering at all. I think it's for a more refined palette. It's one of those ice creams that I'll eat and appreciate, but I appreciate it more when I just sit around and think about it. Then it makes me go back for more and then I'll appreciate it even more!

I think it's worth a shot. I mean, come on. It's ice cream. What have you got to lose? Answer: NOTHING.
author: Jade R.

description:
Although super far from where I live, this place is hands-down the best ice cream place. 
They have a different selection of ice cream every couple of weeks, and the ones that I've tried have been to die for. Flavors include black tea.. Well I can't even remember the names, they're so crazy and out there! The ice cream is very creamy, so expect to consume a couple of calories.

It'll probably be really hot in there (I don't know why ice cream shops are so hot), but I definitely recommend going. It's always busy for a reason! They're open Wednesdays - Sundays.
author: Jade F.

description: I might've heard of this place before - I must've!  We were at Yield Wine Bar diagonal across the street, and a few of us needed some ice cream.  Ok, let's go!  They have nice artisan flavors, not your typical chocolate chip, strawberry flavors.  Basil chip jumped out at me - ok!  And I wanted their freshly made cone - yum!  Lovely on a warm SF day, mmm mmm good!  Plus, I bought a mason jar container of their peanut brittle.  Yummy, great gift idea, but this one is for us and it's practically gone already - yes, it's that good!
author: Maile N.

description:
It's so ordinary! It's alright ice-cream but just not worth the trip all the way to dog patch to choose from 5 aboslutely basic flavours: vanilla, chocolate, coffee, lemongrass something & strawberry. 

I just have nothing special to say about the place, I think it's a typically over-hyped magazine favourite and nothing more than that! I wish I knew what the hype
Was about.
author: Radhika K.

description:
ADORABLE and packed! I love the ambiance in this small establishment. The ice cream at this place isn't outrageously priced compared to any other competitor, and they have unique flavors. My friend got the chocolate vodka ice cream. I don't remember what I got, but it tasted delicious. The place doesn't have many seats, but there are more seats than I've seen at most ice cream shops. It's also a great place to hang out and talk.

Around the corner is a winery or wine warehouse that was offering wine tastings. Parking was a bit hard to find. One car ran a stop light and almost hit us, be careful!

I would recommend trying this place. :)
author: Christina L.

description:
My favorite ice cream place in SF, hands down! Better than Bi-rite/Humphry's/Smittens, etc. They always have different and unique flavors every time I make a visit. I've tried birthday cake, Earl grey, a lime custard one, black sesame, frosted flakes... So far. It's all so good, I have to make a stop at least once a week :') Also the peanut butter malt balls are to die for. If you love peanut butter, you need to try one! 25 cents a ball or you can buy a whole bag. 

My muffin top hates me.
author: Laura T.

description:
My favorite ice cream in San Francisco, a bunch of really interesting, but also great execution on simple and subtler flavors.

You can only sample 3 flavors, even if you are purchasing more than 3 pints.
author: Matt G.

description: Great ice cream. They use Strauss milk; which I am a big fan of. The have a nice variety of flavors and the prices are reasonable. They employees are always with a smile and are great with suggestions for newcomers. The ice cream cake is a great flavor! They usually have parking in the vicinity.
author: Earnest P.

description:
I think I've been here about four times already! They never disappoint, this has got to be one of my favorite ice-cream places in San Francisco. It also has the most seating out of all the ice-cream shops I have been to.

I typically get the kid's sized which is more then enough. They also have other goodies that are not ice-cream but I have not tried any of those yet. My favorite flavors is probably the tea flavored ice-cream. I had the Earl Gray & Black Tea flavored ice-cream, so good! 

Their flavors change very frequently so you always get to try something new.
author: Dana L.

description:
Good ice cream, unique flavors. Went on a very warm SF day (70+ degrees) on a Saturday...long line, prob 15-20 min wait.

I had the Grasshopper (i.e. mint chocolate chip). Good cream consistency, not overwhelmingly minty and chocolate wafer chips. Perfect for a warm afternoon! Definitely recommend the place if in the area.
author: Alex C.

description:
If there is one thing in the whole entire world I feel very well equipped to rate, that's going to be Ice Cream :D

Mr & Mrs Misc has the best vanilla I have ever tasted. Anytime I go to a new ice cream place I start with the vanilla and that there is a deal maker or a breaker for me. I like their non-chocolate flavors a little more than their chocolate flavors but could just be me. 

Overall pretty great decadent creamy ice cream.
author: Sparkles Y.

description:
My friends and I got here right when they opened. So we were able to just taste pretty much the entire menu (Sorry, staff!). They were incredibly patient and just let us taste everything! A lot of the flavors are unique and creative and delicious as well. They had butter mint, french lavender, salted mango, and wheat honey when I went. All were delicious, but I ended up with french lavender! My absolute favorite ice cream flavor. 

So if you're in the area, stop by here!
author: Bonny C.

description: BEST ICE CREAM PLACE IN THE CITY! Customer service is great!! We always try different flavors and so far we love them all! Vanilla, chocolate,coffee, grasshopper are some of them.
author: Pink J.

description: Yet another business that does not update their hours. Drove here for nothing. Have to drive back now
author: Gail L.

description: Yum Yum Yum! Anytime i'm in the dogpatch I must stop by to get some Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. The menu rotates often (which is a good thing to me) so you likely get something new each visit. The best way I can describe the flavors here are well balanced. Not over the top and yet not too subtle. The candies they have are also pretty good.
author: Mike P.

description:
Stop #2 on ice cream tasting trip. This place is a hipster's heaven for ice cream! The whole vibe is minimalist, but the ice cream is on point. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has homemade flavors that rotate, according to my friend. The day I was there, I tried the honey-roasted peanut, creme fraiche, and cookies and cream.

The tasting policy is limit 3 per customer which I was slightly disappointed in, but with the limited staff on hand it is easy to see why the policy is in place. Luckily I came at a slower time, so the wait wasn't long, but shortly thereafter, the line extended out the door. Whew! Dodged a bullet on that one.

Honey-roasted peanut definitely gave the impression of really eating those peanuts...I think I enjoyed it, but I wouldn't be able to eat an entire cup. Cookies and cream were on par with many cookies and cream ice creams at similar joints (so it was good, yes). 

I ended up getting a small cup of the creme fraiche which was sweet, but not overly so. Being creme fraiche, the flavor was actually kind of...tart? Also buttery. The high fat content was also reflected in the texture of the ice cream, which was very creamy, but with small chunks of fat throughout. The high fat content was off-putting towards the end of the cup, leaving my mouth coated.

If I was in the area, I would definitely come again. I'm curious what other flavors they have in their rotation. Keep in mind that parking can be difficult, and depending on where you park, kind of sketch. There are a lot of warehouses nearby, and I'm not sure I'd want to be walking alone through that area. On the other hand, in the other direction, there's a cute little residential neighborhood, so YMMV.
author: Denise C.

description:
Just chiming in since everyone seems to already know this ice cream shop is awesome. Super creamy product. We had the Coffee & Rum (most excellent) and the Mint Cookie (also superb). Don't forget to top it off with a malted milk ball.

Unlike the Mission and Cole Valley, it's easy in and easy out in Dogpatch for folks coming in from out of neighborhood. Just so you know...
author: Norman G.

description: A decent enough ice creamery. On par with mitchell's ice cream, but with only a few flavors to pick from. I would say the major drawback to this shop is the price. Bi-rite, Tara's, even Ici are cheaper and have arguably better quality ice creams. I will say the guava was a nice surprise for a unique flavor of ice cream.
author: Ruobin W.

description: Three years in SF and by far my favorite ice cream place. I like the more traditional favors chocolate / vanilla but also ask for a taste of the funky flavors and sometimes I get a cup of it. I keep a pint of my usual in the fridge which comes in handy esp when I'm feeling down/sick. However, when friends are visiting from out of town I send them to smitten for cool / east locAtion factor. The two blocks around here has a couple of my fav bakery (Neighbor), butcher (Olivier) and go to bar (Smoke Stack).
author: Dukkyung M.

description:
Came here after having brunch at Sepertine.
Small place, industrial looking.  They have a simple straightforward design.  High ceiling makes the place look bigger.  

I got the Coconut cream, I love coconut and this was yummy!
Brown butter sage was surprisingly good.  Reminds me of chicken?  hahah jk.  It's a good combinaiton.  
My sister ended up buying me their brittle and hubby and I enjoyed it.  

Why was this place not here when I used to work around the area?  I would've came here a lot!  Ok that's probably why.
author: Claire J.

description:
I haven't enjoyed a good scoop of ice cream in while. Finally! This place has satisfied me with their ice cream. I got the White Rabbit, which has condensed milk and white chocolate in it. SO SWEET but SO GOOD and creamy! I bought a whole pint of it!

I definitely NEED to come back to try more flavors!!
author: Lina C.

description:
I wanted to come here since I heard about this place opening in March 2010. Sometimes it takes awhile to get to your ~100 bookmarks...I'm sure most Yelpers can relate!

I came last Sunday and MMM (Mr. and Ms. Miscellaneous, aka mmmmmm :D) had sold out on Saturday. Madness! This is confirmed by the message on MMM's answer machine and the wall on it's Facebook.

I finally came this Saturday to see what it was all about. 

Tried: 
Birthday cake
Maple walnut
Chicory coffee 
Sesame banana brittle

I went for the latter in a cone. It was a premium flavor (extra $0.50) and good, well worth the premium. Consider it a topping, already stirred in. 

Bi-Rite seems a bit more refined, Ice Cream Bar has a good waffle cone, and there are few flavors I like better than Humphry Slocombe's secret breakfast, but those places also have their shortcomings. MMM sits up there with them, and is definitely better than Smitten.
author: Erika C.

description:
Great ice cream. The location was a little out of the way, but it was worth the trek. I got the Butterfinger and Salted Mango which both were great. The shop is very nice as well and very comfortable. 

The person who helped us seemed to rush us a little bit. I was in a group of three and she tried to ring us up after the first person ordered their ice cream and looked annoyed when we were trying to order more, but the ice cream was well worth it.
author: Wayne L.

description:
High Quality ice cream is here! I think the Ice Cream I got was the Birthday Cake. I'm not a cake fan but if it's in ice cream I'll eat it. It had a very creamy and the cake was a nice change of pace to counteract that texture. 

The cookies were really good. Alyssa P. saved a good piece of the cookie in my car and yes it did soak up the bag but when I took it out to eat, it was perfect, had a nice chewiness to it!! I lucked out because she forgot it in my car hahaha.
author: Aryan O.

description: Always a good place to try the latest taste trends in local ice cream. Love their home-made peanut butter malt balls (like whoppers).
author: Mellisa A.

description: Stopped in here to grab a pint of something sweet for my bf...the mint chocolate chip was delicious! They had just made it fresh and we're kind enough to charge me less for my pint since they were not able to pack it completely full. I tried the coffee chicory which was very good as well. Great service, it seems like they experience very high volume and did a great job taking care of everyone politely and quickly.
author: Amber F.

description: I was only allowed three samples max. The rose flavor tasted like soap. The Sicilian flavor was zesty. The passion tea flavor was refreshing. I would be able to comment more if they didn't limit me.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Came here for a mid-run ice cream break (yea, that's a thing!)

Crema Catalina - YUM! Super flavorful, super yummy. 'Nuff said.

Would definitely go again and try out other flavors. (Sorry, I had a bite of the boyfriend's but totally don't remember what his flavors were, so excluding them from this review)
author: Tiffany C.

description: I've ran past this place for ages and always wanted to stop in. I finally had my chance last Saturday and they did not disappoint. I tried the earl grey and the jasmine green tea flavors and both were wonderful. I ended up getting one scoop of the early grey with their house made cone ($4.75). The ice cream is so rich and not too sweet. You can taste the quality of the dairy and the artful use of the tea. Hope to be back to try the other flavors!
author: Alice W.

description:
This stuff is sooooo good.
I googled best ice cream in SF and for some odd reason this one isn't on most lists. It needs to be.

Dogpatch is a random part of town but worth the trip!
author: Ellie M.

description: This place was seriously underwhelming. The service was poor---the woman helping us seemed annoyed when we asked to taste two flavors--probably because they were definitely understaffed on a Saturday. Additionally, because of the way it's set-up it feels really crowded although it's technically a pretty big space. If you want amazing, unforgettable ice cream, just go to Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe---they're both much better, much nicer, and much faster.
author: Dani P.

description:
Wifey and I have been anticipating giving this place a try...we headed over to just for you cafe and made sure that we had room for dessert.  

We walked a block over and entered the establishment...first thing I noticed that the place was super clean.  That's always a plus for me!  

I ordered a scoop of honey graham...the ice cream was ok...a bit on the icy side rather than creamy...but everything was made with Strauss.  They use the good stuff!  My ice cream was super honeyish...and there were many chunks of graham...I just thought it was ok...not enough to have me travel out to the dog patch just for the ice cream.  

Wifey and BFF ordered different flavors...BFF ordered the pink squirrel which was alright also...I can't remember what wifey ordered...something with chocolate.  Haha.  But she said it was pretty good.  

The waffle cone was wonderful...another plus there.  They make them fresh in house...brownie points!  

It's nice to have a go to ice cream place in the dog patch...but I don't think I'd go out of my way just to have it.  3 stars!
author: Jen W.

description:
I love the simplicity of the place. Its reflected in their products. Very high quality, simple flavors and ingredients = very damn good ice cream! I like a bite to my ice cream and it was definitely more dense and frozen but still creamy enough to coat your tongue mmm. I loved the jasmine green tea flavor. It was mild and clean tasting, very well done!

The cookies here are pretty good, but could use more chewiness. I saved a bit for later and grease was all soaked up in the baggie...maybe too much butter.
author: Alyssa O.

description: I was surprised during my first visit that there actually wasn't a long line for this place given the amount of reviews and hype that it gets. This was actually a plus since I dread having to wait a long time for any kind of food I'm in the mood for eating. There were a few flavors of ice cream available, and I think I ended up ordering something called the White Rabbit, which is ice cream made with condensed milk and (I want to say) white chocolate chips. The ice cream was decent, but I personally do prefer Birite. There was indoor seating, which was nice so I could chat and hang out with friends for a while. However, it was quite warm inside (not a lot of air circulation), and they charge for water as they only have bottled and don't hand out any in a cup.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I'm such a boy scout. When I saw that "Pink Squirrel" was chocolate liquer and "almond" liquer. I thought it was Chocolate *liqor* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chocolate_liquor and some kind of almond extract/oil.

Didn't taste any booze and it's delicious. So good is the texture here that when I came across a lone ice crystal towards the bottom of the bowl, I thought it must have been a speck of dirt fallen off of me.
author: Bob R.

description:
Really, as good as it gets.

Their ice cream seems to have less sugar than Bi-Rite, as noticed from their consistency. The texture, flavor, and ingredients are unbeatable.

Cute wooden tables in the interior with other sugary treats for your liking. The area is a hip, up-and-coming area that's cool to browse. Cute boutique stores and interesting art exhibits!
author: Angie K.

description:
UPDATE: After coming back here a few more times, I'm bumping my rating to 4 stars. I've had great luck the last couple of times with no line and flavors that are more suited to my palate. Get thee to MMM right now and order the Sweet Cream. Simple, pure white creaminess that will make you cry and sing praises to Jesus. Also get the Basil Chip--basil ice-cream with tiny crunchy flakes of chocolate. An amazing combination that works brilliantly. Cardamom lovers: The Chai Tea was designed for you.

That is all.

................................................................

"Where can I find adventurous ice-cream flavors?" was one of the first questions I asked when I arrived in SF. I was envisioning bacon, onion and all the "hippie" flavors that had grown to become my favorite like saffron, olive oil and basil. Everyone told me to check out Mr. and Mrs. Misc.

Okaaayyyy, so first time was kind of a bust. Lines out the door and my friends not willing to wait that long. I told them they could go on with their day and I'd wait. I waited 5 more minutes before I decided it just wasn't worth it to bake under the hot sun for what looked like completely unexciting flavors.

Second time, it was decidedly less crowded and I was with a friend who wanted ice-cream too. For some reason, one of the guys at the counter singled me out over all the people in front of me and gestured me over to be served. So yay for not having to wait in line! He let me try the Earl Grey Tea, Bourbon and Peanut Brittle and the Fernet Branca. The latter two were decent, but not something I'd buy an entire scoop of--I'm not fond of anise as a flavoring agent in desserts and I could barely taste the bourbon. So I went with the Earl Grey, another one of those subtly sweet "herb/spice" flavors I love so much. It was creamy and refreshing, if not a little too icy.

Overall, I'd give MMM a try if you happen to be in the area, the flavors appeal to you and there isn't a huge wait. Otherwise, my pick will always be Bi-Rite whose flavors like basil, honey lavender and creme fraiche make me giddy.
author: Josephine L.

description: We got 3 scoops of the English black tea with valrhona pearls and almond flakes(?)! It was delicious and I loved the toppings. They also had some other interesting flavors but in general the offering is on the limited side. I had a taste of the rum raisin and remember the rum to be very strong. The flavors available here are more classic than funky - for funky flavors hit Mitchell's up!
author: Annie Z.

description:
Me: a flower LOVING ice cream girl
BF: a flower HATING ice cream Scrooge 

So when my boyfriend picks candied lavender over pralines and creme that made my mind explode. Damn Mr and Mrs. must have done something right.  When I went there was a line so there really wasn't much time for me to try their awesome flavors. They had cheesecake, pink squirrel, and cookies and creme. All were great flavors. The candied lavender was my favorite since it was really refreshing and I loved every spoonful of it. Will definitely come back for more.
author: Jayne A.

description: We were in the area to go eat at Hard Knox and since this was a cross the street we had to stop in. This place has really good ice cream and they come up with cool flavors every time we come in. We got the Brown butter ice cream on a house made cone and it was delicious. Nice and creamy with good flavor. Also the cone was nice and crispy and you can see them making it right before you order so you know they are fresh. We also picked up a couple of the cookies. The Chocolate chip cookie is really really good. Very moist with lots of chocolate. The peanut butter cookie was also good although a little sticky since I think they add some toffee bits to it. Tasted great but a little sticky in my mouth. The only thing I wish was that this place stayed open at night for after dinner desert. But they make their hours and I guess they get enough business during the day to close. Maybe if they just opened up nights on the weekends that would be good. If you are close by you definitely need to try this place out.
author: Vincent W.

description:
Amazing! Really fresh, yummy ice-cream with tons of variety. Even celebrities go here :)

The seating is unusual, one huge bench-table setting. I liked it, it has a communal feel to it -- yet you can sit a few spaces apart. 

Give it a go :)
author: Matea F.

description:
"THE OLD FASHIONED" FLAVOR
We're not talking how it's made, we're talking about the cocktail!

Get this:
- BOURBON-SOAKED CHERRIES
- orange zest
- vanilla base

Can't even breathe.  I was sitting there with my brother, and his lips were moving but I wasn't hearing any of it.  My eyes were rolling into the back of my head and my eyelids were sinking to half-mast.  Forget $12 Old Fashioneds at the bar; I'm coming to Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous instead!

They are not messing around with those cherries.  You bite, and it just oozes out straight into your blood stream.  That bourbon is not watered down!  The orange zest is delicate and refreshing.  The scoop size is HUGE - like 3 inches in diameter.  Alternate with sips of water, and you're experiencing that first-taste sensation over and over and over again...

Ambiance at 4:30 on a Wednesday was fantastic.  Everyone was silent (even the kids).  I loved the huge bouquet of yellow orchids on the main table; they complimented the dark woods and white walls.  Definitely a classier feel than Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe.  Max occupancy is 33, but I'm not sure if its enforced.

Other flavors today: Bananas Fosters, Thai Basil, Kabocha Squash, Pumpkin Seed Brittle, and Chocolate Malted Crunch.  Cookies and Cream ran out around 4:30 so if you want it, better get there early.  Walked out with three pints - two Old Fashioned and one Bananas Fosters.

Best deal: go with a friend and get a triple for $5.75!
author: Michelle L.

description: It was 85 degrees outside and they were closed during posted business hours. 'Nuff said.
author: Adrian T.

description: I have a hard time giving this more than three stars because this ice cream places more like a cross between a foodie haven and a little hole in the wall ice cream place that prides itself on quality components. That's all good but as far as sustainability, I'm not so sure. Plus, I'm just such an old fart that I appreciate places like Mitchell's ice cream in the mission as well as sentence in the East Bay. Maybe I will get used to this place and come back to appreciate a little bit more
author: Kevin F.

description:
This cute ice cream place is as good as Ici's in Berkeley! 

Well...I still think Ici's beats it by a teeny bit because I love their cones and how it tastes like a dried crepe and how there's chocolate at the tip. But the waffle cone here isn't bad either! And this place is probably better because there is no line, where Ici's is this ridiculous long line that goes out the door. 

I got the orange blossom honey flavor and loved it! :) 

This place was kind of hard to find too. But the guy was super nice and was telling me about how they're getting a new sign getting put up. But FYI it's RIGHT at the intersection of third and 22nd. Don't miss it!!!
author: Jeanette S.

description: This is my go to ice cream place in the city. I can't get enough and their many many random unique flavors. And although it makes me sad that I can't get the previous flavor I tried before unless I come on the right day, I really enjoy the surprise element and discovering a new flavor. Keeps me on my toes. And although I hate their hours, I get it. It works for the owners and their lifestyle. It's also a great concept to build hype and have customers cater to their hours.
author: Charles L.

description:
Mr. & Mrs. was one of 40 vendors with food for sampling. maybe it was the simplicity of their food, nevertheless, their ice cream was one of the better food renditions.

locale: sfoodie dish 2011, galleria
sampling: chocolate malt crunch (ice cream)
-smooth, creamy, fresh,  with some taste.
-not a pumpkin fan so skipped the pumpkin ale rendition..
author: Victor G.

description: Having already tried the many ice cream staples in the city, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was up against some great places on my list. I've been wanting to try the ice cream here for a while and I'm so glad I finally got around to doing it! It's much more low key than places like Birite or Humphrey Slocombe, but I think the ice cream really measures up! First off, the place had a nice near-warehouse design, yet homey feel with plenty of large wooden tables and stools for people to sit. All the flavors were unique and creamy, but I decided to get the Jasmine Green Tea which was very light and was refreshing flavor.
author: Elaine N.

description:
ICE CREAM GOODNESS!
They have different flavors everyday, I came in to try the Guiness ice cream but it was not out that day :( I did however try the Buttermilk Lemon ice cream which was DELICIOUS! So worth the price.

The place is very hip, very clean, i get a very "organic" feeling from the ambience, which i love! Totally coming back and trying the Guiness ice cream.
author: Mya M.

description:
I feel like SF makes a big deal about everything, and Ice Cream is one of those things. I'm sure you've also probably tried Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, and Smitten Ice Cream, etc etc. To be honest, I'm not really a big ice cream critic, but i sure do love me some unique flavored scoops!

I only tried their Bday Cake flavor, and it was supposedly one of the most popular flavors of the day. It was pretty good, despite the fact that the flavor overall was very sweet. I wanted a glass milk at the end of my scoop.

Overall, I'm satisfied with my visit... just like all the other specialty ice cream shops in SF! I'm going to try them all!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Ice cream is mediocre. I would have to say that Mitchell's and Birite are way better in flavors. I would give them more stars but I'm huge on service and they were disappointing. I had asked for samples and my husband and I were sharing a spoon to taste in line. When it came to my third sample, I was declined because it's only two per person. Wait a minute, does my husband not count towards samples? Regardless, stinginess gets to me, especially when we buy over ten bucks of ice cream. No matter how cool you think you are, customers deserve some fairness.
author: Archana N.

description:
Got to love the unique flavors of ice cream and sweet treats to go with 'em.  Whether you try the Pink Squirrel, Brown Sugar and Cake, or even the classic Chocolate Chip ice cream, your day will be sweeter in every way.  I must admit the Brown Butter Sage is a bit strong and Bitter Lemon sounds strange, but I had no problems replacing it with peanut butter brittle and a cone with two scoops in a cup of my favorite flavors.    

Service is friendly and helpful especially for tastings.  Where else do they have a custom sink for scoopers, ready to server?  The ambiance and decor are simple with benches to sit and enjoy the view for watching whatever happens on the street.  Parking is ample on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description:
7x7 100 Best Things to Eat Before You Die 2012

#72 Peanut Brittle Cookie at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous

Pretty expensive for a cookie but the massive portion size is somewhat justifable. We also tried several ice cream flavors.

My favorite of the 4 I tried was the Earl Grey Tea Ice Cream! I also tried the cookies and cream and some lime custard flavor.

The Cookies and Cream was your standard run of the mill with the exception of being a bit thicker and creamier than most store brought brands. As for the lime custard one, it was certainly unique in flavor and texture but I don't think I would go back and get it again. 

As for the cookie, the main reason for our venture there, it was subpar. I found the cookie to be way too salty! I expected a yin yan of sweet and savory but sadly it was just too salty for my liking. However, I did enjoy the chewiness of the cookie and found pockets of sweet perfection

Overall Thoughts

I've had better cookies but I am certainly glad I got to try something new. The portion is quite large so sharing is highly recommended
author: Eddie W.

description:
8/20/13 

I work at UCSF and all the postdocs and PI's were raving about this place. During one lab meeting I had a taste of MMM ice cream and I was sold. On this day I made the special trip to have their ice cream. I had their Chai Ice Cream and it was to die for. Their prices are cheap and their menu changes daily. Their staff is nice and energetic. The place is clean and the water tasted clean (no metallic after taste).  Come early though because they sell out around 3ish.
author: Andrew W.

description:
Flavors change regularly, so on any particular day, what they have available may not be your cup of tea.  Having said that, if they do happen to have something you like, you can count on it being very good indeed.

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous in my favorite ice cream in the city.  But I'd say it's a tie between Mr. and Mrs. and Ici in Berkeley.
author: Wilson Y.

description:
I am a real sucker when it comes to all things ice cream. I really do scream for ice cream. 

On a hot indian summer day in SF, what more can I ask for than a scoop (I had two) of ice cream atop a sugar cone? 

Prepare for the long lines here. Not as long as BiRite but it can be a long wait. The boos and I were so eager to eat some ice cream only to find out that there's no chocolate ice cream anywhere on the menu. And they ran out of mint with choc pearls right when we ordered. Seriously? I believe that regardless of how awesome an ice cream place is, if there's no vanilla or chocolate, then that really cuts the population of ice cream goers in half. Vanilla and chocolate are staples! Yes, I really love the creativity and variety of different flavors that are created here but I really wanted something basic and simple, like a scoop of chocolate ice cream on a sugar cone. Disappointed, I opted for the lemon poppy seed and the earl grey. 

Both were really good with quality flavors and the portions were generous so that's a plus. Reasonably priced and staff were helpful, this place really has good tasty ice creams but due to the crowdedness and poor flow of the interior-there seems to be a lot of space but not really when it gets crowded and people have to maneuver through the line just to exit (think fire escape) that puts it in the 3.5 stars range for me.
author: Laurel P.

description:
I came here after reading reviews and looking at pictures of the yummy ice cream. It sounded like they had so many different choices and flavors and I wanted to try the pink squirrel, the frosted corn flake or the birthday cake.This is the second time this week where the menu fooled me! (the other place was Front Porch check out that review.)  Anyway, they only had 8 flavors, and none of them had any reviews on yelp to try. I can't remember the one I got but it was just ok. It wasn anything special. I did like the texture of it though, it wasn't too creamy and it was a little harder and frozen. 

I guess I need to go back when they have different flavors but this time nothing sounded appealing to me (ginger ice cream, turmeric flavor.) I didn't try those bc I knew it would taste exactly how it sounds. I wanted sweet ice cream. Isn't that what ice cream is supposed to be??
author: Jamie B.

description:
Love Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous! It's a friendly neighborhood ice cream spot located in Dogpatch right across the street from Serpentine and thus, makes for a fabulous post brunch snack on a sunny weekend. 

They have several unique flavors that change on a daily basis but my favorites so far have been the Ovaltine and the Brown Sugar. I'd give the Ovaltine six stars if I could and the brown sugar, it's well deserved 5 stars. 

There are some communal tables if you'd like to sit down and eat your ice cream but I've always gotten mine to-go and eaten it at the sunny park nearby. 

Thus, on your next adventure to the Dogpatch neighborhood, add Mr. & Mrs. onto your to do list. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: I was very excited to try this super highly-rated (4.5 stars, 1000+ reviews) ice cream place, but unfortunately none of the flavors I was looking forward to trying were available.  It's frustrating that they don't have a website that lists the day's flavors.  The only flavors that were at all appealing to me were chocolate and chocolate chip.  I tried both and both were bland and pretty flavorless.  I felt like I had to order something after sampling so I had a kid's scoop of the chocolate with hot fudge. The hot fudge was good, I'll give them that, but it was a fairly stingy portion especially since it was a full $1.  Once the hot fudge was gone, the rest of the ice cream was tasteless and I threw it out.  I also tried a chocolate chip cookie and that was really good (warm, soft, chewy and with lots of high quality chocolate).  I would have given 2 stars if not for the cookie.  It's pricey - $4 for a kid's size, $5 for a regular scoop and $1 for toppings; $3 for cookies that aren't that huge.
author: A M.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has quickly raced to the top of my favorites... I must say Mitchell's & Bi-Rite has some competition! It's creeeamy, fresh and the flavors are creative. Creative but not too over the top where I'm hesitant to try anything... I want to try everything! 

Nougat - Possibly vanilla based? Different variations such as apricots, pistachio and honey. But the best is with poached cranberries, a touch of honey, and sliced almonds. 

Burnt Sugar - If you're a fan of Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel, you'll love this. It has the intensity of the caramel times 10!

Corn & Caramel - The sweetness is very subtle. 

Black & Tan - Full Sail IPA and Porter. I'm not an ale/beer drinker at all, but this was so goood! At one point I thought I was eating some sort of caramel ice cream.

Chicory Coffee -  STRONG! A couple spoonfuls and you'll feel like you've just drank a strong cup of coffee. The coffee flavor is strong and distinct, and very yummy!

Of all these flavors, the creamy texture stayed consistent. They sell out of some flavors by the end of the day, but the baked goodies will be completely cleaned out. So try to get in early!

The Mr. and Mrs. not only make great ice cream, but the ice cream cones, salted caramels, cookies... all made in-house. They make everything! I dunno about you, but if I had to make all of these goodies and stand around while every customer asked for samples, I would not be standing there happy to do so! But just another thing I love about this place and the Mr. and Mrs... Always smiling!
author: S Y.

description:
I had learned about Mr. and Mrs. Misc a while ago when I came to Serpentine for dinner a few months ago.  I was in town for a funeral and my usual tradition is to make a pit stop somewhere before heading back home.  My grandmother has this superstition where it says that you don't take the sadness home with you.  

If there's anything that I prefer to wash away the sadness, then it's ice cream!  And luckily, they were open on a Saturday afternoon.  I went with a root beer float with the malted vanilla for $6.  I got a huge scoop of ice cream mixed with a bottle of Virgil's root beer.  Since I was a bit warm in my formal clothes, I needed some cold relief on a relatively warm SF afternoon.

There were a modest number of flavors to choose from and the pricing was very reasonable.  They also make their own fudge and caramel in house so I was sorely tempted to try everything!  

They are only open for a limited amount of hours per week so make sure to set aside time to visit this gem of an ice cream destination!
author: Ben H L.

description:
Hot diggity, or maybe it's cold diggity.  Whatever temperature of diggity it is, there's definitely nothing doggy or dodgy about this place.  Except that it's in Dogpatch.

Excellent flavors, excellent service, excellent execution.

When Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous needs small bills, you need to open up your wallet, even if you're not paying with cash.  I know I did, even though I wasn't, but not enough people were.

Make sure your kids are enjoying age-appropriate flavors (no White Russians for them), and make sure you haven't had too much before riding your Vespa home.

Conveniently located on the T line.  And you can thank me later.
author: John S.

description: All I can say is WOW. I could have a scoop of their ice cream each day and probably not get sick of it. Hubby and I shared two scoops and they were substantial in size. He got the hazelnut praline and I got earl grey. The richness of the flavors definitely stands out but also the creaminess of the ice cream is amazing. I saw a sign that they use Strauss creamery which probably helps with adding richness to the ice cream. Overall, we were not disappointed and it lived up to its hype.
author: Ellin C.

description:
Hubby and I drove over after dinner at Radio Africa even though we'd already had dessert.  We're not often in this neighborhood so we wanted to take advantage.

Well they were closed!  Closed at 6pm.

Now I've got ice cream on the brain.  So we head back on Sunday afternoon. 6 mile drive. There was a very short line as we entered.

Pink Squirrel had the most mentioned so I chose that after having a taste. Almond and chocolate liqueurs but so subtle I can't taste either but I liked the color and the creamy ice cream.  Small scoop $3.50 each.  Hubby had the Crema Catalina.

Ice cream is worth a repeat visit soon.
author: Shirley N.

description:
So happy I finally got to come here. Came here on a Wednesday afternoon, and yes, there was a line out the door! Wasn't quite expecting a line on a random weekday, but then again, I wasn't surprised. 

Their earl grey ice cream is the best! So darn delicious. My friend also go it, and while walking back to her workplace, she was dancing. Yes, it's that delicious. I also got their pumpkin ice cream which was yummy too. It was like eating a pumpkin pie but in ice cream form. What more could you ask for?! I tried my friend's scoop of chicory coffee which was super good too. It had a nice strong coffee flavor. 

Usually ice cream places let you get two different flavors when buying a single scoop, but they only let you get one flavor. Ended up having to get a double scoop because there were too many choices to choose from. Although it's not cheap, it's worth the splurge. I might not be able to come all the time, but it's definitely a place I'd come to again and again. They are pretty generous with their scoops which helps even out for the price...sorta. 

Can't wait to come back and try more flavors!
author: Chris K.

description:
The owners are SO friendly and great.  Beware: they are on the 2012 7x7 top 100 list and are about to blow up into SF foodie stardom.  AKA long wait times , line out the door...30 minute wait time.

The home made ice cream cones (made almost right on the spot) are delicous and only cost an extra 50 cents.

Always switching out flavors - was bummed 3 were already sold out at 4pm Saturday, 15 minutes later they closed early b/c all flavors were sold out.  Some are really hit or miss, but for the most part they are all fun delicious flavors.

Still need to try the earl grey!!!!!!
author: Melody T.

description: I love this place. I travel far to get this amazingly delish ice cream. Unfortunately they get knocked down a star for their service. I was in last Friday, ordering ice cream for my party of four. I ordered, then paid, and then received my order. Yet, my order was wrong. I informed the lady who gave me my order and she did not apologize, she took the ice cream from me and corrected the order. But not before telling me that is was going to be an extra $3 dollars for the correct order. I was appalled by the lack of manners and how they went about asking for more money. I am still a fan of the ice cream, but there service was all bad.
author: Laila J.

description: I fell in love with crema catalana which was lime with burnt sugar. So delicious. I love the idea of different flavors everyday. Their ice cream was so creamy. So sad that I'm all the way in southern California but I don't mind waiting for another bite of ice cream especially if that crema catalana.
author: Nikki S.

description: It's taken me forever to make it over to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous due to the location. I just never find myself in the Dogpatch. They make very creamy organic ice cream. I was disapointed with the ice cream flavor choices. I came here with expectations of a place competing with Humphrey Slocombe and BiRite, but flavors were more basic: chocolate, coffee, sweet cream, and lemonade. Their basil chip is very unique, but a little to savory for my preference. I opted for the Butterfinger. It was sweet and salty with the perfect amount of candy crunch. My husband got the coffee and chocolate. Ice cream was good, but not quite worth the drive over.
author: Kari G.

description: 'Love love love this place!  I love it so much I came back today after  just visiting last Sunday-that's twice in less than a week!  Well, technically, it was thrice.  I built up my coworkers' excitement during our dept outing last Friday only to find out that we ended up coming on a day that the place was closed!   You can imagine the look on our sad & disappointed faces.  When we were telling our story to the very nice gentleman who helped us named Ian, we didn't realize we were talking to Mr. Miscellaneous himself!  He was so nice, empathetic and accommodating.  We found out that they don't advertise their product & yet their business is thriving !  Wanna know why?!  It's because they insist on using only the freshest ingredients with each flavor of the day &/or week & most importantly, each of them is  consistently made with LOVE.  Well, I certainly agree Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous!  I must say that you never disappoint & today is a testament as you once again made new fans out of my friends I brought in today. They just could not stop raving about how delicious & creamy the Sweet Toffee & Friar Tuck were! I loved my Candied Ginger, Chicory Coffee & Frozen Hot Chocolate!.  Let's not forget my all-time favorite whenever it's available...BIRTHDAY CAKE.  After all, it's what convinced me to start falling in love with ice cream.
author: Ann E.

description:
On a particularly warm day in San Francisco, thoughts tend to wander towards something cold and creamy. They wandered straight to Yelp, and found Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, which by all accounts had some unique and delectable flavors. We hopped on the nearest bus to Dogpatch, and found a line snaking out the door. I guess the rest of the city had the same idea we did. 

Thankfully, the staff was prepared to handle the onslaught of people and the line moved quickly. 

I was dreaming of something in the earl grey or candied violet category, but they didn't have the flavors that got the most online raves. Not one to be discouraged, I had the malted milk and the almond jelly, while my boyfriend had the butter toffee and the chocolate. Then we got a peanut brittle cookie to split. 

The place had high ceilings, and a large communal seating area with wooden chairs and long wooden tables, so the acoustics were very cafeteria/mess hall-ish. We got seats next to the window and while the afternoon sun beat down on our backs, we dug into our scoops. Oh. So. Good. 

Malted milk - yum.
Almond jelly - yum.
Chocolate - yum. 
Butter toffee - yum with crunch!
Peanut brittle cookie - a bit on the too sweet and chewy side, but wait a while and let the sea salt flakes convince you that it's all good.

Okay, so I didn't exactly go for the more unique flavors on the menu that day like the mango chili lime, candied ginger, or cardamom rose, but what can I say, momma wants her malted milk! But based on how amazing that almond jelly was -- a flavor that I couldn't quite imagine as an ice cream -- I'm pretty confident that the rest of their one-of-a-kind offerings will not disappoint. Mr and Mrs M, you have made me one happy Miss.
author: Racquel N.

description:
After walking around the Urban and Air Market,  we popped in here today at 11:30am for a cone with olive oil ice cream and a junior cup of lime Catalana cream with caramel brûlée .  We enjoyed both flavors.  Very rich and creamy.  No lines!

Salted caramel at bi rite creamery is still my all time fav so I had to ding this place a star!
author: Foodlover B.

description:
Creamy flavorful ice cream, yum.  
All the flavors.. Were really good, I'm glad they let me taste almost all of them because deciding was hard enough. 
Earl grey is what I ended up with, perfect sweetness.
author: Annie D.

description:
Really fresh flavors. I always enjoy getting a scoop, but the kid size is plenty for me. Just enough to satisfy without feeling like a fatty. 

Not that I don't want a float or something.

My last visit consisted of the Earl Grey (I love tea, and I loved this flavor), and the Almond Butter. The latter was probably the first ice cream I didn't think was amazing, but more because it had a slightly grainy almond buttery consistency. Thus, it's not their fault, it's mine for not considering this thought about almond butter and instead thinking, "ooh, almonds sound good."

I just wish they had better hours.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
TLDR:
- #1 spot on ice cream destination list.
- Unique and ever-changing flavors that have a start, middle, and finish.
- Highlights: orange liqueur hazelnut crunch, lychee black tea, white rabbit.
- Ideal texture and mouthfeel - indicator of ideal ratio of fat, ice, and air content.
author: Christopher L.

description:
This place is awesome. I work not too far from here, and co-workers go here when they crave ice cream.

Their flavors are very different, but it's very delicious. My favorite is the cookies 'n creme.
author: Kathryn Y.

description:
Suppose to be on a wedding diet. Meh. Worth it.

This place is amazing. The consistency of the ice cream is to die for. It's airy yet creamy and rich. I also love the unique flavors that they offer. Today I had the crema' Catalana (lime custard w/ burnt sugar). You could see the green bits from the lime and they had burnt sugar and squirted it on the ice cream before the scooped it. You can tell there is a ton of tender love and care that goes into making every bite. They also make their own sugar cones which gives it a nice touch. Love it!
author: Grace Y.

description: It's a little spendy here but IMO the sundae is totally worth it. Jasmine green tea is so good although it is tough to select a topping that won't clash with the delicate flavor. Try pineapple if you are feeling adventurous.
author: Fancypants J.

description: OHMYGAHH. How did I JUST hear about this place?! Time to get out of my cave. Of all the ice cream places in the city, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous may be my favorite. The ice cream is rich in flavor, but it doesn't feel heavy and thick like you're eating frozen whole milk (even though that's probably what it is). The flavors are creative and the consistency of the ice cream is perfect.  As of right now,  banana toffee, is my favorite.
author: Cindy A.

description:
pretty good ice cream.

I tried the cake ice cream and the sage/brown butter..
2 thumps up for the sage/butter.
delish! not too savory and not too sweet.

cake ice cream... should not be called ice cream.
ice cream with bits of dry choc cake doesn't really give justice.

service- good.

will have to come back to try other flavors
author: Learnee L.

description:
Having heard so much about Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, I looked forward to trying their ice cream and comparing to the other highly regarded Bay Area ice creameries.

After about a 15 minute wait in line on a warm Saturday afternoon, I got a scoop of the Jasmine Green Tea and Banana Sesame Brittle ice cream. Sadly, the ice cream was noticeably icier compared to Birite's and the flavors forgettable. The sesame totally overwhelmed any banana flavor, and while the jasmine green tea was refreshing, it was comparable to other ice creameries (I actually prefer PollyAnn's version).

Overall, I'm pretty disappointed but would be open to trying other flavors next time I'm in the area. I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Steve L.

description:
One of the best, if not the best ice cream shop.  Up until now Humphry Slocombe and Bi-Rite have been my favorite ice cream shops.  After trying this place, I'd say it's tied with Humphry Slocombe for my number one ice cream spot.

I ended up ordering the Caramel with sea salt and the Malted Chocolate Crunch ice creams with a homemade waffle cone in a cup, while my bf got the Jasmine Green Tea and Honey Graham ice creams.  I loved the malt balls in the malted chocolate crunch.  The jasmine green tea was very strong and flavorful, while the honey graham was the most subtle but yummy of the four flavors.  For a double it costs $4.75 + 0.50 cents for my ice cream cone.  I also got their Peanut Brittle and Toffee Cookie ($2.00 bucks), AND the owner gave it to us for free because there was a large birthday party before us.  Score!! :D

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has plenty of seating compared to the other ice cream shops and it's cleaner, most likely due to newer renovations.  

The double is very big and you can probably share it with someone, but if you're like me and love ice cream, get your significant other his/her own double and you can try out even more flavors! Just be sure to have room in your stomach.

I can't wait to come back and try some more!
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
I love a good ice cream experience. I got it at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.

First, awesome name.
Second, I'm pretty sure it was a Burnt Caramel topping that I had? LOVE it.
Third, real flavorful ice cream. We had Pink squirrel, Banana and brown sugar (!!!! This was my favorite!) and Chicory coffee.

I'll be back next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
I had the maple syrup and pepper ice cream! It was delicious!!

Tried the lemon and ghost and earl grey tea. Both were good but paled in comparison to the maple syrup n pepper.
author: Sagar J.

description:
3 1/2 stars - 

If Humphry Slocombe is the Darren Aronofsky of SF Ice cream shops, highly inconsistent but never dull, then Mr. and Mrs. M is the Steven Soderbergh, largely polished, user friendly, well mannered, never truly bad, but then again, also never truly exciting either.  

Of the flavors, the most interesting was the
- sho-chu (Japanese alcohol) and ghost chili.  It was bright, sharp, and memorable because you could taste the base and the flavor together (though alcohol really isn't a flavor, to be fair)

The good were the 
- Mint Chip - which had good mix-in mint chocolate chips
- Bananas Foster - which almost tasted like that of the famous Brennan's/Commander's Palace

The average were the
- the orange blossom 
- ginger and peach?
Can't remember and they were so lightly flavored that they may as well be interchangeable
author: Jay C.

description:
Finally a place that does a rotating selection right. While Bi-Rite has arguably the best ice cream in the Bay, their selection doesn't vary much. Ici, on the other hand, has new flavors practically every day, but there are often times when none of them interest me: 5 sorbets, but no experimental nutty/creamy flavors? Boring.

Ice cream here is creamy, but probably not as rich as Bi-Rite's. I had the sweet cream and mascarpone flavors and they were strongest I've had: Smooth and creamy, unlike the icy, bland "crème fraîche" fragrances you often find at ice cream parlors.

Cookies and other small treats are also great: Had a peanut brittle cookie that was thing, exceedingly chewy, and not too sweet. Ever so burnt, it had the perfect bite.
author: Pierre B.

description:
Bi-Rite Creamery makes good ice cream.  Humphrey Slocombe makes better ice cream. Mr. & Mrs. Misc. makes incredible ice cream that trumps both of those SF staples.  This husband and wife couple know how to make some delicious ice cream and their both incredible people as well.

I had been waiting forever to try this place and when I finally got the chance I couldn't control myself. I basically had one of everything on the menu.  At the time I had the "BallPark" which was a mixture of Anchor Steam beer, roasted peanuts and chocolate-covered pretzels. AMAZING.  And I hate beer!  This place is truly magical and I hope that the hype continues to grow.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I was so excited to catch them before they closed on a Sunday.  They were actually really gracious and let us sit inside and finish our ice cream as they closed up. 

Flavors we got: 
- Candied orange peel: tasted exactly like it, also with orange peel bits in it
- French lavender: not too floral but not my flavor of choice 
- Earl Grey: good tea flavor, and I like it much more than regular green tea/matcha which can be more bitter (earl grey seems smoother)
- Bourbon caramel: swirls of caramel, rich bourbon flavor, didn't taste like there was actual alcohol in it

Topping are $1 each (go with almonds in your earl grey!)  Definitely sample flavors before you order. It's really pretty reasonably priced as far as SF ice cream places go - even the kids scoop ($3) is pretty generous, and a family could share the triple ($6). The ice cream isn't exactly light, but it's do good, and you can tell they use high quality ingredients. 

$5 minimum for credit card, Visa and MasterCard only. 

Bonuses: parking is pretty easy, and it's much more spacious inside than some other ice cream places in SF!
author: Marilyn H.

description: Ugh.  When are these guys open?  Why is there always a line?   In my opinion, Mr. And Mrs. Miscellaneous make the best ice cream in the city.  No gimmicks.   Just very high quality ingredients, with well thought out and innovative flavors.   Don't neglect trying their chocolate covered malted milk balls.   And u thought they only made good ice cream?
author: earl w.

description:
After all the raving and such, we finally made it here.  

Verdict: meh...its good, but is it 30 mins wait good?.....No

We tried the sundae with White chocolate and a Rice flavor.  Both had great texture and a light but tasty flavor.  The fudge was just drenching and pretty much overpowered it, but the little malt balls were a great addition.  

I probably won't be coming back again.
author: Vincent K.

description:
My boss and I stopped into this cute little place around 3pm yesterday. There was a small line but not too long of a wait. We both ordered the crema catalina (lime custard with burnt sugar) on a homemade sugar cone. Hands down the best ice cream I've had in the City! It was super creamy and the flavors were so complex and unique. We also got two homemade peanut butter malt balls - a delicious steal at 25 cents each.

I highly recommend making the trek to Dogpatch for this experience.
author: Tara M.

description:
I dare you--I double dare you--to ask the hipster register dude if you can sample his Pink Squirrel.

Best ice cream I've had in awhile served by friendly folks who tolerate asinine, sophomoric, juvenile acts like this each  day.  Shame on you, people.
author: Joc V.

description:
Oh Yelp, why must you tease? After reading reviews about the Calamansi ice cream, I was intent on ordering it but alas, I had no idea that MMM offered limited flavors and the Calamansi was no where to be seen on my visit :( Regardless, I totally enjoyed my order of Salted Mango & Buttermilk Lemon!

I love how generous they are with the portions (as compared to Bi-Rite) but as always, I still have a soft spot for Mitchell's as my all time favorite ice cream joint. Although I loved the creativity of the flavors at MMM, I found the flavor to be a bit on the subtle side compared to Mitchell's. 

I adored the presentation of their baked goods and I couldn't help but order a couple of their cookies. The Peanut Brittle & Brown Sugar cookie was amazing! Perfectly chewy & sweet. There should be an ice cream flavor based off that cookie! Do it, MMM! It would be a hit ;)

*Couple of tips:
-Street parking
-Fast service (No line!)
-We observed that as soon as a flavor ran out, they immediately replaced it with an all new one! Maybe call before-hand to see if they're carrying your favorite for the day?
author: Faye G.

description:
Really? Near a Power Block station?
Really at the shoreline section near the base of Potrero Hill?
You made an ice cream parlor? Hipsters really taking it to new heights huh?

Can't complain too much they managed to haul my ass from the East Bay across the bridge, with my car in tow. 

In my SF Ice Cream Ranking of Preference:

1) Humphrey Slaucombe
(2) Mr. Mrs. Miscellaneous **??) They just took Bi-Rite's spot.
3) Bi-Rite Creamery
4) Mitchell's Ice Cream

The only three places I'm itching to try to establish who really reigns supreme on my SF ice cream throne are Smitten's, Joe's Ice Cream and Swensen's.

Anyway, Miscellaneous grabbed at my attention when a few of my SoCal foodie (Yelper, Instagram, whatever you want to call them) kept telling me,'

"Have you ever try them?" 
"It's pretty good." 
"Give them a shot."

Parking is pretty scarce so you're gonna have to find a space or two to park your wheels along the warehouse district within a three-five block radius, so be prepared to walk.

Inside it has that classic ice cream parlor feel. With the exception of their eclectically fashion forward staff. They have other tasty decadent alternatives, cookies and chocolate but I'm here for the ice cream. 

I got to try the following flavors:

Cookies and Cream (no picture just sampled)
White Russian w/ Valrhona Chocolate Crispy Pearls and their Notorious Pink Squirrel: (http://instagram.com/p/Yi3sh0nh4t/)

C and C, was straight forward. Smooth and creamy, not too sweet and the cookie crumble is balanced all in a single spoon serving.

The White Russian is invariably the tasty but inverted perversion of what an interracial love story would be. Burlesque and milky, topped with a chocolate "pearl necklace" and having to discover crispy notes at the very end.

I know, that description is vivid... maybe a bit too vivid for some folks *awkward*.

Overall, for $6.00 I think it was a splendid visit. I'll return for future flavors and maybe... just maybe within the next couple of years you might be my number one pick. Keep up the consistency, 3.5 rounded to 4 for quality product and prompt customer service.
author: Ryan M.

description:
One of the most sterile cafe/shop environments I've ever stepped foot in. Wow...this place has a 100% health safety rating. Noticed the sign outside their window!! The interior looked and felt like a hospital setting to me, haha! The decor is very simple, modern, and clean.

This place offers innovative and creatively tasty ice cream flavors which change fairly frequently. I decided on 1 scoop of the Yorkshire Gold (English Black Tea) and I sampled the Lemon Honey, which was really refreshingly good as well!! I recall it being $3.50 per scoop and $6 for a double scoop! Sample as many flavors as u can; that's the funnest part!!

The ice cream is fresh, organic, creative, dense, and really delicious, but admittedly, I'd still prefer Bi-Rite!! Would love to come back here if I'm in the area, though!
author: Juliet Rachel C.

description:
Delicious fresh ice cream with different flavors every day!

Every time I come to this place I never know what to expect because I've never tried the same flavor twice. The area it's in is nice and quite because it is in a residential area in Dogpatch. I also feel the need to sample everything every time I go because I am scared that I will never get the chance to try that flavor again! The people that work there are extremely nice even after dealing with me and my sampling frenzy. The space is always clean and open making my ice cream experience just that much better. The one complain that I have is that they don't stay open late enough. I am a late night snacker and they close at 5pm making it hard for me to get my sweet tooth on.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I LOVE any tea-flavored ice cream from Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for this reason: you can actually taste the tea flavor, which is no easy feat based on my experience with other ice cream shops.

Definitely try the earl grey and the jasmine tea flavors!

Call or check ahead on Facebook as flavors change daily.
author: Jarlin S.

description:
Hot off the press:
The last two times I've been here my scoops sat atop still warm cones.  It can't get any better.

Top it off, a whole soccer team was piled in here on Sunday (as well as half the neighborhood) and they were all smiles, no stress, despite the fact the place was busting at the seems, line out the door.

And for those curious about "pink squirrel" - it tastes like cherry vanilla despite the creme de cacao and almond liqueur going on. And it's nothing but delicious.

Take note: They'll take plastic if you spend more than $5, otherwise, cash ftw.
author: Alissa A.

description:
My brother and his roommate have become regulars at this place, and highly recommended it my first day in SF.  Well, since it was nearing their closing time I suggested we go on another day.  Thank goodness that day was today! =)

Although a simple looking establishment from the outside, the interior is spacious and welcoming, as well as simple and neat.  The flavors for the day as well as the toppings and extras they offer are handwritten on large boards.  I believe there were about 8-10 flavors listed when we went this afternoon, with 1 flavor (Jasmine Tea) being sold out.  

Being a cheesecake lover, the pistachio cheesecake flavor immediately caught my attention.  The line moved at a decent pace, and by the time it was our turn, "Mr. Miscellaneous" the owner himself greeted my brother with a friendly smile as he recognized his regular customer.  

NOTE:    
1)They do provide sample tastings.  We were able to sample some of the different flavors before we all made a final decision. 

2)  If  you choose a cup versus a cone, they make all their cones in-house.

3)  They do accept credit cards.  Minimum purchase:  $5.

Needless to say I ended choosing the pistachio cheesecake.  It was fantastic!  A definite winner in my opinion!  

Bottom Line:  Great service.  Fantastic ice cream.  I'll be back!
author: Michael C.

description: Just okay.  None of the ice cream flavors caught my eye - I wish they would offer a standard vanilla bean or chocolate or something every day.  I went with a chocolate chip cookie instead.  Which was good, but pretty expensive for a cookie.
author: Kelly M.

description:
EARL GREY! you have my attention now, mr. and mrs. 
hats off to you!
author: M C.

description:
My friend couldn't decide so he was tasting flavors. The girl wouldn't give him a fourth taste because "YOU'RE ONLY ALLOWED TO TRY THREE FLAVORS." We are adults and were in line to buy, not just stand there and taste. It's the owner's fault, not the girl's. You need to let your customers have a taste if they can't decide...it's not that big of a deal!
Spend your money somewhere else!
author: Lynn M.

description:
Welp, the impossible has happened: this place is tied with Bi-Rite for my favorite ice cream in the city. I sometimes go climb at Dogpatch Boulders just so I can have an excuse to have ice cream at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous after.

Pretty much every flavor I've had here was good. Their flavors, while adventurous, are not as out there as some of Humphrey Slocombe's (perhaps in a good way). The texture is consistently smooth and just the right amount of creamy. Oh and their scoops are GENEROUS. I only get the kids size most of the time.

The line could move a little slow sometimes, but rest assured, you are in for a TREAT.
author: jon y.

description:
You wouldn't believe that they would have a place with bomb ass ice cream here! Since this shop is easily missed, may be it is because their sign blends in with the building. 

I love that this shop seem to have a zero waste policy! Their candied violet it is made with actual petals and it is soo yummy. I can not figure out what it taste like since I never had violet before, but it taste like a cross between lavender and lemon!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Sorry for this lame statement but, I honestly feel that this is what ice cream made by angels would taste like

But I gladly accept the welcoming, friendly Mr. and Mrs. in their place.

Ice cream SO pure, so fresh (and made from Straus), sooo velvety smooth, creamy, and rich, soooo cold, slowly melting on your tongue and radiating delicate flavor. 

They have perfected a diverse array of distinctive, creative flavors that are full of depth, flawlessly balanced, and HEAVENLY delicious. From HONEY WINE (so nicely balanced with a non-overpowering hint of wine that highlights the creamy honey flavor), to YOGURT & HONEY, CHEESECAKE (exactly like rich, cold, creamy cheesecake with graham cracker crust pieces), to PEANUT BUTTER MALT, to CARAMEL WITH SEA SALT (a daintier version of salted caramel), to JASMINE GREEN TEA (refreshing jasmine tea with milk, in its purest ice cream form), to SPANISH FLAN, to BUTTERED RUM, to WHITE SESAME, to BURNT SUGAR, to CARAMELIZED HAZELNUTS WITH ORANGE ZEST. And of course there are classics such as VANILLA BEAN, MINT COOKIE, and FUDGE RIPPLE. Check their Facebook page for daily postings of their rotating flavors. 

The owners happily share generous samples from silver spoons. They also make their own cones, and amazing cookies...that are flat, soft, and gooey. 

The roomy high-ceilinged place, with plenty of dark wood tables to sit at, fresh flowers, and sun shining through the floor-to-ceiling windows, completes this opposite-of-miscellaneous ice cream experience.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I heard about Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous when a friend posted a photo of his scoops on Instagram. I was immediately intrigued by the shop's cutesy name, and being a lover of ice cream, I put this place on my food bucket list.

I came here for the first time on a Saturday afternoon after climbing at Dogpatch Boulders all day. It's located on a corner with ice cream cones painted outside so you can't miss it! The space is very open with lots of seating. Seeing all of the customers eating their cones made me excited to get mine.

They have very unique flavors... maybe too unique for my liking because there wasn't anything on the menu that I extremely had to have or had any idea what is in each flavor. Luckily they let you sample to your heart's desire, and after having a few, I decided on a scoop of Buckwheat Honey in a homemade cone (extra for $1 - not shabby!).

I loved my scoop! It was the perfect amount of sweetness and the buckwheat gave it a "natural" taste - great combo with the honey. I enjoyed the ice cream here and I'd definitely come back to try new flavors if I'm in the Dogpatch.
author: Sabrina P.

description:
I've only had the leche flan ice cream so far but it was pretty legit.
To be honest, it didn't have a strong flan taste like I was hoping, only a slight one. HOWEVER I did appreciate the even amount of dulce de leche evenly distributed throughout! SO TASTY!!!
author: Susy C.

description:
I'll drive to Dogpatch for their ice cream.
Unique flavors (I like the Earl Grey) and when it's not crowded it's a nice place to chill on a hot day. Parking is easier than the rest of the city but don't leave anything valuable in the car.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description: The only trendy ice cream place that isn't a total clusterfuck, even on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.
author: Irina Z.

description: Solid spot for ice cream!! Tried the coffee and salted caramel - both had good flavor and were consistent throughout. Could use a better seating arrangement as the communal tables seem to take up more space and impede traffic.
author: Josh L.

description:
Wow.

I never thought this day would come.  I have a new favorite ice cream shop (er, um, second only to Mitchell's).  

The shop is beautiful, the ice cream, cones, and other sweets (malted peanut butter balls) are amazing!  Prices are good (2 huge scoops for $5).  And the owners are suuuuuper nice.  

Will be back for more!!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream spots in the Bay Area.  Birthday Cake is my favorite flavor here, rich creamy ice cream with little chunks of cake.  If you like creamy, heavier ice cream this is the spot for you.  They also have lots of other unusual one-of-a-kind flavors and even some lighter tasting flavors, but whenever they have Birthday Cake that's my go to.

Mr and Mrs ranks at the top of my favorite ice cream spots right next to Tucker's (Park St, Alameda) and Rick's (Palo Alto).  Dollar Scoop (Berkeley) is also one of my favorites.
author: Erick L.

description:
Pink Squirrel - what is it you ask? Creme de Noyaux (liquor derived from apricot pits that tastes like almond) and Creme de Cacao mixed to make a very tasty, mildly almond-flavored ice cream that is nearly Pepto Bismo pink in color. It's very good, don't get me wrong but it needs some texture / other flavor to really be a grand slam flavor....

Mr. and Mrs. has a number of very solid, creative flavors. Also on the must-try list are the chocolate with crunchies (not sure what those crunchies are but they are damned good) and the orange blossom (especially tasty paired with a scoop of the chocolate.)

I was disappointed, however, that some of the flavors I remembered from my first experience weren't there for my second visit. Ack, seasonal rotations!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Having both classic and inventive flavors means everyone will find something the like.  That and warming and welcoming service makes for a great ice cream shop!

One of the flavors they had the day I was there was chocolate malted crunch and I was elated.  I love Rite Aid's version and I rarely see anything similar anywhere else.  I loved the texture of the ice cream and the pleasant flavor.

I spied various (miscellaneous, if you will, haha) candies and baked goods that I would love to sample someday!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
My new favorite ice cream shop in the city! :) I love the chicory coffee and grasshopper (which tastes like mint chocolate chip. but 100x better.). Each spoonful is SUPER flavorful and rich- party with each bite. Although it tastes super rich, it's also kinda light (?) so I don't feel like I'm indulging on ice cream but just a super tasty mid-afternoon snack (since they're never open at night!)

Pros:
delicious ice cream flavors that change frequently 
also home baked dark-chocolate cookies (YUM)
cute/plenty of seating area that allows you to chill out without feeling cramped 
lots of street parking available in the area (major bonus)


Cons:
accepts credit card but only with a minimum purchase of $5- so order plenty. They also sell delicious cookies for $2.50 so that should help you meet the $5 buck minimum
limited hours (unless you're a student who doesn't go to class and have free afternoons to stop by) - I would probably call in advance to check if they're even open since i've tried to stop by multiple times prior to my success (closed for remodeling?, etc, random stuff that made me mad initially but their ice cream made up for it)
author: Patricia K.

description: frozen hot chocolate tastes just like swiss miss. do not be mistaken, that is high praise from ice cream fashioned after hot chocolate that is the opposite temperature!
author: Archana P.

description:
One of the better ice creams I've had in SF, but I don't think it beats humphrey slocombe or bi-rite for me. 

The place is located in the Dogpatch and looks kind of like a warehouse inside. Needless to say, extremely hipster. 

I got the burnt sugar(?) and cookies and cream. The ice cream here is realllly creamy, which I enjoy, and plus points for using Strauss dairy! The only downside to the ice creams for me were that the burnt sugar flavor was extremely overpowering and overwhelming after the 2nd bite, and the cookies and cream got too sweet for me after about the 3rd. 

Not to say that it wasn't good. Again, it was really good, but I probably just chose the wrong flavors for my tastebuds. Will probably come back and next time, I'll try the more subtle flavors next time.
author: Judy B.

description:
This might just be my new ice cream place.

Let me just preface this by saying that on the list of "Eight Great Ice Cream Places in and Around San Francisco*," I've tried six of them. Yes, I love ice cream. Yes, I am a fatty.

The ice cream is so fresh and creamy without it being sickening. It's similar to Ici in Berkeley, but I like this place more because:

1. It's closer to me, because it's in SF

2. There's decent parking around the area

3. I like their flavors WAY more. There are times at Ici when I feel as though I need to get 'lucky' that day, and sometimes that may not work so well. At Mr. and Mrs., there are plenty of flavors that I like enough to keep me (more than) happy.

4. Lots of space to eat/hang out

5. You can ask for as many samples as you want. As bad as I feel about this when I go to any ice cream place, the Mr. and Mrs. are both super friendly and kind that I stopped feeling bad after a while :)

Their tea flavors are to die for. They rotate flavors, so make sure to be adventurous and give some new flavors a try.

The only downside is that I went there on a random Tuesday once and they were "closed for cleaning"... apparently, they closed randomly on other occasions because they don't have many people to run their shop? In any case, my advice is to check their Facebook page to see if there are any daily updates.

*Here's the article I referred to:
http://www.gourmet.com/restaurants/2009/08/ice-cream-parlors-in-san-francisco
author: Angela K.

description:
This is hands down my favorite ice cream shop in SF...and ever.  Even when compared to Birite, my previous SF favorite.  The texture is perfect (I hate when ice cream is anywhere near icy or melts too fast) and the flavors change all the time, so every time is a new experience.  Every flavor I've tried has been so incredibly delicious, so don't be sad if your "favorite" flavor isn't on the menu when you go.
