My only complaint is that I wish this place was open later for my post-dinner dessert cravings!  Moving out of the city for work and wish I could take this place with me.
author: Anne Marie F.

description: Tried the caramel with sea salt super!! Next time I bring my husband to his boxing workout ill be sure to pass by again!!
author: Kai V.

description: I had never tried cookies and cream marshmallows before, but now I never want to eat a plain marshmallow again.  They have a 3-sample limit, which is understandable but also torturous given that all their flavors look amazing.  I'm looking forward to going back for the flavors I missed out the last time.
author: Richie T.

description: I love ice cream and it really don't take much to make me happy when it comes to sweets.  This place doesn't disappoint although they did run out of chocolate chip cookies which I love having with my ice cream.  But yeah, I got my ice cream fix and MMM really hit the spot.  The Dogpatch rules, too!
author: Don A.

description: Meh. Overpriced hipster ice cream.  Do yourself a favor and buy two pints of Ben and Jerry's for the same price as a single scoop cone here the next time you're craving ice cream.  I'd rather go to Bi-Rite for fancy ice cream. Verdict: I wouldn't go back.
author: Melissa C.

description: I love the ice cream here, but I also really love the candies and other non ice cream treats they sell. The salted caramel treats are delicious. I really enjoyed the salted caramel candies mixed with marshmallow. yum.
author: Alice H.

description:
(I never thought I'd eat so much damn ice cream moving to this city...)

Anywho, I currently have in my freezer a pint of: Brandied Pear, Salted Mango, Crema Catalana, and Pink Squirrel.  (ALL from this place)  It's not only because it's an easy Muni ride away, it's because there is always variety and it's damn good ice cream.  On top of that, The Mr. (owner) is a totally cool guy.  We always chat it up about music and exchange general pleasantries.  The Mrs and the rest of the staff are always great too.

The staff is super friendly and it's ANOTHER great ice cream place in the city.  I'm happy to consider myself a regular at this fine establishment.
author: Darius Y.

description: Some of the most creative ice-cream flavor combos ever! And I hear they change up the menu. Pink Guava, Caramel w/ sea salt, Ear Grey Tea, Lotus Cream, Cream O' Wheat, Cinnamon Ginger. They also have backed goods. Cookies, Peanut butter malt balls, Almond Brittle, and Peanut Brittle. It's a perfect sweets spot.
author: Charlene K.

description:
MMMM...Ice Cream!!!  It's hard to give Ice Cream a bad rating...and here it is with 5 stars.  The Ice Cream here  I think has a great Creaminess to Iciness level. This allows for full flavor ice cream without it falling apart on you right away.  

I've had a couple of flavors here.  The Chicory Coffee and Peanutbutter Malt Crunch were amazing.  The Fernet flavor was actually really good and better than I was expecting.  But the Horchata blew me away!  So creamy and delicious!

Best thing about this place is that there is typically not a line out the door, unlike those mission places.  The place is hip and and spacious...and the decor fits in well with the rest of the dogpatch!

I will continue to come here on a regular basis and try as many flavors as I can...
author: Veasna H.

description: My new favorite ice-cream shop in SF! Keep in mind that I had a ginormous meal right before at Hard Knox Cafe and being SF, it was freezing cold, but I STILL enjoyed their ice-cream. Earl grey was really good and Pink Squirrel (almond liquor) was unique and very tasty! $3 for a junior size scoop. WILL BE BACK TO TRY MORE FLAVORS!
author: Christine C.

description:
I told myself I wouldn't come here after 2 failed attempts, but my love for ice cream made it difficult not to, with all of their rave reviews.

Good ice cream. Loved bourbon and caramel. Vanilla bean was okay. Delicious cookies. Chocolate chip was baked perfectly- soft and chewy center, crispy edges. Recommend their sugar cookie with orange peel. My bf had a hard time sharing that one.

Would I go again? Maybe if I was in the area, but Bi-Rite is still my go to spot.
author: Sophia B.

description: Amazing flavors! It's a bit expensive but the flavors are sooooo good!! I came with my friends and it's just so good to be true! It's close to where I live too! The ice cream is smooth and creamy! My favorite would be peanut brittle or burned sugar. Peanut brittle is salty and burned sugar is similar to salted Carmel! Vanilla bean is a classic too!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I found it!

In my last review, I said I liked the place but have yet to find my flavor. I came at the right time today. Croquantino and Chocolate Malted Crunch. 

I'm a sucker for texture but I still care about flavor too. Both of these ice creams had both. The ice cream was creamy but not melt in 5 seconds creamy. 

Croquantino had hazelnut with an orange liqueur with a vanilla base. It was perfect. What really made it a great ice cream was that it was not overly sweet. I thought their maple walnut was similar except way too sweet. This is definitely a go to flavor for me.

Chocolate Malted Crunch - They have great chocolate and the crunch that came with it put it over the top. sweet but not too sweet. 
Chocolate Malted Crunch is better than their chocolate stout

Obviously, these are my opinions and other people may like other flavors but 1) you will find your flavor here for sure and 2) you liking a different flavor is awesome because it means more for me!

This place sets itself apart from other ice cream stores in a few ways too.
1) Family Friendly with seats. Every time I visit, there are a few babies or toddlers around. Lots of seats, welcoming, CLEAN environment. It's just a great place that is more than just we have great ice cream buy it and get out of our space. When the rest of SF is focused on limiting seats and making customers go outside to eat, they offer clean tables, THANK YOU

2) Compared to Secret Breakfast or Salted Caramel, this place doesn't seem to have that Go To flavor that other spots (which I also like) rely on. if you skim these reviews compared to the others, you will notice almost every review likes something different.
author: Glenn M.

description:
Ice cream places seem to be popping up left and right around the city but Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has been around for a little while and helped start the trend. I had never been before this visit.  While the was a bit of a line it moved very quickly. You were able to test various flavors before making your official order and while it was difficult for me to decide between lemon poppy and candied violet, I went with the violet. It was very good and different than any other ice cream I've probably had. We also got the peanut brittle which had been so talked about and it is really good.  It came in an old school glass bottle too which went with the whole decor of the place. 

I look forward to coming back and trying out some new flavors next time.
author: Blake B.

description:
This is no bi-rite or Mitchell's icecream. However I couldn't really enjoy my icecream
After the poor customer service experience! The woman who was helping my husband and I told me I could only have three icecream samples! What exactly does that mean? If I came by myself I would get three samples and if we come as a couple I only get three samples? Regardless, it was a cheap approach. We still got two separate cones as planned. Customer service can make or break my experience and this definitely ruined it!
author: archiee n.

description: Much too good for my own good.
author: Be F.

description: You walk inside Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and immediately smell the wafting, sweet aroma of fresh homemade waffle cones.  How could you not already like this place?  My first time venturing out to the Dog Patch and our friends take us to have artisan desserts.  I was told their baked cookies are addicting like crack.  I dared not try yesterday, but was drawn to the unique selection of ice cream flavors.  I sampled the black lychee tea flavor, which definitely tasted heavy with black tea.  I also sampled the bitter lemon flavor and decided to order a children's size scoop on a cone.  The bitter lemon ice cream had bits of lemon peel which added great texture and taste.  The other half got his usual cookies and cream.  Other friends got scoops of black sesame and peppermint.  I'd say that the children scoop ($3.75) is enough to get your fill.  Friendly service and great local neighborhood find!
author: Liv A.

description: This is easily some of the best ice cream in the city. Its perfectly flavored and I never have trouble finishing my serving. Good luck trying it though because they are never open. 8 out of 10 times I visit this place its closed. If you see them open you should stop in!
author: Not A.

description:
Great menu of rotating flavors.  I had the chicory coffee and banana toffee in a cup topped with a cone.  My friend got the french lavender and another flavor that slipped my mind.  The coffee and banana were on par with the SF's golden boy Bi Rites.  The flavors were probably even a little more restrained and not as sweet as Bi Rites, which is a good thing.  The French Lavender was amazing, power punches of layered flavors!

This ice cream shop is in a cool space, super tall ceilings, lots of natural light, and a few community-styled tables.

My only complaint is that I wish this place sold coffee, I was a little tired, and a cup of joe would have been the perfect pairing to my ice cream!

Overall a great little ice cream shop and alternative to the other ice cream joints in the City.
author: Matt S.

description:
I think I was expecting too much from this place that I wasn't impressed with the flavor selections or the taste of the ice cream. I'm gonna stick to Humphrey Slocombe for my favorite ice cream place in SF.

I got the guava flavored ice cream which didn't have that much flavor of guava and it wasn't the best ice cream I ever had. I generally liked the look of the place. Its cool that they have a lot of seating but the stools are a bit small and the tables are too close. So if it were super busy in there you would have to ask everybody to get up for you to get out or just tumble over people. 

Also this place is kind of in the middle of nowheresville. Though I don't mind just a side note in case you go here and think you're not the right place. Its the right place.
author: Denice D.

description: Went here yesterday when it was raining because who doesn't love ice cream In the rain...! Got the creme de menthe and chocolate chip... it was creamy and delicious! The creme de menthe is the more unique flavor.. think subtle mint taste with a hint of saffron.. the chocolate chip was more generic but still very creamy and soft. Clean place good service and prices are fair... no one wants to pay 15 bucks for ice cream this was decent for 7.50. And u can try the flavors without the awkward "can't believe she's asking me to try something vibe".. that's always good! Would definitely come back! Yum
author: Sandra P.

description: DELICIOUS! I have been working in the Dogpatch for 5 years and never tried this place until today. It did not disappoint! AND it's dangerously close to my work - I will be back again and again :)
author: Claire S.

description:
The best ice cream ever. Period.

I cannot believe ice cream could taste THIS good. They use great ingredients and you definitely know it when you get your first taste of this stuff. I can't remember what I got (I want to say something that is reminiscent of some sort of small animal, like a squirrel or who knows what), but their unique creations leave you biting your nails to figure out which ones you'll try and which ones you'll have to save for another time. Well, at least that was the case for me, as I was only visiting from San Diego and knew I wouldn't have as many chances as I'd like to eat here.

I'm kind of pissed that I had the chance to taste their ice cream, though. Nothing in San Diego compares to the rich and zany concoctions offered here. Ugh! So damn good, though! And definitely worth trekking to some random place in SF just for this. Yup.
author: Jamila M.

description:
I'm not joking when I say that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is one of my favorite things about San Francisco. Their ice cream and sweets are, hands-down, our ultimate favorite. Whenever we have visitors from out of town, we bring them for ice cream!

They also made candies for our wedding favors, and they were amazing! Ian and Annabelle were great, super easy to work with and very accommodating. The candies were definitely a hit!
author: Courtney V.

description:
I totally 100% agree with Jennifer L's review about the place.
She gave 4 star but it means 2 is the highest. I had a similar experience that I didn't get what I really wanted. The place has snobbish attitude that " I'm better than you" like.
Also, the guy who smoking was annoying, really.

So, why don't I repeat Jennifer L's review:

"What the hell?! They had no chocolate ice cream on their menu that day."

I said the same WTF? when I found out they did not have the black tea ice cream when I was there.

"I sampled the other flavors, but a chocophile like me doesn't get real excited by the other non-chocolate flavors they had. Sheesh."

I know he feeling, especially for ice cream.

"So the guy behind the counter suggested the hot fudge, which was an okay idea, but really not what I'd had in mind. it  was too sweet for me. *sigh*"

"The hot fudge was thick and pretty good, but wasn't really doing it for me. 
I think fudge is a pretty subjective thing, and I really was there for the ice cream. The missing chocolate ice cream. *sigh*"

It was not really DOING IT for me too. I wanted to get the black-tea but it was gone so I had to have something else, I think I had that Vanilla+blueberry, shit like that. It  wasn't doing it for me. Like watching bad porn, you know what I mean? Its a premature ejaculation ice cream, indeed.

"The guy spooning out the samples was extremely pleasant, and had just come inside from a cigarette break. Unfortunately the samples were affected by the smoky scent that lingered on him. *sigh*" 

Yeah, he smelled like shit!!!

"He recommended that I call ahead first, if I want to be sure to arrive on a day that they offer chocolate. If I return, I'll be sure to call first. *sigh*"

Call in for Ice cream? Give me a break!

The ice cream was definitely fresh, creamy, and high quality, but without a flavor I truly love, but I can't say it's the place for me. So far, "SUMITEN" is still my favorite. 

I mean Smitten, Smitten Ice Cream.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Move over Fentons - this is hands down the best ice cream in the Bay Area. Creamy and delightful without being overly rich. Complex flavors and creative matchups are the star of the show. The buckwheat honey flavor is both deep and intense without being overly sweet.

Did I mention they have PEANUT BUTTER MALTBALLS? Seriously addictive and the P.B. Maltball ice cream is equally as enjoyable. 

The layout inside leaves something to be desired although the ample street parking alone makes up for it. Lines are kept manageable and the staff definitely seem to take pride in their work. 

4.5 rounded up to 5 stars
author: Zak T.
Christian C.

description: I have had this shop recommended to me by many friends, but parking or lines has always prevented me from trying. Today found parking and limited lines on a Wednesday afternoon. The Butter toffee and limencello ice creams were excellent.  Tasted 3 flavors before choosing these two. I highly recommend this shop.
author: Ruth C.

description:
Very good ice cream here. Lots of imaginative flavors. Not all of them work, unfortunately, but some of them are great.

I had the White Russian and tried the Salted Mango.

Some of the staff tend towards the snooty side, but nothing too bad.
author: Mara S.

description: might be my all time favorite ice cream place.  i tried the almond flavor in honor of chinese new year and it was delicious.  on top of that i added a bag of peanut butter malt balls.  Bought a bag for a gift as well.
author: around town e.

description: homemade sour licorice, sea salt caramels and delicious ice cream flavors like peanut butter brittle. Nice staff and nice ambiance - a good
author: Suzanne V.

description: Really like this place, and don't mind waiting esp when the weather is like today (read unusually balmy, not the typical SF wind chill). Had a double scoop today after a long wait: CHOC chip + grasshopper on a sugar cone is close to pure bliss.
author: Sandy G.

description:
After viewing my friend's pictures on flicker that he sent, I decided long ago to visit this place. Despite the fact that I cannot have diary, I still tried their pralines and cream today. It is so creamy that you can taste it in each bite. I also asked for nondairy option and the counter guy was nice enough to offer me Grapefruit-Pomergrante. 

Their waffle cones are so fresh and crispy... yum! The portion for a junior sized is really decent.

While I have had Lush, Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, and a few others... I love the feel of this place and how friendly they are here. The whole place just smells yummy with their peanut brittle, waffle cones, ice cream, and other goodies. 

This would be such a cute place to bring a date or a group of your friends for sweets.
author: Eva Y.

description:
It's hard to justify a $3.50 scoop of ice cream, but when its good its worth it. Maybe only once in awhile lol. It's really hard to compare Bi-Rite and Mr. and Mrs. because they're both so good, so please don't make me choose. 

I got the pink squirrel and bourbon caramel- both a hit in my book. The flavor is so different and wild. I can't remember anything else since I devoured it so fast. My bf got the peanut brittle and toffee cookie and omg it was to die for.
author: Uyen L.

description:
FERNET!!?? PINK SQUIRREL? CROQUANTINO?? IT'S PEANUT BUTTA JELLY TIME!!! What is this ice cream??

This is easily one of my TOP ice cream shops in SF!! Hands down!! And I love ice cream like Charlie Sheen loves coke with pornstars. Seriously, sweets are my crack. 

It was one of those unusually remarkably warm days.. in February. Straight record breaking weather in SF. Get outta here! .. and take your hot ass to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for some sweet solace.

Located in the outskirts of town in the Dogpatch, its easy to find parking, unlike going to Bi-rite in the mission where you wanna tear your eyes apart looking for parking AND THEN having to wait in line!! And while the Mr. and Mrs. don't seem to be too super-hyped YET, I can see them developing a huge fan base and would not be surprised to see a line WAY down the block. Even on this day, they had a steady stream of customers consistently flowing in. They have lots of seating in a warm and cozy space VS. Bi-rite.

The thing I like about this shop is that while they have a limited number of flavors, their flavors rotate weekly.  You can always try something new and interesting. They have a good mix of your familiar nostalgic go-to flavors with a little twist: vanilla bean, choc choc chip and a lot of tantalizing unexpected yet delicious flavors like Fernet, candied ginger, ballpark, and pannetone to tickle your taste buds all the way down to your toes. 

Put it on one of their homemade crunchy crispity waffle cones!

Also, besides licking yourself silly with ice cream, they have brittles, scrumptious cookies, choc malt balls, and chewy salty caramels.

On a misc note: The Mr. and Mrs. gave birth to their ice cream baby. Lucky babe. I want to eat their ice cream all day everyday for the rest of my life too. That baby's eating GUUUUUUUUUUUUUUD and im  jealous!!

Check their flavors here: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Mr-and-Mrs-Miscellaneous/126193770733086

Credit card: $5 min which is not that hard when you''re doing it right.
author: Angela W.

description:
Really. good. I think it's arguable the best ice cream in SF or at least the best I've ever had.
One time I tried coming here on a tuesday and I got soooooooooooo angry when I saw the chairs up and the door locked. I almost broke the glass to go in and serve myself some dangnabbit ice cream (no not really, please dont put me in jail D:) 
There is honestly nothing to say. This place is great and everyone who isn't deathly lactose intolerant should DEFINITELY come here and try some (I get atrocious amounts of gas when I eat dairy and that doesn't even stop meeeeeeee). 

Yeah. Go. Here. Except on mondays and tuesdays apparently.
*rage*
author: Andrew C.

description:
What can I say? This place, in my opinion hands down is the best ice cream I've had in town and I've never really cared for ice cream much either. I've tried all the other spots like Bi-Rite, Humphreys, Icii's, and so on but this place hands down is my favorite to go to. 

Flavors always change but I always manage to enjoy something they have to offer! Some of the most memorable flavors so far for me are Earl Grey, Lavender, Jasmine Green Tea, Fudge Ripple, English Tea, and ALMOND JELLY(please make it more often :()!! Yes there's a trend in my flavors of choice but still, I like the majority of what they have to offer at any given time. 

I always end up getting a double scoop of two different flavors in a cup with a cone on top :). 

I always find it pretty heart warming too that the owners are a young married couple. Adds charm to the place and the staff is always friendly! I'm there at least once a week. 

On a side note, if you're like my girlfriend who orders and pint and try's to savor the flavor with a bite a day, the flavor fades over time if you keep opening and closing the container and it is encouraged to enjoy it ASAP as it's all organic ice cream with no preservatives. 

I think I'll drop by now :).
author: Hiroki M.

description:
I just got home from a very odd night here.  The food is incredible.  The vibe is perfect.  For a Friday night after work, it's hard to imagine where I would rather have been (ok, maybe Hawaii).  Everything was fine until I ordered a vodka martini. What ensued between myself and the bartender was amazing.  I have never experienced such a hostile server in any situation.  He was not only incredibly rude, but when I went to the manager to complain politely but firmly about his attitude, I came back to discover that he had taken my beer away and 86'd me.  First time in my entire life...and I had only had 3 beers.  Trust me - I can do better than that.

Manager was great but could not resolve the situation.  Very upsetting and slightly amazing.  I'm a 61 year old senior executive in a media company.  I'm a nice and reasonable guy.  But this was unbelievable, which btw others around agreed was the case.

So I will tell you: food and atmosphere is great - manager on the night shift, good, really tried but couldn't make it happen.  Bartender - tall with a beard - not someone who would ever work for me or who I will ever let serve me again.  Has some obvious issue, but not my problem...

Tough decision.  Do I go back - great place - or do I skip it in a city with a ton of choices?
author: Greg B.

description:
Loved this ice cream! The staff was friendly despite the long line, and they were patient with us as we tried a few flavors.

Favorites from today:
Cookies and cream
Horchata 

Good but I probably wouldn't order:
Sesame seed
Cardamom rose
author: K. D.

description: I was lucky to come on a nice sunny afternoon (in April) with no line! Even so, parking around here is pretty hard to find. The employees were nice and friendly as I tried to decide on a flavor. All the flavors tasted wonderful and the texture of the ice cream so nice and creamy. I also love that they rotate the flavors with what's in season. I had ended up with the Honey w/Toasted Almond and Banana. Since the menu is ever-changing, I can't wait to go back and see what they've concocted.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Does it get much better than this? I doubt it.  I've been to many a gourmet ice cream shoppes and this is definitely in the top ranks.

The atypical flavors are fun, delicious, and dead-on target to their description.

Worth making a trip to Dogpatch for ice cream if you haven't been to the neighborhood!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
The flavors: Candied Violet, Brandied Apples, Earl Grey, Yogurt & Honey.

SORRY BI-RITE, BUT YOU JUST GOT OWNED! HAHAHAHAHA!!!






I now pronounce Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, the best ice cream in the city.
author: Jenny K.

description: Finally got to this ice cream purveyor and died and went to heaven when I had a scoop of strawberry balsamic. Killer ice cream :)
author: Trixie S.

description: On par with other ice cream shops around the city like Bi-Rite and Mitchells, but far away from the hustle and bustle of downtown (which means finding parking was a breeze!). I was really hoping to try the brown butter flavor, but sadly they didn't have it that day, so I had a scoop of the sweet cream instead and it was very good! Not too sweet and very rich and creamy. If only it had some berries on top, it would be absolutely perfect. My friend had the anchor porter special, which actually wasn't that bad or overpowering as I thought it would be, and the oatmeal raisin had quite a punch of cinnamon to it. Definitely want to come back to try more!
author: Kim D.

description:
We came here St. Paddy's morning after a disappointing brunch at Serpentine. Ice cream makes everything better, right? Certainly!

The guys at the counter were very patient with me. I usually get sorbet instead of ice cream, but they didn't have one that day. I sampled many ice creams (two which were Paddy's themed: irish coffee and kalua/baileys) and finally settled on the grasshopper, which was mint ice cream with tiny crunch chocolate balls. Boyfriend got the same thing and we got two peanut butter malt balls to share. Very satisfied :)
author: Emily H.

description:
I've been meaning to come forever but it's out of the way for me. It's impeccable, both in design & food. The only things keeping it from being 5 stars for me are 1) fairly short hours - it's a little tough to get to if you're not in the area in the middle of the day and 2) ice cream just isn't my favorite thing, so I'm looking forward to being able to try some other items (which mostly seemed sold out by the time I got there).

I tried salted mango and tres leches. The latter was good but surprisingly too sweet for me, and seemed to have chunks of tres leches cake in it, which was impressive. The salted mango had a nice little kick to it, so I got a cone of that. The cones, while simple & somewhat plain, are outstanding. I'd be interested to try the english black tea and, of course, salted caramel. AND the ballpark one which I didn't see there today.
author: Lisa K.

description:
It still bewilders me that in a place that rarely climbs above the mid-60s, there are so many boutique ice cream places in the city. People in SF must really like their iced cream. When I'm looking for gourmet ice cream, this place is at or near the top of my list. They have interesting flavors, and the best mint chip I've ever had. The mint ice cream actually tasted of fresh mint. That blew my mind. If you like the milk tea that you get with boba, and sometimes think to yourself, 'man, I wish I could get this in ice cream form,' then try the black tea flavor. It's delish. The chicory coffee is intense in its coffee flavoring, but in a good way. 

You can tell that this place is a labor of love to the owners. Everytime we go, you can almost taste their enthusiasm in the ice cream.  Not surprisingly, they use compostable utensils, so eating ice cream is good for the environment too. The space is also really nicely done. Simple and modern, it's the opposite of a Baskin-Robbins. 

I haven't had their baked goods, but they look pretty good. 

Parking is easy by here, so that gives it a big advantage over Bi-Rite, and it's across the street from Serpentine, so makes for a perfect dessert fix.
author: Saunders C.

description:
I have been wanting to check this place out for a while, but there is always a long line.  Tip: Go when everyone else is working!

Love the brown butter and bergamot orange favors.  The housemade cones are the way to go!  While I was there, two flavors were switched out--I like that the menu evolves frequently. 

The seating can get a little cramped with large crowds, but the minimalist decor is inviting and welcoming. 

Also, Ian and Annabel were super nice and helpful. I will definitely go back!
author: Catherine T.

description:
All the sweets and ice cream are quite excellent. In some way, it is better than Bi-rite. 

Perfectly sweeten (not too sweet), just good amount of creaminess. I can eat a whole pint of the Earl Grey without feeling guilty. 

My only complains? Hour is so limited! There is no rescue to late night craving.
author: Alice C.

description:
I can never stop by this spot when they're offering a chocolate based flavored ice cream.  It's a very frustrating situation.

I got the cookies and cream ice cream because that's the closest flavor to chocolate they offered that day.  It's frustrating because their ice cream are one of the smoothest and creamiest in the SF area.  I just wish I can order something not vanilla based all the friggin time.  

Their cookies are fresh and awesomely made.  Kind of pricier and a lot smaller than the lesser charged Specialties Bakery in the Financial District, but it's the freshness that makes you keep coming back.  I paid the extra buck for their in-house made cone.  I'll take it as a one dollar lesson.

Cannot give an ice cream spot a 5 Star if I'm not able to have chocolate ice cream from them.  That's just my personal policy.
author: Terrence P.

description: Don't be deceived by the industrial looking area, this ice cream parlor is tucked away in the corner of the block. We came here after eating lunch and I was looking forward to trying the earl grey ice cream, but unfortunately they did not have it. The scoops range from kid size, single, double and triple. If you're not too hungry..then I suggest you not get the double scoop because the scoops are huge here! I had the chocolate mated crunch which i thought should have been more cholately and the armaretto which was not too overwhelming in flavor. I wasn't even able to finish my two scoops, and i'm the type of person who doesn't like wasting food..but it was just too much.
author: Jemille G.

description: I absolutely love this place.  I've tried many of their flavors, which are all my favorite children/favorite color in the crayon box/special little unicorns.  Earl Grey, Cinnamon Chip, Peanut brittle, Cookies and Cream, Candied Violet, Honey Graham... I don't even know what it is they do to the icecream, but each one is great, never overpowering, just a perfect way to indulge, and they are quite reasonable in price, too.  I always get a junior scoop on a cone, which is plenty, and it's $2.75.  The couple, "mr. and mrs." are very cute and friendly people, lil hipster couple.  They make little confections too, so I'm a huge fan of their peanut brittle and give it as gifts, and their cookies are to die for.  Bravo.
author: Terry K.

description: Haven't tried Humphrey Slocombe yet because the location is inconvenient, but this is the best ice cream I've ever had in San Francisco. Cramped seating though.
author: Oli J.

description: Some unique and truly delicious flavors. The best part is the flavors keep changing, which keeps me coming back so I can try them all!
author: Ryan C.

description:
YUM~!!

The couple that run this place are so cute and so nice!! I basically sampled all the diff flavors they had. Lol. 

Halva- white sesame seed was like Chinese in your mouth. Haha. Seriously! 

7-Spice was so holiday! It was like tasting a super yummy eggnog.

Orange Blossom was orangey floraly- DUH...but yeah.

Maple Walnut- lots of chunks of walnuts! and who doesn't like maple?? I put lots on my pancakes!

Chicory Coffee- strong coffee is my cup of tea! I got a pint of this for Thanksgiving dinner dessert!

Burnt Sugar- it's like eating burnt sugar crisps. YUMMY. And it had a slight bitter aftertaste which is so authentic to the true flavor of burnt sugar. AMAZING! I got a cup of this flavor as my snack :)

Love this place- check it out!!
author: Angela D.

description: I have high expectations for a restaurant with 4.5 stars, especially when there is a swarm of people surrounding the location. Got a rootbeer float, was great. There aren't too many ice cream shops in the area as well. Also this place is like 30 or 40% more expensive than traiditonal ice cream francises.
author: Gilad P.

description:
On my pilgrimage I've been to Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe and (in the East Bay) Tara's and Ici. So in the interest of expanding my spiritual experience I had to come here. 
I had a scoop of candied violet, and a taste of Ballpark (made with Anchor Steam beer with the alcohol cooked out, and peanuts).
The Ballpark was pretty rank, but worth it for the experience. You know, like eating durian. 
The candied violet was basically a super delightful, rich vanilla with tiny nibs of baby-blue crunchy candy in it. I have had violet candies and this stuff didn't really taste like violets.
The space is really nice, with plenty of seating, and friendly, knowledgeable service. The neighborhood is a little wack and so is the parking.
But my heart still belongs to Bi-Rite.xxoo
author: Lisa T.

description:
I didn't wanna like this place. Really, I didn't. It's just so out of the way and getting here is such a hassle, and then there's always a line... whine, whine, whine.

But if you had a taste of that brown butter ice cream, you'd understand why none of my whining matters. IT WAS AMAZING!

Also tasty:
+Chicory coffee (better than Humphry Slocombe's Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. Yeah, I said it!)
+Peanut brittle
+Birthday cake

I didn't get to try their fancy fresh waffles (they were out), but I did get a brown sugar peanut brittle cookie and it was just... meh, a sweet cookie.

Because of that brown butter creamy goodness, I've made it my personal mission to try all their flavors. I'll be back, you better believe it.
author: Adena B.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is still my favorite ice cream place, but this is a close second. They seem to have a lot of flavors involving alcohol which is A-okay by me. Frangelica? Ferent Branca? How clever!

They've got great homemade waffle cones (which, if you're lucky, you can see made right in front of you) as well as some nice baked goods and Peanut Butter Malt Balls. 

I'd tell you which flavors I tried and bought but 1) they change all the time and 2) you're just going to ask for a bunch of samples anyway. So all you need to know is that it's quite delicious and the staff is a bit more smiley than those at HS.
author: Brandon K.

description:
i love this place so much! I currently live on the east coast and HAVE to stop by Mr. and Mrs after I land for the great ice cream and to say hello to the wonderful staff! 

I also love their ice cream cakes. I've gotten my birthday cake from them for the past 3 years and they're always beautifully made.
author: Caroline N.

description:
LOVE this place! Finally got a chance to come into SF to try this little gem in the dogpatch. On a gorgeous day like today - 80 degrees in SF?? - I was surprised that there was only a line of 6-8 people. The atmosphere is nice and summery with the huge windows and the simple white decor. There was also a trio of 2 violinists and a xylophone player to add to the awesomeness of this place.

English black tea - great flavor, much bolder than other tea ice creams that I've tried
Burnt Sugar -VERY strong, so if you are hesitant about this one make sure to try it first! The flavor mellows out though as you go through your scoop, and don't get any wrong ideas because this flavor is downright dirty it's so good.
Espresso Graham - YUM. Nice coffee flavor, could've been stronger, but the ground espresso beans and little crunchy graham pieces are what make this ice cream. 

Definitely coming back when I want some good ice cream without the huge wait of the mainstreamers Humphry Slowcombe and Bi-Rite. I hope the hipsters don't catch on soon...
author: Jackie D.

description:
Well besides the really delicious ice cream, the owners are super nice.  They not only did a random stranger (me) past closing hours a big favor but were also just so goddamn pleasant about it.  

rotating, seasonal flavors keeps their menu fresh and exciting, but that means if you're heading there for a specific flavor you shouldn't hold your breath.  they do creative and new flavor combos as well as more interesting single-flavor scoops (versus plain vanilla, strawberry, or chocolate).

favs:
citrus crisp (lemon, orange and maybe other citrus flavors + chocolate pearls)
jasmine green tea
earl grey tea

their baked goods are tasty as well.
author: Jeffry C.

description: Delicious ice cream! They make new flavors every day (maybe even more often now). Earl grey is my absolute favorite.
author: Charles G.

description: Double scoop BlackBerry and Butterfinger sweetness. Cute little corner ice cream parlor in Dog Patch with a unique variety of flavors. A much needed sweet gem in the this neighborhood for those sweet tooth cravings. Go get your scoop on!
author: Veronica C.

description: My last experience here reminded me of my I love San Francisco. People chatting while waiting in line for what I think is the best ice cream in SF (yes, I said it). Communal tables, small ice cream shop charm with twists of a modern day eatery, and just great service. They pretty much got the ice cream and all the other miscellaneous things down pat! Love this place and I look forward to it each and every time.
author: Ellen A.

description:
It took my friends and I a while to get out here (a bus ride then hopping onto the T), but it was SO WORTH IT.

Man I'm so sad this place isn't closer to where I live. Or maybe that's a good thing cause I'd probably come here every single day.

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is AMAZING! If they were a real couple, they'd be the coolest people EVER. The flavors here are unique and it changes all the time. This day that we decided to go, they had Fireside Chat, which is a dark English-style ale from 21st Amendment!! Wahhhh delicious-ness all around! :)

It's awesome how big and spacious Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is, especially when compared to Humphrey's or Bi-Rite. The workers are all nice and very trendy-looking haha!

LOVES IT.
author: Kei H.

description:
The ice cream here is BOMB-BAY! The flavors are unique, delicious and texturally prefect. The only problem I have with this place is that I haven't had a chance to eat every flavor possible because the awesome owners rotate them out. Speaking of the owners, they are really nice and allow as much time and samples as you want. They don't try to rush you at all. They are also the typical SF hipsters and try to recycle/compost everything, which is cool cause I wanna help the environment!

Brown Butter - Thick and savory. It might sound weird, but on a clear and windy SF day, this really hit the spot for me. The subtlety of the sweetness and brown butter makes it something you can just keep eating and enjoying without even think about it.

Candied Ginger - This one was a bit creamier and sweeter. The ginger flavor is great and comes through at the end. It leaves a slightly tingling aftertaste. My personal favorite of the day and I'm bummed I didn't get a scoop of this for myself.

Brunt Sugar - They aren't joking around when they name their ice creams. This literally taste like you messed up making caramel and then turned your residue into sugar. Pretty unique and spot on representation of the flavor.

I will be making every effort possible to come back to visit this place in the future and try more of their creative ice creams.
author: Billy T.

description:
Why Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is my number 1 ice cream spot. 

1.) Texture: That bite! I prefer the bite their ice cream gives to the softened, smooth textures other places offer (not saying Mr. and Mrs. isn't smooth also)

2.) Flavors: They change everyday! This might just be an indicator of my personality that I can get bored of things quickly, but here me out. I used to love Bi-Rite and their coffee toffee/roasted banana, but now it's just all right. Their menu hardly changes and I guess I just grew tired of it. At Mr. and Mrs. the surprise factor is somewhat exciting. "What's their gonna be today?" 

Hard to have a favorite when I can only get them once, but if I had to pick it'd be the Crema Catalana. I honestly can't remember what was in it besides the lime, which totally makes it for me. I tend to gravitate towards any of their citrusy flavors because the citrus lightens up the ice cream making it all the more addictive and easy to continue eating.
author: Peter M.

description:
Buttermilk lemon - refreshing, good!
Spiced coffee - okay

Went with the English black tea ice cream and loved it! It tasted exactly like black tea. Amazing. It was very light, airy, dense. Just super delicious. My bf got a coconut covered marshmallow and a peanut brittle brown sugar cookie - all freshly baked. The atmosphere is clean, bright and inviting. I loved the long black table, too. Great touch. Staff was super-duper nice, too!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Good news spreads fast. This place has only been open for 2 months (according to the owners) and it's already becoming the new favorite. I'm sure this place hates being compared to the big timers like Bi-rite and Humphrey Slocombe but this place took the best of both and turned it into a winner. 

Tried the Praline and cream, beer & brittle, and Creme Catalana. Three big scoops for $5. All delicious, creamy and unique from each other. 

The best part on top of great ice cream? EASY parking, no long lines, friendly service and GENEROUS portions. A definite win. 

Better visit fast before it becomes too popular and the lines start getting longer
author: Diana Y.

description: I went to Mr and Mrs. for the first time yesterday and I absolutely loved it!!! They we're kind to recommend flavors or give samples. Service was very nice, ice cream was delicious! Cough, cough, GET THE PEANUT BRITTLE! The appearance: very clean, warm and it had the bare minimum. I loved that. They also have a counter of assorted things for sale. Overall, worth every star I gave.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Mm....I love ice cream, and I'm a hardcore bi-rite fan.  My favorite ice cream is bi-rite's earl grey.  When I checked in here, I was super excited that one of the most commented items was the earl grey ice cream.  Sad that they didn't have it that day.  Ended up getting the cookies and cream and the orange blossom.  LOVED the cookies and cream.  Really creamy, no doubt due to the straus creamery milk.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Rotating flavors and generous scoops of delicious, real ice cream. Real ice cream as in, rich and fatty tasting. Nonfat for you, you say? Nonsense, says I!

One of my friends insisted that I try the birthday cake flavor, but unfortunately it wasn't on the board when I visited. Instead, I got tres leches (real cake bits were swirled in), earl grey tea (classic), and chicory coffee. The tres leches was not too sweet, yet undeniably cakey (in a good way). I still preferred the earl grey and the chicory coffee - the earl grey was smooth with a pronounced tea flavor, and the chicory coffee tasted like the essence of Cafe du Monde in solid form. 

The toughest choice for me wasn't which flavor to get. I had a hard time deciding whether to pay $5 for a double, or just another $1 for a triple. Who am I kidding? You can never get too much ice cream!
author: Sherry W.

description:
(See pics)

The couple was making their amazing ice cream. We were going to have some beignets when I spotted a few people coming out with ice cream cones on a hot day!

We immediately decided nothing better to have something cool on a warm day.

Every scoop is made by them with lots of details and creativity. Cute and clean spot, super friendly service. Tried nougat, tres leche and chocolate, and of course, the signature-- ginger which was very delicious!)

At the time I told them they needed a sign as it's hard to tell from outside. They said they would have to make more profit first before being able to afford more decoration! It's quite true with their location in a not very dense residential area. I did think they can put a bit more decoration on their glass walls, which can also use a bit of shade on the warm days (note they have since then painted the pillar with an ice cream that has many scopes! Great change!)

But all these were minor as it's their sweets that attract many.
author: T L.

description:
This place could make me a big ice cream fan. I saved room to try their ice creams, and that was a smart move. I tried samples of cracker jack (really good and good texture), choco chip, torrone, and decided on chocolate malt crunch and banana flavors. Chocolate banana combo - hello?! The best!  Their ice creams are so smooth & creamy and are just the right sweetness. What makes them so amazing is that every flavor is so pronounced, true to label, so fresh, and absolutely delicious!! Every bite was like WOW. Banana was like eating a really good perfectly ripe banana. The choco malt crunch was dotted with valrhona chocolate crunchies (yum)! My next flavor would have been cracker jack, but I just couldn't resist the choco banana combo. The owners were both there, and they allowed us to do 2 flavors in a single serving. That made me so happy cos I always like sampling more than 1 flavor but can't eat too much ice cream.

We were all so happy when we left, and I would definitely return.
author: Catherine N.

description:
This was a fun spot for really good ice cream.

It actually wasn't what I was expecting at all...for some reason the photos made it seem as if it'd be a cramped, small place, but it's actually decently sized (larger than most, if not all, other SF ice cream parlors) and has a good amount of seating within the store.  The flavors are more like Bi-Rite rather than Humphry Slocombe (thankfully) and it works:

Peanut Butter and Jam - Creamy sweet-cream ice cream with swirls of salty/sweet peanut butter and sweet jam...I liked the perfect amount of sweetness and texture of the ice cream - very delicious.

Ballpark Special - A very creative blend of Anchor Steam beer, salty peanuts and chocolate covered pretzels.  The idea didn't sound all that great to me, but it actually works.

They're pretty generous with their portion sizes, so this place can fill you up on ice cream easily!
author: Ken G.

description:
Dare I say.. this place may be better than Bi-Rite. Gasp.

Selection of unique flavors that rotate daily. Space is bright and airy with a good amount of seating available. House-made waffle cones.

(Pink Squirrel)   Chocolate and almond liquor. Delicious, unique blend of flavors. Popular flavor, on the menu often.

(Grasshopper)   Mint with chocolate crunch pearls. Refreshing, subtle mint flavor. The pearls were a nice addition and added great texture.

$5 minimum for credit cards.
author: Ashley K.

description: Quality-wise, this hipster ice cream shop is tops with the rest of them. I think the flavors and textures are better than that of Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe. Of course that quality comes at a premium price. A one-scoop junior size is $2.75 with premium flavors costing an additional 50 cents. I really enjoyed the Croquantinol, which is orange with candied hazelnut bits. Other winners were the chicory coffee and the candied violet. The latter is right up there with Bi-Rite's honey lavender as a fragrant flower flavor, but with the bonus crunch from the candy texture. The sundaes looked massive should you decide to order one.
author: Bailey Z.

description: I have to say that this is officially my favorite ice cream shop in SF. Why are you so far though?!?! In the dogpatch! Really? i am rarely in the dogpatch and my reason to go in the neighborhood now is you! Your ice cream has so many dimensions and notes. Something as simple as a cookies and cream is magical. I want more!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Worth the trip to Dogpatch for this delicious ice cream. I had the salted caramel ripple and chocolate chip. If I wasn't pregnant I might have been more adventurous and tried the Pink Squirrel or Pineapple Rum.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Tried the MILK and COOKIES flavor and the wife got the home made licorice (Sour mango, sour cherry and pomegranate).  

The price is what was the killer for me.  $3.50 for a scoop, single flavor and small.  It just seems crazy to me to pay for the cost of 1/2 a pint for one scoop.  I'm just saying.  But I did enjoy the ice cream.  Not the best I had all week while in San Fran, but still really good.   

At least the neighborhood is cool.
author: Caesar R.

description: One of the best ice cream spots in SF. The flavors are so pure and fresh and the texture is wonderfully creamy. Delicious flavors: mint and choc chip, earl grey tea, black sesame.  If you find yourself standing in line, it is worth the wait.  And the spot is in a bright space where you could enjoy a couple scoops on a nice day.  Make the trip to Dogpatch.
author: Heather R.

description:
Awesome ice cream spot! This is now one of my favorites, and I'm pretty snobby with my ice creams. It's out of the way, but who cares? I'll gladly drive here just for a scoop if ice cream. (Plus, plenty of parking in the neighborhood.) I've tried their Ballpark, nougat, and jasmine green tea so far - all are top-notch!

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Delicious! In enjoyed the Macapuno. The line was quite long and totally worth it, it moves quickly!
author: Elaine D.

description:
Will I actually write this review before Genevieve Y?? I am surprised.  She must be busy checking out another new spot.  I'll dedicate this review to her.  

Date & Time:  Saturday May 22, 2010 @ 2pm
Crowd:  Random neighborhood types
Vibe:  Industrial chic
Decor:  Cake pedestals, gorgeous bouquet, wood tables, wood chairs
Service:  Friendly
Imbibe:  Ice cream floats 
Devour:  Vanilla bean organic ice cream in a crunchy homemade waffle cone, take home homemade caramels
Total:  $2.75 for a single scoop, 50 cents for the cone, 75 cents per caramel

You'll find 10 flavors of ice cream (candied ginger was intense, choco-malted crunch didn't have much malted flavor but I liked the crunchy Valhrona chocolate pearls, vanilla bean was solid but didn't stand out), no fro-yo, homemade toppings, and homemade sweets (cookies, choquettes, caramels).  Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I've actually been meaning to write a review for this place the first time I went but I recently went again to try to again and I must admit this place is very good. 

Their flavors vary every week I believe but they consistently have the one flavor that i enjoy most which is the SALTED MANGO (sorry for the Caps I just really love this flavor hands down my favorite) it's a thicker consistency compared to all their other flavors which indicates the richness of the mango within the ice cream. 

The shop itself if fairly small and a little cramped, but it still has a homey feel to it. The location does seem out of the way because it seems so far from everything else in SF but it's worth the drive to get there (trust me I'm actually coming at least an hours away just to grab some ice cream). I wish I could go more often but like everything you can't have too much of something good or else you'll get tired of it (maybe not in this case).

Parking seems to always be available, the store hours are kinda the only negative part I don't really like about it because they close fairly every, even on the weekends. 

They also sell little baked goods within the shop but I have yet to try them.
author: Geraldine R.

description:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, 

It was a pleasure to have tried your ice cream. I really enjoyed your kindness and warmth through your customer service. It definitely goes a long way. You've now found a special place in my heart. Specifically, the blackberries and nilla wafer ice cream brought a sense of comfort for me, as nostalgic childhood happy thoughts raced through my mind. I don't know what you do to make your ice cream so awesome but please, don't stop. 

That's all for now. I'm looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Sincerely, 

Big fan.
author: Will S.

description:
The decor here is great. Very simple, very white, very plain.

Great ice cream. This was my second visit. I don't remember what I went with last time, but I went with green tea and salted mango this time around. Very subtle but noticeable flavor. It doesn't overpower you (*cough humphrey slocombe*). A touch thicker than I would prefer, but that's a very minor complaint.

Probably #2 on my SF ice cream list behind Mitchell's.
author: David C.

description: Spot on. If you want the best candied ginger ice cream you've ever had in your life, come here. But be warned, you'll find excuses to be in Dogpatch a lot more often...
author: Amanda R.

description:
The only reason I can't say 'As Good As it Gets' is because I have already given my 'Best' to Ici's in Berkeley, however~
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. So delicious!

It was 80 degrees out and I sat in their nice large glass windowed shop having candied violet ice cream. So beautiful. Well the view isn't much, but the bliss in my mouth was enough to create my atmosphere. They also use paper straws, yay for being compostable, BUT of course if you were a real green freak. You wouldn't use a straw at all.

I am going to come back, but when I did, they were closed to make more ice cream.
Such a sad sad day.
author: Winè C.

description:
I must have come on an off-day or something, because unlike hundreds of other Yelpers, I can't offer up more than three-stars.  I tried Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous on a weekend around 12 p.m. and the place was pretty empty, just one other couple was there.  The two workers were pretty casual and kind of just waiting for customers, or something.  

When my boyfriend and I arrived, since it was our first time, we took a second to look at the flavor offerings.  The guys did not offer to help make a recommendation or say a thing.  We asked about one particular flavor, asking for some insight/ recommendations, and the guy just said, "i like it."  We took it as that he didn't want to talk.  Other Yelpers mentioned that they were generous with samples, I guess I came on the wrong day.  Oh well, we ordered a single scoop, and a peanut brittle cookie, to go (total $6).

The ice cream was a bit on the frozen side.  When I told my friend about it, she said that this was very unusual, as she never encountered this before.  In fact, it was so frozen that I broke both of the biodegradeable spoons while trying to eat it.  Now that just seems kind of outrageous.  The flavor and texture of the ice cream, once thawed out a little, was fine.  It's creamy and pretty smooth (but not as smooth as Smitten-that's for sure).

The cookie was chewy and not brittle, but caramel-y.  It has a unique texture that is unlike any other cookie I've had before.  Both my boyfriend and I appreciated trying it, as it was something new.  But we also agreed that it just wasn't really for us.  It was enjoyable, but I probably wouldn't pick it again.

Overall, it was a fine dessert adventure.  Not as outstanding as I hoped it would be, but it was fine.  It's a bit out of the way for me, but if I lived closer, perhaps I'd come again.
author: Samantha L.

description: Being a fan of counterpart Smittens, I refused to accept that there could be better ice cream. Though I still didn't want to admit it, boy is this place good! I had the frozen banana... to die for.  It's banana ice cream with chocolate chips and peanuts ( I believe). If I lived a little closer, I'd be there everyday. Location is a little off-- you kinda have to keep your eye out for it. There's plenty of parking in the back, however. Line can get a bit tiring and long but wait is worth it. Service is mediocre and definitely not their forte.
author: Josselin A.

description:
I live in the East Bay and I will make the drive just to get their ice cream and go back home! Need I say more?

I hate that they close so early and often run out of ice cream :( 

Their just THAT GOOD.
author: Nikki Z.

description:
I was climbing down the block with some friends at Dogpatch Boulders when my friend brings in a cup of the most heavenly scoops from this place. 

Taste: Every spoonful floats you through a journey of divine flavors and taste, leaving you with a soft smile on your face. Nothing too sweet like the kind that makes you feel like you're getting diabetes. Just perfectly light and delicious (the best kind of diabetes). 

Texture: Texture is often forgotten in creameries, but Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous remembers! I haven't had this good of ice cream in such a long while I almost forgot what freshly creamed ice cream tastes like. 

The line out the door is absolutely justified. Thanks for the orgasmic scoops, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous!
author: Lisa N.

description:
Love this place so much!!  The owners are super nice and are always there serving themselves.  It's really clear that the couple cares a lot about the quality of their product, and the happiness of their customers.  They are always so pleasant and let you try as many flavors as you like, which is awesome, especially because they have some unique combinations which I'd want to make sure I liked before buying.  It's always really hard for me to narrow down my choices to 3-4, because I don't want to hold up the line forever trying every single flavor, but they are never impatient and don't seem to mind.

I haven't been as many times as I'd like to because of the hours, but my favorites so far include "Beer n' Brittle" which is beer-flavored ice cream w/ peanut (i think) brittle pieces, "Black Tea," "Jasmine Tea," and "Candied Violet."  They are always coming up with new flavors, so I'm sure I'll have a new favorite next time I go!

My only complaint is that they close really early.  I have been telling my boyfriend about this place for like 3 months but every time we have an ice cream craving, we realize that it's closed already. :(  I know that the owners need to have a life, so I totally understand, but I wish they stayed open til at least 9pm.  I bet they'd do so much business during the 7-9pm (or later) hours!  Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, and Ici in Berkeley are always packed late at night, I would have no doubt that Mr. and Mrs. would be, as well.

Will definitely be returning as soon as I can!
author: Caroline K.

description:
We go to San Francisco and immediately start eating. It's the right thing to do. One of our first stops is Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous because ice cream is always a good thing. The place is high-ceilinged, sparse, and very bright. A very nice, industrial look. 

My young daughter steps up to the counter to order from the very nice, tattooed lady behind the register. My daughter recently got hurt and has a little bandaid right next to her left eye. The nice lady exclaims, "nice face tattoo." And all I can do is giggle (in my mind) and think to myself, "welcome to San Francisco!"

So what about the ice cream, you ask? It is delicious. The cookies 'n cream was loved by the little kids. The chocolate malted crunch took me back to my childhood, with reminders of Rite-aid ice cream. The jasmine green tea ice cream was a definite hit - full of flavor and so refreshing. So thanks Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous for starting off our SF trip so well!
author: Angela T.

description:
This place has the worst hours, which is why it has taken me so long to try this much- talked about ice cream place. 

The peppermint stick ice cream was like a piece of the holidays in my mouth, and coupled with their ultra deep, dark hot fudge, it was holiday perfection. 

The space is cavernous and confusing, considering they serve a handful of ice cream flavors, but whatever they are doing in that space, they're doing it right.
author: Lee H.

description: Friendly staff and fast service. A lil pricey, but good. I tried the créme fraiche with house made pineapple preserve. Oooowweeeee!!
author: Andrew T.

description:
Tried for first time today and was very pleased.  Service was quick and pleasant.  It was mid afternoon, so plenty of seats available to sit for a bit. They were busy, but it seemed like most were taking their treats to go.  

I went w/ a scoop each of the chocolate and the raspberry parfait.  Perfect combo.  Both were very smooth and creamy with real raspberries accordingly.

I did not try any of the 'miscellaneous', but the marshmellows were going fast,  The peanut brittle looked amazing and the peanut butter malt balls were very tempting.

Maybe next time...as I will return.
author: Teri X.

description:
1 * for making some of the best (and organic) ice cream in the city.  I'd say at least equal if not probably better than Birite overall.

1 * for offering an awesome smooth, full flavored coffee icecream selection on the menu!

1 * for offering not just rootbeer floats, but also...yes...can you dig it!... black cherry and orange floats too!

1 * for being locally owned and operated.

1 * for being virtually across the street from my warehouse.  DAYHUM!  

How great is this ice cream joint?   Yep I'm a fan.  :-D  

Ian and Annabel are the BEST and so is their ice cream and everything else they make there.

The availability of quality ice cream is the primary reason I dread the collapse of civilization as we know it....
author: Patrick M.

description: Tasty.  Just had a scoop of their amaranth cherry and a scoop of their coconut cream.  Very good, although the coconut had just a tad bit too much salt to it.  Also tried a taste of their orange lassi (whoa, that was funky).  As someone who doesn't eat much ice cream other than the occasional grocery store tub, this was indeed a real treat.  Prior to stopping in I was asking my friend what all the hype was about. He said that it just tasted fresher, but had difficulty finding the right adjectives to describe it.  Yeah, I can't really describe it either.  It's certainly fluffier, creamier, flakier, smoother and not as dense as regular ice cream.  At the same time it's the exact opposite of all of those adjectives.  Doesn't make sense, but whatever.  If I knew what freshly churned ice cream tastes like, I bet this is pretty close to it.
author: Al C.

description:
My friend decided to take me here after a Giants game. The line wasn't too bad and there were plenty of people behind the counter to accommodate the customers.  We stood in line for only about 2 minutes before being helped. (It took us longer to find parking to be honest.)  I got the pink squirrel and he got the same along with the caramel. 

The seating within the shop is family style, but we were able to score a corner to ourselves. The ice cream was quite velvety and smooth in texture. Also it wasn't too sweet- so perfect in my opinion. I tried a little of the caramel ice cream and it was pretty good. It reminded me of kettlecorn with more of a smokey/bitter after taste. Overall I thought  the ice cream and service was great. Most definitely coming back to try other flavors.
author: Mae D.

description:
On any hot day in San Francisco, people will wait in huge lines that wrap around city blocks for the sole purpose of inhaling gourmet ice cream. I am one of those stupid people. Is it worth waiting for 40 minutes? Pretty much, yeah. Especially with all the fancy-pants ice cream places popping up in the city.

I finally tried Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, a cute little spot in the Dogpatch. I had some sort of awesome lemoncello ice cream with candied flower peddles  that tasted delicious. My partners in crime tried chicory and banana caramel. 

I will be back!
author: Amber K.

description: Yum. All around. The cookies and cream ice cream here was maybe some of the best I've ever had. And the customer service was delightfully friendly: not the annoying pretentious attitude that you can unfortunately get from some eateries in SF. Lots of room to sit inside, too. Really, really great.
author: Mel G.

description:
Came across this place sort of by accident, and I am really glad I did.  

They have very unique flavors of ice cream, all of which they make from scratch.  I had a scoop of Beer & Brittle and a scoop of Orange Chip. They told me that they literally used a 12 pack of beer to make that flavor.

They encourage you to sample as many of the flavors as you want, and are patient to explain what each is made of.  The ice cream is so flavorful that it's hard to make a decision.  The staff could not be more friendly, and the place is very clean.

They have only been around 9 months, but I am predicting this place is going to get a huge following and be a neighborhood staple for many years to come.
author: Don T.

description:
This ice cream is outrageously good but the location is absurd. It makes parking easy so if you own a car take a day trip safari out here and you won't be disappointed.

The establishment is extremely minimalist to the point of requiring sunglasses to keep the glare under control.
author: Justin S.

description: This place is close by my job.  Me And my coworkers love the service and the variety of flavors
author: Serenity A.

description:
Wonderful! I dove into an orange blossom scoop with toasted almonds on top. Usually, I ask for a cup but, I had to try their homemade cone and OMG! Sooooo good!

I'm happy to say that I've found my favorite place--and it's in a very cool neighborhood.
author: Shelley C.

description:
I think I died and went to ICE CREAM HEAVEN!

After visiting my brother's place of business, I asked his girlfriend to come with me to try out Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous since they were close by and since it was a nice sunny day, I knew ice cream would make our day so much better... 

I've had my eye on Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for a few months now and haven't had the chance to try them out until today.  The first time I tried to find them, I had a hard time locating them because I couldn't for the life of me find their storefront.  The 2nd time I tried to visit,  they were closed. So finally today, I was able to try out their ice cream. 

I love the different variety of flavors they had.  I tried 3 flavors:  Jasmine Green, Violet and Blackforest and they were all DELICIOUS and trust me, I know my ice cream.  You can tell they use premium stuff to make their ice cream products...

I am definitely returning.  Especially now, since my pregnancy cravings consist of all things ice cream.  Yum..... Can't wait to return.
author: Christine P.

description:
Our local ice cream shop here in the Dogpatch and it's very chill but with great creative flavors and sustainable business practices (i'm pretty sure).

I've had only two flavors so far - Old Fashioned (which is great and has bourbon you can TASTE!) and Ball Park, which has peanuts, pretzels and beer - three of my primary food groups.

Stop by and check them out but they are closed on Mondays!  And remember it's always sunny here in the Dogpatch!
author: Gene X.

description:
It's pretty much inevitable at this point that whenever I have a sub-par or full-on terrible lunch I become awash in an overwhelming feeling of self-pity.  No one should ever have to have a bad meal, ever. When I do, then, I have a little angel-devil conversation with myself, during which the devil beats the angel with his rock-solid logic.  Let's listen in!

Devil:  That was an awful lunch.  How sad is it to be us, having to spend 10 hard-earned dollars on mushy Thai?  We so deserve a treat.  The city owes us.

Angel:  It's your fault for going out instead of home for lunch.  You are being punished.  To treat yourself to something else would be to reward your bad decisions.

Devil:  There is nothing sadder in the world than a bad lunch.  We're super depressed.  We need, and are entitled to, ice cream!

Angel:  We are going to the beach in 2 weeks!  What about all those crunches you've been doing!  You want to throw it all away??  Your abs!!  Think of your abs!!

Devil:  What about a little sorbet?

Angel:  Ooooh, sorbet!!!  I love sorbet!!!

So with my angel and devil BFFs again, I head down to the Dogpatch to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, where I have the genius idea that I'm sure no one has ever thought of before to combine blood orange sorbet and fat-free vanilla bean.  So healthy!  So delicious!  Seriously, this is some of the best frozen product I've ever had.

The only thing that made me unhappy was that you can't mix flavors in a small-size cup.  Why on earth not?  How hard is it to scoop a smaller amount?  I am thus forced--FORCED--to get a medium size, which is really way more ice cream (ahem, sorbet) than I'd ever want to eat.  I'm not one of those people who sit down and finish an entire pint of Haagen Dasz...I just like a little bit.  That said, I certainly finished my medium...how could I let all that magic go to waste?  My angel would never forgive me.
author: Jeri T.

description:
I think this is a place might be better than my taste buds will allow...

Everyone loves this place.  Stating that it's the best ice-cream they've had in the City!
WOW bold statement!

So we check it out.
Maple and Walnuts - Good flavor, decent texture, but I felt my organs explode from the sugar.  There's a Chinese saying that something is SOOO sweet that it taste bitter.  Well I experienced it.
Caramel with Seasalt - Weird bitter taste and melted really fast.
Vanilla Bean - Decent but not mind-blowing.  Again a bit too sweet.

I will have to go again to really see if i like this place or not.  So far I didn't like the ice-cream (so sweet!) and not really impressed by the texture but really appreciated the great service and overall decor of the place.

Your 'sweet threshold' may be better than mine, go check them out.
author: Anthony L.

description:
People were building this place up and I was worried it would be crappy.  It's almost always closed when I go but the moons and planets aligned and they were actually open!

I had the coffee and mint chip icecream. Grasshopper and coffee.  SO GOOD!! holy crap balls of fire, it was cheap too. 5 bucks for 2 scoops but wow this ice cream is freaking awesome. I will definitely go back. 

It was awesome since it was a hot day as well.  very good!!
author: Toby I.

description:
I really like the flavors that they offer here! A lot of interesting, quirky flavors that are really creamy and delicious and taste exactly what they are. Not an overwhelming number of flavors, but there's usually a decent number that you'd be able to find SOMETHING that you find appetizing on there. 

There seems to be a constant line that comes out the door, but it never got too long and the wait wasn't too bad. My only problem was all the flavors sounded so good, I really wanted to taste test them all before picking a flavor to buy! It also sounds like they have different flavors available, and some of the ones people mentioned in reviews that sounded amazing weren't offered today. Oh well, that just means I'll have to go back multiple times! Not a problem for this ice cream loving machine. 

I also tried the peanut brittle cookie, as it's on the Big Eat 2012 list. I thought it was an okay cookie. It was chewy and soft, and it was good! But not the best cookie I've had .... I thought the ice cream was a better pick over the cookie, and if I go back (I mean to say, when I go back), it will be to gorge myself on ice cream. 

The ambiance is nice - they actually have some tables for people to sit on inside the place, unlike some of the other hip ice cream places in the city. For some reason, the centerpieces to the tables seemed to be squashes of some kind - we were trying to figure out if some day, these would be made into ice cream when they got bored of being centerpieces. 

Good customer service too - I asked for a kiddie size, and the guy accidentally gave me the larger size. He just charged me for the kiddie size anyway.

Location is a little out of the way, but it's right by UCSF Mission Bay so if I ever venture to this side of town, I'll have to stop by for delicious ice cream! Also a plus: it's right across the street from Hard Knox so if you had your fill of heart-stopping yummy greasy soul food - top the meal off with ice cream! You've already screwed over your diet; might as well go all the way!

Minus one star because they have some rather odd hours - there's some days when we come and the place is closed. It's hard to keep track of which days they're open or not - when you crave ice cream, you don't consider whether it's Monday or not and whether they'd be open or not.
author: Lena Y.

description:
It's no secret that the Dogpatch hood is the new love of my life. And it just gets better and better. Move over, Smitten's and Bi-Rite, I have a new favorite ice cream joint!

I can't believe I waited so long to come here. The lines are reasonable, the location is so close to my house, and the flavors are out of control. Ice cream line decision-making is one of the most stressful experiences in my first world life, and needless to say, the shockingly short line here compounded my anxiety. After pretty much trying every single flavor and finding them all ridiculously delicious, I eventually settled on the Jasmine Green Tea and Black Sesame. Asian-inspired flavors done right are so rare and this place does them RIGHT. The green tea especially brought me to my knees. I now dream of nothing else. Creamy, so chock full of jasmine-green-tea flavor, and not too sweet! So often, green tea ice cream just tastes like pale green sugar, but I dare say this was the best I've ever had.  Black sesame was rich and toasty and complimented the green tea very well. Not being overly saccharine, I easily could have devoured so so many more scoops.

Will be back again and again - can't wait to try the lauded Pink Squirrel flavor! This place is hard to catch open, closes early everyday and is closed half the week, but I will camp outside if I have to.
author: Carol C.

description:
Located near the Central Waterfront docks and a T-line station. This corner ice cream shop looks like a random store among the warehouses! I loved the decor inside. Very simple, clean, and loved the flowers on the tables. It's interesting that they use liquid NO2 to make their frozen treats!

Got the Lemon Poppy & Halva! So many great flavors and only one stomach in my body! Maybe I have 2? ice cream anytime any day!
author: Yumi H.

description:
I'd been meaning to check this place out for a while now and Stephen G's review was the tipping point. I made a quick run after work yesterday and Mr and Mrs M. did not disappoint; I loved this place! And I'm going to go back tomorrow too, so that's twice in one weekend. If that's not an endorsement, I don't know what is. 

My intention was to get the Ballbark but I couldn't resist trying another flavor, all of them looked so good. I sampled the Candied Violet and ultimately went with it.  And, in my judgement, it just might be one of the best ice creams I've ever had. (I posted a picture) The combination of the floral (real pieces of bright purple candied violet petals) with the notes of limoncello and lemon zest, made magic. 

Then, there was that cookie. A stack of chocolate chip like you wouldn't believe. I picked mine up, still WARM, and it actually started to bend in my hand. I'm not a crispy cookie kind of guy, I'm THIS KIND of chocolate cookie kind of guy. Nice browning on the outside, with just enough crispiness to contain the melty, buttery and gooey center. Lots of chips. Awesome cookie. Maybe the best.

So, I'm having friends over for dinner tomorrow and what's for dessert? I don't know yet, but I do know I'm going back to Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous to get it!
author: Mark N.

description:
French lavender - 8/10
Coconut (young) - 8/10
Basil - 8/10

Unique ice cream flavors and organic cream used.  Line out the door, but folks working here are nice and they do take credit cards. You can't miss the fact they got a score of 100 on their health report.
author: John H.

description:
$4 for one scoop of ice cream in a cone is pretty steep that's for sure but the ice cream is solid. 
Salted caramel definitely had a more sophisticated and subtle flavoring to it.  

The coffee ice cream was delicious! I will probably get that the next time I go there.

I also liked the interior with the mason jars serving as vases and milk bottles as bottles for water.

P.S. Credit card accepted with $5 minimum =)
author: Betty C.

description:
This really is as good as it gets. They put the cream back in ice cream, using Straus milk to add that sweetness profile not found in other ice creams. But I love that they mix it up with flavors and have some staples. So it doesn't get old coming here even though I live 3 blocks away. And the flavors rotate through different palates, which is great since Asians tend to like their sweetness profile toned down in their desserts. So the lychee mint (making up flavors here) isn't too overpowering and yet the malt chocolate ice cream is strong and sudden. 

Yes, their hours are funky and they could just hire people to take over for Monday & Tuesday but I love that they're killing it even without those 2 days!.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Nothing miscellaneous about their Ice Cream, completely original and delicious.

I love Ice Cream and have sought far and wide for the best my pallate can taste.

I must say that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is the best in San Francisco, a title that was once held by Bi-Rite for the following reasons

FLAVORS: Strong across the board from the common staples to their originals, My favorite are Choclate Chip and Coffee Toffee.
TEXTURE: Their ice cream is thick and milky, but melts with smooth consistency in your mouth.
INGREDIENTS: Their ingredients are organic and natural, completety delcious but also easy on the stomach.

The line can be somewhat of a drag. but if your craving Ice-Cream I say this place is the best.
author: J Y.

description:
I was in SF this past weekend for my friend's graduation... Immediate thought upon arrival: Let our food adventure begin! 

I asked my cousin, "What's one must try place do you recommend, your favorite place!" Her answer: Mr and Mrs Misc. for the best ice cream ever. I couldn't agree more.  

I was thrown off a little by it's location... being a tourist and all, but after arriving at the location, I thought the place looked very inviting (especially with the colorful 14 scoop ice cream cone picture outside on the wall). Looking at their menu, I wanted to try everything... I NEEDED to try everything! In the end, the flavors I got were Mascarpone and Candied ginger. 

The Mascarpone was very different, which is what I liked. Honestly, I personally thought it was a TAD... bit over churned, but it didn't ruin the overall experience.
