Candied ginger: I love ginger. Put ginger in any dessert and I'd love it, enough said. This had a great balance though, as in the ginger wasn't overwhelming as I can usually be. They also folded in actual small pieces of candied ginger in the ice cream, which was a plus!

They had an interesting special ice cream of the day? week? I'm not sure... but it was called Almond Jelly. My friends and I instantly thought of the Almond Jello that you'd get at Asian restaurants... and it was... only in ice cream form! Simply amazing. Nice twist on a popular dessert. 

Out of all the flavors though... my absolute favorite has to be the Earl Grey. I TOTALLY REGRET not getting this for myself! I tried a spoon of it from my friend's cup and literally... once it touched my tongue, I was captivated. The Earl Grey flavor was so pronounce, so perfect, SO GOOD! This ice cream "creams" all other ice creams! It's officially my number 1, my favorite of all time. 

I've read in a couple of other comments of a Jasmine Green Tea flavor... Sadly, they didn't offer it when I was there. I can only imagine how AMAZING that would taste especially since they did such a great job with the earl grey.

I will definitely be back whenever I'm in town, for sure! Without a doubt!
author: Andrew H.

description:
One spot destination in the dogpatch part of town, but well worth it on a lazy sunday afternoon. 

Candied ginger on a freshly made waffle cone was delicious.
author: Johnny C.

description:
When I had myself the Fernet ice cream (which I've failed to find yet again here), I asked myself this simple question:

Is this what ice cream really, truly is?

Here I was, basically leaving ice cream as an afterthought because of all the years of the safeway buckets of vanilla, rocky road, and mint chocolate chip, year after year after year. 

This just goes to show you, alcohol and ice cream go hand in hand. Yum.
author: Ben T.

description:
Jasmine Green Tea Ice Cream...was THE BOMB...I am so going back there!!

Btw - CASH only!!!
author: Ronni K.

description: I've tried them all and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is hands down the best ice cream in San Francisco. There is something special about this ice cream that just gives it a different and better flavor, texture, and creaminess than any other ice cream I've tried in SF. They have different flavors every day so you might find something new every single time you go. Flavors I love are the chocolate malted crunch, ovaltine, Grasshopper (mint with chocolate pearls), but honestly everything is so good. They didn't have their housemade waffle cones for a while earlier this year because their waffle maker broke, but they're back now and you HAVE to try them! My favorite waffle cone in SF. It's thick and sturdy enough that you won't have melted ice cream pouring out of your cone making your hands sticky and it's also not super salty or sugary like many other waffle cones I've tried. This is simply the best ice cream in San Francisco and if you haven't tried it, what are you waiting for?
author: Aldrin F.

description:
Clean, spacious ice cream shop in the Dogpatch with plenty of parking nearby. Blame it on this unexpected record breaking temperature this past weekend but I had a huge hankering for ice cream. (Story of my life) We were having brunch in that area when the cravings got strong. Mind you, we skipped the yummy chocolate pudding dessert from our brunch spot but a cold treat was calling my name.

Fun flavored, quality ice cream in a warm, fresh cone made in-house. What more can you ask for? However, I was extremely disheartened when I drove out this way the following day to discover they are closed Mondays. I guess my fault for not checking beforehand.
author: Esther A.

description:
Okay, we all know that hot soup on a cold day is like having a glass of milk with a chocolate chip cookie...they just go together.  Like a match made in heaven.  But I'm here to tell you.....hot soup doesn't have to be the only perfect match for a cold, winter's afternoon.  IMO, a cup of ice cream from Mr. and Mrs. hits the spot just as good as a bowl of ramen would.  And if that ice cream is alcohol-flavored, well then the tummy party just got kicked up a notch!

I've only been here a couple of times, but each time I went I've been really impressed with the quality and unique flavoring of their ice cream.  Plus, the staff has been very friendly every time.  I think they make their goodies onsite, including their ice cream, baked goods, and even their hot fudge sauce.  From what I understand, the menu changes.  Last time I went, the menu included Fernet, Pink Squirrel, Beer & Brittle, Buttered Rum...all alcohol-inspired flavors and all extremely delicious.  I ended up with a scoop of the Buttered Rum and a scoop of Peppermint.  Both were very good and the peppermint was one of, if not the best peppermint flavored ice cream I've ever had.

So yeah, ice cream on a cold day is pretty damn awesome.  And I can't wait for the hot days to come back to make me go even more.  I think that's when I'll kick it up a notch and get some chocolate sauce poured on.  Oh, who am I kidding?  I'm getting a sundae all the way!
author: Joe M.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is located in the Dog Patch district. Supposedly an up and coming neighborhood. There's nothing really around this place except for more restaurants and lots of warehouses. It's an interesting place to open up an ice cream shop.

== Food ==

Ordered a peppermint ice cream and a root beer soda.

The peppermint ice cream was really good. There's a good mixture of peppermint inside the ice cream. It wasn't so strong that it was overwhelming. The ice cream texture was really creamy. 

The root beer was quite good. There isn't a drink menu so it was pretty secretive item to order. 

== Service ==

Counter people worked pretty quickly and they were friendly. 

== Overall ==

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous lives up to their hype. The ice cream is pretty good and you can't stop after one bite. Just keep nom-ing until you finish it off.
author: Steven B.

description: We LOVE this place. Having gone to many other artisanal ice creameries in the City, this is BY FAR our #1 choice. Yes, the place is always packed, so it feels small, yes, the price is a bit on the high side for ice cream, and yes, many times it's warm in there. But the quality is off the charts, the flavors: spot on, and the service, always with cheer and a smile. I do have a couple of suggestions: perhaps make one of the long tables a little thinner, by one plank worth. This would allow more room for people to walk by people sitting on both sides. The other is maybe add a fan to stir the air and a door stop since the line is consistently out the door. Other than that, don't change a blessed thing.
author: cg w.

description: One of the best ice cream that I've had so far this year. The ice cream was light so you won't feel so bad after eating a few scoops. I love the different flavors that they come up with. There was a line when we got there but it went fast. It's a little on the pricey side but not so bad if you have it once in a while. I tried their peanut butter maltball and thank goodness I didn't buy a bag (it wasn't that great). You have to try their flavored licorice, it wasn't so bad for 50 cents a piece.
author: j m.

description: Bourbon & Caramel was pretty good -- a variation on Sea Salt Caramel.
author: Thomas C.

description:
I noticed this place because of the big ice cream cone sign outside and wanted to really like it. 

Unfortunately, the day I went they didn't have the special flavors people rave about on yelp. Ended up ordering a scoop of torrone (almond, hazelnut, and honey). The quality was good, but the flavor was nothing too special. The weak little compostable baby spoon snapped, so I had to ask the grumpy looking a cashier for a bigger spoon. 

Parking was surprisingly difficult, considering it was a weekday. 

I would come back again someday if I decide to go to Hard Knox, and hopefully parking will be easier and I'll remember to get my scoop in a cone instead of in a cup like a lame kid with a broken spoon.
author: C. Z.

description: A delicious ice-cream place tucked away in a very interesting part of SF.  Parking in the area was very easy which is a huge plus being that it is San Francisco.  I ordered the chocolate chip ice-cream, which was really rich and creamy.  Definitely one of the better ones I've had.  Their other flavors are great as well.  The shop smells like homemade cones and fudge.  Unfortunately they were out of their homemade cones, but I would definitely try to go back and have one because it smells amazing.
author: Teresa N.

description:
I think I might need to give this place an extra star than last time based on their strawberry nesquick! It tasted exactly like your favorite strawberry milk from your childhood. I think this place deserves extra props for their creativity.

Another few flavors that were on the menu that I had seen before: 
sweet cream with rainbow sprinkles - the sweet cream was great, but I think the sprinkles made it too much
-Lemongrass - delicious - flowery, aromatic and not too sweet

some other flavors exotic flavors they had today but did not try: funnel and orange blossom
author: Christine B.

description:
the ice cream here is good...like REALLY good. 
We have been wanting to try this place for quite a while and finally had a chance to do so. It was SO worth the drive allllll the way out to dog patch. I love LOVE ice cream and this place sure lived up to its reputation. They don't have a ton of flavors, but what they do have is made beautifully. 

I would love it if they would mark on their menu what is GF since the line gets really long and you don't want to waste people's time with questions.
author: Min M.

description:
One of the best new Ice Cream joints in the city. They always have lots of interesting and tasty flavours from which to choose.

Yesterday I had a scoop of Jasmine Calamansi and a scoop of Candied Orange Peel. They were both excellent, of course, but I think I liked the Calamansi one the best. How often do you get Calamansi Ice Cream... anywhere?!

I have had several other flavours before and can highly recommend Earl Grey, Caramel with Sea Salt, Salted Mango, Brown Butter, White Sesame, and Bananas Foster. 

They usually only have ten to twelve flavours at a time available and rotate them weekly, or whenever they run out and make a different flavour. My one complaint is that they don't have a web-site to check which flavours are currently available; so you have to be surprised when you get there. It really is a "mooo"-t point, as they make excellent Ice Cream, and I have yet to try a flavour that I didn't like.
author: Brian M.

description:
The BEST ice cream in the city and beyond.  


Our Rankings:
1.Mr and Mrs. Misc

2.Bi Rite
3.Post Street Creamery
4.Humphry Slocombe
5.Smitten
6.Tin Pot Creamery
7.Three Twins 


All these flavors were very well balanced, great texture, perfect sweetness, definitely the best ice cream around!!  YUM!!  The staff was so accomodating and friendly.  Wished I lived nearby so we could come here all the time.  Love their store design.  
Chicory Coffee
Ginger
Salted Mango
Vanilla
Cookies and Cream
Jasmine Green Tea
Sundae - the chocolate sauce is phenomenal and the almonds were perfectly roasted and chunky.
author: Xela C.

description:
idk what took so long for me to finally get here.  I knew I should've paid a visit once I tasted their goodness at citizens band. now I feel cheated I've missed out for so long.

let me count the ways i love the sundae i shared w/ my spawn:

1.  choco chip (i dont even like choco chip)
2.  must be homemade whipped cream
3.  sticky fingerlicky hot fudge
4.  choco covered crispies
5.  that cherry i only find in my alcohol

& the extra stars go to the simple decor & music (yeah, they musta knew i was comin, the Wu was playing).
author: Lady K.

description:
Wanted to get dessert after Hard Knox and decided to come here. When I first entered and saw how modern it looked I thought it was going to be some pretty pricey ice cream! But the flavors on the board reminded me of Bi-Rite. Homemade and unique. There was amaretto, Peppermint stix, and other random names I have honestly never heard of and didn't know what the taste would be. My boyfriend and I got a double scoop of the Peppermint Stix and another flavor that was so random with the name that we just got it, haha. They were actually huge scoops and was good!

It was good and prices were similar to Bi-Rite, but I think I'll stick to my Bi-Rite. This place seems a little too copy-cat of Bi-Rite and too modern, fancy and more attending to the rich compared to Bi-Rite which is more homey. That's just my opinion.
author: Veronica A.

description:
The perfect way to start a hot summer day with some ice cream from MR. & Mrs Miscellaneous. My girlfriend and I had the Orange blossom because that was one of the few flavors that was left after standing in a long line awaiting to be served! It was totally worth it, the Orange blossom sweet to the right extent, i'd go back again when i'm in the area. 

Located in the Dogpatch neighborhood with easy parking. Definite plus !
author: Jeff C.

description:
Mr and Mrs delicious is what they should have named it.

The best flavors so far;

Basil

Rose/cardamon

Earl grey tea

Black sesame

Candied violets

Burnt sugar

Its f'ing dope to make in house fudge, whipped cream and top with Italian amarena cherries.


Please make a cannoli flavor?
author: Chastity C.

description: I'm not really a fan of ice cream (I'm weird) but my friend is (she's normal) and so we decided to stop by here since we were in the neighborhood. Some of my friends had raved that this was their favorite ice cream joint in SF, so thought we would give it a shot. We tried their earl grey ice cream in a cup, and we also got one of their house made cones to eat on the side. Got to sample some of their white rabbit ice cream which tasted just like the Asian candy. The earl grey was decent, very creamy but definitely a bit too sweet for me. Not sure how packed this place gets, we probably waited around 20 minutes at around 5pm on a Sunday.
author: Kevin N.

description: Sweet cream flavor is pretty good. The decor is very simple. I wish they had black sesame today =(
author: Nicole H.

description: The peanut brittle toffee cookies should be more accurately named crack cookies.  The cookies are a perfect balance of sweet and salty in a crispy, crunchy, thin slightly sticky candy/cookie concoction of sugar and peanuts...and maybe crack? You will need to buy more than one or two or three because they are quite addictive. You can ease any guilt about consuming so much sugar by repeatedly saying to yourself  that all of the ingredients are organic and local...probably even the crack.
author: My D.

description:
BROWN BUTTER & SAGE and EARL GREY I LOVE YOU.

I wish I lived closer, just so I could visit Mr&Mrs EVERYDAY.  The flavors are exceptional, and there is always something for everyone.  Service is incredibly friendly, and they are so patient (and look pleased) when I announce I want to sample every flavor. 

I would climb a mountain and shout out my love for Mr&Mrs to the world.  Go!  You won't be disappointed!
author: Susanna W.

description: Ice cream is great but people working here look like they want to kill themselves and are quite rude.
author: Arun J.

description:
Delicious ... beer ice cream!! I usually don't like beer ice cream, it's a little gimmicky to me and generally just tastes bad. But this beer ice cream is aaaamazing! I've never had anything like it! Also, the scoops are generous! 

I would come back here just to eat the beer ice cream again. All their more traditional flavors were great too. The consistency and texture were spot on.

FYI ... Chocolate chip cookie was good too!
author: Judy H.

description:
3.5/5 good

I'd put this in the same boat as other reviewers who reference BiRite, Humphrey's, etc. Too bad they have short hours, and the location is a bit off, but it's nice to have an option outside the mission.

I popped in because the sign caught my eye as I was walking over to Rickshaw, and decided to give it a try after this lady almost ran me over. So under miscellaneous assortments, I wandered in.

The pricing is fair, it was $3 for a scoop, which was a decent size. I went for the "Beer and Brittle," and it was great. I could really taste a full flavor and the consistency was nice. If ever I'm in the area, I'd definitely make a stop.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Even though I went there just before closing, there was still a long line.
This neighborhood is still developing, but the positive is that it was easy to find parking.
 I got two flavors which were black lychee tea and blueberry jam.
My bf got the  pink squirrel. Black lychee tea was absolutely amazing. 
Honestly, i couldn't taste lychee that much but it had a freshness perfect for the summer season. The staff were nice and the atmosphere was warm. 
Since they open till 6, you can enjoy sunny weather and ice cream at the same time.
author: SS K.

description: I love it! Not just your typical flavors. First time I've had ice cream with champagne or Rum! Yummy!!
author: Ms. T.

description:
Who's ready to get ice cream wasted?
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=0rZs06fCVQQRnpLqkCuSfg

When I think of San Francisco, I don't think of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate Bridge or the trolley cars. Nope, I think of all the amazing homemade ice cream shops that can be found in the city by the bay. And out of all those amazing shops, in my personal opinion, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is the best of the bunch.  

Located in the Dogpatch, Mr & Mrs is a small place with industrial looking decor and long wooden communal tables. 

The menu changes here daily. Actually, hourly because they sell out of flavors rather quickly. In the thirty minutes we were there they sold out of two flavors and replaced them with new ones. Since I don't make it to SF often I wanted to try every flavor on their menu. After telling the owner, Ian, or Mr. Miscellaneous, what I had in mind, he said he could easily make my dream come true. Ian busted out a metal tray, some smaller cups and started going to work. He not only gave me a scoop of every flavor but also hooked me up with some of the homemade toppings. This is what came on my tray;

Candied Violet http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=hL_Z8S0gzDW8R7MEgWwQxQ
Flan http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=R-lf9yCSvWgJQAELGscNSg
Orange Chipotle http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=YX_RWQFV2UOLzspvAGC5EA
Pink Squirrel http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=QkRkeWjPNriXYCJPcgDZOw
Sweet Potato http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=R7zKBldeCPc54gTc9XADSA
Peanut Brittle http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=hwEdaUNPGcKde89VWwHGBg
Gingersnap http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=DUM4mv8Y8mCy_ba2df7F7A
Vanilla Bean http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=zJT-0qAiOYJJb8T42XtuUA
Mint Chip http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=b0ET2KlTMy-gT1e34ITKQw
Homemade Caramel Sauce http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=1WF9wfqgXwaJ2TMasBHEJQ
Homemade Hot Fudge http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=6iPj8u9k8IP2jkriP7-A5Q
Valrhona Chocolate Crispies http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/YzA3ocJ0XvsTuD18qr2ctg?select=jmkFVW-D2pkDjPdBqSB1VQ

I'm usually into more exotic flavors and even though these were on the plainer side, they were perfectly executed. Every scoop was rich, creamy and exploding with flavor. I think my fave was either the candied violet or the flan but they were all so phenomenal it's hard to choose. Their fudge and chocolate crispies were great but the homemade caramel sauce was a whole other animal. It had such an intense, sweet and smokey flavor. By far the best on earth. 

Seriously, if you live in SF or are just visiting and have not been here you need to do so. Even if you don't agree with my statement that it's the best ice cream in SF, I'm still guaranteeing you'll love it.
author: Craig R.

description: This place is great! Awesome flavors and the ice cream is made of really high quality ingredients too. Between this place and humphry slocombe... I'd have to go with Mr and Mrs misc! I definitely preferred the texture and taste here.  We need one in socal!
author: Joe L.

description:
This place is as good as Mitchell's! I'll wait until my second visit before declaring it better. They serve ice cream with the texture of Mitchell's but the flavors of Mitchell's, Bi Rite and Humphrey.

Their flavors seem to rotate regularly so the flavors that people recommend might rotate out. That being said, here's my review of the following:

GREAT:

ALMOND WITH WHITE CHOCOLATE & CRANBERRIES - There was plenty of almond flavor in this and overall, it was a flavor explosion of all there main ingredients.

CHAI TEA - The chai flavor was decently strong enough but could have better more chai-ey but it definitely wasn't that watered down milky chai flavor that you unfortunately get from most cafes.

GINGER - This flavor has a nice kick to it and they put caramelized gingers bits into the ice cream. If you can't stand the intensity of ginger candy, don't get this.


GOOD:

CROQUANTINO (Hazelnut, Orange, Liquor)  - I had high hopes for this flavor but it wasn't mind blowing because the flavors were all kind of muddled (too much going on perhaps) and I couldn't really tell what I was tasting.

BAD:

NONE SO FAR!
author: Alex P.

description:
If you like rich dense ice cream, then this is your place!
I got the black sesame and it was prefect. Not too sweet but really flavorful and nutty.
My brother got a brown sugar something or rather which was very sweet but very good!

They only had like 10 flavors.
I think I like Bi-Rite better in terms of offerings but the quality and style of the dense style ice cream is pretty similar (to me anyways).
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I sadly was unimpressed.

Granted the ice cream flavor I had was good. Which was I believe a Sneak Attack beer flavored ice cream which I really liked.

But what miffed me was the service. I went over and requested to try maybe 5-6 tastings of different flavors. But the hipster or rockish? pretentious guy looked obviously impatient at me for asking for so many tastings.
But I mean come on? You have such different unique flavors I have never tasted or heard of before so of course I'd want to try them! And they change their flavors on the menu often too, so JEEZ!!!

I mean sure with the pretentious fancy restaurants but I would rather NOT have to deal with that when I order ice cream! Being all "hip" and "trendy" whatever... I'll go back to my friendly ice cream shops any day! (ie. Ice cream bar at Cole valley or Mitchells)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Your salted caramel is sooooooo good.

You guys really need to tell your story on r3lish:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/relish-bite-sized-video-stories/id844759887?mt=8

This is where I would want to hear from you.
author: Michael L.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous serves some pretty interesting ice cream flavors.  Not sure how they come up with the flavors but they're damn good.  

I probably would have never found this place if not for a friend of mine.  They're located in a pretty deserted part of San Francisco.  When I got there I was a bit skeptical because there was no one walking along the streets which is a very unusual thing in SF.  However this is a really cute small ice cream shop.  Its small but very clean and the service is great.  The lady had a huge smile on her face the whole time I was there.  

I tried the Earl Grey ice cream and it was delicious.  I got it in the junior cup size and it was definitely enough to satisfy my ice cream craving.  

Hands down the best ice cream shop ever.  A must try place!
author: Joyce L.

description:
New goal in life: try all the flavors!

I'm slowly getting there...
author: Sara P.

description:
This place is the BOMBTITS! If you only have time for one ice cream place in the city, this is your destination. While Bi-Rite & Humphry Slocombe have their own merits, Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous is REDEFINING THE GAME (of ice cream).

The only con to this place is that it'll make all other ice cream you have taste like poopoo by comparison.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is good, but I personally prefer bi-rite and humphry. I know some people might think, wtf, there's something wrong with my tastebuds but I just personally like humphry and bi-rite better. My tastebuds does not really taste the flavor of the ice cream, they have unique flavors too like humphry, my personal favorite is the bourbon and caramel, ballpark, beer and brittle, burnt supar and green tea. I just wish i could taste those flavors more but texture is perfect. You have to get the waffle cone, there is no exception for that.
For cake orders, you will have to call in advance, just like humphry, about 3-4 days in advance (if i can recall correctly), they do phone or email orders.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: Yummy! I got the chicory coffee and it was really good! Nice strong flavor. The place is a cute little store on the corner with a more modern feel. Very Clean. I had a little trouble finding parking in the area though. Will definitely come back and try their other flavors.
author: Arda S.

description:
Came here this past weekend for the first time.  Cute place.  I tried a sample of  the candied violet and it was ok..there was alittle burst of the candied violet.  I decided then to order the junior scoop of the orange blossom which was $2.50.  

It was okay..nothing earth shattering.  Not sure if I would go out of my way to this place.
author: James L.

description:
What is a poison pill? Is it a defensive strategy used against corporate takeovers? Or a lethal injection of barbiturate, paralytic, and potassium solution given for capital punishment? Or Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous's peanut brittle cookie? 

I think my poison pill is the peanut brittle cookie! Why so? Well, if you place me in front of a box of these cookies, it is the tactic to expand my 24 inch waistline. This cookie is somewhat like the half-baked chocolate chips cookies from my middle school and high school cafeterias, but better. It has swirls of crunchy peanut brittle in a rich buttery dough, which is very addicting! One bite leaves me wanting more of this sweet and salty mixture. 

My lord, I need to find a drug that can counter the aversive effects of this cookie. If I was not so vain, I would eat this peanut butter cookie everyday.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Dear God,

You know I love this place.  I've been to many a ice cream parlors. The ice cream is fresh and they periodically change, add, omit, flavors to keep it fresh.  It's beats out Polly Ann's in the Sunset, Mitchell's, and even Fenton's Creamery. 

Honestly, the only other ice cream place that holds a candles to it for me is Bubbies.  But that's all the way in Honolulu...

Thanks for the great ice cream.  

-Nom Nom
author: Edward M.

description: 4.5 is the real rating. Delicious! I think this ice cream place beat them all. I came in with a $60 gift card, and decided to get 8 PINTS of ice cream. First, they change flavors daily. Second, the flavors are so rich and creamy. Third, the people are very friendly. And the ice cream is very very very sweet. The only reason for the -.5 star is the location, it is so out of the way! I mean who really comes to this neighborhood? I guess I will start coming for this ice cream!
author: Nikita K.

description:
I cam here after brunch at Hard Knox and I was amazed to see that this place did everything bi-rite did wrong. Great venue, excellent service, no long wait, and amazing ice cream.

TL;DR better than Bi Rite with Mitchell's prices and no wait.
author: Dominic S.

description:
Standard hipster ice cream: expensive (3.50 a scoop, 50 cents for a cone), interesting flavours, small portions, good texture, restricted hours.

I may be back if I can ever get there when they are open. I guess they assume that everyone "works" from home and can just stroll over from their live/work loft for a some afternoon ice cream. Would it kill them to be open after 6 when those poor suckers who have to work during the day get off?

The taste is below Bi-Rite, Three Twins and above Humphrey Slocums. The texture is really good. It's about the same taste as Mitchell's but cost far more.

Finally  all it's in NOT in Potrero Hill, notice the word HILL in the name of the neighborhood. It on the other side of freeway from Potrero Hill.
author: DeathandFood H.

description: Yummy. I read about this dessert shop in Travel & Leisure Magazine so I added it to my ice cream obsession list. I'm so glad I was finally able to stop in. They have a ton of desserts to choose from but I had to go with some ice cream. We got cookies and cream and bourbon and caramel which was a tasty combo if you ask me. The scoops are heaping and easy to split. The staff were quite patient while we decided on which flavour to try. I heard the cookies are to die for too so I'll have to go back and try those next time I'm in the area. Sounds like they live up to the hype especially after all of the press they're receiving.
author: Amy J.

description: Forget the ice cream, the chocolate chip cookies here are amazing!!!! Just kidding, the ice cream here is pretty good too. All the flavors are very rich and delicious. The Flavors are always changing too!
author: Clarice C.

description: All the flavors sound amazing but I had to choose one. Pink squirrel was so so good in the beginning. You could taste the quality of the ingredients. Towards the end though, it started tasting more and more salty, and the milky creaminess became too heavy in my throat.. I wish I could've chosen two flavors, even for the kids size (because other ice cream places allow this lol), just so I could enjoy two flavors instead of getting bored with one. Overall, good quality ice cream that mostly justifies the price, but perhaps a tad heavy. Also, it was 2pm (on a saturday), and they had already ran out of the homemade waffle cones, so come earlier.
author: Rita L.

description: I have to admit, I like Humphrey Slocombe's flavor selection a lot more. The ice cream here is good quality, of course. My friends and I came here after having brunch down the street. After hearing all the hype, I thought it was going to have a line. Nope. It was pretty quiet. The space is nice, high ceilings, large windows. Very minimal rustic. Lots of seats, if everyone filled a seat, it'd be hard to walk around them. Looking at the other reviews while writing this, I might have just gone in on a day where the flavors weren't as adventurous. The staff was friendly and fast. This would be my ice cream place for the dogpatch. But if I were craving, I'd head to Humphrey or Holy Gelato.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Still great, after all these (few) years!

Novel flavors, always changing.  Not wanting squash or earl grey in your 'scream? They usually have one or two standard flavors for those less adventurous outings.  Great mouthfeel, not tooooo sweet.

Their cookies are amazing.  Try the peanut brittle cookie, you'll be hooked.

Mr. & Mrs.... Icecreamimus Maximus!
author: Bob K.

description:
FACT: You can't say it five times fast. Trust me, I tried. But you can try their ice cream five times because it's hella good!!!

If it's there (their flavors change a lot, depending on when you go) totally try the Fudge Ripple. It's creamy and decadent, and yes, it has ripples.

Ripples of goodness!

The Earl Grey is also good. Although every time I say, hear, or think of Earl Grey, old ladies come to mind...

However, I'm definitely a fan!
author: Mike N.

description:
This is great ice cream- I like all the novel flavors.  

My only suggestion would be to have flavors where there are more things in the ice cream itself, like almonds or large pieces of chocolate, or something like that.  I guess its a personal preference.

But regardless, I really enjoyed my ice cream cone.  Prices are reasonable too- will come here again.
author: Laleh J.

description:
I came here excited with the idea of having the Banana Foster in my mouth.  But I was won over by Pink Squirrel.  Who'd have guessed it?  It reminded me of the Black Cherry flavor back in the Thrifty ice cream days.  Anyone remember those?!  There's just a combo of great flavors with just the right amount - cherry, almond, and creme de cacao.  Though I felt balls of black cherries would've been a great addition, I am officially a fan of Pink Squirrel.

I also had the Tres Leches.  I was surprised to find actual cake pieces in my cup.  It was a great flavor but the Pink Squirrel wins by a landslide.

If only they opened a little later.  I would gain 5 lbs every week.
author: Linh V.

description:
Like this place needs another 5 star. C'mon if you're still reading this stop - and go get some damn ice cream. It's awesome in almost any flavor. Best in town. Better than BiRite (which is still really good), better than humphry slocombe, better. Period. 

Parking can be a pain, and sometimes they aren't open, just get there on a weekday before 6 and you should be fine.
author: william k.

description:
Punkin' ale ice cream?! Can I get some of that pleasee?

It sounds a little funky but it was actually pretty good. Top it with some homemade toasted almonds and you got yourself a winner. 

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous definitely comes up with some unique flavors that puts Bi-Rite to shame. Truthfully, I'm just not a fan of Bi-Rite. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous definitely has a cute modern feel to the place and you'll always find unique flavors here that won't disappoint. 

PS. The early grey ice cream is pretty tasty too!
author: Jeanette Y.

description: OMG this is my favorite ice cream place in the city now! Their flavor sensibility is right up my alley. I can't believe I waited so long to come down here. Too bad Dogpatch is not really in my 'hood :-(. In one afternoon I came by twice - first time for the roasted fennel - yummy fennel/anise flavor - second time for black sesame - a nutty flavor unlike any black sesame gelato I've had before. If you see a flavor you like get it - don't wait. They do run out of flavors. In the few hours between my visits that afternoon three of the flavors from before were replaced. My friends got the cookies n' cream, earl grey tea and strawberry nesquick. I did taste the earl grey tea  and it was just like really good earl grey tea.
author: Jean K.

description:
Bourbon and caramel ice cream. Try a spoonful, buy a pint. Magic!

Also, black sesame makes you go wha? but then you're like...yissss.

Go.
author: Tysen C.

description:
Heavens to Mergatroid! I love the ice cream here!
Candied violet and white sesame are 2 of my favs.
Everytime I go to TAD, I have to make a stop for some ice cream. 

What's also great is that it's a mom&pop shop and the owners are super cool.
author: Ren B.

description:
Wordy name aside, this place is top-notch. The long salvaged wood table decorated like a dining showroom photographed for Real Simple magazine with artfully placed flower-filled vases and bowls of autumn squash; the sparse white walls broken only by a side table with water-filled milk bottles, the clean & simple detailing, the high ceilings. Very nice and tasteful.

Lovingly written on chalkboard (because the flavors change ALL THE TIME) (I would like to come here 5 times a week to make sure I try all their flavors) (But I'd be really fat) (Boo), the ice cream flavors were diverse, and upon sampling most of them, extremely flavorful. 

Lemon Poppy, was curiously English, like tea & crumpets, reminiscent of clotted cream and lemon curd slathered on poppy scones.

Fudge Ripple was simple sweet cream, dotted with chewy, intensely flavorful, chocolately-delicious fudge... well, ripples.

The Lemon Buttermilk was like a wealthy drag queen with a heart of gold: tart, rich & sweet. 

Earl Grey tingled on the tongue with its interplay of subtle Bergamot and fragrant tea.

In addition, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous (OMG that name is just bizarre to write out, and read out loud!!), give you GIANT SCOOPS for the price. The prices are on par with Bi-Rite and perhaps Scream (lame place), but the ratio of scoop size:price is MUY MAGNIFICO.

Dogpatch is a trek for most downtown SFers, but it truly is worth that journey.
author: Joshua L.

description: Great ice cream! They have interesting ice cream flavors like English Black Tea, Almond Butter, Thai Basil, and etc. You can ask for a free taste if you're not sure which flavor to get. They also sell snacks such as Almond Peanut Brittle and Licorice. Their Sour Cherry Licorice candy is now my favorite! I wish they'd sell it in packs instead of selling it for 50¢ each though. The staff was very accommodating and fast. Pleasant experience overall!
author: Ajay J.

description:
Lemongrass was very subtle. Coconut almond was very bold. I don't think the texture quite compares to some of the other boutique creameries. The waffle cone was frankly disappointing.

The peanut brittle cookie creation was, however, amazing.

But that's not what we come here for, is it?
author: George S.

description:
I came upon this spot during the Sunday Streets event. There were people gathered outside resting and eating some stuff. Since this is one of there only food spots in the area I decided to take a look.

I had no clue that this was an ice cream store! It really looks like a cafe from the outside. I suspect that 'Miscellaneous' is new to the area because their sign is essentially a handwritten piece of paper taped in the window. After seeing customers pass me by with cones in their hand I became excited.

The interior is like a retrofitted bakery with high ceilings. It's has a classy vibe with stark white walls, dark wood tables, and chalkboard menus. I highly appreciated the big beautiful bouquet of flowers on the table. For a place this big it's surprising to find a restroom - a plus. Handicapped door button - another plus.

The menu is composed of about a dozen ice creams and I think a couple of sorbets(?). Most of the flavors sound traditional yet there also some curious sounding ones like Choco-Malt Crunch and Ballpark (beer, pretzels). There are optional add ons to your ice cream treat. They also sell some cookies and caramels. I had the "Mint Cookie". It's mint ice cream with chocolate cookie chunks. I liked my ice cream. I wish the division of ice cream and cookie was more equally divided. It was like eating a lot of ice cream then having one big cookie chunk. Beside this quibble the mint flavor was good and not overpowering. The cookie was fresh but I just wanted more of it.

Prices are $2.75 for a single and $3.75 for a double. It's a little steep in my opinion. The serving size is about the same as a gelato place but it's not as rich as other gourmet ice cream shops so you're left wanting more. They have their own homemade waffle cones which are fifty cents extra. I asked for a cone but the guy stated that they were all out; however, when I sat down to eat there were like three people right after me walking out with cones. WTF. I guess the cone fairy sprinkled her dust.

_____

I still prefer Humphry Slocombe or Mitchell's or Bi-Rite or even Swenson's. I think Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous need to just "play" more with their menu and identity. They are showing the signs of a new business but I think they are off to a great start. I hope to see them at a farmers' market or festival soon.
author: Michael H.

description:
Mr and Mrs has taken over the ice cream scene. Move over BiRite and Humphrey Slocombe, you guys are old news.

The location is maybe less than ideal, but the space is huge and they don't have a shortage of customers. It seems, if you're product is good enough, people in SF will come. I guess that applies to most anything and everything, including drugs right? haha 

The line out the door goes by really quickly. Waiting in lines allows you to ponder or flip flop between ice cream flavors listed on the chalkboard. I like the randomness of the flavors as they run out. During my short time here, they finished three different tubs of ice cream flavors and rather than replenish that flavor with more of the same, they brought out a brand new flavor to the "oohs and ahhs" of those in line. So the chalkboard listing flavors is ever changing.

*Pink Squirrel - almond and chocolate liquor? Overall it tasted like cherries and I can't complain

*Jasmine Green Tea - light and refreshing! 

With the weather already feeling like summer, this place is only gonna get more popular. Don't come having made up your mind on what you'll order, the fun is trying whatever new thing they'ev come up with. 
____
Feb '12 Health Score - 100!
Credit card min is $5
author: Dennis L.

description: Good for an ice cream fix but expect to wait in line if you're planning to go on the weekend.  It's a nice addition to the neighborhood.
author: M F.

description:
YUM!  Came here after a long day of work on Saturday and was pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness of their flavors and the texture of the ice cream.  The night before we went to Smitten and i was GREATLY disappointed.  to be honest, i was a bit worried trying another ice cream spot.  But I left SO SO SO HAPPY!  Huge scoops of ice cream, reasonable prices and EXCELLENT taste.  I'm definitely a fan.

Mr. and Mrs Miscellaneous is in an unlikely.... or may more recently LIKELY growing spot in the Dog Patch!  Theyre on the corner and it's a quaint little store where all kinds of people come and go to get a cup of delightful dessert.  I'll admit i spent a good 30 minutes facing out towards the doorway people watching because really, a very eclectic group of customers.

I ordered the jasmine green tea and the boyfriend got the mango sea salt.  wowowowow talk about a mouth full of flavor.  great texture, a burst full of taste bud heaven with every bite and generous portions.  this isn't your ordinary jasmine green tea... it's got a good kick to it so you can't compare it to marco polo or polly anne's.  it doesn't have all the added sweetener or sugar... it's REAL green tea infused into the ice cream.  SO YUMMY.

overall an enjoyable experience and i would recommend this place to anybody craving ice cream in the soma/dogpatch area.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe have some tough competition.  Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is located in Dogpatch and definitely worth checking out.  Their staff is super friendly and let you sample the different daily flavor offerings.  I tried the Earl Grey today and fell in love with it!  I wanted to try the Jasmine Green Tea, but they were sold out of the flavor for the day.

If you feel like indulging extra, order one of their fresh handmade ice cream cones or the chocolate chip cookies that make you want to salivate while you wait in line.
author: Carli F.

description:
4th try is the charm right.  I've made the trek here several times to find that they were closed mysteriously.  Recently I'd taken to calling before I went to confirm that they were open because it seems every nice weekend day I've tried, the doors have been shut.  It turns out they sell out of ice-cream quite frequently and will leave a message on the answering machine or on their Facebook page to let people know.  Another time I showed up and got in an epic line and was told ten minutes into my wait that they were running out of ice-cream.  This concept of running out of food when you are a stationary restaurant was foreign to me till this point. 

Seems like frequently selling out of your product and having a cult following should indicate that they have good stuff.  My one experience where I managed to get ice-cream was a bit underwhelming though.   It's good, but not that good.  The flavors they had at the time were all simple, mostly one addition to a custard base, and no chocolate.  I felt all the flavors I tried where overly sweetened to the point where they hid other flavors.  The texture also wasn't as creamy as I'd hope for.  For all the hype and waiting I think I'd rather go to one of the other creative ice-cream places where I've never been turned back.
author: Paul T.

description: I walked to this place with a couple coworkers from work and it's good. I lived in Berkeley for a few years and this place greatly reminds me of Ici's on Ashby and College. They go through different flavors daily and that's exactly what Ici does! I had the pralines and cream which was delicious. I also got to sample the butter cream which was also real good. The entire time I was there (late afternoon weekday) there was never not a customer waiting to be helped. People just kept walking in. I also got a sour mango straw candy, which they don't make there, but it was really good. Lastly, I was pretty pleased that they sold me a root beer by itself. Plenty of seating. Nice wood tables inside. There is a minimum charge to use your credit card (I just can't remember what it is).  Definitely decently priced, 3.00 for a junior scoop, 3.50 for a small I believe. Staff was kind.  Overall, I'd come back :)
author: Julie L.

description: Came here with my wife and cuz and copped the sweet cream and banana. The sweet cream ice cream is sooooooo delicious. It's a must have. The banana was good too. It was like the banana candy. They have new flavors everyday. Next time I hit up SF I will def come into this shop to see what they got!
author: Arthur L.

description: SF has many, many ice cream shops & this is one of my top favorites. The consistency is so thick and creamy!
author: Crystal W.

description:
Everybody shut the FUCK UP and listen for a sec: Stop whatever you are doing and go get a scoop of Pink Squirrel right now. No, right now.

I'm rarely on foot when in Dogpatch, so tonight's Bold Italic party was my first real opportunity to get my complacent patooty into Mr. and Mrs. The mister gave me a sample of Pink Squirrel and I know to say this is a yelper cliche, but I actually think my eyes rolled into the back of my head. There is a reason this flavor is in the review highlights, you guys! 

After I was done blacking out and pooping my pants in ecstasy, I order a single scoop on a cone - perhaps a little too enthusiastically because the mister laughed kind of uncomfortably? Don't be embarrassed about having the best ice cream in town, buddy!

Moral of the story is to stop being that sucker staring at your feet in the Bi-Rite line.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
Guys! This place is not that good. Again another example of a trendy place where they want to make something different but then it doesn't taste that good at all!
I had this ice-cream with some sort of "chocolate and malt and more stuff" flavor and another one with a strange name... lover cake... or something like that. The chocolate was OK, it tasted like chocolate and I couldn't taste any of all the other stuff they said it was in it. The lover cake or whatever was the name tasted like nothing. It was good looking but that's it. 
So, why don't they make basic flavors that taste good and then maybe they can try something a little alternative? But, first, make ice-cream that taste good.
Don't know.... man! I am not going back.
Bi-rite creamery has strange flavors, long waiting lines and a lot of hipsters but at least the ice-creams are really good and the flavors come out tasty.
author: Luca R.

description:
Nice location, the ice cream shop is situated on the corner, across the street from brunch place Serpentine and diagonal from soul food Hard Knox café. Cute place with dark wooden furniture and tall ceilings and floor to ceiling windows that opens up to the street and daylight. 

They have a changing ice cream menu.
For the past Sunday, I tried the following ice creams:
*Grasshopper with pearls (3 of 5)-this was a twist on mint and chocolate chip ice cream. Instead of chocolate chips, they had small chocolate balls. It was good, but mint wasn't that strong.
* Sesame with Peanut Brittle (2.5 of 5)-peanut taste overpowered sesame. Should be called Peanut Brittle with little bit of sesame.

7X7 2012 Big Eat Peanut Brittle Cookie (3.5 of 5)-it was tasty marriage of cookie and peanut brittle. It was chewy and soft and not very heavy. I could taste and see the caramelizing on the bottom of the cookie. It was good, but not a WOW for me.

Pricing-wise, the cost was $3.50 for single scoop and additional $0.50 for small waffle cone. Cookies were $2.50 each. This place was a little pricey, but super quaint store and good place to hang out with kids and friends on a hot day if you are around the neighborhood. And their changing menu will keep you guessing, what is their next ice cream creation.
author: Janice T.

description:
Possibly the best ice-cream in the city!!
The owners run the business and are very friendly and passionate about their ice-creams. 
The menu is constantly changing but the combinations are always so good!!!
author: Conor L.

description:
This place totally deserves the 3 billion 5 star reviews. First, all the flavors that I've tried are awesome (horchata, salted mango, black tea, caramel). Second, people are super duper nice and service is great every time. Third, the space is beautiful. As much as I love Humphry & Bi Rite, I have to admit that I love the open space.

You're totally worth my jeans getting tighter.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
I love going to Mr. and Mrs. when I can. They have a pretty unique variety of flavors and you never know what's going to be available that day. Their flavors change so frequently that I always see something new. They usually have about 8-10 different flavors to choose from.

They are pretty good about letting you sample different flavors, which is good because I like to drink ginger beer and rum, but I wasn't sure how it would taste as ice cream. It was delish! Plus, their ice cream is nice and creamy. You can tell they use quality ingredients.

The reason why I'm not giving five stars is because their days/hours of operation are a little limited (closed on Mondays and Tuesdays & only open until 5pm or 6pm on other days).
author: Anne K.

description: met a buddy here after eating at the food trucks at SOMA. I ordered 2 scoops of cookies and cream and it was the best ice cream I had in while.  I ended up buying a quart of cookies and cream!
author: Brian B.

description:
Came again and got coconut cream, mint and jasmine green tea flavors. They were all fabulous. I can definitely taste real mint used. Jasmine green tea was better than what I remembered before so I went back to buy a pint to go and asked which brand of tea they used. 

Turned out they couldn't fill a pint before running out so they gave me $3 off. They also gladly served me four samples when I was being indecisive about the flavors. Awesome service.

General note on ice cream tasting: half teaspoon of ice cream sample often isn't good indication of whether it's good or not.
author: Agustinus T.

description:
A very random spot for an ice cream spot, but anything goes in SF right?  This place doesn't have your out-of-this-world-unique flavors, but it has a nice, creamy, and flavorful consistency. I tried the Mango and chocolate chip. Both were very good and hit the spot on a nice SF day.  

I like that parking isn't difficult compared to going to Bi-Rite. The line moves relatively quick, but seating can be hard to get when the lines are really long.
author: Diane L.

description:
I love me some ICE CREAM and am always loving and looking for a delicious frozen treat! A friend suggested Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous when debating about the best ice cream in the city, so I had to give it a try. I had high hopes for this place and it did not disappoint! The vast variety of flavors are amazing and the they constantly change daily and sometimes hourly.

Flavors:
Cookies and Cream- a nice classic that was married perfectly in a milky cream with oreo cookie crumbles.
Torone- honey, almond, and goodness mixed in together to deliciousness.
Ghost Chili Pepper and Shochu- the hottest chili in the world mixed with a Japanese Alcohol was surpisingly amazing and worked well as an ice cream.


This is a must try place and on my list for top Ice Cream in the city! I will be back!
author: Elliot T.

description: Not much of an ice cream lover but this place is hands down the best ice cream place in sf. Random flavors everyday! MANGO CHILE LIME(was sold out soon after for the day) was so good.. had to buy a pint to bring it home! SNAGGED!  Also, Their peanut brittle and brown sugar cookie is ridiculous! They make their own  peanut malt balls also, which taste like recess peanut butter cups!.. I am not a sweets/dessert person by any means but this place made me a regular. Lastly, they have self made pomegranate licorices. If that doesn't get you to try this place, then I don't know what will.
author: Herb L.

description: Top notch ice cream flavors. Huge variety, and they're all delicious. They have vegan options as well. I really like the decor. I haven't been to such a space for just ice cream before. The staff is super friendly. It's not in the most central location, but it's worth the trek.
author: Mei F.

description:
OK, first of all, how cute is the name! We didn't even see the name of the place until we were walking back to the car. We had just finished lunch at Serpentine, which is kitty-corner to Mr. and Mrs., and saw someone walking out with an ice cream cone, and we literally just said, "Ooh, ice cream." and checked out the place.

Wow. Immediately, you're hit with the smell of sweet goodness. All of the flavors are pretty non-conventional. We tried the banana with toffee, and it tasted so fresh and, for lack of a better word, banana-y. It's quite rare to find ice cream with true banana flavor.

As I've said again and again, I detest trendy places, and with all the crowded "boutique" ice cream parlors in the city, Mr. and Mrs. is a nice, chill (no pun intended) place where you can actually *gasp* sit and enjoy your ice cream! I have to--HAVE to--give an extra star to Mr. and Mrs. for providing a compost bin as their sole means of "disposal". Why only a compost bin? Because everything from the spoons to the straws--yes, the straws!--is compostable! Gets an "A" in my book!

Scoops are pretty generous, too. So you don't expect a measly little ice cream ball in a cup.
author: Kym M.

description:
Hey hey hey! I finally get to try this place! After a crazy brunch full of beignets and eggs,  my friends and I still decided to go for ice cream! Well worth the shot.

From the outside, it doesn't look like an ice cream shop at all, with the tall, gray tinted glass windows, it looked more like a warehouse than a creamery. Once when we stepped into the shop, we were greeted by the aroma of freshly baked cones, and tons of happy faces with cups and cones in their hands. After browsing their flavor menu on the black board, I had to go for their Sea-Salted Caramel! One reason because Bi-Rite had spoiled me well with their caramel version, another because I'd love to do a little comparison between the two creameries. 

There wasn't any line (compared to Bi-Rite's), and the servers are really friendly and they let you sample as much as you like to make sure you like what you choose. Excellent! The Sea-Salt Caramel doesn't fail in contrast to the one I'm used to get at Bi-Rite. I thought it's really firm, and as tasty and it was somewhat a much bigger scoop! My friend got the Crema Catalana, which was wonderful too.

I'm glad to have found you, Miscellaneous!
author: Rika P.

description: I've been wanting to try pink squirrel for so long, but every time I stop by, they never have it! So sad, but their other flavors are still good and really creative. I've tried white rabbit and burnt caramel. White rabbit brought me back to my childhood because it tasted just like the candies! Burnt caramel basically tasted like salted caramel which is my favorite ice cream flavor of all time. I love that there's hardly ever a wait here unlike many ice cream spots in SF (probably because it's in Dogpatch), but the taste and quality is right up there with the other unique SF ice cream places like Bi-rite and Humphrey Slocombe. I've also tried their peanut brittle (sold in a mason jar) which is also really good! Best peanut brittle I've ever had. I can't wait to try more flavors. Crossing my fingers for pink squirrel next time!
author: Stephanie G.

description: There was a long line, but it went by quickly, fast, friendly service, high quality ice cream, and original, creative flavors, all of which we loved. Would definitely recommend this place to others.
author: Emily B.

description: It's pretty amazing how they can take such a diverse array of flavors and always come up with something delicious.
author: Ryan T.

description:
Earthy environment with earthy flavors!
Creamy and not overly sweet.
author: Nanette L.

description:
Seriously, they need to stop making such genius ice cream flavors because I've gained 10lbs in the last month. I like this place so much i came back two days in a row!! Who else could come up with a flavor like pink squirrel and make it amazingly delicious?? Not to mention I've tried their black and jasmine tea flavors and fell head over heals. Earl grey, step aside you've met some damn good competition!

Thank goodness this place isn't down the street from me or else I'd have to invest in more pants w/ elastic waist bands!! Their portions are disgustingly huge, and yet I still can't seem to control my cravings so i keep coming back for more!
author: Kristen C.

description:
OMG OMG OMG

BEST ICE CREAM EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm from SoCal and recently visited NorCal few weeks ago. I have never liked ice cream this much. This place is BOMB.COM

Anyways, I got the Orange Chip and Vietnamese Coffeee flavor. The chocolate chips are so rich and delicious! I'm just drooling thinking about them right now. The Vietnamese Coffee taste exactly like the actual coffee! I've never had ice cream like this and really sad that I cant even find one here in SoCal as good as this. I'm still on the hunt. 

I want to cry right now because I want Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous so bad but it's so far away.. T____T
author: Tina L.

description:
Love the texture of the ice cream here; soft, light and not too dense. 
I had the pink squirrel, which wasn't my fave flavor...but i guess i just need try out more flavors the next time i drop by!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: There must be something in the SF air because there are SO many good ice cream places! Mr. and Mrs. Misc is another one to add to my list. The best flavor I had was earl grey. I've had earl grey before, but this was one spectacular. Really. It has the tea flavor, but more like a milky tea that has a creamy finish. I had the lavender which was comparable to Bi-Rite (my favorite). The only negative is that it is rather expensive. The BF and I each got two scoops (one scoop of each flavor) and the total was $9.00. If I know what flavors I want, I would head to Bi-Rite, but if I'm feeling adventurous, I would head here.
author: Allison S.

description: Cute store.  The portions are kind of huge here!  I like the pink squirrel flavor, it's different and no one else has it.  They seem to have baked goods here as well.  No crazy line, like you know where!
author: Wendy S.

description: They had black IPA ice cream. soooo goood! love all their flavors
author: Aimee M.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has been one of those places I've been dying to try.  Everyone I know has tried it and has had rave reviews.  However, perhaps because it was a cold day and ice cream was not on my immediate wants, I was not blown away.  Don't get me wrong, the ice cream is good and the flavors very creative; however none of them suited my taste. I tried the Basil Chocolate Chip. The quality of the ice cream is great-- creamy and fresh, and the chocolate chips were the perfect size-- small enough to get a good dose every spoonful, and big enough to get the crunch of the very good quality chocolate chips; but just nothing extraordinary.  Perhaps the hype made me more critical. My friend had a different flavor and had it with a cone, and she loved the cone.  Maybe I will have to try it again on another day.

 I don't expect exceptional service from an ice cream shop, but I felt that the place was a little too "cold" (pun-intended) and pretentious compared to other places like Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe.

If I was walking around Dogpatch I'd def stop by, but I would not go out of my way for this place.
author: Ali C.

description:
Stop 3 on our ice cream crawl:

Clean, open, modern with ample seating inside and free parking outside - hell, the ice cream could be average for amenities like that in a city.

Tried-
Crema catalana - citrusy, fresh, but creamy
Pink squirrel - boozy. And pink!
Bought -
Candied violet - sweet, purpley with crisp little candies, slightly floral. You will love it if you like those packs of violet old lady gum, as I sometimes do.
Halva - really? Dude, if anyone told me tahini ice cream would be involved, I might not have made it to the other places. Loved!

Wished - 
I'd bought the pink squirrel and only tasted the violet and brought a large amount of the halva home with me.
author: T B.

description: Help me, I'm becoming addicted.  I'm finding reasons to come down this way just to see what new flavors they created.  Sage and Cider ice cream rocked!  Home made waffle cones and cookies so perfectly made.  I loved the house made salted caramels and the peanut brittle brown sugar cookies.  I would have given a rating on the chocolate and cherry cookies, but somebody who shall remain nameless ate it without checking with me!  Hate when that happens!  Just another reason to head down to the Dogpatch!
author: Maria S.

description:
they didn't have earl grey (which everyone seems to mention) when i went and the flavors didn't seem interesting.
the texture of the ice cream wasn't creamy enough for me either.
tried the white sesame which didn't really taste too much like white sesame to me.
on to the next!
author: Heejin L.

description:
I came here on a Sunday right after a losing ball game, desperate for a pick-me-up.  We arrived at 4:57 only to find out they close at 5pm.  We were still waiting for our friend to arrive so we had them hold the door open for her right at 5pm.  I quickly ordered a scoop of the bourbon caramel and pink squirrel.  Luckily we were still able to sit and eat in there, although the seat we were at was right next to the window and quickly melted the ice cream.

The flavors were good.  Pink Squirrel - A slight almond flavor, although not as strong as I would've liked it.  Normally I would've gotten salted caramel but they were out of it.  For some reason, the bourbon caramel tasted more like almond to me, but maybe the flavors just got mixed together.  The flavors change frequently and are different than other places.  It's a really creamy ice cream if you like that, although mine just melted so fast.  

Overall a nice place to go if you're in the neighborhood but I'm not sure it would be worth a trip if you're too far.  Maybe I will need to try again to taste more flavors.
author: Stacey C.

description:
my fav ice cream in the city, probably anywhere.
Love the owners, too. 
Come to the dogpatch now!
author: alison r.

description: I love vanilla ice cream. I am not into exotic flavors, been there, done that. What I really love is good vanilla ice cream. When I read about a new ice cream place I make sure to check them out. I have been to all of them, and finally made it to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. Their Sweet Cream ice cream was THE BEST VANILLA I EVER TASTED IN SAN FRANCISCO.
author: Molly B.

description:
As soon as you walk through the door th scent if freshly made waffle cones hits you. 

Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous you are awesome. Not only are the flavors here different from every where else...they're ALL good. 

Black & Tan- Beer? Ice Cream? Two of my most favorite things put together in one! I had to sample it first. Its so smooth and creamy...not too bold of a beer taste.

Burnt Caramel- Very similar to Bi-Rite's salted caramel but more of that burnt taste. Tastes good to me!

Chicory Coffee- A winner for coffee lovers. I'm not a coffee drinker, but enjoyed this. Really strong coffee taste. 

By the time we got there all the vanilla was gone...so that tells me two things: 1. Vanilla is really really good 2. Their floats and everything else they make with vanilla ice cream are also really really good.

I'll definitely come here regularly.
author: Heather P.

description:
San Francisco ice cream is just so darn good, and places keep opening all the time!   I think that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous sits in a nice middle area with the sort of unique flavor combinations at Humphrey Slocombe and the fresh and natural taste and flavors of Mitchell's.  I'm usually not a fan of fruit ice cream, but I loved their buttermilk blueberry ice cream.  I also have enjoyed their brown butter and Irish coffee ice creams, as well as the samples of things like squash and a couple of alcoholic flavors. The housemade cones are DELICIOUS, but they ran out this time before we could get one!

I'm also a big fan of their Peanut Brittle Brown Sugar cookie (as recommended by 7x7) and their Peanut Butter Malt Balls.
author: Pilan C.

description:
Innovative yet delicious ice creams you can find anywhere else.

Great ice creams that are not produced Ina large quantity. So every time I visit the store, I find new flavors to try. 

Yum yum
author: Evan L.

description:
I haven't had the ice cream here... yet. I mean, I want to very very badly.

I came here after having a nice dinner at Piccino's only to find that it was closed... at 6:30pm.  

Closed at 6 on weekdays?? I don't even get off work until 6, let alone eat my dinner till around 7/8pm. I thought normal people liked to eat ice cream after dinner?

I'll change my review once I, I mean, if I ever get to try this place. :[
author: Michelle K.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. is an outstanding place to visit. So outstanding that I don't really want to write this review so I can continue to come here and enjoy their tasty treats on random weekends in relative peace. 

As you approach Mr. and Mrs. the first thing you notice is the sweet vanilla scent of fresh waffle cones on the iron, maybe mixed with a waft of chocolate chip cookie. You will leave the store with this delicious perfume clinging to your clothes, and people will turn their heads as you walk, murmuring "yuuum."  

Frankly, that is probably enough to bring any halfway interested person to visit, but add in low key but enthusiastic staff, a friendly neighborhood vibe, really incredible, creative ice cream flavors, and the hope of street parking (we are in the Dogpatch) - it doesn't get much better than this.

If you like that very fine balance between sweet and salt, Mr. and Mrs. is your place. The base is creamy and rich, but not cloying, and the flavors are intriguing - always with a bit of savor to offset the sweet.

My favs; salted mango, the candied violet (just a little lemony too), earl grey, and I am game to try any new flavor these geniuses come up with. Anyone who can make Fernet Branca ice cream taste this good could probably do just about anything.

The baked goods and candy treats always look incredible here, but I haven't yet tried them - no room. I had one of the raspberry lemon thyme popsicles over the summer and it was divine - refreshing, tangy, herbal and wonderful on a hot day.

Hands down better than Bi-rite, and also better than Humphry. 

Take your out of town friends and watch them drool as they approach the door. This is what SF is all about.
author: Connie B.

description:
I want to try more flavors.

I had this cream with burnt orange caramel. Was very tasty.

I also had their salted caramel flavor which was good but I prefer birite. 

This location is TOTALLY random. I have no reason to come to this area. I wish this place was closer or near other things that would make my trip there more worth it. I used to volunteer at the food bank which is a few blocks away, but I haven't discovered this place till now. and i have no time to volunteer anymore. :(
author: Erica L.

description: So, I'm just neutral on Mr. & Mrs. They have concocted some of my all-time favorite ice cream flavors (creme fraiche with pate de fruit? I died) but some of their flavors come off a little icicle-y (like Earl Grey or anything with beer). They're my neighborhood spot, but they close early so I can't give them lots of love (no evening access to ice cream is both a blessing and a curse).
author: Heidi H.

description: Best chocolate chip ice cream I've ever had, period. Plenty of seating, lots of free street parking within two blocks. Definitely holds its own against the other high-profile ice cream joints in the city.
author: Gary D.

description:
Pink Squirrel! Wow!

Not quite sure what makes it pink but with the way it tastes, does it really matter? We walked up right as the guy was walking to the front door to turn the sign to "Closed", but he saw the anticipation & longing in my eyes, so smiled and let us in. Delicious!

Easy parking, lots of seating.
author: Anna R.

description:
I love this ice cream. Creative flavors (but not crazy like Humphrey Slocombes), homemade & organic/local, the ice cream has a beautiful texture and the baked goods like cookies always tempt me. 

I wish Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was cheaper, $3.50 a scoop (although I might eat too much if it was cheaper).  Also 6pm closing time is unreasonable unless your a senior citizen then it might be bedtime, so please stay open later. 

They now accept credit cards, with a $5 minimum! yay
author: Shannon Z.

description: Choices were great and flavors were good (although a bit too sweet) .. but HAIR in my ice cream?  Get that sh*t away from me!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Having already tried Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was next on my hit list of ice cream shops.  Although maybe not as well known as the others (amongst my friends at least), what better way to spend part of my day off than to drop in with a few friends to check them out? 

Walking in, the place really reminded me of the look and feel of Serpentine...which is not that surprising considering they're right across the street from each other.  With the high ceilings, big windows, and a near-warehouse type of design, it's definitely got that commercial type of feel.  While that might suggest more of a cold type of decor, it's actually quite the opposite.  With all  of the stools and big wooden tables adorned with flower centerpieces, it's quite inviting to take a seat and enjoy your frozen treat.

After sampling a couple of their flavors, I decided to go with the Chicory Coffee that I tried, while I took a chance on their Orange Chipotle.  Of the two, I definitely thought that the Chicory Coffee was better.  Good, distinct coffee flavor, not overly sweet...solid.  I still give Humphrey Slocombe the edge with their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but the Chicory Coffee definitely ranks as one of the better ones I've had.  As for the Orange Chipotle, there's no question as to the flavor - it literally tastes like chipotle and orange.  Initially, I liked that sweet, orange flavor followed by that spicy kick at the end.  It was unique to get that refreshing hit at the start, followed by the chipotle aftertaste.  However, I have to admit that after a while, it was a bit too much for me.  Sadly enough, I couldn't finish the rest of it (plus, we had plans to hit up Bi-Rite an hour later anyways).

Maybe in part because of my gamble, I think I might give Humphrey a slight edge because of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (both are behind Bi-Rite though).  To be fair, I've also tried more of their flavors too, but I'll definitely be back to try the other flavors and to try their cookies!
author: Mike L.

description:
My boyfriend and my friend were waiting for Frisco Fried to open up.. and in the meantime.. we strolled by here.

Their LAVENDAR Ice Cream is so rich and refreshing with a hint of lavendar. I got a generous amount on a cone. I like it better than Bi-Rite's lavendar.. but hushhh don't tell anyone : )
author: Jenna L.

description:
As far as ice cream in San Francisco goes... I'm typically a Mitchell's fan, but after visiting Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous... I might become an ice cream deferent.

This place is definitely out of the way, but it's definitely worth it. Their flavors are unique, and delicious. The ice cream is smooth and creamy. And the service is friendly and fast.

I tried: 
Watermelon Wheat (from 21st Amendment)
Birthday Cake
Pink Squirrel
Citrus Rum Raisin

All were different, interesting, and definitely delicious. My favorite was the pink squirrel (made with almond and chocolate liquor...mmm). If you love ice cream, you definitely have to check out this place...

Mmmmmmmm.....so delicious.
author: Lucinda W.

description:
I've been going here since they opened. Actually, I think I even came by before they opened because I wanted to try them so badly.

I live near Ocean Beach and whenever I'm, oh, let's say within 7 miles of this place and I'm craving ice cream, this is where I go.

I have a serious sweet tooth and I've tried them all. HC, Bi-rite, Three Twins, Mitchell's, Pollyanne, Joe's, you name it. M&MM wins hands down against most of these (Bi-rite is close.)

Their plain old vanilla destroys almost all other icecreams in town. Everything here is home made and delicious. Yes, they rotate flavors constantly but they usually have a staple or two on the menu board.

Even the few flavors I've tried that I didn't like were awesome. Chew on that for a while.

The staff is always great. Never had any attitude, just gratitude.

They have two kinds of sprinkles. They are generous with the whipped cream.

You know what else? A clean bathroom, which is really weird for an ice cream shop, but it has come in handy a few times.

I absolutely love this place.
author: Matt J.

description:
I love that we're now in a place where we have sooo many interesting flavors to choose from when it comes to ice cream.  Was in the area for a business meeting and as I walk across the street I see the name of one of my bookmarks staring me right in the face: Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous!!  

Okay, I'll wait till after my meeting (pout)...but wait!!  someone's running late so we're gonna grab ice cream?? AWESOME!!! =D

I tried the Earl Grey Tea ice cream in their waffle cone...wonderful!!  Just enough cream so I'm not feeling like smacking as if I'm eating peanut butter, but also not feeling so light that I feel like I'm eating sorbet either.

Like I said, with so many choices, I may not make a special trip out here...but if I'm in the area again, you'll find me indecisively staring at their menu. ;-)
author: Ninja H.

description:
A hot, sunny summer day called for some ice cream, except I didn't want to wait in the line at Bi-Rite. There was only a line of 5 people in front which allowed me to mull over which of the 8-9 flavors to try and get. I ended up with the White Rabbit (like the Asian candy) with condensed milk and bits of white chocolate chips in every bite. I loved it! Tried some other flavors. Standouts were the English Black Tea and Bourbon & Caramel.

Given the ease of parking and a shorter line, I might have to tip the scales slightly to Mr. and Mrs. over Bi-Rite.
author: Rick T.

description:
Pink Squirrel, all decadent with your Crème de Noyaux and Crème de Cacao. You are excellent.

Likewise English Black Tea and that flaky, chewy morsel of toasted coconut marshmallow. Get in mah bellay.

But then you, Black & Tan...I thought it was going to be a long, torrid affair between us. Seriously, porter and ale and ice cream and me. How could we ever go wrong? Written in the stars, practically.

But it didn't work out after all. Not sure why. I tried and tried with each spoonful to go, "Aha! Our flame is kindled at last" But no. 

Made me sad, a little. 

Made me sadder still that instead of living just 2 miles away from this place I now live 800. But all's made up for by the other awesome scoops and the marshmallow (which says something big because I usually hate marshmallows.)   

Just don't go anywhere soon, got it? Stay there in your humble corner in Dogpatch, so I can find you again next time I'm home.

4+ Stars (minus the tear shed for the Black & Tan)
author: Mr K.

description:
This place is great! I had the Crema Catalena, hot damn that shit was amazeballz. It was extremely rich, you can tell that the Ice cream itself contained a lot more cream rather than air, in its churning process. It wasn't too sweet either, although if you had a large piece of ice cream with the syrup that is drizzled on top that shizz will give you a sugar rush. I highly recommend the Crema Catalena.

I dont think it is better or worse than the other three most popular SF ICE CREAM parlors, but unique in its flavors. I know organic is a really big deal now a days but I love ice cream and I'll enjoy it artificial or not. Enough about my rant.
author: Luigi B.

description:
I will take your Bi-Rite and your Humphrey Slocombe and I will raise you one Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. And I will win, because they are the best. There is simply no room for discussion on this point. I defy anyone to find something superior to their candied violet ice cream, or their Earl Grey, or their croquantino (hazelnuts, orange liqeur), or their basil chip. I also defy you to find any ice cream store employees who pack their pints as densely as Miscellaneous, if that's something you care about. It's a fairly impressive feat to see them fit that one last scoop into an already overfull container.

Come early because they sell out early. Suck on that, HumphBi SloRite. You've been replaced.
author: Corinna K.

description:
WOW - so yummie. Reminds me of my childhood. Such great ice cream, operated by a lovely couple. 

I had the chocolate chip and bourbon caramel, both were great. I topped it with rum butter sauce - which was out of this world. 

I love this place. It's a shame they close at 6PM.

Make sure to try it.
author: Too M.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place :D
My friend got Salted Caramel which I had a bite of and was pleasantly surprised.
i got the Pink Squirrel which was GREAT - the best thing about the ice cream here is that it isn't too sweet.  This place is a hidden gem for sure!
author: Christina July K.

description:
I'm a sucker for coffee flavored ice creams, and was immediately drawn to the Spiced Coffee at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  It was rich in coffee flavor with a gentle hint of peppery spice - I could not have asked for anything more.  The 50 cents for a cone was definitely worth it - the flavor in each bite of the cone contributed as much to the experience as did the ice cream.
