MMM offers an abundance of space to sit and enjoy your cone, unlike many of the popular ice cream places in SF.  Although MMM is situated in a seedy part of San Francisco, I will definitely be back for more!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Best ice cream in SF hands down! They have really improved their recipe. The flavors are no longer too sweet, and they constantly churn out creative flavors. Memorable favorites have included corn with salted caramel and an orange liquor ice cream with hazelnut crunch. However, even basics like cookies and cream, earl gray, or just plain chocolate are reliable favorites.

Their cones are also delicious- they have such a delicate crunch and the perfect nutty taste. 

Best of all, no trip is complete without their butter toffee peanut cookies. They are SO addicting!! They top each cookie off with Maldon salt, with gives your tongue a zing with every chewy, crunchy, caramely bite of cookie.
author: Nicole L.

description:
BEST quality ice cream i've ever had, even better than Bi-Rite and Ici! :O
The owners Ian and Anne are super nice! 
And their cookies are really delicious, too! thin and soft and... just perfect really :) 

I also love that it's in the Dogpatch. They've gotten really popular so there's often a line out the door now, but it's still pretty easy to find parking in that area and it's kind of quaint and charming :)
author: C K.

description:
I'd love to review their ice cream, but this is a review solely of their customer service  and the shop's design lay-out.

Before yesterday, I attempted to go there three times during regular business hours only to find them closed.  Finally caught them open yesterday; three people were working behind the counter and they were just going up to random people standing at the counter to take orders, rather than asking who was next or attempting to figure out the line.  Get a number system if you don't want to deal with who's next... www.takeanumbersystems.com

The flow and layout of the place is weird, and if they've got a full house like yesterday, you are running into people who are trying to order and people trying to pay and people trying to leave.  There are so many tables and benches that there's only one way out without walking on furniture.  How is that legal and up to fire code?

I ended up leaving without ordering anything; won't be back unless some changes take place.  Ice cream is a dime a dozen in this town, took my business elsewhere and got exactly what I was looking for.
author: J B.

description: This place is legit. I like the husband and wife owners and how they have like punk style, but make excellent ice cream. It's awesome. I like the jasmine green tea, the birthday cake, orange blossom, mint chip, and salted caramel, because those are the only ones I've ever had and really liked them all. They are a little pricey, but I think it's worth it. Plus, they're newer, so I don't mind spending a little more than I'm used to :)
author: Kelly B.

description:
i was really excited to try mr and mrs miscellaneous.  the location is a bit out of the way.  its in dogpatch and while we live near att we dont really ever venture down 3rd street unless its for food.  the space has high ceilings and the decor is pretty simple.  little glass yogurt cups serve as vases and milk bottles serve as water dispensers.

a lot of people compare this place to birite or humphrey slocombe.  i think the ice cream texture is a bit more alike with humphrey slocombe's.  its not as rich and creamy as birites.  birites is so fatty creamy that it doesnt really melt if you leave it out.

i would come back to try other flavors though
author: claudia y.

description: WOW This place is awesome! Blew my ice-cream mind! I got the Green tea and jasmine tea ice cream! Two of my favorite types of teas infused into an ice-cream= GENIUS! Sampled a bunch of the other unique flavors and they were just as tasty and delicious. I love the ambiance of the place too. It's very artsy and located in an industrial area. Reminds me of Icy's in Berkeley. I would come here all the time if I lived in Norcal haha. I wish they had this in Socal. :( Ice cream this good should be available to everyone to show them what they are missing out on!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Nothing against this place/ the way it is operated, but I just didn't like the flavors here.  I tried the pumpkin seed brittle and pink squirrel, and didn't really love either.  So then I tried the cookies and cream, which was pretty standard. I felt weird asking to try more flavors, so I ended up getting a junior scoop of the pink squirrel with hot fudge. The hot fudge sucked. It was too thick and completely hardened once it was on the ice cream.  Not to be mean, because the guys here were nice, but I really do think even chains like Baskin Robbins and Ben & Jerry's have better ice cream than this place...  

Their cookies and malt balls and stuff looked intriguing, but I'm not in a rush to come back here.
author: Richa A.

description: Still my fave, but added some more tasty flavors to the mix.  Definitely try basil chocolate chip.  I know it sounds weird, but it's good! And pink squirrel is another awesome blend.  We also tried lemon poppy which was refreshing during these hot summer days.  I could go for some right now....
author: Evie B.

description:
Old Fashion hands down, the flavor to try.

Very creative and unique flavors. Expect to wait in line a short while as this place is popular. 

Parking on a weekend is no problem as it's a bit out of the way from popular areas. Easily accessible from the Caltrain's 22nd St stop. Muni stop one block away was easy access to and from Embarcadero or Downtown.

Flavors tried: 
Old Fashion- all I can say is that I never knew Maker's Mark could be delicious and manly all at the same time. The cherries retain the alcohol so enjoy as you bite into them.

Banana- subtle yet flavorful creaminess of bananas. I recommend mixing it with another flavor or even one of their cookies.

Definitely a great find, next time I will try and get their early enough to get a home-made ice cream cone.
author: Moises G.

description:
I love ice cream!

Trust me.  If I'm in a bad mood, ice cream will lift my spirits.  Not good for my health, but still better than seeing me angry.

Why I love Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous:

1) Convenience
Driving in from Brisbane, Mitchell's is just as close.  But I have to circle around for parking if there's no spots in the Mitchell's lot. On a sunny day in SF, Mitchell's always has a line out the door.  Bi-Rite's the same problem: no parking!  But MMM has plenty of parking and the Dogpatch is this hidden gem of a neighborhood in SF that when you walk around, there's a lot more than warehouses.

2) Seating
MMM is probably double the size of Mitchell's and Bi-Rite.  There's plenty of tables and chairs inside for you to enjoy your ice cream.  The place reminds me of Blue Bottle in the Mint Plaza.

3) Simple menu with fresh ingredients!
Chocolate malted was creamy.  The vanilla was probably one of the best vanilla ice creams I've had in my life (and I've always been a vanilla lover over chocolate).  They have a simple menu -- only 8 flavors were on the board when we were there.  But since I love vanilla, this was a big win for me!

I can't wait to go back and try a new flavor!
author: Aura J.

description: The ice cream here is delicious. Highly recommend that you stop by and grab some ice cream if you are in the area
author: Scoot S.

description: Their English black tea ice cream was hella good! Far from everywhere location and a lame name (Mr. & Mrs. whaat?) can be easily overlooked. Must try!
author: Y T.

description:
Lemon Verbena and.....maybe Black tea ice cream!
I'm super grateful that this deliverance of an ice cream shop is in my neighborhood. Their flavors are always different and I usually want to try all of them. To me they are better than Bi-rite, Humphrey Slocumbe and others nearby. Wish they had longer hours, then I'd be there ALL the time.
author: Lee M.

description: Delicious ice cream in a cozy space. Friendly service. The fancy flavors make me feel classy.
author: Anna B.

description: Love the ice cream here, but the hours are a joke ! I wish they stayed open until after dinner.
author: Diana G.

description: Love this place! My favorite favors so far are: the chicory coffee, lemon with blackberry, always craving their earl grey and the Choco toffee cookies always hit the spot when craving sweets! There are so many flavors that I've experienced here I can't remember all the others I've tried...
author: Tiff L.

description: Good ice cream, but not as good as Bi-rite. The ingredient-to-cream ratio is a bit too far on the cream side here, making everything taste milkier and washing out the particular flavor. And if you do find a flavor you like, good luck ever getting it again. They make ice cream in very small batches and when they run out of a particular drum, that's it.
author: Winston L.

description:
I think what most people are missing in their reviews when they compare this place to Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe is that the texture of the ice cream is different here. I've heard different people describe the texture differently, but basically it's less creamy, so for many people it's more refreshing and not as heavy.

The flavors can get pretty interesting like rosemary pistachio and lemon poppy, and they're all good and change often. (Though I still like the bigger selection at Humphry Slocombe better.) They also have baked goods; I have not tried them.
author: Anton S.

description:
Blog Post - http://dabblewith.com/2013/05/18/truly-miscellaneous-ice-cream-mrmrs-miscellaneous/

AMAZING
Ian Flores and Annabelle Topacio have pastry chef pedigree, opened Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous an Ice Cream Creamery in Dogpatch in the spring of 2010. Flores previously worked at Wolfgang Puck at Spago in Southern California and Maui and CUT in Beverly Hills. While Topacio  previously worked at Chez Panisse and Brickmaiden Breads. Now they run the light filled black and white decorated shop with vintage flare (sweets sold from large mason jars) is located on the corner of 3rd street and 22nd street.

They serve a unique range of flavored organic ice cream but they also have delicious  fresh cookies, caramels, toppings, cones and brittles. The toppings, cones and syrups are homemade as well. If you're not a fan of new ice cream flavors they always have some classics (chocolate, vanilla, etc) but if you like to experiment they have two groups of unique flavors. One is child friendly with flavors ranging from White sesame, Candied violet, PB &J. The second is more for adults (+21) with flavors like honey-wine (Ethiopian honey mead), Manhattan (inspired by their namesake cocktails), and ballpark (a mix of anchor steam beer, roasted peanuts, chocolate-covered pretzel). These two are not looking to have a signature flavor rather they want their customers to trust there will always be something you will like. So far they have forced me to try new things because my previous flavors are rare on the chalk board. Below are some of my favorites:

Ice Cream:images

English Tea
Extra Coffee
Old Fashioned (a mix of Markers Mark and Cherries)
Dark Chocolate Sunday (definitely share with a friend)
Sweets:

Chocolate Chip Cookies
Individually wrapped Carmel
Price: mr-and-mrs-miscellaneous

$1.00 to add a cone
$3.50 single scoop
$4.75 double scoop
$5.75 tripple scoop
$6.50 sunday
$14.99 (Quart)
Hours: 

Tues-Sat 11:30am - 6:00pm
Sunday 11:30 am - 5:00pm
Definitely try Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous to compare it to other local ice cream creameries: Mission Hill, Mitchell's, Br-Rite and Humphry Slocombe.I find Mr & Mrs. Miscellaneous near the top of my favorite local creameries. SF Weekly named Mr & Mrs. Miscellaneous as 2012′s Best Ice Cream so just a heads up with summer right around the corner I doubt their line will be short!
author: Cameron M.

description:
WOWZERS (and I don't say that very often)!  This place is amazing.  

1. You don't have to wait in line like you do at Bi-Rite.
2. It's not pretentious like Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite.
3. They let you taste more than 2 flavors (unlike Bombay Ice Creamery).
4. There are places to sit unlike Three Twins.
5. It's clean unlike Bi-Rite and (Bombay Ice Creamery - good thing this place closed).
6. There are COMFORTABLE places to sit unlike Bi-Rite and (Bombay Ice Creamery - although, I never even tried to eat my ice cream there).

The ice cream is creamy and delicious and the flavors are unique.  The only downside is that some times they run out of certain flavors, but there's enough to choose from that it doesn't put a damper on the experience at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Flavors are not complex, too simple (even though they may sound fancy shmancy) and often just not very flavorful or too sweet. Something about this ice cream just misses the mark and I wouldn't waste my calories here but if you like Smitten or Bi-Rite, you'll probably like this place. The ingredients are high quality and you should come see if you like the flavors. The space is great, with huge walls of windows to let you enjoy the daylight.

Exception: Bi-rite strawberry balsamic kills it and is nothing like Mr & Mrs.
author: Marina N.

description:
The great thing about this place is that they don't make a huge amount of ice cream flavors in a day. That way, it's easier to make a decision and that they make flavors that are all delicious. They basically aren't spreading themselves thin. 

Not only is the ice cream served by a cute hipster-ish guy with amazing eyelashes, but you get to enjoy your ice cream too! The establishment is super clean and in such a cute neighborhood which is almost a hidden part of the city. I highly recommend this place over all the other crowded places in the Mission (i.e. Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe).
author: Rylan C.

description: Best ice cream in SF in my opinion. Beats Bi-Rite and all those other ice cream joints in SF. Love the celebration cake ice cream. Plus the staffs are really friendly!
author: Meuy S.

description: I LOVE this place!  HOT FUDGE SUNDAE is the first thing i ordered when i first came here and i haven't tried anything else! I highly recommend this place!
author: Kris B.

description:
Not your old boring ice-cream shop.  
This place is seriously awesome:

1) Inventive flavors: basil with chocolate? PB&J? fernet branca? (yeah look that up)  pink squirrel?  (now, don't take it too literally).  
My favorite is Earl Grey.  Their tea flavors are just intense and delicious.  I highly recommend.  Menu changes daily - you will always find something you like. 

2) Best cones ever: seriously crunchy, fresh-made, sometimes even warm!  Everyone wants to finish strong with an ice-cream cone, and with these cones, you will!  

3) Nice, friendly, happy owners.  

Easy parking, lines not crazy.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Croquantino does it for me.
The have delicious non ice cream treats here like cookies and peanut brittle.
Naturally they are also delicious.
author: Geordie E.

description: I wish I could give 5 stars but I felt ignored and slightly confused when I first got there. Once I was able to get someones attention and actually get the icecream it was great. Definitely a special treat that I'd recommend to friends. You have to have cash if you spend less than $5. Luckily my friend picked up the tab for me.
author: Tali L.

description: Continuing my ice cream tour of San Francisco, I had to visit this place as recommended by most top ten lists near the dog patch. Luckily, I was able to beat the rush and arrive just in time to be able to sample almost all the flavors being served that day. My server was nice enough to let me try sampling until I found the flavors I wanted and told me not to be shy about it as well, which was very encouraging (great service is always appreciated). I finally decided on pink squirrel (super interesting flavor), strawberry quick (essentially strawberry nesquik flavor), and ovaltine. The scoops were big and with an inverted cone cost me $8. I wish the sample scoops were just a bit bigger as it was hard to get a good gauge on the flavors. Nonetheless, I would definitely recommend this creamery to other ice cream enthusiasts.
author: Maurice C.

description:
I've crowned this place my favorite ice cream shop.  Right in up-and-coming Dogpatch neighborhood.

I think it's better than Humphry Slocombe, the flavors are more organic and tasty. At least that's what my taste buds are saying today.  They are sometimes fickle, you know, so tomorrow they can tell me differently. But for now, it's my favorite ice cream shop. No argument, please. 

I can never order a scoop, in fact it's always a pint to take home that lasts me two weeks. Don' t know how that's possible.  Here are some of my favorites:

Black Tea, Chai Tea, Jasmine, can't go wrong with any of the tea flavor. 
Lavender
Basil
Lemon Verbana
Any ice cream with burnt sugar

More to add to this list, I'm sure.
author: Thuy V.

description: This is actually my favorite ice cream spot in SF. They're a bit out of the way and close early so I can't make it as much as I'd like but when I do it's always a treat. The flavors are unique and every-time I've been they have some kind of grown-up alcohol infused ice cream which is always a plus in my book. The pink squirrel will always have a special place in my heart. I definitely recommend getting a cookie or another treat to take home for later.
author: Holly E.

description:
It's not Bi-Rite, but it's pretty darn good. Wasn't a fan of the pink squirrel but I did like the unique kabocha squash flavor! The ice cream with little malt balls in it was awesome too.

Another plus for their chocolate cherrie cookie. Buttery deliciousness.

To echo some of the reviewers, I would agree the texture is not as creamy as Bi-Rite. In fact when my husband ate his first bite his comment was, "The texture is a little icy." (and he doesn't read Yelp)

Also the line moves soooo slowly. At least it's pretty easy to find parking though. Half the time spent going to Bi-Rite is trying to find parking.
author: Jen K.

description: Of the "big 3" ice cream shops in SF (mr and mrs, Humphrey slocombe, and birite) mr and mrs is my fav. Their flavors are more "classic" and the texture of their ice cream is superior. I wish they had a few other locations and I wish they were open later.
author: Ben M.

description:
I never realized how popular Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous was until I tried to run in and grab some pints and they were sold out of 7 out of 10 flavors and the line was out the door. I finally had to face the facts. They are really really good. 

They're even starting to expand to secret non-dairy options for vegans/lactose intolerant people! A very nice evolution indeed. My person of male persuasion got a scoop of their strawberry basil sorbet, even though he is neither vegan nor particularly lactose intolerant. It was very refreshing with good texture, and yes was tasty too.  

Current SF ice cream hierarchy: 
Humphrey Slocombe [greater than] Mr. & Mrs. Misc. [greater than] Bi-Rite/Mitchell's

Their flavors aren't crazy combo's like Humphrey Slocombe's but they're not as namby pamby vanilla-y as Bi-Rite's. In particular,  I like how they make single flavor alcoholic ice creams like Cassis or Fernet (not as strong as you think it might be) 

Cones were made in house, but their cone machine broke the other day. 

$10 minimum for credit cards.

Also, there are occasionally $5 wine tastings down the street from them at Sutton Cellars (!!)
author: Andrea L.

description:
Sometimes you just want a little something different then your average vanilla. I mean why do people buy B&J's? 

I am so glad I stopped in at this little gem. The Egg Nog ice cream is awesome. Smooth, creamy, delicious. Very clean seating area, and just a nice place to take a minute to get back to being a little kid again. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a little kick to their ice cream.
author: James A.

description: If you're an ice cream lover and seeker of city sweets, you will fall head over heals for Mr. and Mrs. These guys are taking the birite out of ice cream and i love it! They've got flavors that'll knock your socks off without the line. They're friendlier and appreciative of friendly smiles in return. I try to make this place a weekend habit. .. oh and grab a warm, homemade cookie while you're at it.
author: Betsy F.

description:
Husband and Wife owned ice cream shop with it's non-commericalized interior and funky flavors. I've been here on numerous occasions and the ice creams never disappointed me. 

They always have new flavors and the the lines are usually long if you go on peak hours but the service is great and the waffles are made on the spot!

I love this place :)
author: Sophie S.

description:
WHOA!
CASHEW BUTTER! WINNER!
Amazingly velvety-rich ice cream and a beautiful scoop at that!
Paired it with their chicory coffee, which is about everything you could hope for in a coffee ice cream and a little more. The flavor of the coffee overwhelmed the butter if you ate them together, but separately, amazing.

It's a very solid ice cream shop with a steady flow of business tucked away in a more industrial part of SF. Definitely a must try!
author: Christopher S.

description: Good portions for it's price, environmentally friendly, unique flavors lots of space inside and parking can be challenging when they're busy
author: Cee B.

description:
The first time I came here, I had high hopes because my friend raved about it.  I looked at the favors offered that day, and most of them didn't suit my tastebuds.  But given i am such an ice cream lover, as long as the ice cream isn't too sweet, I am willing to give it a second shot.

I came back a few weeks later, and finally they ha a flavor that I like: Black Tea!  It has a rich tea flavor.. yummy.  BUT the waffle cone was disappointing though.  Even though they made it fresh (and they were really slow at it), it was stale.  

Ok, third time I came back.... the line was SUPER long and it was moving VERY SLOW!  And, the flavors weren't very interesting either.  i really couldn't pick out a flavor that I like.  And when they run out of one flavor they don't always have a replacement.  I really want to love this ice cream shop but I just couldn't find any flavors that I like.  

And another thing that's bad about this shop is the they close too early.  I usually go for ice-cream after dinner, but they close at 5 on Sun and 6 on other days!!!!
author: Lillian T.

description:
I'm pretty boring when it comes to ice cream, it's always mint chocolate or vanilla.  But when I looked at the board, neither of my go-to flavors were being served that day so I was forced to sample something new.  Lemon Poppyseed?  A bit too sweet for my palette.  I didn't want to be that girl that samples everything so I got the Earl Grey Tea flavor without trying and boy was that the most spontaneous and best decision I ever made!  It was delicious!!  For those that love coffee or tea flavored ice cream, I recommend trying the Earl Grey... it won't disappoint!  My sister got the black sesame and it was good too, took me back to my childhood days when my grandma would make me a hot bowl of black sesame paste in her apartment. 

This place is pretty simple looking but they really don't need any sprucing... it's their ice cream that attracts customers, not the lack of decor.  I would love to visit again and sample all their flavors, but I would probably end up ordering the Earl Grey Tea again. And again.
author: Panina H.

description: This Ice Cream is fantastic! Some of the best I've ever had. There's pretty much always a line out the door, but it moves pretty quickly and is worth the wait. I had the Almond Butter with Carmel topping and it was great! My girlfriend had the Grasshopper and Mango Lime Chili. They were both interesting and quite good. They are always changing up their flavors, so there's always a reason to go back, which I will!
author: Adam K.

description:
OOOOHHHH SNAP!  i should write this blurb in all caps cause this place is off the mother f-ing chain.  flavors bursting my mellon.

flavs like:  just chocolate...its so rich.  FIVE SPICE!! wow dude, thats hot. and the best was this IPA flavor.

what's banging like a sorority chick on a boozy friday night,  the FLOATS man.  the floats will make you forget about dissing the Marina sluts because, after all, you are all the way over in Potrero hill/dog patch on 3rd, and the honey badger doesnt give a shIT!   

its all about this yummy flavors,  lots of seating in a very cool corner joint.  you feel safe here, unlike most places around the bay view and bernal heights.

Pros:  
-house made waffle cones
-amazing flavors
-seating
-combo options
-other edibles (no, not the special 420 ones, ass)

possible cons:  
-distance from job and or house, real life?? (great get away lol)
- not the price unless you eat a crap ton of ice cream.  its pricer than most but WELL WORTH THE TANTALIZING TASTE.

your taste buds will thank you.  

COMPOSTABLE MATERIALS, cup, spoons, etc.
author: Zach S.

description:
I have a new favorite dessert shop in town.  And when I mean favorite, I mean that I want to set up camp in this shop and live there forever.

After a fab brunch at Serpentine with L, we walked out and saw the ice cream cone painted on the side of the building.  Could it be..?  YES.  MR. AND MRS. MISCELLANEOUS!

I'm a bad SOMA resident because I rarely wander out to Potrero Hill, even though it's literally a stone's throw away, and there's parking aplenty.  I had this bookmarked a few months ago but then just never bothered driving down here.  Even though we were stuffed, we knew we had to go in because both of us had read about it on Yelp.

The girl was super nice and let us try each of the flavors while explaining what was in it, what she liked, etc.  The flavors that day were Orange Chip, Pannetone (Italian sweet bread), Chocolate Malted Crunch, Peppermint, Eggnog, Salted Caramel, and a few others I can't remember.

Each flavor is creamy, not artificially sweet, and full of rich flavor.  I went for the Orange Chip, since it reminded me of Orange Milano cookies and had the same type of texture as mint chocolate chip ice cream.  Love at first lick (insert dirty joke here).

Mind.  Blown.

Aside from the ice cream, they have toppings, floats and desserts like cookies, salted caramels, and almond and peanut brittle.  They would make great stocking stuffers for anyone with a sweet tooth.

Best of all, they take credit cards with at least a $5 minimum, which I had no problem meeting with a jar of almond brittle and my little Junior-sized scoop of ice cream ($2.50).

CCG is back in love, and this time, it ain't with a man.
author: Tori S.

description:
Got caramel ice cream with Mexican coke float. $6

Ice cream tasted yum.

Plenty of street parking.
author: qirk z.

description:
Came here on a afternoon after grabbing some Hard Knox across the street not knowing this place was an ice cream parlor.

I decided to yelp it before coming in and it seemed interesting. Reminds me a lot like Bi-Rite ice cream but they're still unique in their own way. 

Overall, the ice cream flavors are very unique: candied violet, horchata, salted caramel, basil, yellow peach, vanilla bean, and a few others i cant remember. Although they are pretty sweet, they're really flavorful too.

Also, they're very green. everything they use is compostable. 

They make their own cones.

They have their own peanut brittle. peanut butter malt balls? damn!
author: Kenny L.

description:
I cannot get over how good this place is. Stopped in with my three very young kids for the first time recently. A rare hot day; of course it was busy. And all three kids wanted to try about 3 flavors each. To start, they were very patient and understanding, even though there was a line of customers. They had lots of smiles and questions for the kids; they didn't rush them. 

We picked three flavors to share: Pink Squirrel, Chocolate Malted Crunch, and Earl Grey. Around $6, and the scoops were huge--much bigger than Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe. Now, I consider myself an ice cream connoisseur (with the guilty secret of having personally put back about a quart a week during my last pregnancy), and I had a difficult time deciding which was the most delicious, since they were all so perfectly delectable! I'm pretty sure the other customers (all adults) got a kick out of seeing how quickly my three amigos devoured that stuff. After the feast was over (perhaps 6 or 7 minutes later), my two older kids declared that they both preferred the Earl Grey. An unexpected statement for sure, since one of the other flavors was pink, and the other was chocolate. Just more testament to how good they all were.

I loved how clean and minimal the decor was--just as light and pure and no-nonsense as the ice cream. Next time I'm definitely trying the caramels...
author: Lisa K.

description:
Interesting ice cream flavors, great quality, and an ever-changing menu. The owners were really nice and helpful. Great family feel. 
 
Me: "Do you guys do any cookies gluten-free?" 
Owner #1: "We firmly believe in doing a small number of things right. If we're going to jeopardize the taste of the product, we won't do it." 

And that my friends, is true dedication to your craft.

Highly recommended for SF residents & visitors. This is a must-try!
author: Ashish P.

description:
Better than Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe ...
cuz they've got unique, innovative flavors that compliment each other well.  
And homemade cones! I think dad of Mrs was making them(?!)...
Mr & Mrs are super friendly...always with a smile on their face.
Wish they were open longer than 11:30a-6p...
and their ware is compostable! yay to being green.
fun flavors like pink squirrel: creme de cacao + creme de noyeau (almond)
normal flavors like chocolate chip; chocolate with toasted almonds; coffee;
Even their cookies are damn good. 
Next, I gotta try their peanut brittle!
author: Melissa F.

description: I've never ventured out to the Dog Patch before but this is def a reason to go back. good ice cream period. also, nice and spacey place to sit and relax.
author: Queena T.

description:
Scenario.

Girl asks me to run to the store to get 12 figs.

Let's pretend for a moment I only bring back 4.

As you can imagine, she'd be pissed a la Vince Vaughn and Jennifer Aniston in the lemon scene in "The Breakup."

But...I bring back 16.

(They were a bit small so I covered my ass on this one.)

Since I brought back more as opposed to less than expected, why isn't the reaction I get the opposite?  All I got was a puzzled stare.

Math & logic time!!

Less = mad.

More = confused.

Lesson learned?

Do what she says = live another day & fly under the radar.

Anyways, figs are weird, as are the delicious combinations of flavors at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous (say that 5x fast).

I love this place but word to the wise...get there early as they often run out of stock and close.

Inventory.
author: Archie R.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream place - hands down!  The ice cream has the perfect balance of creaminess and it's not too sweet.  They have interesting flavors and they change every day.  The staff said that they are just as surprised as the customers about what flavors are available each day.  My favorites are:  almond butter, cookies and cream, jasmine green tea, and chicory coffee.  They also make my favorite chocolate chip cookie.  The chips really big so they are more like chunks.  The cookie is thick, moist, and chewy.

This place is pretty strict about closing time so don't think that you can sneak in there after they close.

I hear that they serve delicious breakfast pastries in the morning.  Haven't tried yet but maybe some day.
author: Y K.

description:
After trying most of the ice cream shops in the city i finally got around to eating at Mr and Mrs and i was pleasantly surprised. 

i went a couple times and I can't believe that my favorite flavor so far has been candied violet.(at least i think that was the name) Seeing as i absolutely hate the taste of flowers in, well, pretty much anything, the fact that i love this flavor really shows me how amazing their ice cream is.  The violet flavor isn't overpowering at all, yet its still obviously there.  I never missed the violet, but i also never felt overwhelmed by the taste of perfume as most flower flavored sweets tend to be, and the little bits of the candied flower in the actual ice cream added a nice texture. The servers were all really nice and although I did try a couple of other flavors, none of them really stick out in my mind. 

Overall I really enjoyed the ice cream here and will definitely return in the future since their menu is always rotating. i would recommend everyone to come and try their flavors if they have the chance. 

Ps. their cookies are pretty bad ass too.
author: Domingo D.

description:
I have discovered my ice cream nirvana.

I have very few vices, but ice cream is one of them. I've been to Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Mitchell's, Ice Cream Bar, Xanath, and a couple others in this fine city of ours. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is BY FAR my favorite.

Like BRC and HS (sorry, I'm a lazy typer), M & MM has some amazingly creative flavors but unlike the former ones, M & MM has a slightly higher proportion of milk to cream. This means that the creamy fattiness doesn't block the punch of flavor. Plus, since there's a slightly lower fat content (I say slightly, because it is still ice cream people) it freezes the slightest bit more solid and therefore melts slower. And when you want to savor every tiny mouthful of ice cream decadence, that melting rate is a divine gift.

My life-changing ice cream experience was due to their candied violet. It's made with a lemon ice cream base which is flavored with lemon oil/lemon zest so that you get that essence of lemon without the tartness. Then bits of candied violet are mixed in for a pop of crunchy texture, color and a mild floral flavor. It costs an extra fifty cents, but it's totally worth it. Trust me.

I can die happy now.
author: Amanda S.

description:
"Ovaltine...they should call it roundtine"

Came to this place yesterday an there was a small line nothing crazy. I decided on the  Ovaltine and the cheesecake, first off before I talk about the ice creams while you wait in line you see all the candy and cookies. I wanted to try the peanut butter malt balls but I had to control myself there's always next time. The ice cream here is unrivaled in San Francisco if it wasn't so far from Russian Hill it'd be my go to ice cream joint. I had the scoops of Ovaltine and cheesecake on a waffle cone. The Ovaltine doesn't sound great but I might argue its the best I've ever had it was that good. The cheesecake was like biting into a bite of it and it has bits of graham cracker for a little crunch. If you haven't been here you're missing out.
author: Greg T.

description:
I finally made it out here after all the neighbors kept insisting how great this place was and that we should just go already because it's "down the street."  But with all the great ice creameries in San Francisco, I gotta say that living here is turning me into an ice cream elitist.  So coming to any new place always makes me a little skeptical.  Will it live up to its hype?

Turns out trying a new ice cream place like this can still blow my mind.  So my first impression when I walk in, the space is absolutely gorgeous.  Tall floor to ceiling windows, and modern but warm decor.  Just the way I like it.  

I stared at the menu for a few minutes - they definitely have very unique flavors. Many that I haven't seen on other ice cream menus.  Overwhelmed with choice, I decided to ask for whatever their most popular flavor was.  Candied violets?  Umm, ok.  I had no idea what this was going to taste like but one bite and I can't even explain how good it was.  Light and creamy, not too sweet even with those candied violets.

The boyfriend had the jasmine green tea ice cream which tasted exactly like jasmine and green tea.  It was in no way overpowering like it would be if you sipped jasmine green tea from the pot - it was sweet and refreshing.  It reminded me a little bit of Bombay Ice Cream's rose ice cream.  Ah, it was so good!  My only regret was not coming here sooner.
author: Jean A.

description:
3.5 star review (Yelp, can I recommend a 1/2 star option).

Tried really hard to come here completely unbiased, but it's nearly impossible to not draw comparisons to Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe. Us San Franciscans are just ice cream blessed!

Arguably Mr. and Mrs. Misc. is good in it's own right and it's far more convenient to drive and park here versus going to the Mission. Both the flavors I've had here caramel w/ sea salt and chicory coffee are tasty but fall short of Bi-Rite's salted caramel and Humphry's Vietnamese coffee option. Both just deliver more precise and intense flavors.

Anyhow, if you're looking for a quick ice cream fix without fighting for parking and dealing with a line, Mr. and Mrs. Misc. is a good option. Oh, and their peanut brittle cookie is pretty lip smacking yummy.
author: David H.

description: I cry because I can't have this every day. The passion of the husband and wife duo shows in the unique flavors that they have on the menu here. Try everything. Love it all.
author: John B.

description: This ice cream place has an awesome name and their flavors are very unique, interesting, and tasty.We ordered the pink squirrel. Honestly it tasted so good that even though I was full from my lunch I still wanted to eat more of their ice cream once I was done. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Bourbon and caramel - NOMS!!!

This is such a cute, clean, classy ice cream parlor with friendly hipster service.  The prices are a tad higher than at other places, but the scoops are also larger so it balances out.  We got double scoops and these are plenty for one person.  The coffee flavor is also delicious, but the olive oil flavor is too rich to eat an entire scoop.  Next time I'll have to try the burnt sugar flavor or some of the many enticing baked goods! They also have great, sturdy spoons.  ;-)
author: Vicente G.

description:
what pushed this place from four to five was that the people who work here are GREAT. Not only do they have delicious, delicious ice cream, the people are super friendly and great to talk with and buy ice cream from!!

Went to get one scoop, ended up getting 2 pints. Beer and Brittle were UHHmaziing!! caramel sea salt and gingerbread also delicious!! 

it was hard to not buy every flavor in pint form.
author: Nanette W.

description:
Yum for the candied violet. Has flavored (violet?) sugar rocks in a creamy, fresh, and smooth ice cream. The added waffle cone made it better!
I didn't find it too floral and it reminded me of fruity pebbles in terms of flavor. I would come back just for this.
author: Jayme N.

description: Fun artisanal flavors, but a little thin for my taste. It's also quite expensive for the portion size you get. Still, the ice cream is inventive and very, very good.
author: Michael S.

description:
Located in the emerging Dogpatch neighborhood in San Francisco, this ice cream parlor is a true "mom and pop" ice cream parlor in the best sense of the words.  

The interior space of the store is wonderful, with high ceilings in a converted warehouse space located in a corner storefront.  The space is light and airy, and has plenty of comfortable chairs and tables for all to sit and enjoy the rotating array of unique ice cream flavors concocted by the young couple who own the store (the eponymous Mr. and Mrs.  Miscellaneous).   You will probably see some favorite flavors on the chalkboard, as well as a few flavors that you have never hear of before.  Go ahead, don't be afraid to try an unfamiliar flavor.  Mr. and Mrs. M are happy to spoon up free samples to help you decide.

I decided on the Honeywine and Halva flavors, and enjoyed both.  The flavors were distinct yet delicate, and definitely had that creamy rich texture I associate with the Straus Creamery.

There's also a great array of freshly baked cookies and handmade candies (peanut and almond brittle, homemade caramels, and malted milk balls).  I will have to try these next time.

With the moderate prices, comfortable interior (with plentiful seating!), and friendly, unpretentious service, I almost hate to share my great new discovery with everyone, but I will join my fellow yelpers in singing the praises of Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous's ice cream parlor.
author: Elaine L.

description:
When is MMM ever open?  Seems like every time I walk over there (I live nearby), it is closed.  They used to post their flavors and daily hours on Facebook, but that has fallen by the wayside.  I have given up going there, and will go to Bi-Rite instead.

It's a shame, cuz I love the texture and unique flavors of their ice cream. I would rate them at least 4 stars if they operated in a reliable manner. Good product, bad business practice.
author: Mike M.

description: Omfg! I love this place! Best ice cream I've ever had. I recommend the entire menu as well as their peanut butter chocolate balls.
author: Don A.

description: Was lucky enough to be brought here by my brother and sister-in-law when I visited from LA.  Definitely ranks up there with the best ice creams I've had in both LA and Boston.  Had the pink guava and almond jelly flavored and both were stupendous!  Plus very generous scoops!  Will def be back.
author: Art W.

description:
I'm sort of obsessed with ice cream...after growing up with a shop that one of the best ice cream bases I've ever had to date, when I move moved to SF I made it a point to try all the well known ice creams shops. I've tried BiRite and Humphrey and some others, but I can honestly say that Mr. and Mrs. hold their own. 

Their ice base is fabulous it's not too heavy, in fact, it's actually pretty light compared to a lot of the bases out there. They rotate flavors weekly and I've never been disappointment with a flavor selection. They're still too new to really have regular flavors, but I've been floored by their salted caramel and today I had their "Old Fashioned" which was Maker's Mark ice cream with cherries (presoaked in maker's mark) and almonds. It was glorious. 

The interior is really great too, they didn't mess around, the lighting is great and you really feel at ease ordering.

I look forward to getting Mr. and Mrs. every Saturday, and each week we've been there we find more and more people...yay!!
author: Tori M.

description: Amazingly delicious and creatively flavored ice cream. I had the basil and chicory coffee.
author: Luke W.

description:
it's monday and it's HOT AS #$(* why aren't you guys ever opened on monday. 

sometimes mondays need ice cream too.

boo to your hours.
author: R S.

description:
The boyfriend and I have been trying to come to this place many times...and it's always freaking closed for some reason.  We even made brunch plans at Serpentine one day knowing that it fell between the hours of this place being open.  Lo and behold they were on vacation that week.  I get it, you have a life, I just wish there was a way we could have checked online or something before.

Anyhow, we FINALLY made it out to the area when Mr. and Mrs. was open.  I ordered the croquantino and the chocolate with crispies.  I thoroughly enjoyed both of them!  The boyfriend got the malted cream, and I wasn't quite a fan of it...I wanted more of a vanilla flavor, but I know it wasn't vanilla they were going for...but whatever.

We'll definitely swing by this place again next time we're in the neighborhood, but with the luck we've had in the past trying to come here, I don't think we'll make a special effort just to come out for this.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: I loves me some ice cream and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous has been on my radar for awhile. Unfortunately, their hours make it a little tough to get in. It's well worth the trip though. Creative, inventive flavors that make delicious ice cream. I had the PB & J and Pink Squirrel. Both were really tasty. In a town with some heavy hitters on the ice cream scene (Bi-Rite, Humphry, Mitchell's, etc.) Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is holding their own and doing their thing. I didn't yet find a flavor that I'd put above Humphry's Secret Breakfast but have faith that if anyone could do it, it'd be Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Stephen S.

description:
With so many artisinal ice cream places popping up, I had to try this one as well. I mean, why not? I was a bit surprised to find that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous are located directly across the street from my aunt's old cafe that used to be there - back then the place was not as developed as it is now, so that was a pleasant surprise.

On to the ice cream! I love the setup of the whole store - nice, open space with a lot of tables and chairs for customers to enjoy their frozen treats. The staff is really nice and gladly lets you try whatever flavors you want. Like almost all ice cream places these days, tastings are done with metal spoons - makes me feel important!

I tried many of their flavors, however I really wished I tried their mung bean flavor - sounds interesting. But anyway, I tried their sweet cream (didn't do much for me, just whatever), almond with white choc and dried cranberries, honey graham (just vanilla ice cream with honey graham crackers mixed in) and the citrus flan with salted caramel mixed in. My favorite of those was the citrus flan flavor, so for $3.50, I got a single scoop of that in a cup (I probably should've gotten the cone, but oh well). 

The texture of the Mr. and Mrs.'s ice cream was more on the icy side rather than the smooth, creamy texture I usually like to have with my ice cream. For me, the ice crystals were just too large and took away some of the enjoyable-ness of the ice cream. Luckily when we went, there was no wait time - if I did have to wait a while, I would've been a little upset only because I don't think the ice cream would have been worth a wait. But at least I've now tried it and maybe would only go back if I had to, definitely not a place I would think of going to just out of the blue.

Compared with Bi-Rite, Mitchells and Humphrey, I'd still pick any of those three over the Miscellaneous's.
author: Julia K.

description:
I had Double Flavors: Bday Cake (which actually has pieces of cake in it) and Milk and Cookies (which has chunks of cookies in it). Delish!  I added sprinkles on top and I was in love. 
There was a line out the door but the wait wasn't that long. Parking is easy too.
author: Danielle L.

description:
I'm a fan. I remember when they first opened. They're friendly and remember their old customers.

Great new flavors all the time. My only suggestion if they're reading this - more flavors with little crunchies in them! Chocolate with choc malt balls were great. The croquantino and violet flavors are delish too.
author: E T.

description:
This is one of those spots that really make Dogpatch. Home made ice cream, great space, inventive flavors. My favorite is Salted Caramel and Fernet. The cones are made fresh there as well. There are great looking confections that I never buy because one of the perks of being a regular is you get samples of them thrown in your bag every now and then.

Your mind will associate some flavors with words like church or flowers or summer. It's amazing.
author: Tony G.

description:
Although Strickland's is still my favorite, this is pretty darn close. I tried a few different flavors:

Berries and Cream - The focus is definitely the sweetness of the berries. It goes well with the soft creaminess of the ice cream.
Banana - A strong, strong banana flavor with a graham cracker spice to it. It's made with banana liquer which gives it that mystery flavor.

In the end I ordered a Cream Soda float with Vanilla Bean ice cream. They use Virgil's Cream Soda so the soda itself can't really get much better. The ice cream is not too icy and mixes with the soda well without giving you too much head. Delicious, the best soda float I've had in quite some time.

I still love my Strickland's in Irvine but this is definitely just as amazing!

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description: Wicked good ice cream, friendly, line out the door is worth the wait! Guava could use less salt. Sustainable paper cups get soggy if you don't eat the ice cream quickly enough. Coconut was basically perfect :)
author: Krista R.

description:
I LOVE YOUUUUUUUUUUUU!!! 
But why oh why do you close so early?
Whenever I crave you at night, you've already closed your doors. Sigh.
author: Veronica H.

description: I always go here after I visit Dogpatch boulders because everyone knows climbing and ice cream are the perfect pair! Man this place has very interesting flavors!! When I went, they had flavors such as hickory orange which tasted like spicy orange ice cream like I said, interesting. I also remember they had cardamon which I did not like at all. I liked their candied violet(?) but it was a tad bit too sweet for me. But I went safe with a scoop of chicory coffee. I did enjoy it but it is a little pricey for ice cream in my opinion.  I heard their sour licorice is good too!
author: Audrey N.

description:
The ice cream is amazing.  The service - genuine neighborhood amiability.  If the perfect sunday were a perfect sundae, a visit to this place would be like the warm fudge.

The peanut brittle and toffee cookies already had incredible texture, this wonderful balance saltiness with sweet, and then they leave them in the oven just a moment longer, giving them this slight burnt tinge around the edges that turns a great cookie into something you can get nostalgic over.
author: Dustin G.

description: This place isn't as hectic as Bi-Rite but definitely worth trying. The place is quite hidden and of all places-- in the Dogpatch area. I love the look and feel of this place. It feels like a real grown up ice cream parlor. The flavors are simple and pretty familiar. I had cookies and creme and it was so creamy! Paired with their mini-brownies = orgasmic. This place provides further evidence that San Francisco is indeed the land of heavenly ice creameries. If you love ice cream, you definitely have to stop by.
author: Julie H.

description:
i dont wanna over hype this place.. but this is way better than any other creamery i've EVER tried.. i had the lychee green tea and salted mango both of which tasted like heaven...  i don't know how they do this.. but amazing!! i'm deifnitley coming back to try the other flavors..

(their cookies are amazing too)
author: James H.

description: Fourth time here but only the first time I was able to try their ice cream as they have random ass hours and even when they say they are open they have not been.  My first 3 attempts they were closed.  I would definitely call before to see if they are open.
author: Scottie P.

description:
It's a good thing they let you sample ice cream.  I normally don't like to sample things, because I feel like it's a waste of time.  However, this is one rare time I actually did  try a sample and it was of their Beer and Brittle ice cream.  I'm glad I sampled this because it wasn't delicious at all.  

After being turned off by my first pick, I went with the Chicory Coffee, since coffee flavored ice cream is a personal favorite and you can't go wrong with it.  They're nice enough to offer tepid water on a nearby table for you to quench your thirst since the ice cream is so rich and creamy. 

My favorite thing about this ice cream shop were the peonies on the table.  They had an assortment of glasses with fresh flowers on the table which really made the place feel welcoming :3
author: Agent X.

description: Crazy lines at this place! Fun specialty ice cream joint. Love the high ceilings and large windows inside. Definitely recommend the sweet cream, which is similar to vanilla but so much better!
author: Laura S.

description:
so good. the best part about working in the dogpatch. i go here about once a week, which is slightly more than i go to the gym unfortunately. 

favorite flavors: anything with butter. trust me, do it.
author: Jessica W.

description: Conveniently next to TAD at Dogpatch! For the serving size, the price is great. Honestly, the best vanilla bean ice cream I have ever had was had here. I am so pleased. Gotta come back here for the 3rd Street Sale for bacon/coffee/cookie dough TAD ice cream!!!
author: Steevens A.

description:
This spot is on rotation along with Humphrey's, Bi-Rite and Mitchell's and I can proudly admit Mr. and Mrs. Misc is rotated in a lot more often than the others. 

Quaint, clean spot in a budding neighborhood which will likely be the hip scene in a couple of more years. Huge storefront windows allow the what little sunlight is out, making it always feel like the right time for ice cream no matter how windy or cold it is outside. 

Whatever flavor you get, you'll have one with thick, creamy quality you can taste. There are a plenty of unique flavors to try and even the ones that read out as unappealing have a taste you can appreciate.

Scoops don't come cheap, but they don't come small either. It's too bad I've just found out how close this ice cream parlor is to my job.. I definitely will be frequenting it more often.
author: Melvictor T.

description: I tried Black IPA with spiked alcohol which turn out to taste like butter scotch candy to me, yummy! Also got Pink Guava with Mexican coke float which was also very good. Overall it was yummay and the service was excellent.
author: Diana H.

description:
At last! Finally had a chance to visit Mr. and Mrs. and taste their ice cream.
Despite its Meatpacking Industry-like draw, Dogpatch is not an easy access area.

But I'm sure glad it my route led me there. It sits on a corner and welcomes you in with its high ceilings and open space filled with wooden bench tables and chairs and clean rustic decor. 

Upon seeing the chalkboard menu, I found my eyes dancing at the flavors that were available that day. Among the ~8 enchanting sounding flavor names, I tasted Pink Squirrel (How could you not given the name and knowing it's one of the most popular? A combo of almond liquor and coco liquor that has a subtle yet aromatic flavor), Ginger w/Choco Chips (Ginger was rather subtle for my taste buds but thought it a good combo), Earl Grey with Lavender (a lovely bouquet and tastes exactly how it sounds) and Chicory Coffee (good coffee flavor with very light on chicory).

Great friendly service. The man who was helping me indulged my questions and my curious taste bud.

Take-Away: Good and creative ice creams; flavors seem to be on the subtle side and texture is on the lighter end rather than overly creamy. $2.75 for junior scoop.
author: Carol K.

description:
After trying to come here and failing TWICE, I finally got to taste their infamous ice cream that ive been lusting after for months. First time I came, they were closed. Second time I came, they were -totally- out of ice cream and once again closed. But third time is a charm, right? I must say it  was definitely worth it. 

First off, I love how spacious this place is. A good amount of seating, and the people in line aren't crowded with the people already done ordering.. And let me say, there will be a line. But dont fret, it moves pretty fast. I should also mention, they take card but there is a 5 dollar minimum. So if you dont feel like engorging yourself on their oh-so-tasty ice cream, bring cash. 

I got a single scoop of lemon poppyseed.. Very tasty! Im not usually a fan of lemon flavored stuff, but this had a great balance of lemon and creaminess. I almost want to say there were too many poppy seeds in it.. Some parts of the scoop had it evenly distributed, but in other parts there were very dense swirls of poppy seeds.

I tasted the white sesame as well. It wasn't as sweet as I was expecting it to be. It was almost savory in nature, with a very distinct nutty taste and texture (almost like a nut butter/ ice cream hybrid.) It just wasnt my thing.
author: Alison A.

description:
ice cream is definitely good here but it's sad when everyone raves about the pink squirrel and it's not on the menu when you go. i feel like they need a couple of flavors that are always there. 

i got three flavors (don't remember what they are :(  ) and they were all really good. but it doesn't really matter I guess because it mostly won't be there next time i'm back. 

great ice cream nonetheless!
author: Janet Y.

description: Cute little ice cream shop with delicious and unique flavors that will not disappoint you!! Had the cinnamon chip and it was great! Environment is clean with a very friendly staff! I would definitely like to revisit in the future to see what new flavors they come up with! :)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
It's aiiigggght. 

Rosemary pistachio. Real pistachios. Ice cream breaks apart and causes little clumps. Not the smooth kind but still good.  Not sure if I would drive out of my way for it .
author: Kelly C.

description:
Can a city with freezing cold summers become known for its plethora of ice cream boutiques?  I, for one, think we are well on our way.

Swensen's - classic, like your childhood in a cone
Joe's - old timey, hand-dipped with their own version of an It's-It, Joe's-It!
Polly Ann - classic with a twist.  Durian ice cream, anyone?  Home of the flavor wheel
Maggie Mudd - where omnivores and vegans meet in happy harmony
Mitchell's - tried and true rich ice creams with an amazing array of tropical and Asian flavors
Bombay - when you need to armchair travel to India and luxuriate in exotic spices and rose petals
Bi-Rite - the gourmet classic, with that amazing salted caramel, and now soft serve
Three Twins - like having the farmers' market in a cup
Humphry Slocombe - the avant-garde, with a big line of hipsters to prove it

and now...

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous!  

As Phil H. rightly points out, M & M M is like a love-child of Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe.  It's less edgy than HS, but uses some interesting ingredients like beer.

The space is big and the line on a sunny Sunday was very reasonable.  I appreciated having somewhere to sit and enjoy my cup of yummy - I had the Buttermilk and Chocolate Cake, and my partner-in-crime had the Beer & Brittle.  Both were delicious.   I loved the fact that when we asked what toppings we should get, our server said that the ice cream pretty much stands on its own.   The opposite of upsell!  I like it!

It's a friendly environment without a lot of hassle, and a place to hang your hat when the ice cream urge strikes you.  I will definitely be going back!
author: Liz S.

description:
i love mitchell's
bi-rite is overrated
humphrey's i can definitely do w/o

with that said, i really like mr. and mrs. misc. one of the better ice cream places in the city - creamy and not overly flavored. i do not like the business hours though, and their prices are a bit high for a child's scoop of ice cream. i can deal for a visit a few times a year.
author: Tammy T.

description:
I've been back so many times since my first review, I owe them an update. This has to got to be the BEST ice cream joint, ever. I don't usually make blanket statements like that, but in this case, the awesomeness of this shop is so obvious that it's pretty much a fact.

And I've gone to all the others (Humphrey's, Bi-Rite's, Mitchell's)...but this place is different. It's safe to say, I'm in love with this shop. In fact, I need to work a "Mr and Mrs" line item into my monthly budget because without their ice cream, I would be one sad puppy :(

Why they're amazing:
- It's owned by an awesome couple (Mr and Mrs) who makes everything in-house (ice cream, waffle cones, cookies, peanut brittle...you name it). Where else can you eat ice cream that is served to you by the very people who make it? 
- Everything is biodegradable and compostable, so you can feel good about eating there. 
- Their flavors are amazing. I haven't tried a flavor that I haven't loved: Cinnamon Toast, Salted Caramel, Halva, Sweet Corn Caramel, Earl Grey Tea, Burnt Sugar, Rum Raisin. Their flavors are the perfect balance between unique and delicious. I tend to think Humphrey's tries too hard to be unique and some of the flavors don't taste good at all. But this place gets it just right. You could literally pick a flavor blindly and you'd love it. 
- Their 10 flavors change daily so there's always something new and exciting to try. To find out what flavors they're offering today, friend them on Facebook!
- Even though this couple works their butts off, they are always warm and welcoming to their customers. Even when I ask to sample flavor after flavor, they oblige with kind enthusiasm.
- The shop is spacious, bright, clean and has plenty of seating and the cleanest bathroom ever. Also, plenty of free parking.
- Water for customers: They have mason jars with water and biodegradable cups so you can cleanse your palette after devouring your ice cream

If you are reading this, do yourself a favor. Bookmark this place and make it a point to pay them a visit. You can thank me later :)
author: Mariela D.

description: Small little place in the dogpatch. I ordered a single scoop (2 scoops) of Jasmine Green Tea. It was so creamy and fantastic. I would definitely come back!
author: Veronica C.

description:
I'm torn!!! I think Mr. and Mrs. M may have won me over Bi-Rites...

Organic Ice Cream and amazing yet simple flavors. Totally worth the wait...

Try the Strawberry Cream and Citrus Rum Raisin. SooooSooo good!!! I inhaled my cone!
author: Monkey T.

description:
After Hard Knox, me and Rebekah head across the street to wait for a ride; serendipitously stumbling across this rather spacious ice cream shop. The first thing I notice is the huge common tables and I instantly think "UYE" (unofficial yelp event). That and the amount of babies/todlers here. 

I have a huge sweet tooth that needs constant satiation so waiting for the ride soon becomes waiting in line to order. We decide to split a scoop of the beer and toffee (or was it beer and praline?). In any case, this is apparently a meeting place for new families in the dogpatch because the place was packed w/ kids, nom nom noming on ice cream and mothers/fathers taking a break from parenting. 

The scoop was definitely enough to share let alone satiate one sweet tooth. It was sinfully rich and creamy and totally worth the cheat. 

Our ride has since got there so we have to scurry off but I definitely want to come back to this quaint shop for a lazy Sunday cone.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Service-really friendly & patient couple runs this place.

Decor-open & modern.

I ordered:

Vanilla bean & Gingerbread in a half pint-really creamy & good!

chocolate peanut butter-creamy peanut butter flavor with bits of chocolate. YUM!  Unfortunately, I only got a taste because my nephew and niece killed it!  I turned around and it was gone!  They LOVED IT! 

Almond brittle-let's just say the jar was almost empty by the end of the day.

They also have pies, cookies, etc.

I will definitely be back to try the rest of the items.
author: Michelle S.

description: The lotus cream and butterfinger flavors were good! But I asked for a wafer come and they gave me their $1 sugar cone instead, but it was good. With there were more flavors to choose from but ice cream was good quality! Still like bi-rite the best tho
author: S C.

description: This place serves up absolutely amazing and innovative ice cream, in my opinion the best in the city, unless you consider Frozen Kuhsterd ice cream. I have yet to try anything here that wasn't delicious, and it's right around the corner from Oliver's, a great butcher you should stop at! I recommend trying some of the more unique flavors here as well, they are very palatable compared to other ice cream shops' unusual offerings, while still appealing to those of us who live for such oddities as Ghost Chili or African Curry ice cream!
author: Joshua B.

description:
First off, I know this is mainly an ice cream place, but  I just gotta say that they have one of the most delicious chocolate chip cookies ever!!!  $2 very well spent.  Makes me just wanna stop writing this review and head over there for some!  It is 5 stars for the chocolate chip cookie alone!  I also tried the peanut brittle & toffee cookie.  Hubby loved this since he is a peanut lover.  I also enjoyed this cookie, but not as much as the chocolate chip!!!

On to the ice cream...I was hoping to try try the candied violet, earl gray, flan, tres leches, ballpark, peanut brittle and all the other flavors spoken highly of in other reviews the day I came, but being "Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous", none of those were being offered the day I came.  I opted for the salted mango & caramel with sea salt.  Salted Mango blew away the caramel with sea salt for me.  Very, very yummy.  The caramel with sea salt had a good balanced flavor...didn't really wow me.  My daughter had the jasmine green tea and caramel with sea salt.  I had a bite of her green tea, and it was pretty yummy as well.  Hubby had the corn & caramel and milk chocolate.  The corn & caramel tasted like fresh corn in ice cream but without the corn chunks in it.  I couldn't really taste too much of the caramel since the corn overpowered it. Milk chocolate was delicious...can't really go wrong with chocolate.  My most favorite was the salted mango.  

They also make fresh peanut brittle and cones here.  I think the cone is an extra 50 cents.  Jr. Scoop is $2.75, Single scoop is $3.50. Double is $4.75.  The scoops here are very generous!  I believe there is also a $10 minimum for credit cards.

Overall, my family & i enjoyed our experience at Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.  We enjoyed it more than Humphrey Slocombe.  We will definitely be back to try the other flavors. :)
author: Sheila M.

description:
Son liked the Cookies and cream ice cream but said he felt there was too much cookies, go figure.
 
Grape sherbet in homemade cone delicious grape taste and the best cone ever.

This go 'round purchased a chocolate and cherry cookie. The owner gave me two 'cuz he said they didn't bake up as big as usual and felt it wasn't fair to for the price. AWESOME! Ice cream is good but I think the cookies are my favorite thing here.
author: Maria M.

description:
Came here with friends; they all loved it. That's probably the best recommendation I can give a place: if I like a place, that's one data point, but if four people all enjoy it--well boy-howdy, now you're talkin'!

And hey, the line wasn't out the door! It didn't wrap around the block in a ridiculous fashion! That's kind of nice, right? Actually, that's *really* nice.

A+++ would eat again.
author: Greg P.

description: Mr and Mrs M means ... ice-cream alway good in San Francisco ,
author: Bill J.

description:
Was picking up my bag at Rickshaw Bagworks (block and a half down the street) when the salesperson suggested I head over here for their latest sorbet.  By the time I reached the counter just a few minutes later - they were out of the orange sorbet with lime zest and cardamom... and they promptly ran out of 2 more flavors as I stood there... but the ambiance and friendliness of everyone (including customers!) in the store - made me realize running out wasn't a problem... it just shows how good this place is!  

Things I love:
Flavor combos and flavor names: Pink Squirrel (yum - creme de cacao), BEER and Peanut (hello?! - Awesome!), Hazelnut Orange (brought out quickly to replace freshly out flavors.)
Cookies & Candy: coconut covered marshmallows and vanilla caramels with sea salt!
Want to taste test something - no problem, and no plastic spoon - nothing but the best - and on a real live steel spoon - no waste, no foul!
Homemade sugar cones for $.50
Super nice bathroom (why not mention it?)
Gorgeous decor - and super friendly staff
author: Laura C.

description:
See.. They get ice cream.. You don't have to get all crazy with ice cream flavors just for the sake of crazy flavors. Some favor profiles go together and others.. uhhh.. don't.. Sorry Bi-Rite..

The Mr and Mrs are former pastry chefs, and they understand the subtle nature of cream.  Vanilla bean can be just as complex in flavor and depth as Bi-Rite's Strawberry Balsamic.. They have the classic flavors down and create new classics.

Anyways, I support their business because they are a 2person show and put their heart and soul into this frozen culinary endeavor.. Props to their business and culinary acumen..
author: Carlo M.

description:
Why Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous in SF's Dogpatch neighborhood is quite possibly my new favorite ice cream & sweets shop in the city:

1. Quirky, artisinal, and yummy! ice cream flavors made from scratch using organic, local, and seasonal ingredients.
2. Spoons shaped like mini-shovels.
3. Compostable everything - including paper straws!
4. Clean, bright, modern interior in one of SF's sunniest neighborhoods.
5. Friendly staff/owners who don't mind (or at least pretend they don't mind) if you sample EVERY SINGLE FLAVOR on the menu
author: Dianne Q.

description:
I ordered a pink squirrel in a cone.  I had a tasting of the rosemary and honey and didn't like it.  and i walked away tasting the hazelnut concocktion.  Loved the hazelnut one although i was already full.

I love the eclectic feel of the place.  Black and one walls with old furniture.  I just wished someone older like 30 something was behind the counter.  I felt so old.  i know i wasn't clubbing but still, i know there are many unemployed out there and my age bracket is one of them.  

The smell of their cones made the destination worth trying but it's not easily accessible for my ice cream fixes.
author: Daphne A.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend yesterday after lunch at Mission Pie and loved the experience! I admit that the simple yet sleek industrial feel of the shop won me over as soon as I stepped inside, but the food and service proved to be just as refreshing. The couple who owns the store is really friendly-- the man offered us several samples before we settled on our preferences. We tried the black & tan (?)-- the beer-flavored flavor, and finally decided on the coffee & donuts and the blueberry & buttermilk. What picks!

Originally I had (disparagingly) thought that my boyfriend's coffee & donut was going to be overly creamy and heavy, but the combination was a condensed scoop of intense coffee flavor and bits of donut. It was cold and thick, the way that I like it, with its surface naturally softening into milky drips for your tongue to lick. The blueberry and buttermilk were just as sensational. Vibrant and substantial, with the buttermilk and frozen blueberries melding into pools of lavender tangy-sweetness.

I adore this place! It's very simple, clean, and non-pretentious. And their ice cream is wonderful.
author: Gigi L.

description:
CANDIED VIOLET IS DELICIOUS.

Went right before closing so they ran out of some flavors, wish I could've tried more! The owners are also very friendly and helpful with helping you decide. And they give generous scoops :)
author: Nikki P.

description:
on a mission to find the best ice cream in SF?  A friend of mine and I are....

Can't declare a #1 yet but this place ranks

Try it.

The end.
author: Athena S.

description: The day I visited, I sampled Brown Butter, Candied Violet, Cake and Cream and Amaretto, which won. I wish the flavors were regularly placed online, so I could plan ahead. Other than the creative menu, I like that they have a lot of seating. It's nice to have a seat when most other ice cream joints don't have more than a bench or two. However, the service I got the day was poor. The man looked like he didn't want to serve me ice cream and made me feel I shouldn't sample any of them, as he reluctantly bent down each time to scoop a bit for me. :(
author: Theresa S.

description:
Great friendly staff. Really clean place and KILLER homemade ice cream.
Came here waiting for my car while it was being repaired for coffee...didn't know they didn't sell coffee but was offered a nice hot cup of apple cider.....hit the spot on this wet, cold day...but that wasn't enough.

My girl wanted to try their ice cream but didn't know what she wanted..the girl behind the counter was great and let her try any flavor she wanted. They even discussed the girls favorites...in the end it was the nougat and pralines and cream....

Silky, creamy, tons of flavor on both...normally id let my girl.fill in here and comment but her mouth is currently full of ice cream.

Check this place out...I am pretty sure you will love it
author: Dean M.

description:
Great ice cream with fun and unique flavors.  I still need to try the home made waffle cone as they were sold out of it by the time I got there.  I did sample a few flavors, at places like this, it almost seems like the familiar flavors are the ones not to get as those fell flat to me.  

I tried the peanut brittle, crema catalana and pink squirrel.  The crema catalana was probably my favorite, but it's probably because I'm not a fan of super sweet desserts and that had a nice tang from the lime.  

The texture isn't as creamy/gelato like as bi-rite.  They do give you nice sized scoops in each order which was actually hard for me to finish (as I'm so used to the tiny scoops).
author: Karen T.

description: Hands down my favorite ice cream in San Francisco and I think I've tried all of the big ones.  With the menu changing frequently I usually find one I like after sampling quite a few (the staff is friendly and never seem to mind and often I've waited long enough if it's a hot day). My favorite flavors are Pink Squirrel, Salted Mango, Tres Leches Cake.  I usually opt for the cones made in house.  I like the decor and the clean bathrooms too. They do have odd hours, which is probably for the best otherwise I would be here everyday.  When I do get out of work early enough to make it over there it is usually such a treat!
author: Christina M.

description: The owners are super sweet and the flavors are pretty delish. They have their version of the salted caramel, I think I still prefer BiRite's. The strawberry shortcake was full of strawberries and just the right amount of creamy tartness. The coffee was perfect. It was like a frozen sweetened coffee. Yummy.
author: Eve C.

description: Yummy!  They have creative new flavors every week like Basil & Olive Oil, Jasmine Green Tea, Birthday Cake and many more.  My husband and I have become the Sunday afternoon regulars.  Super friendly staff!
author: Zaina O.

description: Service is really cool and the flavors are okay. I liked their White Russian and Egg Nog. I'm not really interested in trying the rest of their flavors as I am with Humphrey's ice cream but if I'm ever in Dogpatch (which I'm usually not - eeeeshh) I will.
author: James M.

description: I'm rarely in the Dogpatch during ice cream hours but have been the last couple of Wednesdays. This place is wonderful. My favorite ice cream flavors are tea flavors and floral flavors, and they seem to do both pretty regularly. I got a bergamot chip that was really lovely and a lychee black tea that was also great. The texture is nice and dense and creamy (using high-quality dairy), and they don't underdo the flavor intensity. Of all the frozen milk products in the city, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and Lush are topping my list. If only I lived close enough to carry the pints home...
author: Ellen L.

description: What a gem in the dog patch. Located right across from Serpentine (amazing brunch there fyi) Since the dog patch is an up and coming area, there was not a lot of people here (or at least when we came). I can't believe I'm saying this but their caramel with sea salt is probably up to par with birite's salted caramel if not better. The staff is pretty friendly and there is seating in the shop so that's nice. I definitely recommend coming here if you can make it out here.
author: edward k.

description:
Stop standing in line at Bi-Rite!  It's been done to death.  Try something different: come stand in line at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous instead!  Or, be like me and show up here before noon on a Friday and rule the place.  Yep, my friend and I did get the undivided attention of the Mr. AND the Mrs.  Not bad.

They told us their whole story: their business plan, their expansion strategy, their babysitter situation and so on.  You'll never meet two nicer, more approachable and friendly people than the owners of this place.  I mean, they were naturally nice and friendly!  If they were only acting, they deserve an Oscar for Best Customer Service Smile.  I didn't have the courage to ask them about the origin of their shop's name, but I'll try to do it next time.

They had about 10 flavors that day.  $3 for a single scoop in a cup, $3.50 for a single scoop in a waffle cone.  The single scoop is plenty big, so pace yourselves.  My friend had told me all about the ballpark flavor, but Mr. and Mrs. were not featuring it that day.  Hmmm, decisions....  I hate calling an audible, especially when it comes to ordering ice cream.  

I tried the Fernet flavored ice cream first.  We have a couple of friends who love Fernet more than life itself, and it's become an ongoing joke for us.  I cursed the second I decided to sample it, because ... it did taste exactly as I imagined: a Fernet ice cream float.  It was absolutely disgusting!  I'd rather drink a window-washing fluid and transmission fluid cocktail than Fernet.  Of course if you love anise, black licorice and that vile beverage, you'll be in heaven.

Instead, I opted for the Bananas Foster scoop.  The ice cream was creamy, delicious and just sweet enough.  The texture was better than Bi-Rite's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bi-rite-creamery-san-francisco#hrid:gdpKWjOyrG-FCHnPTFqN7Q), and the flavors were stronger than Humphry Slocombe's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco#hrid:Y3Fkn6Y0rCwJV_ssl2zhHw).  Combine all that with a sparkling clean store, friendly owners/employees and free street parking, and you've got yourselves a perfect ice cream shop.

I am making Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous my #1 ice cream spot for my out-of-town guests.  Sorry, Mitchell's! (http://www.yelp.com/biz/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco#hrid:oqoNtN54VXzeSkMisjnCtw)
author: Yan G.

description: This place is always closed during the weekdays. I call beforehand to make sure they are open, no message stating if they are closed. I get there, complete disappointment. Closed! It's like a sharp knife right in my heart. A suggestion: please leave a message on your phone informing customers you are closed. But overall, I love your ice cream!
author: SF S.

description: Pink Squirrel and White Russian are yumz!!!
author: Deborah V.

description:
If Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe hooked up one night and had a bastard child, it would probably look a lot like Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. For those of you craving the subtle flavors (Bananas Foster!) and creamy textures of Bi-Rite, they have it. And for those of you more interested in wacky flavors that tickle your taste buds (Fernet? Old Fashioned? Yes, please!) ala HS, they have those as well.
