The guy behind the counter was quick with the free samples and didn't bat an eye when we ordered child size cups for us three clearly not childish adults. Me thinks I have a new favorite fancy pants ice cream shoppe.
author: phil h.

description: Mr. & Mrs. is a delightful ice cream shop. I came here to peruse the flavors of the day on a recent visit to Dogpatch. There's a nice spread of sweet treats so nicely styled at the counter: big mason jars of peanut butter brittle, a basket  of assorted cookies, kraft bags full of peanut butter malt balls, all housemade. There was even a little selection of cheery licorice-looking whips by the register. The Mrs. held down the front of the house, as the Mr. was busy in the kitchen. Despite the chill outside, I couldn't say no to a scoop of their Tres Leches Cake ice cream. I have to say that my expectations of this flavor were pretty high. I wasn't wowed by the texture, which seemed less than creamy for an artisanal ice cream. I really wanted to love it, but I will give the Mr. and Mrs. another go and visit again.
author: Angie N.

description:
My first two times here were after stuffing myself with brunch at Just For You Cafe. Silly me. The mind was willing but the body was weak, and all I could do was stare at the 10 intriguing flavor choices and promise the proprietors I'd be back to try their artisanal ice cream.

Since then I've returned several times and sampled the orange blossom honey, earl gray, peanut butter and jelly, chai, nougat, blueberry buttermilk, chocolate mint, and old fashioned. I give the M&Ms credit for scooping generous portions and for tempting me into trying flavors I'd normally avoid, like the nougat and the orange blossom honey. Both were subtle, but tasted like summer in an ice cream cone. (BTW, they make their waffle cones on premise, and it's hard not to order a cone once you've smelled them cooking.) 

I like the mom-and-pop feel of the place and appreciate their eco-conscious choices in cups, bowls, and spoons (all compostable). What a welcome addition to this sunny part of San Francisco! But they could use some blinds to shield the interior from the sometimes too bright sunshine.
author: Julie K.

description:
Delicious ice cream! Loved the peanut brittle and bourbon & caramel.
BIG servings.
YUM!
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
I am giving this place a 'Woohoo!  As good as it gets!' review because honestly, the fact that it exists in a neighborhood such as Dogpatch (awesome but so frickin' desolate) is a miracle.  

I love it's minimalism.  I love the decor, the little touches that shows the owners really take pride and are excited by their business.  Their exotic flavors are great, but I'm really just a plain jane so I generally get cardamom.  Although last time, I had a blast mixing cardamom with their black cherry soda.  It was so delicious!  So much so that I got sick the next day - I'm lactose intolerant.  But it was worth every hack and fever chill!

I also discovered someone I know works there.  Hi Ben!  So go, visit Ben and the rest of the team, get some sweetness in you and do a photo tour of the neighborhood.  Let's get the Dogpatch trending!
author: Lily E.

description:
Riz and I were in the area and saw few people walking down the street with ice cream cones. I thought of the last time i had real ice cream (not froyo or sorbetto). WIth our handy dandy yelp app we found MR & MRS MISC.

Riz had the Coconut Cream in a cone and I had the Almond/Praline in waffle cone. Soooo gooood! Unique flavors... Rich and creamy... Sometimes you gotta take a break from the froyo and indulge. 

We'll be back Mr & MRS MISC!
author: Riz and Jane E.

description:
nice atmosphere, decent price

the flavors were definitely unique, i can see why some people would rave about this place and some would opt to give it a bad rating. some of the flavors will definitely polarize you, but i guess thats why they give samples?

personally, i'd still opt for bi-rite, just based on flavors and options, but this place definitely gets the one-up on bi rite for the atmosphere
author: Long C.

description: Delicious chocolate chip.  Definitely top 5 ice cream shop in the city.  woot
author: Fatty A.

description:
I have a mad crush on this place.

This is the best ice cream shop in the city, or quite possibly, known to mankind. I love this little place in the Dogpatch District with all my heart. They have unheard of flavors that hits all the right g-spots of your taste buds. Candied violet, what?!

Yes, I will come here again and again and again. Yes, you bet your ass I will come that much.
author: Mary Anne R.

description:
Years, no, make that now a decade plus of unwavering dedication to exercise, eating right and healthy living was almost thrown out the window. I had met my greatest foil, and it was called PB & J ice cream. I got a taste, and it took every bit of will power to not get more. I wanted not just a scoop. Or a sundae. Or a pint. I wanted the whole. damn. barrel. It was frozen crack. Cold booze. One of the best ice creams I've ever had.

Fighting my cravings tooth and nail, I settled with something ever so slightly healthier, good old vanilla bean. Also excellent. The serving was super generous, the service super friendly. This is my new favorite ice cream shop in the city.

P.S. Peanut. Butter. Malt. Balls. I had one. Those with less self control can get a pound for $7.99. Call me to share. I'm gonna need a hit.
author: Jason B.

description:
I like ice cream like any kid, but goddamn. Mr. and Mrs. is the bomb. I understand the whole strange-o flavor craze in SF because that's how we roll...bring the interesting and get mad love from the peeps. But I will say that it's not always about who can make the most interesting, it's about who can make a damn good cone of ice cream. My Mr/Mrs cherry was popped by a cone of Coconut Cream...chock full of fresh coconut that made it feel like a cool breeze on da island, you know? The sweets on offer were made the vibe even cooler. I appreciate that the proprietor was workin' the scoops, helping us make decisions, and he's so laid back (I see you, Ian) that you feel like you've been homies for days.

I'm happy to support a business that puts effort into customer service not to turn a buck but to connect with the consumer and turn them into regular customers. Keep up the good work, and you'll be getting a bill from my dentist. ;-) Thanks again.
author: Charlene L.

description:
I'm not the best judge on Ice Cream only because I love all Ice Cream, high end, low end, from a truck or homemade. 

I will say, they have creative flavors, a great shop that is environmentally conscious and the lines aren't too long. So if you're in Dogpatch and want an after meal dessert or just some good ice cream you can't go wrong with Mr. and Mrs. Misc.
author: Binh D.

description:
Came here after a Giants game one day and almost didn't get to try the deliciousness because it was a minute after closing.  Luckily the owners saw me drooling on the window and kindly opened the door and let us in.

Love all the savory flavors as much as the sweet.  We quickly tasted a bunch of flavors and picked our favs to take to go so the staff could go home.

They are super friendly and worth paying another visit.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
4.5! I thoroughly enjoyed the flavors and creativity at this place! It was so great, I was perfectly satisfied having 3 scoops of ice cream for my dinner. And they are very generous so the 3 scoops was a mountain-full.

Bananas Foster - bananas can be over-powering but this was just the perfect amount that let the other scoops have its own presence. You can't taste the alcohol foster portion which I personally enjoy.

Tres Leches - a dream come true! There are actual cake pieces in the ice cream, and you can't see them so it's a nice surprise when you get it. The flavor is right on as a tres leches should be - creamy, milky, condensed milk dominant - and the added texture of the soggy cake is really nice. 

Pink Squirrel - hands down my absolute favorite. I don't know what comprises of this flavor but I taste a hint of almond and other Yelp reviews say there's black cherry in it. I'd compare this delicate flavor to how beautiful a cherry blossom is. Gay, I know but it really is a nice combination of fragrant flavors and pleasant surprises. 

I also enjoyed the location - quiet, easy to find parking. I'm not stressed out from the bustle of the city, and it was easy to get to. But that's just me who didn't need to eat dinner beforehand either - I guess it would be annoying to come out to just for ice cream and nothing else.

It's a good thing I'm not a local - I would be a fatty mcFat if I was nearby!
author: Jenny C.

description:
It's better here because you don't have to deal with hipsters in the Mission and/or stand in a crowded room waiting for your number to be called! Plus, the parking is easier!

Heard about this place through some website talking about the new up and coming ice cream places in the city. It's a nice change of scenery and you get to try other people's take on ice cream flavors. Their salted caramel is way more salty than Bi-Rites which can turn people off, but good for people that don't like overly sweet things.

Lots of seating and water at the counter. The staff is super nice and offered to keep our take out pint in the freezer while we sat and ate. There's also baked goods too. Definitely gonna check it out again.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
Apparently, the 3 tasting limit is only applied when there is a line.  I can't fault them for wanting to bring ice cream to the people in a more efficient manner.

I enjoyed the Croquantino flavor today.  The caramelized hazelnuts had the right amount of crunchy texture.  I also tasted the PB&J which I was surprised I enjoyed so much given that it is on the sweeter side.  

The owners are super nice and avoid putting a pretentious slant on their gourmet ice cream shoppe which is hard to do in SF.  Example:  They call their chocolate chip "chocolate chip" when they could call it stracciatella which is "chocolate chip ice cream"  in Italian.  

Being a pretentious snob myself, I ordered "stracciatella" just to test them.  Guess what, they absolutely knew what I was talking about.  Kudos for keeping it real.
author: Monica L.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream. With a name like that who would've guessed it's an ice cream shop.

This is a relatively new ice cream shop in the Dogpatch owned by a couple.  Cute place and minimally decorated.  Small selections of 10 flavors daily.  The flavors change once or even twice a day according to Mrs. Miscellaneous.  She told me that they make a 3 gallon tank per flavor each time and when that's sold out, they make a new flavor.  So it is constantly changing.  The place has one quirky rule though, there's a limit of 3 tastings per person.  

I sampled the flavor my friend had which was the Orange Blossom Honey.  Texture was creamy but the honey essence was really strong and overpowering.  I love honey but this was too much and it just overshadowed the orange flavor.  So I went with a kid scoop of the Peanut Butter and Chocolate Malt for $2.50.  YUM!!!  Super creamy with a nice balance of subtle taste of peanut butter and chocolate.  Not overpowering at all.  Hard to describe, you'll have to try it for yourself. 

I can't say this is my new favorite ice cream place just yet since I've only been here once but it's good enough for me to go back to try out other flavors.  I have my eyes on the Earl Grey flavored.
author: Hannah C.

description: OMG the place is so simple and so yummy if you like ice cream this place is the best. Good customer service and very quick. Very unique flavors with traditional flavors as well. Best part of this place is everything is home made.
author: Edward A.

description:
Like I said before, I never ever ever write reviews unless I feel the establishment absolutely deserves it. I know I know, you're probably saying I should hop off my high horse; however I simply have zero damns to spare for you. Anyways Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous deserves my review and a lot more.

Lawd have mercy, I love their ice cream so damn much! This is one of those places that you'll remember when you're old with alzhiemers. Your future grandchildren will be eating dip-n-dots, and you'll be like "I remember when we had real ice cream like from Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous!" And your grandchildren will just laugh in disregard. 

I love the Mom-&-Pop-i-ness vibe i get from this place. The employees are always helpful and always seem to converse with customers with ease. I'm sure the employees know me here because I walk through the door yelling "TAKE MY MONEY!!!" They're located right across from Hard Knox. Ice cream after chicken & waffles? Yes please. If you're not lazy, the ballpark is a couple blocks away. Ice cream after a Giants game? Yes please. Parking in the area isn't much of a hassle compared to other hipster ice cream shops *ahem* Bi-Rite *ahem* 

Every flavor always satisfies! The ice cream is a perfect balance of creaminess, sweetness and texture. Some flavors, like Bourbon Caramel and Banana Toffee, have a buttery component which ties the flavors together. Some flavors, like Crema Catalana and Honey Yogurt, have a perfectly light and refreshing quality. Whatever you like, they'll have something for you. My favorite flavors are Pink Squirrel and Candied Violet, but sometimes they don't have them that day. But, you see, that doesn't matter because all their flavors are so good. I'm always discovering random flavors that creep into the top of my ice cream favorites list! Unlike Bi-Rite, I find myself trying new flavors every visit, instead of the usual Salted Caramel or Ricanelas. Also, thanks to the Señor Sisig collabo, they have Filipino-related flavors like Macapuno, Almond Jelly and a Turon-inspired flavor (banana + jackfruit), which are also a nice addition. I'm a fatty, so i usually order two scoops because I'm indecisive on which flavor to have. 

For the most part, their extra stuff, like the toppings and baked goods, are made in-house. The waffle cones are made in-house and have the perfect sweetness and thickness. I havent tried any toppings (although the homemade caramel is always tempting), but I have tried some of the their baked good. The cookies with huge chocolate chunks are just as addicting as their ice cream. I compare their cookies to Anthony's Cookies, but a little bigger. Also they have a caramel-marshmallow thingy that is sooo bad for you, but is hella delicious. Im convinced, they can do no wrong if they just add their caramel to anything. The next thing i will have to buy is a jar of their Almond Brittle. If you're ever overwhelmed with the sweetness from anything, they have free water. The bathroom is always clean too. 

Bascially, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous is like a crack house, because I fiend for their products and i go there to get my fix. The only downside to everything I just said is that they close at 6pm and are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. I ain't eem mad though, they deserve a break after supplying the ice cream fiends.

lol @ people going to Bi-Rite or Humphreys when Miscellaneous is open. 

Have I hyped up Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous enough for you? ... Good, now go try it!
author: Jeremy Y.

description: Absolutely Wonderful eggnog ice cream!
author: Nick R.

description: Flavors are always changing! It's so fun, friendly, and delish!
author: Megan B.

description: Loved the flavour options, the trendy space, the actual not-cloyingly-sweet taste, the slightly icy texture, the toppings (dare I say BUTTERED RUM). Only thing I hate: the hours. Can't wait to return, though my Cholesterol *can*.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I like everything about this place, even the things that I didn't like, I liked!!!!

    Where to begin...oh yea, first thing i want to do is sell my house in Fremont, and move HERE!!! What a great area. What a great effing name(Dogpatch??!!). My 2 vices, ice cream and alcohol(leaving women and kids out) thrive cross-corner from each other(there's a dive bar nearby, that LOOKS like what a dive bar should be). Oh!!!, and a boxing gym 100m to the south. 

   First, the ergonomics of this place were designed by a 8 yr old boy who owned a lemonade stand. Picture 3 employees, crowding around an old style ice box trying to scoop ice cream?! I wanted to laugh and cry. It was like watching 3 elephants trying to wallow in the same 1 sq meter watering hole. Impossible!......but we were eventually served:-)  We blind-sided them with 3 families, and everything ALMOST came to a screeching halt. Too funny. 

  Ice Cream: To die for, with all these artisan flavors that are in vogue. Cookies and cream and caramel w/ sea salt  were kick ass!! Stay away from the olive oil and whatever. I had a cookie that had some kind of chewy junk in it. EXCELLENT!!! I saw some candies(home made chocolate malt balls?) that I wanted, but with all the kids, I would have had to share:-p

   Staff: Great, friendly, but UBER trendy. Not a hit, just a bit alien for an infantryman like me:) One cute Asian girl that looked like she owned the place, that could have been a Vogue cover model(sis that a non sequitor?)

  Anyway, I'll be back, but possibly earlier in the day, and without so much family, so they're not over-whelmed. Then I'll hit the dive bar across the street:-)
author: Peter B.

description:
To take a trip aaaall the way out to the dogpatch and pay like $4 a scoop, I definitely thought "Meh. I've experienced better." 
We had the lavender, gingersnap, and eggnog. The eggnog tasted like vanilla bean. Not very strong in the eggnogg-ness. The lavender was a bit too fruity and gingersnap was ok. 
I sort of expecting a Bi-Rite ricanelas/salted caramel experience and I got ... interesting flavor-of-the-month-at-Thrifty's experience. Just... IMO.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Love it!  Sooo nice to have a local "Keep it Weird" ice cream shop and not have to deal with the lines of Slocombe or Birite!

Little bro tried their famous Treat Bar - wasn't too impressed overall unfortunately.  However, my flatmate soopah psyched to get the Fernet Branca half pint (FTW!).

I myself loved my salted mango cone - in and out with all three in less than 10 minutes, parking outside and quickly made it to SFO after!  

Definitely be back to try more!
author: Lara L.

description: Love it!  It is the BEST ice cream in town.  I know the hours are a little strange, but that really doesn't matter too much to me. I have yet to find a flavor that I don't like.  I have had the ghost pepper with lemon, carrot mango & cardamom rose and many others.
author: Sheetal P.

description: Cute place. Ice cream was good, but the flavors a little bland (tried malted mill, pink squirrel, and mint chocolate).  Would come here a lot if I lived in the neighborhood, but not worth making a trip
author: Julie P.

description:
I wish I could eat this every single day...but my slowed down metabolism says no...which makes me sad!

Please get your ice cream here!  It's just amazing and has truly knocked my favorite, Three Twins Ice Cream, out of it's number one position!  Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, you guys are amazing, thank you so much for being so sweet and for making such fresh, both delicious unique and traditional flavors and for also being so close to my house!!!!

My favorite:

Salted Caramel with Hot Fudge.  The best ever!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, you are definitely not misc... you are more like Mr. and Mrs. Magnificent.

Located in a rather discreet location with not many other stores around, it's easy to miss this place, but at the same time, not really b/c of the huge ice cream cone statue thingy right outside their door. 

Mr. Swell Guy and I went to get some ice cream and waited in line for about 15 minutes, not too bad. I've waited in longer lines. According to Mr. Swell Guy, who has been here before, the flavors that day weren't that special or adventurous. The most unusual flavor that day was "pink squirrel". I asked for a sample and didn't quite like it.. too much of an almond taste for me. So instead, I ordered a scoop of the classic caramel with sea salt. This was definitely comparable to the one from Bi-Rite. I have to say though, I think I like the salted caramel from Bi-Rite better.. Mr. and Mrs. was a bit too sweet for me, but still delicious. 

One major plus for Mr. and Mrs. is that it has indoor sitting! Ahh, you get to order your ice-cream and eat it at a table and chair.. and grab a cup of water if you wish. I always thought I'd stay loyal to Bi-Rite, but I'm thinking that I can expand my loyalty and include Mr. and Mrs. :o)
author: Cassy H.

description:
Very interesting favors. I had the English black tea ( a bit too swt, since i expected not to be swt). My boyfriend had the chocolate (it was very chocolate-ty) 

I liked :)
author: Zee Z.

description: This is my favorite place to get ice cream, period. Their textures are unlike any other and their flavors are delicious without getting too rich. So far everything I've tried is good, but my favorites are brown butter, malted milk, and tres leches.
author: Megan S.

description:
Some people get all nostalgic when they eat ice cream.  They tend to stick to familiar flavors and the major brands.  Others opt for edgier flavors.  What they agree upon is that ice cream should be thick and intensely flavored and it should melt smoothly in the mouth.

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous' ice cream does just that.  All their ice cream is texturally flawless.  Unlike at other ice cream places I have yet to find a superfluous ice crystal chez Miscellaneous.

Their vanilla makes  Häagen Dazs vanilla taste like those ice milk desserts that may have come with your school lunch.  The Old Fashioned flavor reminded me the old school Parkerhouse flavor from Perry's Ice Cream of Western New York [see http://www.perrysicecream.com/icecream/premium/product.php?id=78] but artisanally made.  That's cherry-almond ice cream to you.  The Miscellaneous twist is that they use Bourbon-macerated cherries for a little oomph.  It also reminded me of the cocktail known as the old fashioned.  Familiar yet creative, this is the ice cream I thought I ate in my youth but didn't until now.
author: Suo L.

description: I have tried the most unique mint chip ice cream ever!  The mint chip here isn't the ordinary peppermint flavor that most ice cream parlors have.  Instead, the mint chip flavor here is like a mojito.  The flavor is strong and fresh.  I love it!
author: Karen L.

description: This place is best for those who don't get attached to a particular flavor or who are up for something new. I've never had a repeat flavor here, and they've all been good. I'd like to have some of those flavors again, but I'll have to wait and see what shows up the next time I'm here!
author: Jess L.

description:
I love SF because I love Mr. and Mrs. M.
I love Mr. and Mrs. M because I love San Francisco.

Mr. and Mrs. M is in my heart.
My heart is in Mr. and Mrs. M.

Mr. and Mrs. M is ice cream.
Ice cream is Mr. and Mrs. M.

Mr. and Mrs. M is divine, scrumptious, and a wondrous spectacle to all my senses.
Divine, scrumptious, and a wondrous spectacle to all my senses is Mr. and Mrs. M.

Mr. and Mrs. M breaks all rules of logic.
author: Hana J.

description:
The best ice cream cones EVER!
Their flavors are unique - the owners are friendly and accomodating.
I love coming here even if its super out of my way.
I hope they do really well only negative thing is that they close early but I guess considering that they do this because they want to be home and take care of their daughter - i think that deserves a star too.
author: Kitty C.

description:
This ice cream establishment is our favorite in all of SF.  It is kind of a mixture of all the popular shoppes right now, but this one has so much more charm in more ways than one.

Location: easy parking on streets nearby, no hassle circling to find a parking spot
Store: quaint wooden tables, chairs and stools with beautiful simple floral arrangements, always a place to sit and no one breathing down your neck while you are trying to enjoy your ice cream
Service: 5 stars - the nicest owners and makes you happy to be supporting them while enjoying excellent ice cream - btw, congratulations on the sign out in the front - it is beautiful and stands out!  we love it!
Consistency - perfect - creamy, but hard enough to shave off in small bites and does a cool "dry ice" effect when you take bites from it.  You will have to experience it to know!  

CANDIED VIOLET is the greatest flavor!  We have been there a few times now, and so far it is my favorite.  The flavors are unique enough - different, but not way out there.  

The price is right - $3.75 for 2 large scoops.  They are very generous with the amount they scoop and service is always with a genuine smile.
author: three's company M.

description: So delicious!  I looooved the cherry ice cream I had here.  Usually when I try to stop by it's closed, merp, but I finally got lucky and was very pleased.  Nom nom nom.
author: Amy M.

description:
Bi-Rite vs. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous:

Mr. and Mrs, Miscellaneous, you had me at "ballpark." Naturally, I'm not big on sweets. Any of my close friends could tell you that I would always opt for another slice of steak or another bite of burger rather than working on a desert. Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is single-handily responsible for my rearrangement of dietary priorities as I have quickly fallen in love with their ice cream. 

The "Ballpark" (hook, line, and sinker)

- Beer ice cream with roasted peanuts and chocolate covered pretzels... need I say more? (Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous do different beer/brittle ice cream combos too)

Other favorites...

- Salted Caramel (rivals Bi-Rite)
- Peanut Butter Malt
- Fernet Branco (making fernet taste good is a miracle on it's own!)

I'm sad to say I've only made 3 trips here so I haven't had too many different flavors. However, everytime I stop by there is something new and it's impossible not to find your "flavor of the week." I loooooove Bi-Rite's ice cream like everyone else. However, I don't like Bi-Rite's parking and super long lines.

Sorry Bi-Rite, I think Mr. and Mrs. Miscellanous wins the battle of ice cream in the city

honorable mention(s): Mitchells, Three Twins, and Humphry's
author: Brian L.

description:
I waited a while to write a review because I didn't want to increase my wait time. But now that its already crazy popular, I'll give this place the props that it deserves.
     The ice cream itself is on par with anything that I've ever had (including that place in dolores park). They don't just have one signature flavor, all their flavors are good. Not only that...they have THE BEST cookies I've ever had. Perfect!
author: Siao W.

description:
I hate you!   Not only are you in the coolest new district of town (by my house), you tempt me to cheat on my absolute favorite place ever, Bi-Rite Creamery.  It used to be the BEST ICE CREAM IN THE WORLD and now you rival their mega selection and friendly happy people (who would not be friendly if you had free ice cream all day) with your Milk and Cream (vanilla wafers and vanilla ice cream), Ballpark, Coffee, Red Bean and other unique, handmade, artisan flavors.  

Now I may have to work out an extra day a week just to keep me from being on The Biggest Loser.  Thanks for every luscious bite ;)
author: Chris K.

description:
I'm liking the Dogpatch more and more as I slowly discover that it's a hidden gem for great little places to eat, including Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. 

I was feeling tired but the Boyfriend had been talking about "this new ice cream shop that's been getting great reviews" and he almost cried when I told him I wasn't up for it so I got into the car and boy, was I glad I did. 

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is a darling little store that nestled its way into my heart for two reasons: 1) good ice cream and 2) all of their waste is compostable! 

I'd say that MMM is right in between Mitchell's and Bi-Rite in terms of consistency. It's smooth and creamy but not as smooth and creamy as Bi-Rite. Their flavors change often but they always have something you'll want. My latest obsession there is the Peanut Butter & Jelly. At first you're like, "Oh, jelly. Ice cream. Ok." And then you're like, "WHOA! Peanut butter! OK!" 
 
I also love how they make their own waffle cones right when you order them. 

If you're looking for a recommendation, candied ginger, chocolate malted, cookies and cream and peanut butter and jelly are pretty safe choices, IMHO.
author: Christine P.

description:
Just wanted to clarify my statement... 

First the chocolate chip cookie is amazing... buttery, dark bitter sweet chocolate cuts through the sweet and fat of the cookie nicely...

The ice cream has great flavor.  On par with other greats out there.  I prefer BiRite because I think BiRite uses a little more cream or fat in its ice cream.  Mr & Mrs. Misc is not as creamy as BiRite.  More ice crystals in its flavors...
author: Frank M.

description:
I am NUTS over Pink Squirrel!!  It is a MUST try...

Yummmmmmmmmm
author: Samantha M.

description: Two pastry chefs who used to work at Spago, they are now working their magic with ice cream and we are so unbelievably lucky.  I can't afford to go to amazing restaurants to taste this kind of magic but I can afford ice cream and we go here as often as we can.  Sage honey with toasted hazelnuts is the new favorite but more than likely I will have a new, new-favorite each time I go.
author: christine m.

description:
{standing in front of a room of people like in AA}

Hello. My name is Lyn and I am an ice cream addict. I am ashamed publicly but proud privately to admit that I've probably tried all the ice cream shops in San Francisco (and even some outside of San Francisco). If you name it, I've probably been there. 

Bi-Rite: check
Mitchell's: check
Humphrey Slocomb: check
Three Twins: check
Fenton's: check
Ben & Jerry's: check
Ghirardelli: check
Swensen's: check
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous: check

PS: I refuse to list places like Baskin-Robbins because loving ice cream means not compromising my high ice cream standards.

I was disappointed at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. I went in with high expectations stemming from Yelp's 4.5 star ratings. I left with a child's scoop of cookies and cream ice cream because that was the only remotely appealing flavor for me. Much like Humphrey Slocomb, I felt the flavors were just too out there. I tried the basil and chocolate chip and it tasted like a mixture of a Thai dish and chocolate. The selections weren't abundant, which wouldn't be an issue if they were as delicious as those of Bi-Rites but alas, they weren't. There weren't many desserts to crave either, which was another minus for the store. I wouldn't drive all the way out here for ice cream but am willing to try one more time if I'm every near the Dogpatch, which means I won't be back for awhile. 

Parking wasn't the easiest either, and I went at 3 pm on a weekday.
author: Gwen L.

description:
Seriously, I am a dessert fanatic.  I love eating, but I will always try the dessert especially if the patrons before me have recommended it.

I have wanted to try Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for some time now, but they close relatively early and I don't live too close.  

Finally this past Sunday I had my opportunity.  I had just left the Giants game, and in walking to my friend's car, happened to mention the ice cream place which I knew was in the area.  

We ended up going, and omg, soooo good.  I love unique flavors which is why I like Ben & Jerry's.  But many Ben & Jerry's flavors can be too overwhelming with their mix-ins.  That is not the case at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  The flavor is in the ice cream itself, not the stuff that's mixed in.  

I had "Pink Squirrel" which was SO good.  I really like black cherry ice cream but don't prefer to deal with the countless pesky cherries.  Well, Pink Squirrel is black cherry minus the cherries.  It was so perfectly creamy and not too sweet.  I also tried the strawberries and cream, really yummy too!

The flavors change regularly even within the same day as they run out.  I can't wait to go back and try some more.  I know they also had banana, horchata, english tea, pralines & cream, burnt sugar, and blueberry that day.
author: Suzi F.

description: Delicious ice cream! If you have a sweet tooth, or just enjoy some good ice cream, take an afternoon trip on a sunny day and enjoy your ice cream in the sun filled ice cream boutique.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
My friend and I drove out to the Richmond before realizing Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous was on 22nd St, NOT 22nd Ave...  It was already 5:30 at this point so we had only 30 minutes to make to all the way across the city before the 6pm closing time ... in the heart of rush hour! 

Luckily we made it just in the nick of time. We chatted with the worker and told him about the little adventure it took to reach the shop. He showed some compassion by insisting on giving us our ice cream on the house. SUCH A SWEET GESTURE! I had the peppermint ice cream and it was sooo good! I'm not sure if it was just a seasonal flavor since I did go during the holidays. My friend purchased the almond brittle (it's made locally) and they were divine. Definitely returning!
author: Annie L.

description:
Actually more like 4.5 stars!!! On our second ice cream foodie hit, we went to Mr and Mrs Misc, cause we wanted to try out the Pink Squirrel.

Long lines aren't a deterrent. They have ample places to sit inside, lots of water and cups to drink, and interesting flavors to sample. First off, Pink Squirrel is like a light almond amaretto...it's a combination of 2 creme somethings and it's pink. So that's scoop #1. Scoop #2 was Coconut Creme..which had toasted coconut flakes all around. It was intense and I actually prefer the coconut over the Pink Squirrel...it overpowered the other light flavor. The one we should have went with but we arrived too early for, was the Croquantino (Hazelnut with hazelnut liqueur)...it was vibrantly intense and the ground up bits of hazelnuts was a good texture with all that cream. Ahh...we just couldn't fit anymore, and my tongue was numbed up pretty good. So maybe next time for hazelnuts!

Handmade cones were $.50, 2 scoops were $4.75, but they were big scoops. They also offer other homemade peanut brittle, cookies and baked goods. They also have a bathroom too. They'll only take credit if it's over $5.00.

Parking is street with some free hourly parking.
author: Pauline L.

description:
I've been a loyal fan of BI-Rite but when I had my first taste of the Monkey King at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, i was a believer!  The jasmine ice cream was so amazingly good and refreshing. 

My friend's Candied Violet was delicious as well. They had a few other choices that were pretty creative such as the ballpark (i think it was something along the lines of beer and peanuts) that I tempted to try but didn't have the stomach capacity to do so. 

Service was great, the owners were really nice. Despite the fact that we walked in even with the closed sign hanging up, they were still willing to serve us. 

The cleanliness and bright openness makes it a great place to just sit and relax. It is a definite must try!
author: Hung F.

description:
The reviews here are right!  Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous tastes soooo much better than all the other ice cream joints in SF.  Better than Bi-Rite, better than Humphry Slocombe.....the list can go on and on.

Super friendly service letting us try all kinds of flavors the day before Thanksgiving.  Bought a pint of Mascarpone to complement the Pumpkin Pie our friend was baking - boy were people impressed by the combination!  The pint was gone in a manner of seconds - no joke.  Only $7.50 or $8 for a freshly-packed pint, too, which I consider a steal for SF.  (Don't know if it actually is...)

We will definitely be back to try more flavors and impress another group of friends with ice cream more flavorful, creamy and smooth than Bi-Rite's!
author: J. P.

description:
Went biking with a friend around SOMA and the Dog Patch.  Mr and Mrs Misc was definitely a pit stop that I could not past.  

The place was very clean, has a lot of room to sit down, and best of all, the ice cream was awesome.  I ordered a scoop of the Burnt Sugar and I will have to be truthfully honest, in my opinion it was better than Bi-Rites' Salted Caramel.  It had everything from texture, creaminess, and unique flavor.  I will definitely have to go back to explore more flavors.
author: Shad B.

description:
Very nice/urbany location, located pretty close to Hard Knox, so if you're fiending for dessert, you have a good default place for dessert. This place is a semi-new ice cream shop that has instantly established itself among the heavy hitters (Bi-Rite, Mitchells, Humprhy, etc). The service is awesome and both owners are very nice and friendly, and I really get the vibe that they love what they're doing, which definitely shows in their ice cream.

Chocolate Chip Ice Cream - this is more like vanilla ice cream with tons of dark chocolate shavings... very very good... esp the quality of chocolate they use. Almost milky, and the separation between chocolate and vanilla flavors was very delicate.

Pink Squirrel - almost tasted like almond gelato, but with a slightly creamier texture. Extremely delicious, and I could imagine myself going to China town and making and ice cream almond cookie sandwich. 

Burnt Sugar - if you like creme brulee or that slightly bitter sweet taste... oh boy you're in for a treat. This was soooo good, and it tastes exactly like the name suggests. I actually went back and ordered a pint of this mixed with vanilla to make a Creme Brulee (guy called me out on it).

Vanilla - Another very rich vanilla ice cream. I bought this along with the burnt sugar for my sister after polishing off my 3 scoop ice cream. My sister said this was the best vanilla ice cream she has had. Though not as custardy as other ice cream places, this one has very good quality and the vanilla is rich but not overwhelming. 

Chicory Coffee - this is like Vietnamese Coffee turned into ice cream. A nice slight taste of chicory root a long with the coffee grounds adding texture created a good ice cream. This has quite a bit of caffeine in it for someone who isn't used to drinking coffee, so I was left with a nice buzz. Initially, I thought this ice cream was maybe 3rd amongst my top 3 coffee ice creams, but I really could not stop thinking of this ice cream, as the vietnamese coffee tones really won me over. This is my favorite coffee ice cream. I'm actually craving this now while I type.

Horchata Ice Cream - this tastes like a less gritty ice cream version of La Santaneca's Tiste... this was amazing... almost like eating cinnamon toast crunch in ice cream form. It was a little bit sweet (the guy mentioned this and I agreed), but it was still so delicious and such a great take on Horchata... I actually would take this melted down over ice over horchata!

yeah, I'm a pig, but I really love the ice cream here... you cant go wrong with anything you order. They also have peanut butter and chocolate malt balls, but I ate too much ice cream. This was basically my lunch. I love this place. Wish they had the Brown Butter ice cream, which is probably the best ice cream I've ever had. Overall, my favorite ice cream in the city, with the most ice creams falling into my top 5 (Coffee, Burnt Sugar, and Browned Butter are top 5, with Bi Rite and Humprhy taking the other 2 spots)
author: Marc T.

description:
When I first discovered this place, I ate their ice cream 3 days in a row. YUM! Even the winter cold does not deter from such a fine delight.

LOVE:
- Burnt Sugar
- Beer and Brittle
- Croquantino
- Chicory Coffee (I don't even drink coffee; sometimes decaf)
- Buttered Rum
- Cones made in-house!!... seriously the best cones I've had in my life and I eat a ton of ice cream.
- creative yummy cookies e.g. peanut brittle & burnt sugar
- Short lines (compared to Bi-Rite/Humphry Slocombe/Mitchell's)
- Great ambiance/seating area
- Easy street parking

Like:
- Candied Ginger
- Pralines and Cream
- Pumpkin
- Candied Violet

Also think it's cool they have root beer and cream soda floats. I wish they opened at night like Bi-Rite/Humphry/Mitchell's. I heard they're experimenting with their hours; the sign on the door said they close at 5 or 6pm.

Wall Street Journal mention last week: http://bit.ly/dDwIP9
author: Chris P.

description:
Another great local business in this up & coming area.

The flavors change every day, they're experimental and interesting but not as crazy as Humphry Slocombe. I find their flavors more balanced, and less sweet, than Bi-Rite.

I'm struck that they don't do many chocolate-based flavors, instead they tend to run to more subtle cream-based ice creams, like earl grey, lavender, caramelized ginger, halva, pumpkin spice, etc.

Well worth a visit - it's easy to get here, and there is lots of parking.
author: Gian Pablo V.

description:
ICE CREAM, YOU SCREAM, WE ALL SCREAM:-)

Pros:
Free and easy parking (in SF!!!)
Delish homemade, gourmet type flavors (different flavors daily)
Friendly and helpful staff (you can ask them anything about the ingredients used)
Free tastings
Good prices and generous servings ($6 for 3 scoops)
You can add toppings for a small charge all mostly $1
Almost no line at certain times of the day, Definitely shorter lines than Bi-Rite (Went at 1:30pm only 2 people in line)
Next to awesome eats like: Serpentine and Hard Knox Cafe among others. Eat there, dessert here, yah!
Husband and wife owned (Mom and pop shop, hey!)
The cutest jars for water (Don't know if that counts, but its free water)
Oh they also have other goodies, peanut brittle, almond brittle, cookies, and more...

Cons: 
It's more cost effective to purchase the 3 scoop for $6 than the 1 scoop for $3.5, so now I'm an ice cream fatty butt:-)
Another con is that I offered to be their taste tester if they'd pay me in ice cream and let me live there but I was denied, hahaha...hey a girl can dream!
author: Mavi T.

description: Thank you food network for leading me here! My fiance wasn't super excited about it because I picked the two flavors, and then proceeded to make it a sundae. Um...AMAZING?! What diet?! To prove to him I thoroughly enjoyed it, I finished it. NBD. To give you some perspective, I eat like a crazy person in that i like a bite of everything, but I hate finishing anything. To finish an entire sundae of decadent ice cream says a WHOLE lot, and what it says is AWESOME!
author: Camille T.

description:
Screw this place!  I have been successfully avoiding ice cream for MONTHS in an attempt to get my SF summer (aka October) body ready for Dolores Park.

But then this place had to open a block away from me and and every night I see the happy families and children and groups of young 20 somethings smiling and laughing over a cup or cone of delicious ice cream and I had to give it a shot.

Worst mistake of my life...it's heavenly!  And the folks working in there are so nice and accommodating they make you forget you're about to order ice cream for the first time in months!  But alas a rotating flavor board, interesting creations mixed with the classics, great toppings all make for a fantastic experience.

Oh well...I guess I'll just run back and forth to Dolores park! Enjoy everyone!
author: Kellen M.

description:
What better hook than a hot-off-the-griddle waffle cone stuffed generously with Ballpark flavor ice cream (beer, pretzels, and peanuts) to kick off summer in the city??!!!

A very cool accomplished couple, Ian & Annabelle are also making brittle, cookies oozing with chocolate and cherries and other goodies will keep me coming back for more sweet treats.
author: Mariangela S.

description:
Why oh why can't they be CLOSER!  I live way too far away...

All I can say is AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!  I think I would even rate above bi-rite... 

Flavors are very imaginative yet mouth-watering.  Ever time I go, I truly have a very hard time trying to decide which flavor to get because they all sound so heavenly!
author: Yvette H.

description: Yum! I had the salted mango ice cream- it was smooth, creamy, and perfect.  The atmosphere is clean & simple with a few large tables and stools to share.
author: Christy L.

description: Simply put: among the best ice cream shops in the city. And that's saying something in a city like SF, with so many great ice cream shops.
author: Ben R.

description: This place may have a smaller menu compared to Bi-Rite but is by far superior to Bi-Rite. The flavors are unique, but not overpowering. They also mix well together. I've mixed and matched flavors, and everything reminds me of Ratatouille when Remy describes his taste sensations as all the colors splash and dance across the screen.
author: Art W.

description:
I am breaking my three try rule for the first time, since I bought 3 pints to take home AND had two other flavors in shop.  That qualifies for at least three visits!  Ian and Annabelle have created a lovely haven for ice cream on the edge of Dog Patch.  The space is open, airy and simple; creating the perfect backdrop for a multitude of fabulous flavors.  Let's get some technical out of the way:

1.  They now take credit cards.  So you have no excuse why not to take home a couple of pints.
2.  They are SUPER nice.  Customer service takes you far now a days. Good music, good conversationalist and they didn't rush us into choosing.
3.  Parking is not a huge problem if you are willing to walk a few blocks.
4.  The space is super clean.  

Now for the part you have been waiting for...drum roll....flavors du jour:

Pint number one:  Earl Grey.  Outfrigginstanding.  Tastes like the fabulous organic bergamot  Earl Grey I get at Rainbow.  Well rounded, not too floral and very sensual.

Pint number two: RedRum Raisin.  It just blew Toscannini's rum raisin out of the water.  The right amount of booze mixed with a very smooth vanilla.  I never have to go back to Boston again.  Just kidding dad.

Pint number three:  vanilla and blueberry.  Since blueberries are at the height of their season, this was a no brainer.  Super light and fabulous; perfect for after a meal.

In store I had a cup of candied violet and vanilla. The candied violet was awesome, but a pint of it would have been overwhelming.  Definitely better in small amounts.

The ice cream was smooth, sweet and not as heavy and dense as Humphry Slocombe.  They have a great selection of unusual flavors  and for a nice change, they also pay homage to the classics.  I hope they have the Cable Car next time I go!

We also purchased the hybrid cookies: peanut butter/sugar cookies and the chocolate chip/cherry.  Oh and their coconut marshmallows.  The cookies were crispy on the edges and soft and chewy in the middle; super yummy!

They have been open about two months and I wish them years of success.
author: Monika S.

description: This place may have the best ice cream in SF.  Also, the line/wait is typically not as long as the other usual suspects (Bi-rite & Mitchell's).  However, Mr & Mrs. Misc. closes around 6pm which is a real shame and the reason it loses a star.  If this place stays open later, it'll get the additional star :)
author: Daphne N.

description:
I LOVE this place! They are one of those new-age ice cream parlors with some interesting flavors. I've tried a lot of their offerings and loved every one. The staple is of course the candied violet, which is amazing. 

Please opt for a fresh-made waffle cone, I don't really think you can resist, as the smell permeates the whole shop, they also pack the waffle cone with ice cream, so you have ice cream through the last bite! Lovely touch. 

On top of this, the owners are amazing and so friendly! They never give you weird looks if you want to try 4 of their 6 flavors, and aren't stingy with the tastes either, which is a + in my book.
author: Angela H.

description:
Gold gold gold...

You walk into this beautiful place and are instantly greeted by Mr or Mrs Miscellaneous offering spoons to taste the goods.

I tried the Bourbon something and the Blackberry something and was in love with each, but being such a hot day, I went for the strawberry sorbet.  Just perfect, tart and smooth and so so so tasty.

The decor is perfect and Mr & Mrs are such sweet people....

Pure Icecream Gold...
author: Nathan H.

description:
This was my first time here and was pleasantly surprised. They have a very unique menu which I understand is not always the same. They try new flavors all the time. If you are expecting vanilla, chocolate or strawberry - go somewhere else. But if you're looking for gourmet ice cream, flavors like nougat, mascarpone, chickory coffee, chai tea, halva, jasmine green tea, etc. this is the place to try. And yes, these were most of today's flavors. They also offer baked goodies that they make themselves - not delivered from some other bakery. 

They offer taste test on their flavors plus they use recycled spoons, bowls, etc. The place is also very clean with antique style wooden tables and a restroom.

The staff is very friendly too.

Stop in and have a taste. If you love ice cream, you won't be disappointed.
author: C R.

description: Oh my God!!!! What amazing things I could say about this place. The Constantly changing menu keeps things interesting visit after visit. The MALT BALLS!!! The attention to detail and the staff being so well informed and just plain nice. It can get a bit packed, but it's so worth the wait in line.
author: Max R.

description:
These people are amazing! And the ice cream is my favorite in the city, the best I've ever had! 

Favorites I've tried so far:
Earl Grey Tea
Creme Catalana (flan + lime = epic)
Ginger
Peanut Butter Malt
Candied Violets
Orange Blossom

I could go on and on. 

Everything is homemade with seasonal ingredients, the flavors are delicious, and it's always a wonderful experience going in.

The couple who own the place are so sweet and really enthusiastic about getting the flavors right. They're always super engaging and genuinely interested in what you think about their ice cream. I've been a regular since they opened (I work in the same block) and I've never had a not pleasant experience there. They're always full of smiles and ready to hand out the ice cream - my kind of place.

Thanks for moving into the neighborhood!
author: Natalie J.

description: Excellent ice cream, inventive flavors, an all around good time. Ovaltine stood out the most for me as it was one of my favorite drinks as a child. They deserve nostalgia points for that. Buko Pandan is exactly what you'd expect if you're familiar with the flavor, can be a bit exotic to those new to this Filipino treat. The Earl Grey tea was an excellent choice, reminiscent of a floral milk tea. Wanted to try the candied violet but they were sold out an our before closing.
author: Ryan L.

description: 100th review!  And of course I'm saving it for this place which has overtaken Bi-Rite for my favorite ice cream place in the bay area.  Very chill spot that isn't crowded like some other places and the ice cream is DELICIOUS.  Creamy but not too thick...somewhat of a contradiction but it's true!  And the Honey Graham flavor.  Oh yes.  The Honey Graham flavor.  They've got other inventive flavors like Earl Gray and Salted Mango.  I wish they'd have all the flavors available all the time but they seem to rotate so it's a bit of a surprise as to what's there when you go.  If you haven't been to this place, check it out.  Do yourself that favor today.  It's that good.
author: Francis S.

description:
I love this place. Ice cream with a beautiful creamy texture. They usually offer 9-10 ice creams each day, ranging from classic flavors to inventive new combinations. You are greeted and served with a smile, but it's you that ends up smiling as you enjoy a little cone of heaven.

Even a cold, overcast day like today could not stop my craving for some Mr. and Mrs. ice cream. Their salted caramel hit the spot -- the perfect balance of sweet and salty. 

Different flavors every day. Follow the Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous page on Facebook to get the daily menu.
author: Joel A.

description:
This ice cream is not for me.

The flavors are good and intense but I like my ice cream to be rich and creamy.

The texture here is very light (too much air in it). 

Thank god I live near bi-rite...
author: David L.

description:
Meh.  

The flavors were somewhat interesting but limited, especially if you don't want booze in your ice cream.  Interesting that there were lots of kids there when I went.

The texture was fine, not icy, but not creamy or smooth like BiRite.

I wouldn't bother, it's Mitchell's quality ice cream, but more expensive with fewer options.
author: Linda L.

description: Pretty darn good! One of my fave ice cream shops, next to Marco Polo, in SF! I got the rosemary honey and coffee flavors. The coffee was goooood! $4.75 for 2 scoops. Next time, ask for the JUNIOR scoop ($4.50) but at least it'll be smaller. But it was so good so I stuffed myself. =) Flavors were all unique and changes daily.  It's a bit out of the way but I wouldn't mind coming out here for yummy ice cream! Plenty of parking and spaces to sit inside the shop. I like Mr. & Mrs. more than Ici in Berkeley and prefer Mr. & Mrs. over Bi-Rite and definitely over Humphrey.
author: Natalia H.

description: I think this is my new favorite ice cream spot in SF. The flavors have unique names and unique flavors. I went with a few friends and collectively we ordered pink squirrel, birthday cake, and bourbon & caramel. All of them were yummy! I'd have to say that my favorite out of these three would be pink squirrel. I actually ordered the bourbon & caramel. If you really like bourbon, I recommend getting this because it's pretty strong, the flavor that is. I really want to come back and try Earl Grey!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I'm from and live out in the burbs and really feel bad for anyone who never gets out - get out as in, get out of the area or ever get out of their comfort zone (or both).

this review's mainly for the out of towners and like to stick to their usual, franchisey Baskin Robbins with the same usual flavors and rarely venture out into something with more taste or flavor in anything, this may not be the place for you.

i heard about this place through my girlfriend who was working the Tretorn Wellie Wagon in San Francisco earlier this year where they toured all of San Francisco for about 3 months and she got to taste first hand a lot of the great places to eat and she just could not stop talking about this place.  i'll have to admit, i mean....come on, it's just ice cream.  one of my first 

Let me just first of all say that i absolutely LOVE this place!  you have never had real ice cream until you've been here.  There is so much flavor packed in every spoonful of ice cream that i am really having the toughest time to find the words to describe it.  one must experience this for themselves.

it was my second trip there last weekend and they had a flavor called, "Chocolate Chip Basil."  my first thought was, "wow...what a daring flavor combination." and i'd wager to say that it takes a sophisticated (snobby *ss) tongue to appreciate something like that.  if you can get past the fact that your ice cream has basil in it, it actually accentuates the chocolate chips in a minty kind of way.  nonetheless, i have to give them props for their risk taking and forward thinking in their approach to the flavor spectrum on something as classic as ice cream.

while that might be a little bit too over the top for you, they have several flavors there (don't be surprised to see completely different flavors every day) and you can sample everything before committing to a scoop.  i've had their Earl Grey Tea, Dirty Chai Tea and several others that i can't seem to remember the name (damn, i really shouldn't have taken 2 weeks to do this review) but extremely, flavorful and delicious!!!  every little spoonful was like a taste of heaven.  i literally had an out of body experience, was sitting up on a cloud just above the building and was looking down at my physical body and...kidding kidding! but you get the jist! :)

now about the location, depending on what time of day you head out that way, you may have to drive around the block at least once to find parking but trust me, very worth it!!!  the decor and atmosphere inside is very cozy, homey with a nice window view out to let plenty of natural sunlight in.  the staff is very friendly and can get pretty crowded from time to time.

in terms of pricing, if you're from the burbs like me and you're not used to this, just letting you know, it is a tad bit pricey.  $3.50 for a fairly generous scoop and a little extra if you want it on one of their cones.  but you have to remember, the ice cream here isn't massed produced in large quantities like a baskin robbins or a cold stone or any of your typical franchisey ice cream outlets - these are made from scratch (yes made from scratch) and are in extremely limited quantities per day.   

this has easily become one of my necessary stops whenever i'm in the SF Area vicinity and look forward to my next trip out this way!
author: Elvin L.

description:
Strawberry shortcake ice cream was delicious! The employees are happy to let you try all the flavors.

Would give this place 5 stars if they were open later during the week.
author: Ross A.

description:
Not gonna lie...I'm an ice cream whore!  

We love supporting the local joints in our neighborhood and this place is even better since they serve my all-time favorite food!  Tried this place before they even had a sign and I knew they were gonna do awesome. And!  Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous themselves serve you!  Couldn't get any cuter than that!

The place is located in the dogpatch with tons of parking around it.  It's near tons of great eateries, so it's perfect to swing by after for some dessert. 

The ice cream is absolutely delicious!  They have tons of creative, tasty flavors.  Today I had the banana's foster and that was awesome.  My most favorite flavor of their's so far is definitely the Peanut Butter & Jelly.  The mint and rocky road are definitely runner up's.  Their ice cream is creamy but not too rich and not too sweet.  Also, I love their cones!  Very fresh, crispy and crunchy and not too sweet.

I love Bi-Rite ice cream too and I can't decide which place I like better since the ice creams from each place are just too different too compare.  But, here you can avoid long lines and get front door parking, so that definitely puts it in the lead for me.  Mr. and Mrs. Misc is more comparable to Humphrey Slocomb and this place hands down has better ice cream.

My favorite food is ice cream and if I'm giving this place 5 stars it means that I'm guaranteeing you ice cream that will make you cream in your pants!
author: Sharon T.

description:
I only wish they were open later in the evening!

We tasted a bunch of flavors, and weren't a huge fan of the more "creative flavors", which seems to be so and went for the classics, which they really take to another level. I got a scoop of the Rocky Road, which featured *HOMEMADE* fluffy marshmallows and fresh nuts.  The chocolate ice cream was creamy and just sweet enough.  My husband had their cookies and cream, which had the perfect amount of cookie and again, you could tell was super fresh, had a great consistency and had the right "melt time".  Their homemade cones are also delicious.  I have to rank it above Humphry Slocombe and Bi Rite.

I wish more there were more sit down ice cream places like this in the city.
author: Nina S.

description:
Damn friendly Dogpatch place with Pink Squirrel & candied violet with this delicious nutty crunch. Loved the vibe of this establishment even more than i did the ice cream. I ordered after remembering I had to go the loo so the guy held my two scoops behind the counter while I took myself into get flowing. Totally worth the wait. A truly sweet relief.
Maybe important for you. They take credit cards but have a $5 minimum. Two scoops is $4.50. 
Definitely important for me. They have a bathroom. Can't imagine what this experience would've been like w/out one.
Back to you: Get a cone with a cup. Cones help to balance out the sweetness of some ice creams and enhance the experience.
author: Michael W.

description:
Just what the doctor ordered for the neighborhood! 
We now have a fried chicken joint, snitzy pizza place, blue bottle coffee out-post, an American cafe, loading dock (covert nutrition) sandwich stall, Salvadorian taqueria and a few other random hole in the wall places. So yes... this place makes it complete

Really wonderful couple who own and operate the space. They both have bushels of restaurant/baking experience; and it shows.
All the ice-creams have just the right amount of fat. Great mouth feel and text book viscosity. Delicate but still rich. The cream lingers on your lips for just a fleeting moment then dissipates. 

Dynamite seasonal fruit creams,  and innovative, not too wacky, ones as well. All the ice-creams are very approachable. Even your cousin from Toledo will enjoy them . 
They also make really good cones. 

I didn't try the cookies and caramels but will for sure get some next time. 
I know a success story when I see it. 
Congrats on the new space! many years to come.. 
Thank goodness this is NOT in the mission. you all can keep the Humphrey / bi-rites. this one is for us!
author: Stephen G.

description:
Sinfully good.  My friends always rave about this place on Facebook.  After an afternoon Giants game and a win, I didn't want to ruin it by sitting in traffic so decided to try out Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous, I made the right choice and looks like a lot of other people coming from the game had the same idea.  

I had the Nougat on a cone, it was so good!  They make their own cones.  The others in my party of 4 decided to have root beer floats and loved it.  I will definitely come back, I have more choices to try out.  I don't eat ice cream often but I want to try all their flavors, so creative!

Like them on Facebook, they give updates on flavors, availability, etc.
author: M D.

description:
Sweet baby jebus!  
What's not to love: 
-amazing ice cream!  My gf & I have at times totally different tastes,  but love to share. We'll get flavors the other would never go for, taste each other's and ALMOST want to trade. They do all the flavors so well. 
-they're so cute and sweet!: they are great peeps and they work hard to make their art. 
-they use organic/sustainable ingredients:  mmmmmm, Strauss dairy, most things made onsite.

My one issue, it took me til the heat wave of 2010 to try their fudgecicles, why oh why did I wait?!?! I've seen jebus in their their little dark chocolate dipped stickless wonder bars.
author: Carol S.

description:
I'm so glad these guys moved in across the street from me! Great ice-cream, super friendly owners, and a beautiful street-level view. Pretty much everything you could hope for in a Dogpatch establishment. I can't wait to watch this neighborhood take shape over the next five years, especially if its drawing talent like this.

Make no mistake about it, the Dogpatch on 3rd St just got another gem to compliment Serpentine and Hard Knox in culinary excellence. 

For now it's cash only, and there aren't a lot of ATMs in the area, so stock up on green before you go.
author: Alex M.

description:
It was well worth the wait! Small batch production. Only 3 gallons of any flavor are ever made- guarantees freshness, but when it's gone, it's gone! Then they replace it with a different flavor.

Today I sampled:
Honey & Thyme- 5 stars on originality and uniqueness of flavor, a little too unique for a full scoop 
Nougat- 4 stars for combination of ingredients (apricots, pistachios, dates...), sadly there were not enough scattered throughout my scoop.
Roasted Banana- 3 stars, delish, but not as good as the RB from BiRite Creamery
Chocolate Malted- 5 stars for creamy texture, not too rich, little choco malt pieces made it crunchy and good 

There's no website, and no prospect of getting one any time soon. They aren't interested in sacrificing quality for the increase in traffic a website could attract. But I would love to see what flavors they have available on any particular day, as I'm holding out for Pralines & Cream! They are on Facebook and there is talk of perhaps using Twitter for this purpose. I hope so.
author: Carnley P.

description: Wow. I drove up here from Pacifica just to get ice cream and they told me they are closed and I was right at the end of the line with other customers. That's horrible customer service. Don't come here past 5pm people.
author: Kim M.

description:
I used to love going to Mitchell's to get my Mango ice cream fix, but this place has flavors that I crave for every week!  I try to come out with my family once a week for a well deserved treat.  The owners are chill and down to earth.  The flavors I liked the most are Fudge ripple, Croquentine, Candied Violet, Vanilla Bean, and Blueberry Buttermilk.  

Oh, make sure you get a waffle cone with your  ice cream.  They make it fresh daily.  Also try the cookies!!!
author: Marvin C.

description:
I've only been here once, but I know I'll definitely go back. They offer a variety of flavors (be sure to check their Facebook page for their daily flavors) and are very helpful in helping you decide. Believe me, you'll need help trying to pick one flavor out of the handful they have... unless you're a pig and just order every flavor available... which just might be me one day. 

I ordered the Fernet Branca, which.. and this will sound funny... tasted very pretty. It had a light and not overpowering flavor of the liquor and a creamy, satisfying texture of ice cream. Very delicious. I was savoring each spoonful as I gobbled it up. The shop itself looked very clean and trendy. I'll definitely return soon.
author: Robin I.

description: I've tried most of the ice cream staples in the city - Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Mitchell's, and Smitten and I don't know if Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is my favorite or anything but I do really like it. I'm very rarely in the area so coming here always feels like a real treat (especially when they're open for once.... must have tried coming here at least 3 times and it was closed each time for different reasons). I always like what I get here, but I don't know if I'd call it the most original in terms of ice cream flavors. Buttttt, they do know how to do it well and I love sitting at their long tables in the sunny Dogpatch having an afternoon chat with friends.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Had the Earl grey didn't have a strong taste to it but still good, not to heavy and made organic....might not be a comparison to bi-rite....=\

Didn't have that many choices to choose from, very large and bright store with plenty of seatings.
author: Linh D.

description: With all the awesome reviews about the unique flavors this place has to offer, I was expecting something mind boggling. I left just feeling eh. I definitely prefer Bi-Rite over this place. Actually, my friend, who's into making ice cream makes sugar free ice cream better than this. Maybe I've just become an ice cream snob now too...
author: Ede S.

description:
Life doesn't get much better than ice cream on a hot day.  Today was that day for me, made much better b/c I was standing in a surprisingly short line at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous (beat the rush) as I eagerly anticipated my first taste of the much-hyped flavors.  

It did not disappoint.  Had a taste of several and then ended up with a triple-scoop because I just couldn't decide. 

My favorites: Candied Violet (sweet but not overpowering) and Basil Chocolate Chip (love the originality of that combo).  Also good were the Orange Blossom (the aftertaste of the orange really stays with you, in a good way).

The two "traditional flavors" I tried (Vanilla Bean and Pralines & Cream) were also good but compared to the exotic combos of the other flavors, were a little too mainstream for me.

Can't wait to return to try flavors they didn't have today (Old Fashioned, Ballpark, PB&J, Burnt Sugar)!
author: F. P.

description:
A big thank you to Genevieve Y for taking me here for some awesome birthday ice cream! :)

I'm really glad to have found this place - I think it ranks up there with Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, and 3 Twins.

I got the coffee, but I tried some of Genevieve's candied violet, and I'll definitely be getting that next time (unless they change up the flavors).  Don't get me wrong - the coffee was still really tasty, but the candied violet is unique and a little bit lighter.  (Coffee's pretty rich.)

I probably would have given it 4.5 stars because I'd like to see more flavors, but the modern yet welcoming decor and exceptional service bump it up to 5.  It was super clean, too!

I'll be making a trip back here for sure!
author: Alice C.

description:
Ice cream is rich, but not overly so, which allows the flavours to shine through, versus getting weighed down and diluting the taste.  The 'ballpark' is great...the beer flavour is subtle but evident.  Also really liked the '7 spice.'  'Grasshopper' and 'praline' were equally delish.  Not many flavours at any given time, but what they put out, they do well.  Small batches, so they do run out.  Definitely comparable to other boutique ice cream places in the City.

They make or process all of the ingredients they mix into the ice cream themselves, from what we were told.  What an awesome personal touch that really sets it apart from other ice creams.  They also sell other homemade goodies to eat.

They gave us 'tastes' on real spoons, which was surprising, but a very cool touch.  Better for the environment and the doesn't impart a plastic taste.  Also a bigger portion and allows one to really get a taste of the flavour versus the dime-size you might otherwise get.

Super friendly 'staff' and definitely willing to chat and be helpful, assuming they're not busy.  Location and decor were nice...industrial/modern, which suits the neighbourhood.  Easy to get to and parking is not difficult.  That alone makes it worth going back.
author: JM Y.

description:
About to the lines the lengths of Tartine to less frequented Dog Patch. You will eat you some Gggggrrrrreat (to borrow a line from the frosted flakes kitty) ice cream here. Let me put it to ya this way: you'll eat ice cream even though you're not craving it and don't ever eat ice cream. 

The owners are like having really lax neighbors to chat with. The cones are made fresh and that perfumes the air. The flavors take you to places classic (vanilla) and out there (ballpark something with beer and peanuts, etc. But this is not Ben and Gerry's bullshit everywhere stuff). It's clean and they use Strauss Family Creamery.  Oh and before I stop my rambling, this place is a sight to behold if you are into modern industrial design. If they a one bedroom of it on Craigslist if would be gone in like 2 secs.
author: Mandy S.

description:
Everyone loves ice cream, young and old, skinny and fat, hell, even my dog does!! I've been meaning to check this place out for a while and I'm glad I finally did! This place is in a great location, ample parking, clean and plenty of seating. 

I have to say this feels very much like a adult's ice cream shop. Not that you won't see kids in the place or this is a bad thing. It's got exotic flavors that are constantly rotated, which can be a plus or not. I was a little disappointed when I got there, that some of their much written- abt flavors weren't available. However, it is my fault, I should have checked before going. It's too bad they do not have as many flavors at a time that you'd see at other places, but maybe that's how they get you to keep coming back lol. Good thing for me, we're not too far from them, so multiple trips it is, until I try all their yummy flavors! 

Their ice cream is really smooth, velvety, and fresh, nothing icy about it. Def try olive oil, as strange as it may sound, it's actually pretty good; pretty subtle but rich flavor and I couldn't get over its SMOOTH consistency!! Candied violet sounded interesting, but I felt after half a scoop, I got tired of it. Their coffee flavor was strong and yummy. OOhh!! I forgot to mention they have homemade sugar cones that were super fresh and yummy! 

They also have a bunch of other homemade goodies for sale (cookies, brittle, marshmallow) that looks scrumptious, but that'll have to wait for my next trip back :)
author: Ly T.

description:
I tried the punkin ale, tahini and sesame, chicory coffee and the earl grey.  Each flavor was pretty intense with the tahini and sesame being the most interesting.  I went with the smallest scoop of the Earl Grey and found it to be a pretty hefty portion.  

I loved the dark chocolate cherry cookie.  I'm not a sweets person but I could eat those on a regular basis.  The peanut brittle cookie I wasn't as much a fan of.  There was an aftertaste I didn't care for.  

I am guessing anytime I go to Hard Knox, I'll be stopping in here.
author: Seong P.

description:
Hip new ice cream joint wins points in my book. 
I spoon-swabbed the Carmelized Hazelnut & it was DELISH... followed by a swab of the Buttermilk & Blueberry & it was FEROSH!  Yum.

But when I looked at the chalkboard menu & read "PB&J" - it was a done deal.  I felt like I had a gourmet frozen Goober sandwich.  Creamy, salty, sweet - ding, ding, & DING.  

Hats off to Mr. & Mrs.
author: Deanna A.

description: This is dangerously close to supplanting Humphry Slocombe as my favorite ice cream shop. I've had the old fashioned and the beer & peanuts, both amazing flavors. They really like alcohol flavored ice cream here.. I've even seen fernet flavor, what could be more San Franciscan than that? Their hours suck... I have to leave work early to make it here before they close, otherwise I would seriously have put on about 20 pounds by now.
author: David K.

description: Father's day, owner/daddy is scooping to the masses, good daddy! Roasted peanut, lemon verbena and brown butter. All homeruns, no errors, the giants world series 2010 team of ice cream shops. Oh, don't miss the peanut brittle, just as outstanding and a great gift.
author: Kelly K.

description:
I feel like a fairy when I'm eating their ice cream. 

Yes, I was there gathering the flowers and their honey.
Yes, I was there with the soil where almonds and peanuts grew out. 
Yes, I was there helping the fruits ripen.
Yes, I can feel the gifts nature gave to Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous because they know what it means to craft these gifts. 

Oh! They're my No.1 in SF.
author: Liz H.

description:
I love artisan ice cream. And Mr and Mrs Misc has some of the best flavors I've ever come across. Old Fashioned (Maker's-soaked cherries and sliced almonds), Red Chai Tea, Basil Chip...  yum. I almost can't stand the suspense of what's up next on the constantly changing menu.

And the cones aren't just bland ice-cream holders. No, they are a treat in themselves. Fresh, crispy, flavorful little waffles. 

Service with a smile too. Awesome.
author: Bethany M.

description:
So I went to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous in anticipation of trying their raved-about Ballpark and Old Fashioned flavors, and much to my dismay, they were nowhere to be found on the menu.

I understand that all the products are handmade and that flavors change regularly, but jeez, if you know that there are two flavors that everyone loves, make sure you have at least one of them available!

I did try the Chicory Coffee (I usually LOVE coffee ice cream, but thought this was just okay, I guess I'm not really a fan of chicory), the Halva (good, but not anything I'd go all the way to the city for - reminded me of butter brickle), and Mango & Yogurt (really really good - you could taste the fresh mango).

I felt like I was at a completely different place than what I expected, given the Yelp reviews and the pictures of the menu posted on their Facebook page.  The flavors offered that day were just not that exciting to me, but I did appreciate that the ice cream itself was very high quality, using Strauss Organic products and sustainable business practices. 

The people were very friendly and I like that they are a local 2-man business.  Also, parking in this area is plentiful, so no need to circle around the block a few times to find a spot like at Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe.  

However, this was all overshadowed by the fact that was not able to try either of the two flavors for which I had made the trip out there.  So sad.  I will give them another shot though, since the quality is clearly there.  Maybe next time, I will call first and double check that the flavors I want are being offered.
author: Sarah G.

description: Just barely left without getting a second scoop.  It was that good.  I had Earl Grey and my friend had some Banana Toffee flavor that was also incredible.  Nice guys working the counter... I'll be back in the Dogpatch just for this spot!
author: Sam F.

description: Pink Squirrel and Candied Violet are above and beyond my favorite flavors, though I can't help but try at least three whenever I go in.  Great and innovative ice cream but I wish their hours were more reliable and they were open later.
author: Rachel W.

description:
What an amazing ice cream shop. I stumbled upon this little gem and keep dreaming of all the delicious flavors I tried....Lemon poppy, pralines n cream, candied violet and candied ginger. They were all amazing but I ended up with a cone of lemon poppy. Yum. I also bought some malts and a delicious cookie for a treat later. 
The couple that runs this shop are super sweet and I cant wait to go back and try more uber creative flavors! 

***A little tip -- check their facebook fan page for flavors.
author: Rachna P.

description:
My weeks obsession with coming here was finally satisfied...and I want MORE =)

serious amazing ice cream...creamy, cold, perfect consistancy flavor rich and no icey-ness baby!
Had the lemon crunch (um lemoncello with lemon drop crunchies!!!!) the boy had the black forest (vanilla with brownie and cherry)
All the flavours were to die for...orange blossom honey, earl gray, vanilla malt with peanut butter....
Oh had to try the caramel in the pretty brown wrapper in the candy jar at the counter. 75 Cents for hands down TOP caramel confection I've had in the city (compared to CDs and the mysteriously infamous caramel from the boy that I have yet to try)
Peanut brittle in mason jars for sale and mega coconut marshmallows and cookies too!!
Great space...only bummer is there early closing hour...I don't want this place to lose it's independent delightful small scale charm, but 8pm is early fro after dinner delights...
GO HERE NOW!!!
author: ERICA E.

description: Their malted chocolate ice cream is amazing. Totally worth circling the block 10x for parking for.
author: Wan H.

description:
I usually prefer frozen yogurt or soft serve, so the fact that I am writing such a rave review about ice cream is a big deal.
