My friends kept raving about this place so I decided to skip the Bi-Rite soft serve and give it a whirl. AMAZING! So much so that I wrote home about it. I swear...I came home and emailed my family who love ice cream and own an ice cream maker and told them that we have to go to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous when they come visit. :)

You are probably wondering why is it so awesome that I had to write home about it. So here goes...
 
1 - The ice cream is creamy and delicious and will put a HUGE smile on your face.
2 -  So many delicious, interesting, creative flavors! Usually only 1-2 flavors strike my fancy, but the first time I went, I wanted 6. I don't think they make bowls that big...
3 - It is not the size of a shoebox AND there are seats inside! What this means is that you don't have to eat your ice cream surrounded by impatient, hungry people who are still waiting in line and probably ready to jump you. 
4 - The line is not so outrageous that you want to give up and leave with no deliciousness.

I CANNOT wait to go back. In fact, I have been thinking about it every day since I've gone. Sadly, I am trying to have some self control. But the Peanut Brittle ice cream is calling my name...
author: Pei L.

description:
Whoa, pretty awesome Pralines & Cream, in a cone made right there in front of me. And the scooper assistant was super friendly.

This place is of the Bi-Rite 80/20 good/weird variety, versus Humphrey Slocombe's 50/50. 

Will definitely be going again to eat one of those giant chocolate chip cherry cookies.
author: Brent F.

description:
I came here hunting for the best chocolate chip cookie in SF, but instead ending up ordering a double scoop of ice cream and taking the cookies to go.  As others have noted, this place definitely does seem like the love-child of Humphrey Slocombe and bi-rite, with a line a fraction the size of both! The ice cream flavors border on the avant-garde, but they're not as extreme as HS.

the ice cream:

corn w/ caramel - I LOVE corn, and the flavor of this ice cream was perfect.  there are bits of corn in it and they swirl in caramel when scooping it out of the container.

candied violet - initially skeptical that I was eating sweet flowers, I ended up liking this one a lot. I kept digging around in it to find the bits of violet to eat. this one was sweeter than the corn caramel ice cream.

the cookies:
chocolate chip with cherry & chocolate chip - unbelievably chewy, even after day 2 of being in a package.  the cookies look very unassuming, but they're packed with chewiness and flavor ("Chocolate in the classic cookie is Cacao Barry; in Flores' chocolate-dried cherry spinoff, it's 70 percent Valrhona Guanaja. -- to quote a recent sf weekly article)
author: Jenny S.

description: THis is a great ice cream shop really inventive flavors and super ingredients. Love the Earl Gray and the cones!!!! O the cones. Don't forget to try the coconut marshmallows. and the caramels SUPER!!!!!
author: Leigh S.

description:
I really try to avoid contact with this place...
I'm not gonna lie, IT'S DIFFICULT. There's a few reasons...

1. I currently live right across the street
2. I've had their cookies... OMG OMG OMG. Cherry + Dark Chocolate = Foodgasm
3. THEY MAKE THEIR OWN ICE CREAM CONES! Paired with candied flower icecream...Aaaahhh.

I could gain 4,000 lbs if I came in here as often as it called out to me!
I will just have to avoid eye contact.. Until, maybe, this afternoon?! :D
author: Kellie P.

description:
I love this place.  They always seem so happy to serve you, the ice cream is great and the caramel and yellow corn is so fantastically awesome.  

I have no idea why people like bi-rite so much, this place is like 50x better.  

Parking is easy to find here.
author: Warren A.

description: Delicious creamy ice cream. Can't go wrong with any of their flavors.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I have been coming here for years! Everytime I have an ice cream craving, nothing satisfies me more than Mr & Mrs Misc! The quality of the ice cream is phenomenal! I love how the flavors change ever so often. Let's you try all the potential that this lovely couple has for this ice cream joint! Just took my bf here and he was so amazed. Had him scooping every last bit of his double scoop after it was long gone! 5 stars for the best ice cream, HANDS DOWN!
author: Krystal H.

description:
The verdict: Delicious. The line wasn't bad, and the flavors are great. I had the red rum raisin, which was chock full of actual raisins. 

I'll definitely be coming back. The cookies also looked fantastic.
author: Evan G.

description: Very good ice cream! This was my first time trying It. I had a scoop of sweet cream and a scoop of mascarpone. Both had great flavor and the sweet cream had just the right amount of sweetness to it. I really wanted to get the french lavender but it sold out by the time I got to the counter. All in all, the ice cream was worth the wait in line in the sun.
author: LaShea R.

description:
So excited to have this in our hood and to have tried it in its opening weekend. Walked in and the place looks amazing and immediately feel a warm vibe (partly from the large, open windows which allow the Dogpatch sun to shine in) from the friendly owners. 

I had the Ballpark ice cream and really enjoyed its odd flavors. My partner had the Chocolate and it was delish!

So excited to walk here and visit often. Ah.. and the 5 pounds heavier I'll be. :)
author: Art A.

description: I love stopping by this place on my way to something. It is delicious, and I hate American ice cream! But I love gelato in Italy, and that's my standard. This place rocks!
author: Carla Y.

description: It's as good as it gets! Great flavors you want and really effing good ice cream. I've become somewhat of an ice cream connoisseur since I became pregnant, so I know these things. The husband and wife team and staff are fantastic as well.
author: Donna A.

description:
They only offer two cookies, but damn those cookies are good!

Peanut Brittle cookie was big, thin, crunchy, and a bit chewy. The cookie flavor was buttery and the peanut brittle gave it great texture. 

Chocolate Chunk cookie was much different from the texture of the Peanut Brittle cookie but it was just as delicious. The cookie was softer and the chocolate was rich. 

When I told the guys they were my first stop on my SF cookie tour, they recommended three other places to try. They make great cookies and they know great cookies in their city.
author: Antoine T.

description:
Really great ice cream; imaginative flavors with a nice texture.  

Inspirational flavors. I make my own ice cream too, so coming in here gives me ideas for new flavors to make.  

Menu changes every day & multiple times a day.  Don't expect to get the same thing each time you go.  I appreciate the time and effort these folks take to constantly make new flavors. If you're the kind of person that doesn't want to try something new, just go to Baskin Robbins.

As clean as it gets. The place is literally spotless. 

Nice people that take pride in what they do. 

Overall a great addition to our hood.  Good thing its just a little further than walking distance from our place or we'd be here every day. 

Keep up the great work!!
author: C S.

description: The cherry ice cream is so good.  I really like this place.  Mmmm so good!  It also just seems to have an authentic, we make this stuff from scratch vibe.  Not sure if they do... but it has that vibe.
author: M C.

description:
Holy crap, this city is just silly with great ice cream places! I really don't understand how a place with limited days of actual summer can have so many fantastic ice cream joints. The coffee I get, but ice cream!?!

I came here on a Sunday afternoon with windy weather and there was a bit of line when we ordered, but a massive one when we left. I got the buttermilk and chocolate cake ice cream and an almond brittle cookie. The ice cream was rich and smooth and absolutely perfect. The cookie had a chewy center with a crispy edge and that nice sweet salty pairing. It's in the Dogpatch so it's a bit out of the way, but parking in that area is a breeze.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
Most awesome!  Especially for their alcoholic ice creams - kudos for bringing in some awesome new flavors for adults!  They also have non-alcoholic flavors too, but they just didn't seem as fun.  :P  They also have really awesome cookies - try the peanut brittle cookie (chewy, peanutty goodness!).

I had recently attended a training in Dog Patch, and went to this place every day for ice cream after lunch!  Their flavors tend to vary day to day, so that tells you how fresh their products are.  Flavors of note:

- OLD FASHIONED: Vanilla ice cream with bourbon cherries - OMG, so awesome!  I can't even say I like bourbon unless you're talking about chicken, but it really does work superbly with ice cream - yummy!
- BALLPARK: Anchor Steam beer with chocolate pretzels (and maybe nuts?).  It was actually quite good - certainly better than it sounded.
- CHAI TEA: I often find chai ice cream disappointing, but this one had a good amount of spice to it and was really tasty.
- LEMON KRUNCH: Limoncello with small crunchy bits.  It was a good lemon ice cream, but could be more lemony and more crunchy.  But I have to admit it actually is a good representation of limoncello.

If only they would open one near my house....
author: Fontane L.

description:
This is the best ice cream I have every had!  

White Sesame and Blood Orange.
author: Lily W.

description:
When is it NOT a good time for mr and mrs miscellaneous?! I'd come here in 30 degree weather in the pouring rain (or would it be snowing?) for ice cream. I'm glad the boyfriend started working in dogpatch or else I would have never found out about this place.

The Mr. & Mrs. are great. They are so friendly and nice. They'd let you try everything on their menu even if the line is 20 deep without rushing you off.

I love their coconut flavor but I've only had it once, unfortunately. I've pretty  much tasted everything they've had. Everything tastes great. I absolutely love that their menu changes all the time. It's like going to a new place everytime. It's like when your man/woman gets a new haircut/hair color and looks like a new person and you want to give them another name and have your way with the new stranger....

Like them on facebook! They post the day's flavors up (every so often).
author: Jeanette P.

description: Their ice cream is always fabulous, but what I actually come here for isn't even ice cream-- it's their Peanut Butter Maltballs. Mmmmm! Seriously, off the chain! Buy some and you won't be disappointed. :)
author: Shari B.

description:
Loved the ice cream. 
Loved the space.
Loved the Mr & Mrs.

...and that's all you need to know. 

FINE! I guess I'll write a real review. For one thing, this place just opened up about a month ago and do not have a real sign up. So, how can you find it? Well, it's across Serpentine and if you still don't know where that is, it's also right across Hard Knox. Tahdah! 

I love the dogpatch, not only is Hard Knox is right there, but one of my favorite brunch spots, Just For You Cafe, is right around the corner.  And I can safely say, this is the much nicer part of 3rd Street. Also, it's always sunnier around these parts. And what calls for sunny, warm days in SF? Ice cream, of course! Their shop is set up with huge windows as walls furnished with dark wood tables. 

They have house made peanut and almond brittle, cookies and other goodies such as coconut marshmallows for sale. But of course, it's the ice cream that you're here for! So far the flavors that stood out for me was the Ballpark (Anchor steam beer, pretzels and peanuts), and Old Fashioned (Maker's Mark, cherries and almonds).  Noticed a trend? I do like my alcohol... in ice cream that is ;P You'll also see some traditional flavors such as pralines and cream and oreo cookie- which are also yummy by the way! They also like to add new flavors to the mix such as "coffee and donuts," tres leches with chunks of tres leches cake in it, and "black forest," vanilla ice cream with kirsch-soaked cherries and chunks of black fudge cake. Very unique flavors without the weirdness (ie. Humphrey Slocombe). So come down and have a scoop or two or three. A plus, they use biodegradable cups and spoons!
author: Neva R.

description: Great product nice selection. Went about 5 minutes before close. While we were eating our ice cream a father and young daughter came in about 3 minutes after they closed. They refused to serve them and actually made the young daughter cry! It was obvious that the decision was made by employees that didn't care. Can't believe an owner would make that horrible decision.
author: richard w.

description:
I think the 400 reviewers who got here before me have said it all, but MMM is my fave ice cream in the city because of:

candied violet
full sail ipa
salted (super salty!) caramel
the brittle
the promise of awesome new flavors every time i visit

Plus, Ian could not be nicer.   Honestly.  I told him I was having dinner at Piccino and he offered to stash my ice cream until past his closing time, just so I could keep it frozen.  Lucky for me Piccino has promised to do the same, so I didn't need to bother him. But that's the kind of neighborhoody customer service that sets him above the rest.
author: Pei L.

description:
OMG what?! Fernet Branca flavored ice cream.  Oh yeah.  This place is an awesome ice cream place.  I got a scoop of toasted almond and my friend got a scoop of jasmine tea ice cream.  The flavors tasted so real.  I'll definitely be back when I get the chance to try all their crazy flavors.  

One minus is that the candied violet tasted really artificial.  Do violets really taste like grape drink?  No matter though; I admire their creativity.  Must try the Old-Fashioned next time!
author: DJ P.

description:
Part of the fancy pants ice cream craze that's all the rage nationwide (where nationwide = "bicoastal urban foodie/hipster circles")  

I hate the word hipster cos it signals lazy thinking, but nevertheless it seems like there should be a word for hipster-foodies... you know the types who are raising chickens and butcher their own meat and write blogs about raising chickens and butchering their own meat... foodster?  I'm sure somebody's already proposed a better name for it.  But I digress.  (I love writing 'but I digress' because it's such a yelp thing, half the reviews on here are like blog entries centered loosely around shopping/dining... not that there's anything wrong with that *ahem shawn g*)

So back to the ice cream. If you like Humprey Slocum you'll like this, it's the same deal.  Definitely get one of their homemade cones, they're really good.  As for flavors, here's the ones I've tried:

nougat-- too subtle, too sweet-- kinda bland
bananas foster -- ditto
caramel / corn - way too corny, i thought this one was kinda gross
old fashioned - *** winner *** this is my fave, it's bourbon cherries and toasted almonds, really good. if you like secret breakfast you'll like this

So get whatever has bourbon in it.  
Their marshmallow coconut things are pretty good though although you feel like a pig the second you start eating it.  A pig, or a 5-year-old.

The space they're in is nice, I quite like it-- well lit, airy, old wooden tables.  It has a good vibe.  I don't know much about the propritetors but based on the name and their interaction I'd guess they're dating or married?  The girl is super friendly and nice, the guy is a bit more laid back and  down to business, but they seem to be working together nicely and it's cool to see a partnership like that flourish.

It's great to have places like this in Dogpatch/Pot Hill!  Keep em coming
author: Amar P.

description: My favorite ice cream place in town, but they are closed for no good reason at any time any day they want. Make sure you are in the area, you may go there and it may be closed.
author: Matthew K.

description: No idea how I have not come here all these years but the ice cream really is great, the interior is welcoming, and the staff is friendly. Delightful surprise flavors not oft found elsewhere that I had this afternoon: olive oil and basil w/ dark chocolate. Can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Norman P.

description: Line out the door!! Worth the wait. I got the juniper + rose and my husband had a root beer float with honey graham ice cream. The cones are an extra 50 cents and made there. Loved my ice cream. Can't wait to come back and try other flavors.
author: Natalie S.

description:
LOVE!

These Ice Cream wizards are as good as it gets. We've been in three times so far (it's dangerous since we pass by several times a day to and from work/home) and I have to say it is some of the best ice cream I think I've ever had. 
It's made in house and every time you go there are new flavors to try. Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous are a friendly, genuine couple who have come to save the neighborhood from its former Ice-Cream-Shop-less-ness. And thank goodness for that!!
I was in earlier this week and had the Candied Violet on a homemade waffle cone. It was perfect. Sometimes violet flavored food items can be a bit perfumey, so much so that it can give me a headache. Their Candied Violets were delish! Sugary little purple nuggets in my ice cream...I couldn't have asked for a better scoop!

You can even get pints and half pints to go. And they say that they may do ice cream cakes in the nearish future! YUM!
author: Jes M.

description:
Worth the money. 

Worth the travel. 

I LOVE THIS PLACE. I take every visitor to M&MM -- its basically an excuse for me to have their incredibly well crafted, delicious & creative ice creams as much as possible. 

And their chocolate cookies are perfection.
author: Gall A.

description: Ohhhh ice cream how I love you! Interesting selection of flavours that will make even the biggest ice cream snob a happy camper. There's always a line but something's are worth waiting for and this is definitely one ofm
author: Leanne S.

description: Why are your hours so atrociously limited?! Ppl like to eat ice cream after dinner. Do you not want to make more money?!?
author: Roger G.

description: Seriously, I would love to rank their ice cream but every time I come here, they are closed. We came by on a Sunday at 3 pm and their hours are supposed to be till 5. They were closed and my kids were disappointed yet again. Another hipster place, seriously, how do they run a business when they are never open?
author: Elena R.

description:
With the arrival of Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous, Mr and Mrs Mogal may have to seriously consider moving to Dogpatch.  Mmm, nothing like a grilled fish taco from Mabel's followed by a scoop of Pralines and Cream on a freshly baked cone.  But I digress.

Perfectly creamy ice cream, some interesting - and some more traditional - flavors (in the middle of the spectrum, where Fenton's is on one end and Humphrey Slocombe's on the other), prepared on the premises.  Groovy urban-sustainable-exposed beams-minimalist furniture kinda space.  Lovely fun couple (the Miscellaneouses?) run the joint.  Super friendly and welcoming, always offering more tastes and fun conversation.  It's a kind of Bott's (for those who grew up in Berkeley) for the early 21st century.  Worth a trek, if you're not one of the lucky ones who ends up in Dogpatch on a regular basis.
author: Katy M.

description:
I scream, you scream we all scream for....

PEANUT BUTTER AND JELLY ICE CREAM! What? seriously outstanding! and Candied Violet .... uhhhh-mazing. 

I am on board with the ice cream craze and have to say that Mr &Mrs has got a great location and gig. Love the daily FB posts, thank you. 

The ice cream is wonderful but their sweets are great too, I have had the toasted coconut marshmellow, the vanilla caramels, and the peanut butter malt ball. The cookies are the best too, the chocolate in the chocolate chip and chocolate cherry cookies are like layers of goodness. they are not chipcs, but sheets of chocolate!

I love you, Mr and Mrs!
author: Cara G.

description:
Overall: very solid ice cream with tasty flavors in an out-of-the-way setting that keeps the crowd manageable.

I tried the candied violet, which tasted less like soap than I expected, and had a scoop each of the Ballpark and the Seven Spice. Ballpark was totally delicious and I can't wait to have more. Seven spice was a bit of a disappointment. I liked it a lot when I sampled it, but the flavor somehow got lost as I ate more than one bite. Maybe it was just a little overly vanillaed or something, or maybe the maltiness of the Ballpark was drowning it out as they comingled a bit. Anyway, I would probably try a different flavor next time. The cone was a bit of a disappointment. It wasn't particularly tasty (made me wish I was at Tara's) and the bottom was not well sealed, so for the second half of my dessert, I was mostly working on drip control, which kind of kills the experience.

The really great thing about M&MM is that I went there on a sunny saturday afternoon and I MIGHT have waited 3 minutes. I didn't go by Bi-rite that day, but I'm willing to bet it would have been closer to 45 minutes over there. For that reason alone, I will be returning to this place over and over (until they are destroyed by their own success).
author: Julia G.

description: Much like Bi-Rite and Slocombe, Mr & Mrs has an interesting list of rotating flavors.  I've only been here once.  I had a single scoop of Graham Cracker, which was good but didn't knock my socks off.... but it's definitely good quality ice cream.  I'm willing to go back and try other flavors.
author: Paul K.

description:
this place is awesome. every time I've gone the experience has gotten better and better. the ice cream is always very tasty. the first time i went i got the sweet cream, and that sounds a bit plain but it was delicious. my friend got the pink squirrel and that was just as good. although  people may argue the pink squirrel is better. the combination of the two is pretty good too.  

i had to come a 2nd time since they ran out of their famous peanut brittle cookies that are on the 2012 7x7 100 things to eat before you die. boy was it worth to go back.  i went earlier this time around and the ice cream was just as good, i got a different flavor this time. plus the cookies were still around...i ended up getting 3, after trying a piece i didn't even want to share anymore, which was the purpose of getting 3. 

i'd def come again to try even more flavors :]
author: Olivia L.

description: I got the cardamom rose and bay them. Both very spiced and deliciously creamy. The woman at the counter was friendly and let me try as many as I wanted. I really liked the mango chili lime, but it had a bit too much of a kick for me.
author: Chloe W.

description: The line was out the door when  went but it was worth every single bit of it!The ice cream flavors were very unique and delicious.The custom service was great,the workers were very nice.Would definitely  recommend  it.
author: Michelle L.

description: They have really interesting flavors like orange chipotle, burnt sugar, candied violet, and even beer flavored ice cream. However their more interesting ones are also more of a miss in my opinion. The ones that I have enjoyed are the jasmine tea and coffee. Overall I like Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and I think it's better than Mitchells and Humphrey Slocombe, but it doesn't hold a candle to Bi-Rite!
author: Alice J.

description: There was a long and slow moving line. There were a small handful of flavors to choose from, which I wasn't all that enthralled by. I settled on "cookies and cream," and took a half pint to share with friends. It was good, and of nice quality. But at this point I would rank it just slightly above Haagen Dazs. Maybe I'll try another flavor that will change my mind. But between Humphry's, Mitchell's, and Three Twins, I'm not in a hurry to rush back.
author: Marissa S.

description:
we are spoiled with all the ice cream options in sf, but this here is the clear winner of them all!

yey:
- spacious seating with wide glass windows that welcome sunshine and city views.
-lots of flavors
-big scoops
-other dessert choices like candy and cookies
-favorite flavor:  chocolate chip with shaved chocolate chocolate that pairs perfectly with CHOCOLATE MALT.

the ice cream here seems to have a creamier mouth feel than bi-rite, less icy.  it's perfection.

make the drive if it's out of your way.  it's worth every lick.  :)
author: Josie M.

description:
I'm quite happy that Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous decided to go the route of offering classic ice-cream flavors. We went the day after opening and I had the coffee. It was perfectly satisfying - just the right amount of creaminess and the right hue of coffee flavor. We were so excited that we went back the day after and I had the praline and creme - mmm mm mmmmmm...best praline and creme I have ever had. Sometimes the pralines can be candied too sweet but these were perfect. The homemade caramels that they make were also wonderful - gloriously chewy yet surprisingly light. I want to try the peanut brittle next.

The owners, Ian and Annebelle, are working pretty darn hard to get this shop off the ground and it shows. But they were upbeat and personable and taking time to talk to all the curious customers. They make their waffle cones fresh and it makes all the difference. Plus all the ingredients are organic which is always a good thing.

I enthusiastically recommend this place and am excited that it's now part of the neighborhood! Oh yeah, we're definitely going to be regulars.
author: Sherene C.

description: Hands down my favorite ice cream in SF. #thatsall
author: Cassie G.

description:
I have heard many debates over whether this place is better than Bi-Rite.  Some points of contention:

-Bi-Rite is in a "better" location.  It's easier to get to the Castro area than Dogpatch.  But, this also gives Mr & Mrs an advantage- they have a very short line.  I also prefer the quiet environment of Dogpatch sometimes.

-Bi-Rite has Dolores Park nearby.  But Mr & Mrs has ample seating, so you aren't forced out of the shop as soon as you hand over your money.

-Bi-Rite has more flavors.  However, you tend to only eat 1-2 flavors at a time, so this didn't bother me.  Mr & Mrs still had good flavors and plenty to choose from.

Overall, each shop has its ups & downs.  But I think I prefer Mr & Mrs because they are less busy, their ice cream is creamier (you can taste the difference), and they are less of a "destination", making the experience more quiet and enjoyable.
author: Natalie H.

description:
It's all about the cones. They make 'em fresh here. Next time, I'll ask for 2 cones. 

Will return for that earl grey flavor ice cream. You should too. That way, I will know to save enough room for their peanut brittle and cookies for the post ice cream treat.
author: Judy L.

description:
So my folks were in town and I treated my step-father to a burger at Serpentine, because I needed an excuse to try the most expensive place in my neighborhood.

As we're rolling back to my apartment, I notice the doors to the space across the street are open. That's funny, says I, I don't remember anything in that space. I poke my head in and see a menu for ice cream with flavors like Choco Malt and Ginger Glace. How long have you been here, I ask the tattooed girl working the counter. We just opened today, she says.

Artisinal, homemade, organic ice cream on my block. This is the final bit of proof that if anyone out there has some cash to spare in this economy, you should invest in the Dogpatch. It has turned the corner from "it's going to gentrify any year now" to "the artists and restaurants are moving in and everything's starting to rise in price." Can the hipsters be far behind?

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous seem like nice people and the space is industrial and sleek.

Oh, and the ice cream is awesome.
author: Eric G.

description: I was impressed.  I thought after Smitten, I would not like this place, but I was wrong.  It was yummy.  Service was decent.  Worth a try everyone.
author: Aban E.

description: Cute little place. Long line for a weekday. The homemade licorices were good. I had the black cherry, pomegranate and two others forgot what they were. The day I went there they ran out of the salted caramel so instead I got the brown butter ice cream and my friend got the orange blossom I think that's what it was called. Hers was really good. Nice and light. Mine was good but you have to like sweet. I do but after a while I started to get sick. I think if you can share the brown butter you should. My stomach started to hurt and I could start feeling the butter slime on the top of my mouth. Don't get me wrong it was really good but too much butter for me.  And if you are wondering why I didn't get other flavors it was cause they didn't sound that great and oddly brown butter sounded the best.
author: Christy P.

description: Thank god I don't live near here - I'd be huge! Everything looked so delicious that I had to try several scoops during my recent visit. The highlights were Butter Toffee and Malted Milk. Coming back for sure!
author: David S.

description: been here dozens of times and have always enjoyed the new flavors. Today I tried some Guinness and Kahlua flavored ice cream, incredible.
author: Brendan C.

description:
Can't wait to go again.  I went and got the pink squirrel, which was one of the best ice cream flavors I've had yet.
The waffle cone is so worth it at 50 cents, and sooooo good, they're the best I've ever had.
I also tried the orange blossom, and it was super good too.  Not as insanely creative flavors as Humphrey Slocombe but it is also not as salty.
author: Theo T.

description: Creamy goodness that just makes you wish you could have a scoop (or two) of this ice cream every day for the main meal of the day. Had a caramel ice cream and my daughter had blueberry/ginger. The flavors literally are so strong and pungent just as you bring the spoon to your mouth, let alone when you actually eat it! Place was packed but there's lot of help.
author: P G.

description: Either they've improved the texture or the different flavors produce something entirely different in terms of how it feels in your mouth!! I got the cookies and cream here and I couldn't put it down. The ice cream was just fabulous and creamy and just decadent. I like how they give you pretty big scoops too. It's great on a warm Saturday afternoon with friends if you happen to be in the area or come here right before they close.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Every single time I go here I am impressed with every facet of the experience. It's a local place for sure, the owners work there everyday, with an open floor and plenty of seats. The decor is thoughtful and appropriate for the modern-style-with-throwback-vibes, approach. The owners are the nicest people and seemingly work hard but definitely enjoy what they do! 

The flavors are ever changing and they always have 8 or 10 of them. Some of my personal faves have been *Sweet Corn, Beer & Brittle, Old Fashioned, PB&J, Burnt Sugar and the Chicory Coffee*. I love that this place is in our neighborhood and it's a great addition to the city!

The single reason that I didn't give 5 stars is because it seems as though they're closed at odd times. Anyway...
author: aaron c.

description: my new favorite ice cream parlor in San Francisco. the bourbon brittle is amazing.
author: Anthony A.

description: There is always steady food traffic in and out of this place. Quality-wise, I say it's on par with Bi-Rite but with a fewer selection of flavors. What unique flavors they do have are all delicious and not strage in the Humphrey Slocombe weird-just-to-be-weird bad way. Worth a trip if you're in the Dogpatch area.
author: Mercutio k.

description:
OK so the day I had them I also had Bi-rite like 30 min earlier. So the flavors here are very unique and quite tasty but I preferred bi-rite's taste more.

The ice cream was great and the place is in what looks like a converted factory building in dogpatch was quite unexpected to be serving some great ice cream. I'd come back to try some other flavors but parking here is also really difficult.
author: Justin C.

description:
I stumbled in here on a Sunday to find out what this place is about and my I was surprised, in a good way. Here you will find seasonal, home-made ice-cream but their specialty is making their own waffle cones. They have some already made earlier in the day or you can ask to get one freshly made for you. Not that many flavors of ice-cream to choose from but they do give free samples so take your time in deciding, but not too long because there is a constant stream of people coming in. 

I can't say too much about the ice-cream since they do change the flavors out but you can always find Vanilla on the menu. But I do like the creative flavors but watch out for the Lemon Ginger ice-cream, it can be a bit sour because of those tiny candied pieces. But the coffee ice-cream is great for coffee lovers. Everything is bio-degradable: spoons, napkins, cups, bags, etc... So I find this to be one of the most eco-friendly or GREEN places in SF. 

Living down the street from this place I think this is a nice addition to the neighborhood. We got cafes across the street, Hard Knox too, and a wine bar. The only thing is this place doesn't have good parking so go in there, order your pint, and take off somewhere else to enjoy your ice-cream. This is more of a neighborhood/local ice-cream shop so if you are in the neighborhood take some time to sit and enjoy the simple decor but if not just do the grab n' go. 

Enjoy!
author: Nana R.

description: Today was a beautiful sunny day- so decided to go and try mr. &mrs. as did a lot of sf- as there was pretty long line outside this afternoon. We waited about 20 minutes which was fairly fast for how long the line appeared. They were out of 4 flavors out of 8 when we got to the front but we had the honey &nut and the lavender and lemon- both unique and tasty. I loved that they make the cone fresh when you are there- we also took home a peanut brittle cookie to try later- which was AWESOME! I would go back for the cookies- for sure probably the ice cream too but def the cookies :) Oh and though the line was long the staff was super friendly which I appreciated.
author: Nicole S.

description: Jasmine Green Tea Ice Cream FTW! but they have a ton of flavors that I believe changes every day.  I'm super indecisive and I sat there sampling every flavor and they were so nice about it even though I created a huge line behind me.
author: Nancy H.

description: Best ice cream I've had anywhere. Staff/owners are really friendly. They sell out fast, they don't update their FB/website often enough and they aren't open very late - negatives which I am willing to accept.
author: Jessi H.

description:
The best. The absolute best. Yelp, why can't we give 6 stars? 

Two of the hardest working, nicest, fun people around making THE best and most unique ice-cream in SF. When I have friends from out of town visiting I walk em' right by Bi-Rite and H.S. all the way to the Dogpatch just to experience Mr. & Mrs. 

Get in an get some ice cream now before they blow up and you can tell all your friends you knew about them first!
author: Sammy O.

description: I am glad I tried this place, but perhaps I am too much of a dessert snob, given that I am one of the few people that doesn't give this place 5 stars.  I certainly appreciate their creative flavors.  The candied violet was surprisingly good- not too floral, as if you're eating girly body wash.  The crema catalana is actually really tasty, I would order that next time.  The old fashioned is a great idea, but I'd choose Humphrey Slocombe's "secret breakfast" over it.  My main issue was that the candied violet and old fashioned weren't homogenous enough - if you got a bite with these flavors swirled in it tasted great, otherwise you simply got a bite of plain, flavorless ice cream.  Moreover, their basic ice cream recipe is not as satisfyingly smooth & creamy as Ben & Jerry's.  At $3 for a single, $3.75 for a double, and $0.50 for a sugar cone, I don't think I'll be a regular customer.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
This is the worth the trek. Forget Bi-Rite, forget Mitchell's....Misc. is it!

First off, the space is gorgeous. And on a nice sunny day, it looks even better. White walls, industrial decor, high ceilings - it's perfect. The staff is excellent, and the ice cream is even better. They change out their flavors so there's always something new to try. I'm a purist, so I go for the vanilla bean but you can't really go wrong with anything they have. 

Don't forget to try some of their fresh cookies or a jar of their peanut brittle. So good!!

Jr Scoop - $2.75
1 Scoop - $3.50
2 Scoop - $4.something

(they are very generous with their scoops)

Best of all, not many people = no line.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
The ice cream is excellent, the cones are freshly made, and the interior is simple and quaint.

I tried the chocolate chocolate chip, and the pumpkin ale. Both were excellent. The ice cream had a perfect texture and consistency. Parking is quite easy which cuts down the craving time. 

They take card which is great. I just wish they stayed open later.
author: Jenn V.

description:
Hands down, the best ice cream I've had in the bay area!  

We tried the caramel with sea salt, and chocolate with rosemary.. gosh.. I could not believe how rich and complex the flavor was when the gourmet ice cream melt in the my mouth... the little twist (sea salt, rosemary) took gourmet ice cream to another level, and made it sooo unique and memorable.  

The owner was very very nice and patient with introducing the different flavors to us... I can see that he was taking alot of pride in this work!

Can't wait to go back again!
author: Mandy C.

description: My usual go to spot in the city if I want to avoid the crazy packed lines of Mitchell's and Bi-Rite. I highly suggest the candied violet and butter almond with toffee if they have it. They rotate their flavors every week I believe so everytime you come in you'll probably see a flavor you haven't tried. Usually when I find something good in a restaurant I stick to it. But since they don't usually have the same flavors each week you're forced to experiment. Which is good because every flavor I've had has been just as good or even better. Ice cream is very rich and creamy. Seating is available inside. And parking is usually widely available. If you want good variety and not your everyday type flavors. This is the place to experiment and open up your taste buds to flavors not tasted or heard of before! Highly recommended!
author: keith s.

description:
Homemade waffle cone hot off the press, rich and creamy vanilla ice cream, homemade butterscotch sauce warm and oozy. In a bowl, for me to devour in the bright and airy space.

There was such simple perfection in my bowl of ice cream, it had a pinch of nostalgia, a swirl of modernity and many glugs of heavy cream.
author: emily h.

description: 5 stars for the black tea ice cream!  If you're a milk tea fan, you need to try this flavor.  It seriously tastes like milk tea ice cream...sooo delicious and full of tea flavor.  Also, people are very nice and allow you to try several flavors without complaint!   So go on and take your time to try the find the flavor that suits you the most!
author: Kristen T.

description:
Get's huge points for originality and consistently trying new, seasonal flavors. I also like how the selection is small, that's how you know they are taking care of each gallon they create. 

Issue is that sometimes they get a bit overly creative and the quality of the ice cream is marginalized. Had a dogfishead pumpkin ale ice cream that neither tasted much like pumpkin, nor ale, but definitely did not have the best texture.
author: Louis A.

description:
Like all the ice cream fans you'll read in these reviews, I've been to all the eclectic ice cream places around the Bay Area. Some are better than others but one thing that ceases to amaze me are the combination of flavors that are put together that are surprisingly good. Well Mr. and Mrs. set a new high bar by offering Beer and Brickle. Yes, beer ice cream. And the best part is - it was delicious!

In addition to the Beer and Brickle I had the Burned Sugar which also was perfectly textured and flavored. In addition to the great flavors the prices seem a bit lower than the other chic ice cream parlors. There is lots of room for seating and because it's in the Dog Patch neighborhood, the lines are not out the door!

If you're looking for ice cream, go to Baskin Robbins. If you're looking for exceptional ice cream, venture out to the Dog Patch and hit Mr. And Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Steve M.

description: Seeing all the great reviews, we had to swing by to try it.  The flavors are original and we like the decor.  I wasn't as impressed as other Yelpers though.  The texture wasn't that smooth and the flavors weren't very strong.  The line wasn't long but it took some time for our turn since people wanted to taste different flavors and the owners were nice about it and took the time with each customer rather than helping the next customer while the undecided took their time.  The 4-star is for its original flavors and concept rather than a reflection of the taste itself.  I would still prefer Bi-Rite.
author: Irene C.

description:
Came here yesterday and had a taste of the candied violet, a scoop of the pina/orange/coconut and the ballpark and they were like heaven in my mouth.  No joke.  

Not only are the owners friendly, they make all the ice cream in house and their other goodies (cookies and brittle) are HELLA good.  Their ice cream is the perfect balance of sweet and salty and their waffle cones are super fresh.  Not only that, their ice cream is actually hard and not a gloppy mess like other places (*ahem* Birite).  They have a great seating area with big windows and lots of light so you can relax and enjoy your kick-ass ice cream.  They also accept card over $5 for you non-cash carrying folk.

Even if this place is out of your way, take a little weekend trip out to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and you won't be disappointed!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I tried this place last time I visited San Francisco.  A couple of friends told me I just HAD to try it out, and boy was I not dissappointed. 

The main thing here is the ice cream.  While I thoroughly enjoyed my strawberry ice cream on a freshly made wafflecone, the other flavors I tried were just as good.  The most unique one was the ballpark(?) flavor that included Anchor Steam and nuts, surprisingly good despite my initial skepticism!   

They also sell cookies, which were pretty damn good as well.  But the ice cream is the real treat.

Service wise this place can't be beat.  The owners are friendly, authentic, and passionate.  Their only fault is that they don't live and work in Portland.  ;-)
author: John F.

description: Came here since one of my friends suggested this place for some ice cream. It was okay. Random ass location though. Suddenly out of nowhere there was a long ass line! Crazy! Glad I got there when I did. I wish they made more flavors here....I just had the lemon and it was good. The guinness was good too.
author: Diane L.

description: Their ice cream does not justify their reputation.  Cute flavor names and Strauss cream, but where is the taste?  The chocolate chip had ice crystals and the orange peel was weak in flavor.  Great ice cream has flavors that you can taste and that last.  The richness of their ice cream was perhaps middle of the pack.  There are too many old favorites and new purveyors in the City to patronize this one.
author: David C.

description:
As you approach the ice cream shop, you can already smell the sweetness of the ice cream and waffle cones. 

I sampled the Burnt Sugar with Sea Salt, Croquatino (carmelized hazelnut) and Coffee flavors. I absolutely love coffee ice cream (Humphrey Slocumbe wins for their Blue Bottle coffee ice cream)  but the choice came down to either the Burnt Sugar or Croquatino. I was told those are their two most popular flavors.  It was a tough one and I couldn't go with the double with two flavors because the portion would have been too big. 

Croquatino won because it's a unique flavor that I haven't seen offered anywhere else. It was mighty tasty with the creamy ice cream and crunchy texture of the hazelnuts. 

I went with a single on one of their house made waffle cones. I like that they put a mini scoop inside the cone to hold the big scoop. It also allows you to get to the bottom of the cone and still have some ice cream left.  The Croquatino had a generous amount of carmelized hazelnut, -which usually I don't complain about - but too much of  the candy coating on the nut itself made the ice cream a little sweeter than I would have liked it.  More hazelnut and less of the carmelized coating would have made it perfect but it came pretty darn close. 

I'm looking forward to returning to try all the other flavors.
author: Cyndi G.

description: I haven't actually been to this location but I had the earl grey/chocolate chim ice cream at Darwin Cafe an the ice cream was just delicious - the earl grey flavor came out very distinctly.  Loved it and hope to visit the actual store front soon.
author: Alias A.

description:
Deliciously unique ice cream flavors and generous portions! I sampled the praline and cream, candied violet and nibs flavors. Each flavor was yummily delightful! 

$3 per scoop, add 50 cents for a cone. I'd say stick with the cup -- they give you LARGE scoops that a cup holds much better than a cone. And like other reviewers said, no line and good service! My friend bought a couple pints of ice cream and they held it in the freezer for her while we ate our scoops of ice cream. Totally cool place.
author: Apple P.

description: BESTICECREAMEVER.  I can't stop thinking about the almond butter flavor...the toffee cookie was *expletive *expletive.
author: Mark A.

description:
Super cute little ice cream shop in the Dog Patch! I love it that it's so close to work. I had the pralines and cream - yummy! I tried the candied voilet and i'll definitely get that next time! 

The lady that served me was super nice and didn't mind that I asked for samples of other flavors before deciding.
author: Juliet W.

description: ICE CREAM!!! COOKIES!!! GOOD STUFF!!! There are but a hand full of places I've been to 2 days in a row! 'Nuff said.
author: Delbert A.

description: Best tea/coffee themed ice creams I have had; pink squirrel is great too. Innovative flavors are usually pretty good. I rarely encounter long lines.
author: pH R.

description:
Each year for my wife's birthday we do a culinary tour.  One year it was chocolate.  The next pizza, then ice cream.    

This year we did a "best of" culinary tour -- hitting the best chocolate (XOX Truffles in North Beach), the best pizza (Pizzetta 211) and best ice cream (Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous).

Despite being completely full by the time we arrived at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, we had some great, great ice cream.  The meyer lemon ice cream was just about perfect and the first time we went their the waffle cones were still warm after coming off the waffle press.  

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is tucked in a part of the city I never would have found, but now I have a reason to go back (and back and back).
author: Jamie A.

description:
heaven in ice cream, holy cow i am hooked. had some time on lunch yesterday and was hot so i stepped inside. Mrs M greeted me right away. I sampled the candied violet and the makers mark with cherries. i took a scoop of that... amazing. just amazing. also purchased some sea salted caramels... oh my!

this place is a gem. i am so hooked. (and they also had fernet flavored ice cream... what a thought!)
author: laura f.

description: Lavender ice cream. Smell took me to the Provence. And the taste took me to heaven.
author: Jan S.

description: What's the best ice cream in the city? Ice Cream Bar? Bi Rite? Or Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. I'd have to say, it's Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous in my book. I had candied violet ice cream and it was far and away the best ice cream I've ever had, and I've had a LOT of great ice cream! I also love the purpose-built space, it feels so serious, like an artist workshop for ice cream. And, if you want to get some incredible meat after your ice cream, there's an amazing butcher just around the corner. Just saying ...
author: Eater S.

description:
Ice Cream in the Dogpatch!

Wonderful addition to the hood..I appreciate the decor and giant floor to ceiling windows and of course the ice cream. :)

I was told that my ice cream was made fresh that morning - which was a treat. I loved the chocolate malt and will make it my personal goal to try every flavor that is offered!
author: Christian S.

description:
I was anxious to try this and I must say.. it's pretty darn good.

I'd say comparable to Humphrey Slocumb's.... 

I was told to try Basil, was like what?! but actually liked it.  Be open as you never know what interesting flavors you'd like.
author: Andy W.

description:
Yall need to represent this icy new ice cream joint yo!
The owners are mad friendly, and the flavors come correct!
They just opened a few weeks ago and the interior of the space is fresh to death. You wont be sad with any flavor they have to offer, and they make it with their own hands! Good people and good eats, next time Ill hit it up early so I dont miss out on the ballpark flavor aight!
author: M K.

description: How did you guys ever come up with your pumpkin cuchinta icecream flavor?? Pure deliciousness in every bite. I look forward to trying more of your flavors. Wish the store was open a little bit later though...
author: Mertani G.

description:
This place was really cute and trendy! I admit I am a huge fan of Birite, and get extremely fussy when it comes to ice cream shops. Though I have to say that I am still diehard Birite, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous is still worth a trip out to the Dogpatch. 

My friend and I came out to check it out on a Saturday afternoon. The place has the worst hours in the whole world, and when we got there it was already 5. They were already sold out of their vanilla bean, chocolate, PB&J flavors. That was a bit disappointing, but I think it says a lot when that many flavors (especially ordinary) are sold out. I sampled the candied violet and the red rum raisin. Ultimately, my friend and I ended up with a scoop of earl grey and a scoop of red rum raisin. We opted for cones, which were delicately made behind the counter with the coolest receptacle I have seen, and we strolled outside and ate our ice cream.

It was delicious and not overly creamy. I definitely am looking forward to returning.
author: stacy c.

description: came on a saturday late afternoon and no line! whooppeee! my first time and i tried the ROSE & PISTACHIO!!!  it is THE BEST ICE CREAM I'VE EVER HAD!! im craving it and i normally dont even love ice cream. it is one of their seasonal ice creams. i'm going to cry when it is discontinued. i can't wait to try the earl grey when it is back, but in the meantime if you go. try this one. you won't regret it.
author: Jen S.

description:
i wouldnt say this place deserves like 5 stars but the ice cream here is decently unique/good. 
i'd recommend the following flavors: 
- Halva: the inside has this sesame candy flavor, very interesting 
- Lemon and Poppyseed: very refreshing 
- Birthday Cake: it has chocolate cake bits mixed in there 

overall, not too many flavors, but it's a couple of blocks down from ucsf so if ur in the area, should check it out.
author: Joyce B.

description: I am a frequent patron of many ice cream shops in San Francisco. I think Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous have the best ice cream texture, since they focus on true ice cream, not a sorbet texture. They use organic Straus Farms milk which makes their ice cream so deliciously creamy! Also, I like that the owners of the shop are normally there socializing with customers and serving us. It gives you the feel of a traditional mom and pop shop.
author: Justine A.

description:
The Bay Area is sooo spoiled when it comes to ice cream, and just when I thought I had a solid handle on my favorite ice cream shop, here comes Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous to change my mind. The corner spot is super cute and simply decorated with a clean atmosphere and makes a perfect addition to the neighborhood!

I'm lucky enough to work about 45 seconds away from here, so I am pleased to say I was one of the first to try their flavors today. The Nougat ice cream was wonderfully flavored with little hints of apricot, honey and flowers, but I'm super GAGA over the pralines and cream. The caramel was sooo gooey and had that buttery, toffeeish goodness that warms the heart. Can you tell that I loved it? Served on a homemade waffle cone, it was a true delight on a sunny spring afternoon after an 11hr work day. 

Don't know if its a good thing having such a phenomenal ice cream shop located right under my workplace (that's what my ever growing belly tells me), but at least now, I have no excuse to not try all of their flavors. YUM!
author: Christina N.

description:
Are you serious?  How did I live in the Bay Area for 5 years without knowing this place existed.  

Every flavor I tried was amazing.  The burnt sugar, the horchata, the orange blossom (oh my god, the orange blossom).  There's probably more to say about this place - it's awesome decor, it's incredibly friendly staff, the samples, etc., but I'm so overwhelmed by the amazing taste that's still in my mouth that I simply can't think of anything else.  Oh, orange blossom ice cream, maybe after the city finishes legalizing gay marriage, someone can pass a law that lets me marry you.
author: David F.

description: A few select flavors a day but awesome stuff. I tried their orange blossom ice cream and a chocolate chip cookie with cherries YUM!
author: Ashwini S.

description:
Ice cream are excellent! I love how they change up their menu so there is always something new with their favors.

Although they are a little out of the way for me, I still make attempts to stop by and enjoy a few scoop of delicious ice cream in variety of favors.  

Prices are also great because you get the fresh ingredients they used in every bite.

Enjoy their ice cream!!!
author: C Y.

description:
They offer a junior size scoop!  Yay!  They also make their own waffle cone and Ann (one of the owners is so warm and friendly) behind the counter.  

I tried the candied violet that reminded me of something I ate as a kid.  Can't quite put my finger on it.  I also tried the candied ginger, which has the same kick of ginger as the ginger snaps at Miete.  I chose their mint chip, which was made with real mint and had just the right amount of chocolate to balance it.  I also had one of their chocolate chip cookies that was crispy on the edge and ooey chewy in the middle.  

They offer a number of other treats such as a coconut marshmallow and almond brittle packaged in jars.  I'm going to have to try those next time.

To get there, you can drive (lots of parking) or catch the T line to 20th street and walk to 22nd.
author: Nina L.

description: Most probably the best ice cream in all of SF.  You want to try all of the flavors, and then you'll have a really hard time deciding, so you end up getting a single scoop for the trip home and a couple of pints of different flavors.  A bit pricey, but it's worth it for ice cream that's so good. $3.25/scoop, $7.99/pint. $5 minimum for all credit cards.
author: Trinh N.

description:
Love the deliciously unique flavors! The ice cream is a little too buttery for my personal taste (won't be visiting too frequently, but will still definitely indulge once in a while), but I looooove all the different flavors. My favorite was the Earl Grey.

The line moves pretty quickly, so don't be intimidated by it. Pro tip, the kiddie cup isn't too different from the small, and they give really large scoops.
author: Joy X.

description: Good ice cream but too rich for me! I had to share and couldn't even finish. It might have to do with eating a big lunch beforehand at Hard Knox Cafe :P
author: Angela C.

description:
not my favorite sf ice cream. only flavor that's decent is cookies and cream, which is weird to say when they have a crazy variety. 

i've tried the following flavors and could care less...
-salted mango (could've done without the salt)
-strawberries and cream (like the lifesavers)
-chai tea (not a huge fan in the first place)
-vanilla bean (sadly this classic was way too sweet, couldn't even finish it)

good sugar/waffle? cones though. note, flavors are constantly changing...even if you have a flavor in mind, it could be gone by the time it's your turn.
author: Ann B.

description:
Dogpatch really is coming into its own.  It even has a fancy artisan ice cream place now.  Mr. and Mrs.  does the whole unusual and creative flavors thing, with great results.  They did one with beer in it that was tasty.  It tasted like a beer float.   They also have solid renditions of the classic flavors.    

The young couple that runs the joint is charming and usually in the shop serving up scoops themselves.  A welcome addition to the bustling Third Street corridor.
author: Jon B.

description: Very tasty! Always changing up their flavors so you will never get bored. I tried the cheesecake with whipped cream and my boyfriend had the cookie n cream with hot fudge. Their fudge is delicious! All of the bowls and utensils are biodegradable so they don't have trash cans. Only recycling and composte!
author: Jackeline A.

description: If the candied violet flavor is available, get it.  Wonderful service, playful (but not weird) flavors.  Creamy, not too sweet, absolutely perfect!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Sort of off the beaten path from the hustle and bustle of the main San Francisco area, but it's definitely a diamond in the rough!  We got there a little after 2pm and it still had a steady flow of customers.  

The people there are so friendly and attentive to making sure we had a great experience there by letting us sample the different flavors.  The menu is outrageously different...yet so tasty.  We were lucky enough to go on the day when they served Beer & Pretzel...and it definitely tasted like Beer.  The Burnt Sugar tasted just like the burnt sugar on a creme brulee...it was awesome!    

I ended up getting Lemon Crunch (lemon ice cream with bits of organic "lemon heads") and Pralines and Cream.  The lemon crunch could have been a little more lemony...but I'm not complaining.  The Pralines and Cream with its bits of carmalized nuts made my taste buds very happy!
author: Michelle F.

description: oh wow...this place top mitchell, bi-rite, and ici.  The ice cream was so good.  I want to come back for more. I got the candied violet...it was very delicious. the chococolate chip cookie was too good to be true. the couple behind the counter were very nice as well.
author: con c.

description: Dark Chocolate & Bing Cherry Cookie - Wow !!! Peanut Brittle Cookie - incredible. It is worth a trip to the Dogpatch for these cookies. I have to try the ice cream next time.
author: Mike C.

description: Have we found heaven on earth? I think so. Everything here is a delight. I love the peanut brittle, and I'm not even a brittle kind of girl. The ice cream is dreamy, the caramels divine. The cookies are scrumptious. I can't get enough.
author: Rachel T.

description:
most memorable ice cream I have ever had! Couldn't help but overload on the scoops!
Got candied violets
Chicory coffee
Turtle
all so different.. and all ohhh soo gooood! Wish they were open till later.. :( they close at 6 so on days I want ice cream.. dinner starts with dessert! (can't complain too much there ;)
author: S R.

description: We showed up for a quick Ice Cream before grabbing some meat around the corner and we loved it. Nice people, clean spot, and the ice cream was great. Only four stars this time but if they have rockin cookies they will get five.
author: Greg B.

description: This place is always closed, but it is okay since it's an artistan ice cream shop. They said they closed at 5 PM so I arrived at 4:55 only to find that they would not let me in. To make matters worse, there were about six people inside still in line and many more eating their ice cream.
author: Cherrie W.

description: I used to think Bi-Rite reigned supreme in the local ice cream world, but I recently became a convert to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. It's probably not the best thing for me, but I end up coming here for lunch break way too often. You can't go wrong with the burnt sugar or pink squirrel, but it's hard to play favorites with their perpetually changing menu of awesomeness. Thank god for the hot weather lately - I'll take any excuse for an ice cream break here!
author: Carla B.

description:
I now have a new place to go for lunch, afternoon snack, dinner, and desert. It's not good that I work across the street just right of the restaurant...

The Anchor Steam beer can definitely be tasted in the Ballpark flavor. I'm not a fan of beer would would get it again.
The violet flavor has crystallized bits of violet which is sweet and crunchy. My favorite so far.
Nougat--made with pistachios and apricot. I love the twanginess of the fruit. Excellent.
Roasted banana--very good.
author: Evan W.

description:
Great and interesting flavors in a family-run establishment that is fun to visit.  

Problem is that unless you live in the neighborhood and/or can get there before 6pm (5pm on Sundays), you're out of luck.  Other SF establishments of this caliber are open much later (especially on weekends).  

C'mon -- give other potential fans a chance to try you out!

Btw, personal favorite flavor is birthday cake : )
author: Tom O.

description: Fantastic ice cream flavors and really cute ambiance.  It's probably not quite as creative as say Humphrey Slocombe, but I would say based on taste and texture, they certainly can stand tall along with the big dogs of HS and Bi-Rite.  I tried the candied violet and the basil and both were really good.  The candied violet reminded me of a more floral and creamy cotton candy while the basil was just surprisingly refreshing.  I think I'll definitely add this place to the ice cream rotation now.
author: Gary L.

description: overrated. not sure what the hype is. sampled a couple of flavors. ordered the cookies and cream - it wasn't very creamy or flavorful. I prefer humphrys. or even safeway brand cookies and cream.
author: Grace M.

description: I love the interior design of this place. Simple, yet, modern and hogh class. Most importantly, I love that they always surprise you with unique flavors you can't imagine. That's the beauty of this place.
author: Michael C.

description: Love.  This.  Place.  I kind of ran in to this place when I happened to be in the neighborhood and happened to check out the posting on Yelp.  Since there were so many positive ratings and the weather was unusually warm out, I thought what the heck, I'll give it a try.  Was not disappointed with any bite I had.  Definitely one of the best ice cream I've had in the city.  The atmosphere is modern, industrial looking with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows.  I believe there was community seating, which was fine considering I inhaled my ice cream and was on my way.
author: Kent W.

description: Hubby and i love ice cream!  John wanted to check this place out and its really close to the Giants stadium.  The Ice cream is organically made here.  They have a few selections daily and are unique in flavor.  If your looking for the standard ice cream shop this is not the place for you to come too but if you are adventurous and want to try ice cream in a whole different level then this is the spot.  Tried their black sesame and enjoyed it a lot.  Hubby had this ice cream which I can't quite remember the name but it was an Italian liquor.  Some people who tried it said it tasted like medicine but John enjoyed it.  It had so many different spices when we Googled the liquor it confirmed the flavors we tasted.
author: Emmy D.

description:
Awesome service and some of the most interesting ice cream flavor choices I have seen in a while. Waffle cones are made right in front of you and everything tasted uber fresh.

But it was not mind blowing and at $3.50 for one scoop, its definitely not a one "$" like Yelp says it is.

Overall a good place for ice cream.
author: Matt Z.

description: Spent the afternoon in heaven eating ice cream with friends.    If you have NOT gone - GO!  you will not be disappointed.  how do I load my videos?
author: Bruce H.

description: FANTASTIC!!!! nice friendly service. Had the birthday cake flavor, and wow was it great! I plan on visiting here every time I'm in the city :)
author: stacy a.

description: This is outstanding, designer ice cream with out of the ordinary flavors. The size is large. The problem here is that they close early.
author: Mihir M.

description: I love this place.  The ice cream is so so so good.  It has a great creamy texture and the flavors are inventive and tasty.  I loved the rosemary pistachio and most recently had a scrumptious cinnamon-y horchata.  The ceilings are high and the tables are really cute too.  I love this place.
author: Jen P.

description:
i'm on a mission to eat at every ice creamery in the bay area. 
and i would so eat here on the regular. i had an ice cream float with my favorite soda, aka, jesus beer, aka virgil's. and cardamom ice cream! yes, it was amazing.
my lady friend, inga m. got earl grey, heaven! and some other flavor that i totally forget. but i remember it was tasty, whatever it was.
they change flavors on the daily. they make everything in house, cookies, hot waffle cones, caramels, ice cream... obviously. everything but the malt balls. the ambiance is totally new hip joint and less ice cream shop, but whatever, it's on 3rd street. which used to be totally industrial... and still sorta is. sigh, i miss you esprit outlet. but i digress..
and they are owned and run by a real life married couple. if their ice cream wasn't so good it might make me bitter.
author: Wanda D.

description:
This place is AMAZING! Not only is it aesthetically beautiful with its simplicity, but the owners are AWESOME!

I live in the Sunset, so this place was quite a truck to get to. When I got there I was sadden to find out that they didn't serve Ice cream sandwiches. I told the owner my story of coming all the way from sunset, and the owner ( i believe his name was Ian)  went into the back and grabbed 2 pecan and vanilla ice-cream sandwiches! This was such a cool thing to do, I def. will be returning in the future to satisfy any ice cream craving!
author: Matthew L.

description: This place is fantastic. I got the Honey Graham ice cream with fudge and didn't look back. They give you free tastings too.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Carl N.

description:
We happened to be in dogpatch last Sunday and found this place via Yelp. 

I tried Candied violet and Vanilla bean liked both, well... maybe 4* for candied violet, and 5* for vanilla. 
My friend had Choco-malted ice cream with chocolate crispies, rated 4.5*. 

So overall I'd say this place gets 4.5*.
author: BO P.

description: Have been wanting to try this place for a really long time, but have never been able to make their weird very restrictive hours. Finally got off work early today and drove all the way across the city, only to find the place closed during supposedly open hours without an explanation! Unprofessional. Uncool. Won't be making that drive again.
author: Daniela I.

description: was alright.  didn't blow my mind.  sort of madly in love with (distracted by) Humphrey. Second to HS is Bi-Rite but that might be location.
author: Rrrona 7.

description: My dear friend Shirl introduced me to this place and I FINALLY made it over the other day... by accident. I had no business eating ice cream that day, but since we were in the neighborhood, we HAD to give it a try! The manpanion and I shared three flavors: strawberries and cream, cookies and cream, and burnt sugar. OMG. All three were great! The portion was bigger than I had expected. Definitely worth the money considering the portion and quality:) I also splurged on the peanut butter malted milk balls, a chocolate chip cookie, and a caramel roll for the manpanion to have for the week. I had tastes of all three and they were yummy too. Thank heaven I'm not in the area too often. That would be DANGEROUS! But yes, I'll be back:)
author: Joanne R.

description: One of my favorite dessert spots. Super friendly owners who bust their humps making all their treats by hand on site.
author: C G.

description:
If you live in SF and claim that you really love ice cream but haven't ventured out to the 'dogpatch' and tried Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous yet....then I am going to call you out right now and say that you are not a "Hardcore Ice Cream Lover" and you need to re-evaluate where ice cream falls on your "I Love" priority list. Mine looks something like this:

I Love:
Family, Friends, Food (i.e. Ice Cream)!

I've been to all the snazzy ice cream spots in S.F. Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, Mitchell's, Smitten, The Ice Cream Bar, etc. All of these are tasty spots and well worth checking out for their own reasons but they still pale in comparison to Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous. For the scoop size, price, unique flavors, and Mom & Pop feel of this spot there is no other place I'd rather be eating tasty ice cream from in San Francisco. My only wish is that they stayed open later for those late night cravings.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description:
Dear Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous,

So, so happy to have met you. Welcome to the neighborhood!  Thanks for bringing the ice cream....The roasted banana ice cream with butterscotch topping was perfect.  I look forward to spending more time with you and your yummy treats soon.

Love,
The neighbor across the street  xo
author: Mollie T.

description:
Yum. I LOVE ice cream and am excited that there are so many great options in SF. I'm glad there's a new one to add to my list of places to visit. I was hoping to have ice cream for lunch, but my friend convinced me to eat "real" food first. I didn't have room for much and a single scoop was perfect. (I really would have liked to try more, but that darn "real" lunch took up too much room in my tummy.)
I tried the candied ginger and LOVED it. It was a bit on the sweet side, but still light and delicious with spicy pieces of ginger. I tried the vanilla too - simple and delicious.  

It's great that everything is compostable and made in house. It's a hipster place but not at all pretentious like so many of the trendy food places that have popped up in SF in the last few years. The best thing is that the owners seem SUPER nice & genuine. I'm coming back for more!
author: lynn t.

description: Hubby loves cookies and cream, girls love celebration cake, I like EVERYTHING, I love ice cream and rather very picky and this place satisfies. Oh yeah, cookies and cream marshmallows! I bought a couple and mixed it in with our ice cream, heavenly bliss!
author: Tammie C.

description: The ice cream that i tried was good (mudslide+hot fudge+peanut butter maltedball) but it was not special. It was just good. The ambience was nice, prices reasonable and welcoming staff. There were not many options to choose from so I ended up eating the ice cream that seemed the best of the bunch but it was not near what i wanted).
author: Joel H.

description:
Location = Parking is not too bad. Love that it's along the muni T-line.
Decor = GREAT high ceilings and love the simplicity of the dark woods against the white walls. The long sharing table is always decorated with some beautiful arrangement of seasonal flowers.
Staff = I love patronizing local mom/pop establishments. Mr and Mrs always greets you with a warm smile and they serve very generous portions.
Food = Hands down, best ice cream in SF. Amazing, unique flavors (Fernet or Candied Violet) and flavor combinations. There's always something new and different. I recently tried their English Black Tea. It was divine.
Special Note = They make fresh ice cream cones...can't beat that!
author: Vibby V.

description: Absolutely delicious, trendy ice cream shop. It was a fun location I've never explored before in SF. Nice neighborhood. I felt the ice cream flavors were limited. They were all quality flavors. I'll probably go again.
author: Travis N.

description: YUM!  We drove by bi-rite and saw a line out the door and around the corner... we both groaned... fortunately we were on the phone with our awesome friend Jonas T. and he had told us to skip the line and try out Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous... we promptly looked it up on Yelp for the address and directions and off we went.  We were unfamiliar with the neighborhood so we had no idea where we were going but once we got there we found parking and stood in the line... it was almost out the door but not just yet.  I was a little dissappointed at first because there weren't many flavors, some were sold out and there were no cones!  so at first I felt like I was settling for CHOCOLATE CHIP?! because that was the only thing that sounded good to me but omg that was the best chocolate chip I have ever had!  I topped it off with some toasted almonds that made it even more yummy.  It was so delicious and I wanted more.  My friend had gotten the black forest cake with these delicious valhrona chocolate rice krispies and they were awesome.  Will definitely be back to try more flavors here, hopefully earlier in the day so they wont be sold out.
author: Kymberli C.

description: The ice cream was too sweet for my palate. Cookies were run of the mill.
author: Aiko S.

description:
Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, there are so many reasons to love you:

* You hand-churn all your ice cream. No wonder it's so delightfully smooth and creamy.
* Your mouthwateringly inventive flavors. There's something for everyone, whether they seek novelty or stick with the tried-and-true. You change up your flavors every day, so I never know which one I'll stumble upon next, but I'm impressed every single time.  A few of my favorites: 
       + Caramel with sea salt (gives Bi-Rite's salted caramel a run for its money)
       + Mint chip (the mint tastes freshly picked)
       + Tres leches (studded with moist chunks of cake)
       + Earl grey (like Japanese bottled milk tea, only a zillion times yummier)
       + Chicory coffee (intense and not overly sweet)
       + Bananas foster (banana, cinnamon, and brown sugar)
       + Pink squirrel (almond with chocolate)
       + Chocolate stout (delightfully boozy)
* Your house-made caramel sauce. Rich and buttery with the perfect level of viscosity; tastes divine with ice cream, cookies, or by itself...yes, if I had no conscience, I'd totes pour the stuff straight into my mouth. I've heard good things about your buttered rum too.
* You serve warm waffle cones straight off the iron, and they taste just as good as they smell. 
* You bake spectacular cookies. Like your ice cream, the flavors range from the novel to the traditional: dark chocolate with bing cherries, peanut brittle, and chocolate chip. So chewy. So buttery. So delicious.
* You've kept your interior charming, cozy, and minimalistic, with sweeping white walls and mahogany tables.
* Every single serving utensil and container in your store is compostable. 
* Your employees are exceedingly earnest and always willing to let me try as many flavors as I want before I order. 
* You are open on Sunday afternoons, when I'm dreading Monday and craving sweets more than at any other time of the week.

My favorite ice cream parlor in the city, hands down.
author: Jen L.

description:
I would say that it's quite difficult for me to drive out here because I don't live near this side of San Francisco but if it weren't for the traffic then I'd definitely come often! 
The time I came was on a Saturday in the afternoon and the weather was as gorgeous as it can get. I walked in with my sister and it wasn't busy so that was definitely a plus! The service is super friendly and the store itself was nice with its wood/antique feeling furniture. 
But now, for the goods! I decided to get the pink squirrel on a sugar cone and it was beyond delicious! When the cone was handed to me it was warm and toasty!! It was the freshest cone I have ever had. Yep, they were definitely better than the cones you buy at the dollar store. It's really werid how the ice-cream was pink but that's what I loved most about it. The taste was pretty suddle and not too sweet. On the other hand, my sister got the fudge ripple and that was hands down amazing. When I go back, I will automatically choose that one. 
All I can say is that I cannot wait to go back!
author: Susie N.

description: Delicious, unique flavors make this a favorite.  It seems there is always a line, but it moves quickly and is worth it.  Every flavor is a win and they constantly change.  It is not uncommon for flavors to run out towards the end of the day.  I love it here!
author: Jaime L.

description:
Love the ice cream, hate the wait.

Ice Cream is outstanding. My favorite is the Old Fashioned.

The wait is often endless. I usually cut it off at 15 minutes or so. It just takes very long to serve one customer.
author: Heiko L.

description: BEST rootbeer float ever!  I tried to simulate this at home with rootbeer and my favorite icecream but somehow could not get it right.  Their ice cream is just better than anything you can get at the supermarket.  I am hooked.
author: Annie N.

description:
I have been gushing about Mr and Mrs for weeks and it's been high time I write them a review to reflect my stellar expierences.
Like many gems in Dogpatch, Mr and Mrs seems from the outset is nearly... invisible, blended into the neighborhood theme of large warehouses and empty spaces. There's no sign outside, nothing to denote it's fantastic ice cream magic inside... You just have to have faith almost that it's there.
The first time I went to Mr and Mrs was during 2010's first Bayview Sunday Streets; I wasn't even sure it was a food place let alone an ice cream parlor. When I heard it was and my curious friends rushed to stand in line to grab some treats from our find, I declined thinking oh, yet another attempt to create mind challenging ice cream a la Humphrey or bringing in familiar tasty but not commonly ice cream flavors a la Bi-Rite or Mitchell...
Instead, they came out with the very traditional Prailines and Cream; I had a bite and regretted not getting my own. Fresh spun caramel, a great balance of salt and sweet, such a wonderfully tamed richness...
I have since been back via bike (wonderful ride always) and have been loving it.
