They have a few novelty flavors (many seemingly in homage to a mistakenly simple, effortlessly cool and decadent Mad Men era like Old Fashioned and Banana Foster) that are quite good but it's their masterful crafstmanship of the classic old school faves that singles them out as a note worthy mention in the competitive gourmet ice cream business. Packaged together with their ever-so-nice, humble two-man service they're an absolute delight. 
Cheers to the Miscellaneouses!
author: Jessica L.

description: Croquantino okay I'll try it... Hazelnut, candied orange peel, vanilla base- delicious.  The texture was of course creamy but also chewy which was perfect. Parking was easy and the lines were minimal even though the place was packed. I'll be back to try the other flavors as they were sold out of many but they looked so tasty!
author: Kacey H.

description: How anyone could give this joint less than 5 stars is beyond me.  Not only are the flavors unique, wonderfully random and delicious, but Ian and Ann are super friendly versus the "next please" deal often found at HS.  If you ever happen to catch "Mr. and Mrs." at a slow time (tough to do) ask Ian about the Sourdough flavor he concocted--his passion and excitement for the cream will easily pull you in, and you will be talking Boudin versus ACME in no time.
author: Steve W.

description: The black sesame, the coconut cream, the caramel with sea salt, the strawberry, the cardamom...every flavor had by the crew on mother's day made the day. Exquisite pure flavors, perfect creamy density, all organic, a-m-a-z-i-n-g-l-y nice Mr. Misc (Mrs. Misc got the day to be with baby misc) even with a never ending line on the sunny day, beats Bi-Rite, Humphrey, rivals the now-defunct Sketch in Berkeley...worth the way out to Dogpatch no doubt.
author: Kim A.

description:
I sometimes meander through Potrero Hill having come to appreciate it for the generous sunny days, ample parking, sweeping views, access to the highway and simply, a peaceful slice of city life.  On such strolls, I might cross a person peppered here and there or the occasional dumpster diver, but surely, excluding Farley's, there must be more of my species than this?  Turns out, they are licking ice cream in the Dogpatch.  

If you'll be disappointed with less than 31 flavors though, keep right on walking.  Mr. and Mrs. isn't the tormenting decision paralysis one gradually feels from being faced with a battery of inconsequential choices.  Not exactly.  I mean, it's not the off the charts blood pressure claustrophobia that is Mitchell's, let's just put it that way.  Sure, you'll wonder how many peanut butter malt balls you could lay away in your cheeks, whether to order a creamy fizzy float or a gourmet fudgesicle, or maybe you'll just build yourself a rogue ice-cream sandwich with  house-made cookies.  But if it's ice-cream you crave, instead, you'll narrow down a dozen artisanal flavors to a few without breaking a sweat.  Somehow being spoon fed delightful samples balanced on long handle stainless steel utensils from tattooed sweethearts all under lofty ceilings and the afternoon sun on my back made it seem like I could afford to lolly gag.  Here, in this chic neo-old fashioned parlor, they've dreamed up flavors like the Old Fashioned (Maker's Mark, cherries and almonds) and the Ballpark (Anchor Steam and pretzels).  It's the quirkiness of Slocombe without the high-sugar eye-squinting tummy ache.  In fact, I'm about to say something that might be considered sacrilegious, blasphemous and downright heretical in this city:  

I THINK BI-RITE CREAMERY JUST GOT ONE-UPPED.  

The candied violet--having just the perfect floral balance of salt to subtly sweet, cream to ice, nibbling vs. dissolving--is a keeper (please consider offering this daily!) and my new favorite flavor of all time.  Flecks of violet petals carefully prepared on location and layered in a milky scoop make it also aesthetically admirable.
Ian asked if I was partial to a chewy or crispy texture before he hand-selected a peanut brittle cookie from the pedastal; no one cookie is the same and should never be turned down at the register.
author: Irene S.

description:
Ridiculously long line, and if it's a warm weekend day and you show up at the end, there won't be any flavors left!  Keep that in mind- place is popular.

Unique flavors, handmade waffle cones, lot's of toppings, excellent floats....It really is worth the hype.
author: Allie L.

description: 3:00, I was standing in front of this place thinking to myself should I? Should I have Ice cream as my first meal of the day? I remember reading amazing reviews on yelp about this place, but I'm never in that area (I was there that day for the 3rd street warehouse sale). I watched the long line of people coming out with their delicious looking ice cream and I stared at them eat it. My stomach was growling from no food...Oh I wasn't a freak just standing in front of a ice cream shop, I was waiting for a friend to come.I played with a doggie who was staring at his owner's ice cream while they were eating it, I was drooling with the dog. My friend shows up and I finally gave in, I want ice cream for my 1st meal!! The "white rabbit" was so good when I tasted it but I went with the butter toffee junior scoop. WOW!!! it was sooo good! Perfect texture so much flavor, I am so happy I got some :) Now I want to go back for the "white rabbit."
author: Karen T.

description: A BBQ I was at yesterday had Mr. and Mrs. M ice cream! What a great surprise! I had a root beer float with their vanilla bean ice cream. So. Good. Why have ice cream with added preservatives and colors when you can have natural, homemade ice cream?! If they start making ice cream cakes I'm going to become addicted.
author: Kate J.

description: Bourbon and brittle, and the one with the lime custard and orange something-or-other... in a cone... Mr and Mrs M FTW.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Same texture as bi-rite, with better flavor options.  Some flavors were hit or miss - I'd suggest tasting before ordering.  The mango was phenomenal.
author: M B.

description: The sage and caramel apple flavors are both outstanding.
author: Maggie T.

description: Best ice cream I have ever had in my life. Great flavors (buttered rum is my favorite). Wonderful housemade brittles & cookies. Lovely, inviting space with room to spread out and soak up the Dogpatch sun streaming in through the windows. Owners are hospitable and nice to interact with.
author: Laura K.

description: CAUTION:  I brought my nieces here (6 and 4) and the first thing they said when they walked in and the candy smells were cooking was, "It smells funny in here..."  The 2nd thing they said was, "They don't have many flavors."  You know what, it made me appreciate Mr and Mrs all the more!  This is ice cream for adults, with adult tastes and adult experience.  The kids have Baskins.  We wage earners, cubicle dwellers, internet entrepreneurs, warriors and soccer Moms have Mr and Mrs. The kids can come when they start voting, teaching, inventing an Ap or carrying a weapon to defend the homeland.
author: Tim L.

description: Been here a couple of times, but my latest trip had me trying a Black Cherry soda float with their Sweet Cream flavored ice cream. Arguably the best float I've ever had. Friendly staff to go along with the delicious sweets makes this an awesome place.
author: Alvin T.

description:
this ice cream really gives Bi-Rite a run for it's money. seriously. the only reason why they don't have long lines is due to location. i mean who is ever really in the dogpatch?? i just happend to be in the neighborhood and decided to stop by. 

almost every flavor was intriguing. the candied violet was floral in a nice way. i don't like beer but i can appreciate the beer and brittle flavor. it was actually really good for what it is.  but the winner was the burnt sugar. ridiculously good. the next day i found myself thinking about it and wondering why i hadn't bought a pint. i got it topped with their hot fudge which is AMAZING!! and i almost cried when i realized the hot fudge was of the gods. there's some well deserved drama for you!! it's the complete opposite of mcdonalds faux fudge. when kissed by the frozen ice cream it turns into an almost caramel consistency, which is how hot fudge is meant to be! 

i really can't wait to go back. next time a sundae.

**why aren't they open later??? i keep trying to find my way back but 6pm is too early!!
author: Regina C.

description:
I hate hype.

But this is not hype.

This is two people innovating without ego. 

The flavors are inventive without being contrived.

And the result is a delicious, fresh, clean product with robust flavor and zero attitude.

And another thing - the prices are completely fair. I don't feel humiliated when I leave.

Nice people, great ice cream, great prices.

Thank you, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: D B.

description: I love this place! They have really unique flavors that change constantly. Also, they'll let you try as many flavors as you want before you decide. They have homemade licorice, almond and peanut brittle, and some yummy salted caramel marshmallows as well. Plenty of seating and excellent customer service.
author: Nicole W.

description: Definitely my favorite ice cream spot in SF and maybe even the world! Along with the spectacular ice cream, the design is clean and hip and the husband-&-wife duo who run the spot are super friendly and hardworking.  Great for a cone or even to grab a pint for a dinner party!
author: Paul G.

description: Just tried the ice cream for the very first time and it was delicious! I had the earl grey ice cream, never thought it could taste that good. Looking forward to my next visit there to try other flavors. Customer service was good, friendly and attentive =].
author: Peggy C.

description: i crave their lemon poppy (tastes like a muffin!) and their earl grey (like milk tea) on a waffle cone.  their choco chip cookies are hella bomb, too! check em out!
author: Ali and Nick G.

description: The Kalamansi (golden lime) is absolutely refreshing! I love it!
author: Pamela M.

description:
Wow, I've eaten countless times at Piccino and Kitchenette, and never made it to Mr. and Mrs. M's because of their limited hours.  Well, today was my first time there and it was fantastic!  

Ice cream:  Creamy, rich but with bright flavor.  I got the rum raisin, what can I say it's all about the classics, this was SOOOO good much better than Haagen Dazs if you're going to splurge do it right.  

Staff:  Super nice, patiently explained all the flavors even though they're all described on Yelp.  Good thing there was no one behind me.

Ambiance:  Light, bright, floor-to-ceiling windows looking out on the dogpatch, black and white scheme inside, lots of seating, really nice and relaxing.

Only thing was, at 1pm today there was nobody there... let's support a local small business people... please, check out Mr. and Mrs. M's, they make great ice cream that gives Bi Rite a run for its money!
author: Celine T.

description:
big hearts for this place's ice cream, candies, cookies, treats and fantastic friendly owners.

ice cream flavors change daily and range from very expected - chocolate, strawberry - to the fantastically unexpected - earl grey chip, bananas foster, sesame.

hours are tough but if you work somewhat in the area, it makes an awesome lunch-break field trip. and when was the last time you took a field trip?
author: Dama J.

description: Seriously delicious ice cream and baked goods.  As an added bonus, the people who work there are really nice (why shouldn't you be happy when you are selling ice cream).  They have a bunch of great flavors.  My favorite - they only had it once - Fernet.  Part of me wants to give them 4 stars because they close so early - but in the end I am all about people being about to have a life and own a good business.  So when I want excellent ice cream during the day time, I go here.
author: Mel H.

description:
Upon running the Nike Women's Half Marathon and eating up a storm post run, we decided to make one last stop at Mr. and Mrs. for some ice cream upon returning home for some rest. Now how lucky were we to not have to wait in a long ass line on this amazing beautiful day in San Francisco for some homemade ice cream. Ok, so SF has some amazing/well-known ice cream options already (mitchells,bi-rite) but this place is definitely my favorite when I do go into the city. I like my ice cream to be on the creamier side of the spectrum and not too sweet and this place does it just right! For about three dollars a scoop and 4 something for 2, they definitely do no go cheapo on you. These scoops and ginormous and for an extra 50 cents, you can order it on a sugar cone. Their flavors are unique with numerous options where you just want to try every flavor. As for myself, I've always been a fan of anything tea flavored, cookies and cream or coconut and so I've always opted for the jasmine green tea or earl grey or coconut flavored ones on almost every time I come in for a visit.

So on that very special occasion, I opted for a coconut single scoop cone and lets just say I went a bit coco-nutz for it. I loved the little coconut pieces you get to chomp on with every bite or lick and the flavor tasted so organic and not too sweet. So not only do the people there make good ice cream but they definitely know how to treat their customers with respect. Everyone there is so nice, conversational and helpful. So for all of my UCSF mission bay housing people, please walk 3 blocks down from your apartment and eat at this place everyday for me. Thanks! - Anna

Pros:  I absolutely adore this place. They even have enough space within the place for you and your many friends to all sit down and devour your ice cream. Huge windows for you to enjoy one of SF finest scenery (the muni stop ;D). 
Helpful tips: They have weird hours, so make sure you check to see if they're opened before heading over. Their lines are definitely a bit crazy/out of the door/looped around the corner at times.
author: Anna T.

description: Very very very very good icecream! I think they make their own waffle cones and icecream. I wasn't planning on getting any but when my buddy was on the phone, I ended up having some before it melt. I had to tell him to get another cone! Yum!
author: King H.

description: My favorite new ice cream shop in the city.  Hands down.  I am in love.  There hasn't been a flavor I didn't like and their cookies and other baked goods are divine.  Forget about all those other shops, this is the place to go.  Peanut butter and jelly ice cream....oh yah.
author: a g.

description: On my ice-cream venture, M&MM was my #3 (#2 on my daughter's list). The Malted Chocolate Crunch, Flan, Chocolate Chip Banana, Vanilla Bean, and Chicory Coffee were all equally good (very cream which I look for in an ice cream). The place is spacious, and the decor is very welcoming. I know my daughter will drag me here again for the chocolate chip cookie...so I will definitely return.
author: Eunice M.

description:
this place can give bi-rite and humphry slocombe a serious run for their money.

we're been here 3 weekends in a row and i've loved everything i've tasted.  the three i did end up buying were the PB&J, malted cherry w/ hot fudge and crema catalana (flan w/ burnt sugar sauce).  the pb&j was exactly you would think a pb&j ice cream flavor would be.  the malter cherry and the catalana both had their respective sauces mixed as they were being scooped and add a fresh twirl to the mix.  the texture for each were spot on.  i can't wait to go back and try more flavors.  my wife's favorite flavor that she encountered was the croquatino (candied hazelnuts).

they do sell other lil goodies like marshmallows, almond brittle and the like which all look great but didn't try.  my wife did try the coconut marshmallow and was more than happy.

having mr. and mrs. miscellaneous around is great for all the great ice creams makers we have in the area.  each place has made their own niche and all can co-exist but i think mr. and mrs. has the potential to be the best of the lot...
author: Swarup B.

description: I had been eyeing this place for a while and decided to try it yesterday.  WOW!  Great ice cream and made with good quality ingredients.  I also bought one of their salted caramels and man, was that good!  My sister bought two types of their cookies and I gotta say that was probably one of the best cookies I have ever tried.  I will definitely bring my father here as he is an absolute ice cream fanatic and I'm sure he will agree that this place serves legit ice cream
author: Kirsten M.

description: $5 credit card minimum. Here's how I did it. single scoop ($3.50), cone ($.50), buttered rum topping ($1.00). Turns out, buttered rum doesn't have any rum. It's $1 for sugar. I was okay. I thought it was going to be rum. That said, I wanted rum n raisin. I then learned that they do have rum n raisin in the winter...I told them, I'll see them in a few months.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Went here on the recommendation of a friend who lives in the neihgborhood - slightly overpriced I would say but the ice cream is just plain delicious.  The flavors are quite unique - I had a cardamom blend which was so yummy.  Not much to say except that it will definitely put a smile on your face!
author: Jessica T.

description: Close to the Giants stadium... kind of. Clean. Just a nice place overall. The ice creams are all unique and custom-made for that day! I've never tasted flavors such as burnt sugar, rum (something), etc until I tried ice cream here. Customers flow in and out and and the owners are so kind!
author: Jessica C.

description: My favourite ice cream place on Earth. I am lucky enough to work just two blocks away, because I have quickly become addicted to their supreme ice creams. The halva and beer & brittle are to die for, just like the lemon poppy. Super nice people too. Forget Bi-Rite, this is THE ice-cream shop to go in SF.
author: Katalin G.

description: HOLD UP. Move over Bi-Rite, hello Mr. & Mrs. Misc! ...Wait, did I just say that?! Why yes I did! ... For as long as this place has been around, it's always been closed when I've tried going...until today. The 25 min wait was worth it. I asked if I could get two flavors in a junior scoop cup and the guy was nice enough to okay that with two mini-scoops of Strawberry and Black Sesame. Turned out this nice guy was Mr. Miscellaneous himself! The Black Sesame (which I've only found Asian versions of til today) was the best I've ever had. B-E-S-T BEST. Perfectly nutty, mild (not too rich), and creamy. As I was obviously mesmerized, Mr. Misc asked me how it was. Pretty sure he could tell by the ear-to-ear grin on my face and my spoon which broke from over-aggressively trying to enjoy my scoops. He said he had worked a month on the recipe. No wonder why it was so delicious! Just for Mr. Misc and this flavor, I'd come back again and again. The strawberry was great too. Not to knock on Bi-Rite since it has been my go-to raison d'etre for living in SF, but the strawberry balsamic is hit or miss there and can sometimes be dry. Not here. There wasn't one flavor on the menu I didn't want to try. Great to have such an awesome ice cream joint in the hood! Just make sure you go when they're open and bring cash. We took our ice creams for a stroll to the dog park in front of the MUNI depot and sat in the nice (windy) sun. There's also a nicer dog park on one of the state streets nearby too. Oh, and I love the branding and the labeling of your pints- you got good style, Mr. and Mrs. M! Hey, how about some frequency cards? :)
author: Jeana K.

description: Great ice cream, interesting flavors (they have about eight flavors at a time, and they change them almost daily), friendly owners, not too crowded. Solid place!
author: Gary Y.

description: As much as I hate to write this review, I must do so on the poor lack of service this business has. As much as I love to rave about the ice cream here and always recommend this place and consistently come here to get ice cream for work parties since its impossible for me to make it here afterwork hours, I just can support a place that does not show any appreciation for their customers. Rushed here on a saturday thinking they close at 6pm, but as usually they somehow alter their hours and was closing early. I totally understand that as owners are free to open and close whenever you want, but when you see a 6 month pregnant customer rushing out of the car in hopes to buy some ice cream, the least you could do is walk up to the door and let me know you cant sell me any ice cream. Instead, as I peek through the window, I watch the owner standing there kind of signaling me to hold on, which i patiently do, and just ignore me for the next ten minutes. Obviously you dont want to help me, but at least have the courtesy to let me know. Im myself work in the food industry and would never do such a thing like that. I was with my sister who has never tried this place, but after that, will never come back again and neither will I. I just cannot support businesses that dont have any knowledge of service and would rather spend my money elsewhere.
author: Connie C.

description: Best ice cream in town!!! They make their ice cream fresh daily, and are constantly creating new flavors to keep you coming back. They also make amazing treats (house made cookies, brittle, etc). You will not be disappointed! Not to mention, the owners are an adorable couple who live in the neighborhood. Support your local neighborhood businesses!
author: Shannon R.

description: Unique flavors, great service with a big smile. Homemade ice cream and cones with organic ingredients. Compostable cups and spoons, environmentally friendly. Bang for the buck.
author: Allen C.

description: Sinful and worth every mouth-watering bite! Talk about the creme de la creme of ice cream. It's gourmet and so full of unexpected flavors. Lucky for me, I live too far away to come here on a daily basis. Otherwise, I'd probably have to get my stomach stapled.
author: Qx T.

description: All the ice cream is so creamy and delicious.  The space is light and airy and lovely to sit in.  One of, if not the best ice cream in SF.
author: Preeti M.

description: Most original flavors, delicious ice cream, and cones!  Very sweet owners.  Really spacious, clean, and cool space.  Soooooo happy is close to work!  Totally worth the extra 20 minutes at the gym for the Candied Violet flavor!  Mhmmmmmmmm ;)
author: Laina V.

description:
nothing like coming back to the usa, and having satisfying ice cream.
sure, i wish we have 0.80 euro gelato, but $3.75 double scoop from here does the trick.  many interesting unique flavors, a la humphry slocombe.  tried ballpark, candied violet, bananas foster, dulce de leche.
ballpark beer flavor is accentuated nicely
bananas foster tasty.  good texture--this is just like bi-rite.  glad they do the spoon thing.  will try more.
rotating flavors, this time honey wine, butter almond (excellent), chocolate crunch, chicory coffee.
cones done fresh. still going strong
author: Rob C.

description:
anyone who knows me knows that i eat pretty healthy, but my downfall is  ice cream.  it probably doesn't help that my husband is also an addict, so we can't help but feed the habit.

this place is out of the way, but i had been dying to try it.  i like the modern, minimalist decor, and it's really roomy here.  you also won't have to stand in the sf cold like you do at bi-rite.  they have revolving flavors everyday, and yesterday, we tried the choc malted crunch and the crema something flavor, which was a lime flan flavor.  both of us got the scoops on homemade cones, and it was delicious!!  the husband also got a choc cherry cookie, which was yummy as well.  i tried the caramel w/ sea salt, which was a bit sweet for me.  the flavors are definitely interesting and creative, so i can't wait to try more!!
author: Helen T.

description: Beer and Peanuts flavored ice cream.  Amazing.  'Nuff said.
author: Erik N.

description: Some of the most interesting flavors I have seen (Fernet? Caramel and Bourbon? [they're not all alcohol flavored]). Only open during the day, but worth the journey to Dogpatch.
author: Clay M.

description: This is such an awesome and yummy spot in Dog Patch! The decor is simple and modern and the cookies and ice cream are to die for! I LOVE the cherry dark chocolate chip cookie! Fresh and tasty - the chocolate melts in your mouth. Their ice cream is also fresh and creamy! We went in on a cold and rainy day and there were others eating ice cream with us with our big rain jackets on! Great place!
author: Cat K.

description: Deeeeeeeeelicious! I am so happy to have Mr. & Mrs. in my neighborhood, welcome you two! Everything about this place is perfect. Location, decor, smells, tastes, friendly smiles of service. I am going back to have a root beer float or a fudgesicle. This might mean trouble!
author: Michal E.

description: Since I've been in the area, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous has become a big part of my weekly caloric intake. I'm a huge fan of their orange spice flavor, but I haven't been let down by a single thing I've had there. Seriously good stuff.
author: Mike P.

description: This place makes me happy because you can tell that the owners LOVE sharing their ice cream with every single person that walks in.  The cherry bourbon one is my favorite.  Some of their flavors are kind of "weird," but they are very generous with their samples so you'll be sure to find something to your liking. :-)
author: Kei D.

description: Honestly this place has the world's best ice cream ! Yes and I think its better then Bi-Rite creamery.
author: Sulaiman B.

description: I guess it's time to jump into the love fest.  This place was so highly recommended I had to try it.  I was a little concerned at first as I tend to be more of a traditional ice cream flavor girl, but I'm glad I gave it a try.  It was temping to order the chocolate or vanilla, but I decided to go for something more exotic.  It was a mixed berry creation and it was soooo good.  Highly recommended!
author: Kara H.

description:
we walked by here on the way to the furniture store next door. the shop is cute and there were alot of ppl in there, so my husband I decided to try the ice-cream. we got the mint-chocolate, which was very good. I love the scone is freshly made. all the utensil from the store is bio-degradable. wish they had more flavors though. 

definitely worth a try, a bit expensive. but it's like going to starbucks. it's an affordable luxury.
author: Cicie W.

description: I was totally blown away by the flavor of the ice cream at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  I have never even tried anything like the corn w/ caramel.    YUM!    :-)  I must admit that I must not be as much of an ice cream connosuierr as some of the other posters, because I haven't experienced anything like that before.  :-)  I often walk by the shop and have noticed the line outside getting longer.
author: Robin B.

description: Love their daily facebook menu posts. I've been a loyal patron since opening. Ian and Isabelle are wonderful. My favorites are Earl Grey, blackberry tea, chocolate malted crunch, lemon drop, mint, mint chips, banana foster, coffee, chicory coffee, candied ginger, candied violet, grapefruit sorbet, nougat, crema Catalina, crocotino, smores, cinnamon toast, basil chocolate chip, pb&j, buttermilk chocolate cake, buttermilk blueberry, jasmine, orange blossom, nibs & pearls, sage & cider, family jewels, halvana, etc. Waffle cones are the best I've ever had. Oh, they're clean and organic too!
author: Cindy K.

description: We love how creative they are with their flavors.  We've been here a couple of times and each time we try something new.  Love the ginger candy, orange blossom, earl grey, burnt caramel, basil ice cream, lemon coconut.  My son says their flavors are strange but he loves it everytime.
author: Cj P.

description: Pure crack. Yum. Had a scoop of the malted chocolate (i think?) and it was gobbled down in an instant. The baked goods were calling my name, but I was too stuffed so I only escaped with a salted caramel for the husband. I will be back, though, do not worry!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
So. Freaking. Good!! 

I'm not a lover of ice cream but man, this ice cream is phenomenal. I had the nougat which was so delicate, floral, fruity and just a gorgeous flavor. And this is creamy, dense, yummy ice cream unlike some of the overly fluffy ice cream that tastes good but is overly aerated out there.

Plus the place is just filled with the love of the couple who makes this amazing dessert for us to savor. It's a happy place. So awesome. 

Totally worth the trek out to the Dogpatch!
author: Karen C.

description: I know I'm in the minority, but I really haven't found any ice cream I'm completely in love with in SF.  My favorite is probably Three Twins, but I would say that this place and Bi-Rite are probably in the same class - just below.  Great texture but could use stronger flavors.
author: B. Y.

description:
beer & brittle makes for an interesting ice cream flavor, but i can't see myself sitting there licking a beer ice cream cone.

i do love everything else about them...the atmosphere and innovative flavors make for an awesome setup. fan them on facebook to keep track of what flavors they're putting out because they change it up every couple days.
author: Marjie T.

description:
I'm so glad we live near this place! Just a few blocks to great ice cream. Could life get better?

It does close early for an ice cream place, so do plan accordingly. It smells delicious as soon as you enter the door - probably from the cookies and other baked goods that they sell in addition to ice cream. There is a line some times when you get there, and if it's busy, you might not get a place to sit right away. 

The scoopers are all very friendly and let me try a few flavors. I can't remember what flavor I had the first time: something orangey and scrumptious. I got it with hot fudge sauce, which got clumpy too fast because of the cold ice cream. My recommendation: don't get the hot fudge sauce - or get it on the side and dip your ice cream in as needed.  I got the Lemongrass flavor most recently and it was super tasty. My husband got Rosemary Olive Oil and he loved it, though I found it a bit too herbal for me. I think they do a really good job of having interesting flavors, yet I always see kids in there, too, so they clearly have tamer flavors too (or these kids have way more sophisticated palates than I did at their age.)
author: Amy L.

description: A god-send to the Dogpatchers! How on earth were we so blessed to have these folks fall from the sky and land in Dogpatch?? Seriously don't know what I'd do without them. And in a town of others with some serious ice cream moxie, these two can roll with the best of them.
author: Amy K.

description:
what i ordered... toasted almond ice cream and peanut brittle cookie

...this tiny ice cream parlor look's new and much adorned with yuppies and wanna be's... and yes, fancy flavor names and hype goes with it...

ice cream had a taste and texture of homemade ice cream but way way way too sweet, i couldn't get myself to another scoop.
cookie was good, chewybuttery and fresh...

ambiance... ok (simple setting)
service... good (server's were upbeat and nice)
cost... $-
author: Gors P.

description: Well I have been wanting to try this place since I started working in the area. I got my chance today and sadly I was disappointed. Went in and scanned menu and liked the choices. I ordered a double with a scoop of White Rabbit and Ameretto. I also grabbed 1ea of the fresh licorice . Happy w/ my choices I left to face the warm summer day w/ my ice cream to beat the heat. I dug in and took my 1st bite. Mmmm very good vanilla, creamy and sweet? Wait a minute I didn't order vanilla. I tried I bite of my other scoop and it was the White Rabbit, condensed milk and white chocolate chips. It was ok, tasted of sweet creamy milk I tiny chunks of white chocolate but it didn't knock my socks off. I tried the 1st scoop again and again a nice vanilla ice cream. Thinking the very pleasant girl a the register had mixed up my order I went back and told the young woman that I couldn't taste anything resembling Ameretto or almonds and if by chance had she given me something else by mistake. Now just to clarify, I'm a bartender by trade and I've been behind a bar for 30 years so I know what Ameretto tastes like. The server (   never got her name) took a sample spoon and tasted the ice cream from the freezer and looked at me like was crazy. She didn't say "sorry you didn't like" "would you like to try something else". She didn't say anything! If I have a customer come to me and says I didn't like my drink I immediately ask if I can fix the one they have or I offer to make them something else completely. Now while some people have now idea what they are talking about and just want a stronger drink I want to give that person the best drink I can make them. I'm sure that these folks are making a lot of very happy with their ice cream which I admit happily is almost as good as Mitchell's their customer service is lacking. Excuse me, not theirs, hers. And to mr & mrs miscellaneous if you are able to get my contact info from Yelp I am happy to try and let you change my mind.
author: Steve B.

description:
"It be good," says my husband.

and I would have to agree. Tried a couple of flavors and loved them all. Yummers! Can't wait to return to try more flavors.
author: Goober S.

description:
"A man can be an artist... in anything, food, whatever. It depends on how good he is at it." 

This couple has found what they are good at...ice cream.
author: Jon I.

description: I went with some misgivings because I wasn't crazy about Henry Slocombe and heard it was a fancy kind of ice cream spot.  I tried the blueberry and buttermilk and was eh.  But the Burnt Sugar was so damn awesome I have to say something.  It was like smooth creamy toffee in a sweet and subtle kind of way.  They make their own little waffle cones too.  They were out of vanilla bean but we will save this for another visit.  The consistency of the ice cream was some of the best I have ever had.  I recommend this place to everyone.
author: Jerry V.

description: Hands down, my favorite ice cream in the city. The owners are great people and space is amazing. Their cookies are delicious too.
author: Christopher P.

description: You must come here and try their Earl Grey ice cream, it's orgasmic!!! Oh, but call beforehand to see if they're serving it that day....they change their menu around.
author: Michelle T.

description: Can't believe I have been coming here for a year now.  Seems only yesterday we had our first mouthwatering taste.  the hype and success are well deserved.  Family owned business, 2 foodies with a dream to present SF with Wonka-tastic pure imagination ice cream.  Their passion for the flavor and commitment to a green business are more reasons to love.  And the complaints about the hours?  Phooey!  They are only 2 people(recently hired a plus one).  If they expanded hours it might dilute their vision because it would mean hiring others.  Leave it be. Besides, Mr. and Mrs. want to see their little daughter sometimes- she is as adorable as their sunny, welcoming shop.  Let them have a family life or they will quickly burn out and lose their enthusiasm for the business.  SF's collective taste buds would suffer a sad loss if that day came.
author: Lorraine V.

description:
adorable ice cream shop- simple decor with fresh, organic ingredients.  love that the flavors are ever-changing & love that "mr & mrs" actually run the shop!  really unique flavor combinations- the pink squirrel is my most recent fave.  plus they make their own waffle cones-- love!

only downside is they close at 6pm on weekdays, boo :( so much for satisfying my sweet tooth after dinner!
author: Karen F.

description:
The Ice cream is still my favorite, but don't overlook the cookies.
These are the best cookie's you will find anywhere. Ian is also a killer baker, I'm hooked on the cookies!
author: Jim M.

description: i love this place! the vibe is just awesome when you walk in and you can just tell you're going to be trying high-quality, artisanal ice cream with interesting flavors. i haven't tried enough of their flavors but everything i've had so far has been delicious. you really can't go wrong! also, unlike bi-rite in the mission or ici in berkeley, parking in the dogpatch is pretty painless. I've always been able to find a parking spot nearby and it's also really close to the T for those taking public transportation.
author: Jennifer W.

description: omg, how can you NOT love the name of this place?? Thanks to Jenny K. for bringing me here on a nice sunny San Francisco day. Sampled several flavors but ultimately liked the earl grey tea the most. I really like how they have such unique flavors that are always changing. Time to introduce people to this ice cream joint! :D
author: Eugenia G.

description:
I had the Cheesecake which was really good and had actual crust mixed in.  Not just chunks but actual strips of crust which made it that much better.  Chill atmosphere with nice service.

Only 3 stars because every flavor I tasted, including the Cheesecake, had a weird after taste.  I know it's organic but damn, not one flavor I tried didn't leave me with a hint of something not that great.  But I got over it with my flavor.  Also, $3.50 for 1 scoop (arguably 2 small scoops) is really expensive.  I'll have to try bi-rite.

Overall good place but not the best thing in the world.  Def should at least try it out.
author: Isamarie P.

description:
It's unfortunate that I've discovered this place early in the summer season. I am going to want to go everyday

The openness of the place and all the windows make it a great place to soak up some sun (even if it is only 50 degrees outside).

They have enough unique flavors without trying to do too much. Plus, all their utensils and cups are compostable.
author: kirti p.

description:
The English Black Tea Ice Cream is the best scoop of ice cream I have ever had. 

The flavors are as original as they are delicious.
author: Lindsay O.

description: After devouring a huge plate of red flannel hash at Serpentine today I couldn't resist checking out Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. I'm extremely loyal to Bi-Rite. Humphry Slocombe to me doesn't even come close. But I have to admit, this place makes me waver. And the fact it's across from one of my favorite restaurants in the city makes it a powerful combined draw. Think I still like the texture of the ice cream at Bi-Rite slightly better, but the richness of the flavors here were exceptional and I can't wait to go back and try the homemade cones and other assorted treats when I have a bigger appetite.
author: Shoshana D.

description: Best ice cream in the bay area - better than bi-rite, humphry, ici, etc.  Mr and Mrs are also very friendly
author: Joshua R.

description: The ice cream here is sooooo good!!  I use to live down the street from them and prob went about once a week.  Unfortunately now I live in the peninsula and can't go there as often.  But when I'm in the area and they have my favorite flavors (birthday cake being the top), I make sure to stock up!
author: Van P.

description: Oh my holy ice cream cone!  Crema catalana + a made to order waffle cone, still warm and chewy.  Quite possibly the best ice cream cone of entire my life.  I may never go to the Dogpatch without stopping by Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous again.
author: Jenny S.

description: My favorite ice cream place in the city! Definitely does not disappoint! I think bi-rite is so overrated, cause this place has better ice cream and there's no wait!
author: abby q.

description: Ice cream is good, but odd flavors. They must be doing very well since their hours are so limited.
author: somel y.

description: My new fave ice cream spot! Try their candied violet ice cream and home made marshmallow covered in shredded coconut...wowza!! Look out Mitchells! They may not have the selection that Mitchell's does...but they are SO nice and they do everything themselves and are super eco conscious (compostable straws even....whaaaat?awesome!) I love them! Yum yum gimme some (more!)
author: Jenn T.

description:
Their Bananas Foster Ice Cream is the best thing ever!
Slightly pricey, but totally worth it.  
I'd go here over Humphrey Slocombe any day!
author: CJ V.

description:
I brought a couple of friends from out of town to the Dogpatch for what I think is the perfect Sunday morning excursion: brunch at Serpentine followed by a scoop of ice cream across the street at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.

I had a scoop of Old Fashioned, which was Maker's Mark ice cream with almonds and cherries.  The ice cream itself was delicious, with the perfect cold, creamy texture; but the best part was biting into one of these succulent booze-steeped cherries and getting a burst of fruity, whiskey-ish flavor.  I also tried their chocolate ice cream with "choco-crispy pearls" in it, which was just as tasty.  M&MM also sells scrumptious cookies and caramels, and it's all in a lovely post-industrial space with epic 20 foot ceilings (like Serpentine) and plenty of tables.

To my mind (and mouth) M&MM is on a par with Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite Creamery in terms of the quality and originality of their flavors, and as a bonus it's much less cramped and crowded, even on a sunny day.  Well worth a visit to the Dogpatch, especially when paired with a meal at Serpentine.
author: Yoshi S.

description: Interesting flavors, high-quality ice cream. Ice cream snobs would approve.
author: Jolie S.

description: Wow, welcome to the ice cream game Mr&Mrs M.  Easily on the same level as Bi-rite, but with a refreshingly new set of creative flavors that seem to change almost weekly and actually work unlike at Humprey Slo.  I tried cinnamon toast, buttermilk and blueberry (my favorite), and butter corn.  All rich in flavor.   A little lighter on creaminess then bi-rite.  Really nice owners, plenty of seating, and they home make almost everything except the sprinkles. Plenty of parking in the street behind it at least on the weekends.  This is definitely my favorite shop in sf.
author: beverly l.

description: Oh you guys are in for a treat!  Make an effort to get down to this part of San Francisco for delicious ice cream, cookies and candies. Had the Old Fashioned (cherries, Makers Mark bourbon and sliced almonds) and hubby had the Nougat (honey, apricots and pistachios)-what a sensory overload we have here!  It's a great destination to try some really unusual flavors.  Also, we had a hankering for the delicious coconut marshmellow and peanut brittle.  Absolutely exceeded our expectations!
author: Al L.

description: Love them!  I've tried orange blossom, burnt sugar, vanilla bean and a couple others I can't remember...all delicious.  Just be forewarned, on so several visits they've run out early, especially on warm days.
author: Alex S.

description:
I was a little disappointed that, on the day I went, there were no chocolate-based flavors. Can you imagine? No chocolate ice cream! Pretty much every flavor was based in a light-colored cream. However, I give them massive points for their imaginative flavors (of which I am a huge fan) and their chocolate-stout (again, the name is deceptive... not a chocolate base) was superb. Not at all like mixing cream with real beer (shudder). 

 I haven't been there multiple times so I don't know if their flavor menu changes often. That's one thing I like about Bi-Rite Creamery, so I'm hoping this will be our equivalent on this side of the city!

Also, they need to stay open later. I've only eaten there once despite cruising by with an after-dinner sweet tooth a couple of times. 6pm is only the beginning of ice-cream-o-clock.
author: Geae D.

description:
The BEST ice cream in SF.  OK I love Mitchell's but the flavors here, different, subtle and exciting.  The ice cream is so smooth and tasty I can't compare it to anywhere else.  (I'm an ice cream freak!)  

You might think "rosemary pistachio" sounds odd but it's just about my favorite.  I say about because I haven't tasted a single flavor there that I did not like.  (We live close-by so I go there often.)

Anabelle & Ian, the owners and creators of all things edible at Mr. & Mrs Miscellaneous, are charming and down-to-earth, fun people.

MAKE an opportunity to stop by 22nd STREET and 3rd STREET (they are right on the corner) and taste something outstanding.
author: Greg W.

description: Love it here! Not your average boring ice cream shop, they have so many new interesting flavors to choose from. I love the Candied Violet, Hazelnut, and Coffee ice cream! My husband really likes the blueberry buttermilk so I'm going to have to go back and try it!
author: amber c.

description: Love this place!  The Black tea and Peanut Butter Malt are my favorites.  They have such creative flavors and switch them up so often.  My only complaint is that they close too early for me to hit it after work.
author: Jean P.

description: Best. Ever. They have the most unique and delicious ice cream flavors I have seen in SF thus far. Buttermilk Blue, Burnt sugar, Croquatino and Black Forest cherry are just some of the amazing flavors to try. Get a scoop in one of their homemade cones - you wont be sorry! To top it off, the owners are incredibly friendly, and their chocolate chip cookies are delicious!
author: Asha R.

description: Finally made it!    There was a bit of a line, and although I am not very patient with lines, I enjoyed watching the people in front of me tasting many different flavors and the comments,  care and patience from the servers.  Ghost Chili & Shochu - yummy - loved the heat at the end.  Lychee and Black Tea was great - I have always loved green tea ice cream, but black tea is my new favorite.   My mom had the Maple Brandy and of course I had to have a taste.  Loved the real maple flavor that you don't always get with many maple flavored products.  All the baked goods looked delicious, but I will wait to try those on my next visit.
author: Vicki M.

description: Enjoyed a creamy, rich Pralines and Cream ice cream, a giant coconut marshmallow, and a chewy. moist Dark Chocolate and Cherry cookie.  Love the giant glass windows and (relatively) ample inside seating.  A great addition to the SF ice cream scene ...
author: Melinda C.

description: AMAZING ice cream and waffle cones and such nice people to boot. You NEED to come here.. plain and simple.
author: jen p.

description: I AM THE BIGGEST ICE CREAM FAN EVERRRRRRRRR! So when I heard about this place I was more than ready to see what they got.  After my initial visit all I can say is that this is now THE BEST ICE CREAM  in San Francisco! Forget overly hyped places like Humphry or Bi Rite! They just won't compare to the real deal!  GO GIANTS!!!!!!!
author: foo d.

description: Mr. and Mrs. is my little secret in the Dogpatch.  It just opened last month, but already its slowing becoming part of my daily routine.  Breakfast, lunch, dinner, and then ice cream!  The ice cream flavors change frequently with interesting names like Peanut Butter and Jelly and Mexican Spice.  Highly recommend this place for anyone who wants a little sweetness in their life.  Just don't make this so popular that I have to wait in a line that extends out the door. :)
author: Ash S.

description: I absolutely love this place! The ice cream tastes home-made, and the flavors are unique and fun. Driving by Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous makes me crave ice cream on a cold day! Candied Violet is my absolute favorite =)
author: Jean B.

description: Hands down best, creatively flavored ice-cream around! LOVED the Crema Catalana...definite must try!! Great location right across from the Hard Knox Cafe. I had a chance to talk to Mr. and Mrs. right before closing...founds out some interesting tidbits. Menu changes daily and they're always up for new ideas. The best thing about it -- it's super inexpensive! Can't wait until next time!
author: Jen D.

description: Love their flavors! Fun and clean and easy... but leave the dog at home. They also have fun sweets like peanut brittle and pnut butter malt balls and sour licorice. Loved their lemondrop ice cream!
author: gary a.

description: We love to go here for ice cream breaks at my work! I love all the flavors. I even love the vegan sorbets they have when I'm trying to be a little healthier! Plus the couple is so friendly and the shop is so cute. Its always a pleasure to go here! They make their ice cream and cones too! Can't beat that! I haven't had a flavor that I didn't like and they are really nice about letting you taste first! :)
author: Delilah G.

description: I'm sorry, but if a place cannot keep hours that are meaningful, it needs to change. I want to like MMM. But how can I possibly enjoy and ice cream shop that is closed by 6? If the business is growing and they can't keep up, hire someone to help. With Piccino and Serpentine so close by, we need a place open until 9 or 10 to have a cone after dinner. Look at the lines at HS, BiRite and Mitchell's. Change your hours and I'll give you 4 or 5 stars.
author: Robert U.

description: The best ice cream I gave had so far.  The ice cream is made fresh at their location using Strauss milk. The flavors are unique and really good. The waffle cone is also made right in front of you. Te couple who own the place are really nice and very friendly allowing you to spend as much time tasting. Has be one my favorite ice create haunt.
author: Rohit D.

description: BOING!!!!!! they have some damn good ice cream.... and marshmallows.
author: jerry a.

description: Loved the burnt sugar! Hubby actually like the fernet Blanca! I must say I like the ice cream version 100 times better than the drink! Can't wait to try the others! Yay for ice cream! I scream, you scream, we ALL scream for ice cream! My cheer for the day!
author: MiSa S.

description: love this place. i think there's a bit of a trend for some ice cream places to be clever, but i've seen this go at the expense of creating good tasting ice cream. mr & mrs miscellaneous has, in my opinion, found a great balance of creativity and delicious. they focus on creating a few, good flavors which encourage you to come back just to see what's on the menu.
author: Paolo M.

description: Delicious! While the BF and I were waiting for a seat at the Just For You Cafe we decided to go get some ice cream. It was GREAT!! I had the Fudge Ripple and the Chocolate Malted Crunch (Fudge was just ok, the vanilla in it was really good and the Chocolate Malt was fantastic!) and the BF had the Pecan Praline which was phenomenal. I will be back soon!
author: Aryn Y.

description: So, yeah, this ice cream is really good. The flavors are intense and inventive, similar to Humphry Slocombe. The texture is just a bit too dense for my preference, but whatever. It's still really great. If you decide to go the sundae route, the toppings are good, too, and a pretty decent deal. The hours this place keeps can be kind of inconvenient for those not right in the neighborhood.
author: Brian C.

description: Parking was hard to find, but I was all worth the trip and definite return visits. The place is modern and spacious. The ice cream...wow. Oh BiRite I think I have a new love. I tried 3 flavors which is there limit on test tries. I had banana foster, lemon crunch and nougat. All very yummy but nougat won my heart. It is a ice cream with soak apricots, pistachios and honey.  A small cup is $3. Next time I visit I'm need to check if they can sell pints...
author: Jess H.

description:
Simply amazing ice cream and other goodies (marshmallows, caramels, cookies), enthusiastic and friendly crew... And, unlike any of the other quality ice cream shops in SF, this place not only has a fantasticly light and airy interior with plenty of room to hang out, it also has gobs of street parking. 

In other words: perfect.
author: Sarah V.

description: love, love, love the spaciousness of this corner ice cream shop! the high ceiling, white walls, and contrasting dark wood tables really give this place a contemporary modern feel. but what's a great eating space without great food to accompany it? not to worry, their ice creams are definitely worth writing home about. with flavors like bananas foster and pb&j, it'll satisfy the pickiest of sweet tooths. don't forget to give their cookies some love as well. they are equally worth the mention.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Great ice cream.  I still have a preference for Bi-Rite based on the sole flavor I had today (an orange-based flavor - can't recall the name), but I'd definitely make a trip back out to the dogpatch just to try some of the other flavors.  The wide-open seating space is a huge plus.
author: Ernest S.

description: Delicioux ice cream in interesting (but not *too* interesting, if you know what I mean) flavors! Early Grey tea, candied violet, orange blossom (also vanilla and chocolate peanut butter). Decadent homemade hot fudge sauce. Next time I also want to try the homemade caramel. Beautiful place, light and airy and clean and bright. And, importantly, very nice proprietors. (Also a 100 on their health score! Mazel!)
author: Brooke H.

description: Ice cream is the best I have had in San Francisco, everything is handmade, different flavors every day, and a cute vintage theme. The waffle cones and syrups are all handmade! It's ran but a husband and wife team who need all the support they can get to keep this wonderful shop open. To reference other reviews comparing it to BiRite this shop is locally owned and operated by only two people so they don't have the staff to say open long hours. Strongly recommend trying it if you love ice cream or cookies
author: kirstina s.

description: I'm just back from the lovely Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and my ice cream--burnt sugar in a sugar cone--was so delicious I want to go back there immediately and have another.  Nice space with lots of room to sit down if you want, cute and friendly owners, and just perfect ice cream.  This place is a bright spot after a pretty dismal "summer" in SF.  Yay! and welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Annette K.

description: Awesome ice cream, but the business hours suck. But it's good enough that it's worthwhile planning ahead to get the ice cream here. I got a boring cup of chocolate, and cookies and cream. Both of them were excellent though, and surprisingly were REALLY good when eaten together. Will be back to have more of the same.
author: vincy b.

description: Okay.  I'm upset.  This place is one block from our place and I love ice cream.  I'm going to have to work out an extra four hours a week if I don't get a grip on my ice cream habit!  Two standouts so far: creamy salted caramel ice cream and malted milk ball ice cream.  Everything else was just "excellent".
author: Kevin M.

description: Excellent.  Bi-rite and mr and mrs miscellaneous  are our favorites in the city.       Both great options.   Tried Humphry Slocums (sp?) and thought it was fine and unique, but not workth going back to.
author: michael d.

description: Location is excellent.    Homemade organic ice cream.  Great creative flavors that always change.  Great interior-suitable prices.  I could honestly come here everyday!!  Remember its always sunnier in the Dogpatch than anywhere else.
author: R L.

description: Came across this place on accident, and love it! All the flavors are great, so far I've had the peanut butter & jelly, banana foster, pralines & cream, Chocolate fudge crunch or something like that! But every single flavor is delicious! I highly recommend it!
author: J H.

description: pretty decent! Yummy! Close to UCSF mission bay! Walking distance!
author: Wenwen J.

description: I went into the shop and i fell in love with the chocolate cookies with cherries, the ice cream was delightful and I will continue to frequent the shop when i am in SF. My question is do they have a website... maybe a list of upcoming flavors... and other treats?
author: Lynn H.

description:
I live fairly close by, so when the incredibly friendly owners post the day's flavors on Facebook, I can make a decision about how quickly I'm going to have to get out the door to get my favorite flavors before they run out.  Because, yes, they do run out!

Today, a new one hit my radar - Coffee 'n' Caramel.  If you see it on the menu, just go get it.  Now.

I agree that the hours aren't ideal, but great things are worth a little work.   I love the normal flavors - esp. mint chip - but their original flavors are awesome.  They're not as over the top as HS, but clearly the work of flavor geniuses.    The fudgsicle is AMAZING.

My only complaint is that some of the chocolate flavors are too salty.
author: Pam H.

description: This place is a nice addition to the ice cream scene in san francisco.  Space is clean and airy with large windows leaving a great view tot he dogpatch.  The icecream is top notch, not quite 5 stars, b/c 2 of the 6 flavors I tasted were only OK, the other 4 were oustanding! (especially the lemon crunch).  points off for the early closing time as well since I rarely eat ice cream before 9 pm.
author: p w.

description: Obligatory stop after lunch @ Oralia's. Not sure I get the mural outside (sorry), but ultra sleek interior. Inventive and vibrant flavor combinations that have included fernet, white corn and candied violet ... Sophisticated, yet appealing to your inner fatty. Don't sleep on the handmade sugar cones.
author: Ben R.

description:
One of the best homemade ice cream shops in the city, run by a cute couple.  Very creative flavors and there is always something new on the menu.  The prices are quite reasonable and the scoops are twice the size of those at Bi Rite!

Please come to the Dogpatch and support this tasty shop so they can stay in business.  I will be really sad if this place closes.
author: Ben E.

description:
I didn't really have a perspective on Mr. and Mrs.  Miscellaneous until they went on vacation a couple weeks ago.  I knew that the ice cream was fantastic, yet didn't really have perspective with the two other biggies out there....Bi Rite and Humphrey Slocumb.  Well, when I wanted ice cream, yet could not get it, I needed to travel to the other places.  I went to Humphrey twice, yet did not go in.  The line was so long and I couldn't see the flavors that they posted.  I guess that I cannot really compare M&MM to HS, yet if you are making strange flavors and there is a huge line, don't you owe it to your customers in line to tell them what you are serving????  I know that someone told M&MM that they should put up a great ice cream sign...and they did.

Anyways, went to bi rite.  Ordered the coffee ice cream, chocolate chip and then one other time the mint chip.  Nothing blew me away.  The mint chip tasted like something that I would get from the grocery store.

M&MM mint chip taste like a mojito.  The mint is so fresh...I have had nothing like it.  This weekend, I tried the Caramel and Sea Salt...wow.  I am going to buy a pint for my dad.  I also had the pretzels and beer.  They  basically grind up some of the pretzels and add malt or something to make it taste wonderful.  I suggest going in and trying a few before getting a cone.

I did have the cookies and cream and wasn't wowed.  Yet that is like going to a restaurant and ordering a steak versus the specialties on the menu.  Just go in and try a few then buy a cone.  Make sure you get a homemade waffle cone.

Love these guys and it is with mixed emotion that I write a review.  I like having this establishment all to myself.
author: Jack S.

description:
I tend to come in here a lot. 

First, a few disclaimers that might bias this review: I like good food. I like sincerity. I respect the hard work it takes to create something good.

So when two hard working people make a sincere effort to create the best ice cream they can, and it's really good, and they serve it to you in a pleasant and friendly atmosphere, I give them 5 stars. The fact that they're in my neighborhood guarantees it.

I love the fact that their flavors are inventive without being weird just for creativity's sake, and they have a cool vibe without having a bunch of pretentious, overly-hipster attitude.

It's a great little shop, and just writing this review has made me want to go down and get a cone.
author: Neil H.

description: THEY ARE NEVER OPEN!  I've tried to come here 3 times in the past couple of months, during "business hours", and they were closed.  The ice cream is great, but you have to work from home or leave work st 4pm in order to eat it.  They should stay open later so that people can come after work or after dinner when you normally have dessert!
author: Alison C.

description: Best homemade ice cream east of Humphry Slocombe, possible the best in SF period. Try the candied violet or the PB&J. This place singlehandedly classes up the Dogpatch by about 100 percent.
author: Wade R.

description: This place is awesome!!  The candied violet ice cream I had was exactly what I needed today.  Light and refreshing and delicious. Owners = super friendly and the place is spotless.  Worth the trip out to the Dogpatch for sure.  Heck I made a Yelp account to write this review!
author: Matt K.

description: Great vibe to this place.  Had the Chocolate Malted and it had little bits of malt balls in the ice cream.  Delicious, not too rich, but smooth and creamy and YUM!   I like that they only have a few selection because they do it all well.  Super friendly staff too.  Unfortunately they were out of cones but I was getting a half pint anyways.  Great that this place has opened in Dogpatch.
author: Big Toe ..

description: When it's not super crowded this place is so awesome.  Really cute inside and the candied violet ice cream is so delicious.  This is a real treat, especially right after a nice meal at Serpentine.
author: Sweaty P.

description: My friends have been recommending this place for months so we finally popped in to try it out today. At first, I was nervous because the sign said PB & J was sold out, but the man who works there managed to scrounge up a scoop for me and my son to share. I got two pints to go as well and they only charged us for the two pints. The ice cream was delicious and they were very friendly. This seems like a great neighborhood business. I am very excited to crack into the two pints waiting in the freezer now!
author: Johnny G.

description: you just need to go here asap! the flavors and texture will get you hooked!!
author: Ange G.

description:
I don't usually write reviews or "Yelp", but I can't help myself after a trip to this gem of an ice cream shop located in the Dog Patch / Potrero Hill area. 

I tried samples of the Beer & Brittle and Candied Violet before settling on a two-scoop cup of good old fashioned Chocolate Chip and Banana with Chocolate Chips & Salted Peanuts. All of them were awesome and delicious in their own right. From the taste of it, it looks as if Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe have some stiff competition on their hands. 

The shopkeepers (a super sweet woman who tried to give me my $2.50 tip back -- she said it was too much -- and a tattooed gentleman) went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. The prices were "right on the money" ($3.75 for two generous scoops in a cup), and the interior was comfortable and simple. 

Definitely highly recommend this place if you're looking for awesome ice cream or live in the neighborhood and need a delicious cold creamy fix!

Five Stars!
author: Greg O.

description: Fantastic mom and pop outfit in an up-and-coming neighborhood. The couple the that own and run the place are super friendly, and the ice cream is top-notch. [Corner of 3rd and 22nd]
author: Stanley D.

description: Super-delicious, creamy ice cream - Beer & Brittle, Orange Honey and Roasted Banana - without the crazy long lines of Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe.  And the sun-filled corner location in the Dogpatch (3rd and 22nd) is wonderful.  We'll most definitely be back soon!
author: Nhi N.

description: Incredible flavors.  My favorite (even better than Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe).  They also have delicious sorbet flavors in the back if you can't take dairy.
author: J E.

description: 5 starts for 2 great people following their dream and making awesome ice-cream. Great for the neighborhood, the Dog Patch needed this!
author: C L.

description: I'm not sure how I feel about having such a delicious ice cream place so close to my home - especially now that it's summer.  Anyhow, I had their mint chocolate chip ice cream today with their homemade hot fudge, which was about as satisfying a dessert as a girl could ever hope for.  The atmosphere is low-key and friendly too.  I'll be back.
author: Heather C.

description:
Great ice cream- I had the Choco-Malt flavor. It was actually kind of light tasting. Not as heavy on the cream as some other specialty ice cream places in the city. I could tell the ingredients are top-quality. The cones were tasty and fresh too. I'll be back!

Just wish they were open a tad later. We usually finish dinner at 8-8:30, which is just the perfect time for an ice cream diversion.
author: Cynthia s.

description:
I almost stopped on a green light as I drove by their new glass window which says, "Don't panic, it's organic!". I whipped by head around to see...ice cream, finally! We strolled down this evening to taste their handmade organic ice cream,  I had the coffee which was creamy and rich, my man had pralines and cream.The owner said all their ice creams are made in their shop, how cool is that?!

we walked back up the hill, both of us were in heaven, eating our treats! Plus we loved the modern decor and the cool owner and his wife, next time we are trying their brittle and caramels...hell maybe i can have my ice cream birthday party there!
author: ARLENE K.

description:
Every flavor I sampled was better than the one before...this is a great ice cream shop with inventive sweets in a rad location! What an excellent addition to the dogpatch. 

try the ballpark ice cream...
author: Hadass G.

description: Our friend took us here on a visit to SF; he liked the flavors plus it's not as crowded as the other more popular ice cream joints like Bi-Rite, Humphrey's, and Mitchell's.  The flavors change daily, and on the afternoon we visited, we were told Rocky Road, Browned Butter, Candied Violet, and Jasmine Green Tea were the most popular flavors.  I skipped the Rocky Road since that didn't sound as exciting--Blue Bell, after all, makes a Rocky Road.  The Browned Butter was too sweet and rich for me, while the Candied Violet tasted just like Skittles--again, too sweet.  I settled on the Jasmine Green Tea since the flavor was subtle even though it wasn't as creative as some of the other flavors.  They come as a perfectly round scoop the size of a tennis ball on top of a skinny cone; it was so cute, just like a cartoon ice cream cone.  The ice cream's texture was creamy and dense--just how I like it--and the best part was there was no line.  We salute you, Mr. and Mrs. Misc.  What a cute name albeit too long for lazy tongues.  (Tongues lazy from licking your ice creams.)
author: Christine H.

description:
Good stuff! Very nice ice creams and sorbets. Somewhere between Humprey Slocum and Birite in style- which only means they have their own Mr & Mrs style.

The store doesn't have much signage yet, so it's easy to miss on the southwest corner of Third and 22nd Street, diagonally across from the Dogpatch Saloon.
author: Rocco P.

description: love love love!  i was impressed with everything at this place.  the shop is quite cute and modern and there was ample room to sit and mingle.  the service was quick and friendly and best of all, the ice cream is divine.  i got the earl grey on a waffle cone could not believe how warm the waffle cone was.  freshly made!  i don't know if that's the norm but it was the first time i had a fresh waffle cone and the contrast was amazing. mmm, can't wait to go back here.
author: Karen N.

description: Great flavors, perfectly icy, creamy delicious ice cream.  Cool decor, easy to street park.  Feels good to support a young hip family run place.
author: Nathan M.

description: The Crema Catalana ice cream is perhaps the best desert that I have ever had. I also highly recommend the honey gram ice cream. Walk down the street to Piccino Cafe and make yourself an affogato.
author: Matt L.

description: outrageous!  salted mango...home made almond brittle...caramels...chocolate chip cookies...um...explosion of flavour.  so, so good...i only wish you were closer...but then it would mean my intake would increase exponentially.  WOW and AWESOME don't even come close to how good this is.
author: Sonia C.

description: This place is so yummy! They have interesting flavors and let you sample them.  I ordered the Basil Mint Chip (super delicious!) .. they also have other flavors like Salty Mango, Burnt Sugar, Chai Coffee, B-day cake, strawberry cream, but basil mint chip was my favorite. Next time I'm in the city, I'd come back! 5 stars~
author: M Y.

description: best ice cream place in the world! and the owner is a complete beast!
author: Sam B.

description: We went after lunch at Serpentine. What a super place with the most friendly owners! Everything was DELICIOUS! I'm a self proclaimed cookie connoisseur and can't stop raving about the peanut brittle-brown sugar cookie. Yum! We'll definitely be back - it was delightful!
author: Mona T.

description: I love this place and the owners. The ice cream is delicious and unique. The treats are yummy. I just wish I could go here. My only complaint is the hours are unpredictable and every-time I go when they are supposed to be open, they are not. Also, the shop closes at 6 on weekdays, making it impossible for the 9-6ers. I am not angry but I am disappointed I can never get ice cream from this lovely little shop because I really want to! :)
author: Michele C.

description: This is the best ice cream place in the city -- trust me, I have checked them all out and take this description seriously. What's special about the place is the originality/subtlety/variety of the ice cream recipes and the quality of the ingredients. This is not a place that serves off-the-shelf flavors -- they've invested time and attention to detail into new concepts and refined execution. The result is an excellent work of craftsmanship.
author: Brad C.

description:
there are some great things about this place:
-beautiful, minimal industrial victorian decor. i know that sounds wacko, but all of those elements are there!
- gorgeous packaging.
-WARM made to order cones!!!!!!!wow. i haven't been when it's crowded. how does that work?
-tempting baked goods.  big homemade marshmallows. for a buck.
-basil chip was really unusual, in a good way. it was very herby.
-pretty good parking.

BUT,
my heart belongs to bi-rite. can't help but think of their creaminess & pillowy salt caramel. this 'scream tastes a little, icy. no decadent mouthfeel.
and i'm not a sucker for their too cool for school flavors like fireside chat (that's beer flavor), or pink squirrel or even gingersnap.
also, not crazy about the gruff attitude i got.
come on. it's ICE CREAM. not, uh, black clothing or anime art.

so it all kind of works out to a meh for me.
author: Kim Y.

description: I ran over to these guys at 530pm on Valentine's Day with a box full of dry ice (I do science, it's like the only perk of this job, having coolers of dry ice on hand) to get a double scoop of croquantino to put in a jar that I had brought along with me for my guy for v-day. Mr. Misc was at the front and was super friendly, talking to a friend (or just a nice customer) of his, and took a minute to help me. I asked if he had any ice cream that had some chunks in it (croquantino was no longer listed on the board, sad), as I like my ice cream chunky (who doesn't?), and he said there was the chocolate chip and some other flavor but I was so craving the hazelnuts... and then he said, "well, there's a little bit of croquantino left, I packed it away in this pint, do you want some of that?" Score! So I got a double scoop in a cup (to transfer into my jar after I'd taken a bite (so good! hazelnuts and orange and frangelico), and paid for the 2x scoop... but as I was leaving he asked me if I was going back to somewhere with a freezer, and I told him about my box of dry ice, and he told me that I could have the rest of the pint if I wanted, as otherwise he was just going to eat it, since there was so little left (but still like two scoops--- P.S. 2 scoops is like half a pint, it's a ton of helado!)--- who would say no to that? So packed both away into my box of CO2(s), and ran back to lab, and gave the gifted 1/2 pint to a fellow labmate who had more-or-less recently and dramatically transitioned from relationship-land to singles-ville, since it was v-day, and I know that ice cream is one of the few loves of his life. And my boyfriend almost died when he had the croquantino for dessert, and he is terribly picky about his ice cream. It is so good! And Mr & Mrs are the coolest people ever, and so friendly!
author: Amanda S.

description: good texture (think: bi-rite), solid flavors (think: ici.)  looks like the dogpatch is well on its way to hipsterdom!
author: Jill k.

description: This is my bestest favorite ice cream in town.  I don't take my desserts lightly,  and the flavors, the texture of this ice cream is the best around.  For a while in the summer, we were taking the kids every day.  I'm usually a fan of the basic flavors, but I think their chocolate chip, pink squirrel, sesame, banana are all fantastic.  Any day the mercury hits 70 (give or take 10 degrees), my mind wanders to the Miscellaneous family and what they might have in store for me.
author: Sarah C.

description: I first heard about this place on 7x7 magazine and I wanted to try the candied lavender flavor. I am a fan of lavender and I have yet to try ice cream with lavender in it. A friend brought back treats to the house - 2 points of ice cream (Candied Lavender and Chocolate Chip). Chocolate chip is always a pleaser but they make it very unique. The Chocolate Chip ice cream has small confetti-sized slivers of chocolate as oppose to actual chocolate chip drops. Every bite had a light airy taste of chocolate that rested like feathers on my palette. I was expecting big things with the Candied Lavender and was slightly disappointed only because I was expecting the ice cream to have the lavender flavor too in addition to the candied lavender chunks. An added bonus for me is that this parlor uses organic ingredients in their ice cream and the variety of simple flavors as well as innovative combinations being offered.
author: Candace F.

description: I loved the English black tea ice cream; Assam tea is my favorite and this ice cream seemed to capture that flavor nicely. I also thought the cones were delectable---warm and crunchy and something I'd eat even without the ice cream. Only you have to get there before they run out of the flavor you want!
author: Grace H.

description: Nothing beats the salted caramel ice cream at Bi-Rite and nothing beats the Lavender ice cream from Fairfax Scoop. However, finally, we have good ice cream outside of the the mission! This place rivals Bi-Rite, kicks Humphrey Slocombe's ass, and presents a closer destination than Mitchell's and Joe's. Easy parking is another plus. Right across the street from Hard Knox and Serpentine, this place is a great addition to the Dogpatch. The ice cream here is tasty and fresh. I tried the Candied Violet, the Ballpark, Burnt Sugar, and Cookies and Cream. The smooth and creamy texture of the Burnt Sugar was better than Bi-Rite's salted caramel although I still prefer the salted caramel flavor. I highly recommend the Burnt Sugar. I thought the waffle cone was the highlight; it tasted better than all the aforementioned ice cream shops. The staff is friendly and the building itself is quite minimalist.
author: Annie Y.

description: Extremely friendly service. The rosemary and honey ice cream was delicious. The samples were pretty big too. I had BiRite later in the day and this was better.
author: Sean H.

description: Humphry Slocombe my tushie. This is the best ice cream in San Francisco and the people there are lovely to boot.  I am eating Jasmine Green as I write this and am in heaven.
author: Rachel C.

description: I'm so happy for Ian and Annabelle.  Finally open!  The mint ice cream was amazing.  Not the standard overpowering fake mint flavor I'm accustomed to, but actual fresh mint flavor.  The chocolate crunch was great too.  Be sure to try the Ballpark ice cream.  The Anchor Steam really comes through, but it's yeasty/beer-y flavor is nice.  Really great stuff.  Congratulations you guys!
author: Chris D.

description: What a lovely place this shop is. I came with some family on a "warm" day to enjoy some ice cream. Although I was disappointed they were out of the flavor I wanted, I was happy when they let me sample the runner-up. I ended up ordering the Orange Blossom in one of their handmade cones. Overall the experience was great. It's a cool space in the dog patch, and definitely big enough to hold the large crowd it was drawing that day. There were other treats in the shop other than ice cream, and I can't wait to go back and try those out as well.
author: William d.

description: across from hard knox lies mr. and mrs. miscellaneous, very quaint and humble ice cream shop out in the dogpatch, where industrial meets artistry. i just love that they have a huge space to do greatness.... ice cream isn't too overpowering and very gourmet. i really looove chocolate and their choco malt crunch hits the spot for me, as well as their choco cherry cookies. :D
author: Marc K.

description: Great ice cream n super friendly people! They will not have the standard flavors, but some better ones ; ). A must try. Love the place.
author: Luciana Z.

description: I came here for the first time this past weekend and tried the burt sugar ice cream on a cone. It was SO GOOD! I hate to say it, but it dethroned Bi-Rite's salted caramel as the best ice cream in SF. I like hard ice cream and I never liked how Bi-rite's salted caramel was so soft and melty. The ice cream here is a little pricey, but I think it's worth it!
author: Maria H.

description: I really like this place. Better than Humphry's and just as good as Bi-rite. Distinct flavors, more subtle than Bi-rite, less pretentious than Humphy's.  Cute neighborhood, friendly staff. Not open late, but you can't knock them for that. It's their prerogative. Support these guys!
author: S. N.

description: had the candied violet.  my fave thus far.   just found out my ldl is a little high so might have to cut back on the fried chicken across the street in order to keep the mmm goin.
author: Bing S.

description: seriously bummed mr & mrs was closed on the first day of school. raced home to start a new tradition with the kids and was thwarted by the closure!
author: Cathy W.

description:
