I really like this place! I drove over from the east bay specifically to try it out, and I'm glad I did. Flavors change daily and I would love to make it back to try some more. I tried their candied ginger, which i liked a lot- little pieces of candied ginger and a nice, not too strong, not at all lacking flavor. I decided on the burnt sugar with vanilla bean. It was a nice combination, the burnt sugar is really strong, bordering on bitter- but the vanilla bean paired really well with it. I think that an ice cream place's vanilla is a strong indicator of how good their product is and they passed that test with flying colors! The vanilla bean is what they call "dirty" meaning that you can really see the pieces of bean in the ice cream. My girlfriend had the buttered rum and chicory coffee. Both of those flavors were great as well, strong but not overpowering. The cone was ok. Handmade, which I really appreciate. 
I think this place would benefit from some art on the walls, but the atmosphere wasn't bad at all. The person who helped us was super friendly.
author: Ela F.

description: totally heavenly. every flavor i've tried and each lovely person working there - totally heavenly.
author: I. V.

description: love, love love this place. came here on a lazy afternoon (would've missed it without the address and all 3 of us looking) and loved the assortment of flavors (which were all good) - my friend had the candied violet, which was so delicious, and i had the caramelized hazelnut. in the afternoon on a weekday it wasn't too busy so we didn't feel too bad trying whatever we wanted, which was great, although don't be a dick and do it with a line, people. the owner was super friendly and sweet, she poured the fresh waffle cone and it baked as we chose. the ice cream is really rich and delicious. the place does a chocolate crispy topping using valhrona chocolate. seriously. will not miss this place any time i come to sf.
author: lo k.

description: Wow!  After sampling a few flavors, I bought a cone of peanut butter and jelly and then a couple pints, one of candied violet and one of half mint chocolate chip, half candied ginger.  Incredible stuff.  The waffle cone had just been made in front of me.  I served the ice cream to a foodie friend and my girlfriend the next day and they loved it too. The shop itself is as well thought out as the ice cream.  All the spoons, bowls, cups, etc. are compostable.  And the couple who own it are great people, super friendly, unassuming, and they make everything they sell themselves, except for one thing: the malt balls.  They said they're often there from 7:30 am to 3 am the next day!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Mark M.

description: This is my very first review even though I've signed up for an account long ago because this place is delicious. All their ice cream flavors seem like they've truly put thought into each one because there hasn't been a flavor I've tried that's sup-par.  I really like how all the flavors listed on their menu actually taste like what they say they should be too. Birthday Cake? Yup, vanilla ice cream with bits of white cake and sprinkles. Black Tea? Wow...it really tasted like black tea and even had the dry tannic aftertaste like drinking a cup of good black tea. I think this is the only ice cream shop that actually has a good amount of seating too. Bi-Rite is such a tight squeeze no matter the weather outside. My favorite cookie is the Cherry Chocolate. I'd only say that if you're someone who has to have plain vanilla or plain chocolate, you might be disappointed because they really are creative with their flavors here...bumping up classic chocolate to another exciting level.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Forget the ice cream - the peanut brittle cookie is the best cookie I have had in San Francisco.  Its chewy and salty and sweet.  The ice cream is good but for me the cookie really stood out.  I wish I could get a peanut brittle vanilla ice cream with that cookie.  They also sell jars of peanut brittle which are really cute and would make a great gift or party favor.
author: Anonymous S.

description: YUM YUM YUM without all the fuss and funky crap swimming in your ice cream. I'm an ice cream purist and am sick of all the pretentious foody one up-manship that's so pervasive in SF food culture. NO! I do not need foie gras or bacon in my gdman ice cream thank you.  So refreshing just to have great quality traditional flavors with a dash of something special here and there. I'm dying to go back for their homemade brittle!
author: Linda Y.

description: I love this place.  It beats the other good ice cream places in SF because there is indoor seating and super nice people making the ice cream/running the store/doing everything.  Plus the cookies and caramels are awesome.  Best part for me is always butterscotch sauce...seems to go well on every flavor of ice cream.
author: Amanda H.

description: Good ice cream, but pricey. And not a huge selection of flavors. UPDATE: Now that it's not longer their first weekend open, they've really worked out the kinks. More flavor options, and they're goooood. Today, I had basil chocolate chip, which was super awesome. (They do run out of the good flavors by the end of the day, so be prepared.) I'm converted.
author: sam l.

description: I am not a huge ice cream eater but this place has change my mind.  Everything I have ever tried here is delicious!  The sweets and cookies are awesome.  The store has a great look to it.  The owners are awesome people! This place is as good as it gets.
author: Will G.

description: This is the second time I've updated my review. They keep running out of ice-cream and cones and closing early. Once or twice is acceptable but now its just bad business. I loved this place and was such a cheerleader for it but now I just go to Mitchells, its open late. Sorry Mr & Mrs!
author: Charlie B.

description: I just sent a link to the Yelp reviews to a friend and said, "Yes, it really is as good as these reviews say it is. Well, actually, it's even better!"
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
welcome to the neighborhood, mr and mrs! this place is a cute little parlor that makes the dogpatch that much more special. the chocolate malt cone is a must...the little crunchy malts are deelightful. 

love the owners -- they're so great.
author: Terri L.

description: I think this may be the best ice cream I've ever had! What a treat! All the ice cream is made in small batches on the premises. It may seem pricey, but it's well worth it for this quality. You just won't find this kind of handcrafted product in many places. This is a wonderful addition to this neighborhood. The owners are very nice and the space open, light and pleasant. I wish them well.
author: Linda M.

description: can't wait for the opening! ice cream ftw!
author: will g.

description: Fantastic little ice cream spot!  I am thrilled they have moved to the neighborhood.  The owners are hard-working, enthusiastic, knowledgeable and uber-friendly.  The flavors I tried were white grasshopper and 7 spice, both amazing.  Creamy, fresh and not overpowering.  I ended up with a black cherry float and it didn't disappoint.  Lots of adorable antique wood but no kitch.  I think I'll go back for another in an hour or two.....!  Check out their heavy-weight cone maker, a serious piece of hardware!
author: Krista H.

description: Don't call it vegan, but do try the sorbet. The pineapple/coconut sorbet was outstanding!  -- divine even without dairy. The dairy eater in our party thoroughly enjoyed Choco-Malted Crunch. This is good stuff -- worth the trip from anywhere.
author: Joell H.

description: my favorite ice cream place thus far and i've been to a lot of ice cream places in the bay area. their flavors change pretty often which is somewhat sad because once i find a flavor i like, i cannot get it again.
author: Josephine S.

description: simply deelish. they make amazing creations. . .unique flavors. . . my favorite is the candied violet--it has a subtle lemon essence and is so rich and tasty. the proprietors are so cool and down to earth--the ice-cream is so yummy. . . only downside is i am on a mission to lose llbs and it would be AWESOME if they did fro yo. they do have sorbets, but not my thang.
author: mary c.

description: good ice cream..but whats with closing so early!!!!!!!!!  i want ice cream after 8pm
author: Stefanie W.
